description:
It's been almost a year since we went to this restaurant and I still think about it. Sit at the bar and you're sure to have a great conversation, food & wine recommendations and meet some awesome people. 

That alone deserves all the stars, but then the food came and it was AMAZING!! We had the carpaccio and stuffed mushrooms. Both so good!
Then we had an awesome veal dish (my first time) and it was really good!

This place is already on my list for when I return.
author: Amber S.

description:
We came here without reservations on a Thursday night, and the wait wasn't bad at all. The hostess kept me informed about our wait, and I really appreciated it.  

The food is not your typical Italian restaurant - there's no chicken parm on the menu, but more nuanced specialties.  I had the pork medallion special, sauteed in madeira sauce with artichoke hearts, and my bf had the gnocchi in a tomato cream sauce. A glass of red wine and a Caesar salad completed the meal. 

This was the second time I've been here, and never been disappointed.
author: Jenn C.

description:
Loved it!  
Great service.  Full bar.

We started with the sausage stuffed mushrooms and already planned our next visit because of this dish.
So savory--so good!  The amazing bread was used to soak up the brown sauce covering the mushrooms.

Next up was the Pappardelle.  I asked them to switch out the rabbit sauce for a meat sauce.  They gladly did this for me.
The sauce was a delicious mix of pork, veal and ground beef.  The noodles were homemade.
This was one of the best sauces I've had in an Italian restaurant in SF.

The next dish we shared was the  Penne mare e monti.                                                                     
It's penne pasta with prawns and chicken in a light tomato sauce.
There were so many flavors incorporated into this dish because the shrimp and chicken were also seasoned.  They sat in a garlicky red sauce that was completely different from the pappardelle.

I was impressed by our meal.
Clap! Clap! Clap!
author: Thomas D.

description:
I'd give it 4.5! We were looking for a good Italian place for National Spumoni Day! We found it. I chose it by reviews on here and we weren't disappointed. It is right on the edge of Little Italy and China Town. The awning on the outside worried us. The outside of the restaurant needs TLC, but once you're inside, you forget that. 

Our server was so friendly and knowledgeable about wines and the menu. He made the experience so wonderful. Inside, it looks like an old school place with white table cloths and it's quaint, dark, and cozy. The food went along with this theme and that's a good thing! We shared a veal/eggplant special (our favorite), the gnocchi's-award winning and awesome, and cannelloni. The cannelloni had a flavor in it that I wasn't super fond of, but that's my fault because they're filled with chicken and prosciutto and I took a chance on liking the prosciutto. The sauces on our dishes were so flavorful, we just couldn't stop soaking it up with our bread. The focaccia bread they serve is phenomenal! It was baked with fresh herbs and was so light and moist.  

Of course we saved room for dessert and you should too! They have at least 12 desserts! We got the spumoni-of course and the Tartufo. They were both worth saving room for!
author: Karen S.

description:
A trip to North Beach is not complete without a meal at Firenze. Nadia is a warm and inviting host whose smile lights up the room when she greets you. The gnocchi is light and airy as any great gnocchi should be. The pappardelle was perfectly cooked and treated with care. Don't forget to try the house made lemoncello to lighten you up a bit at the end of the meal. 
Firenze will forever be our first and last meal when visiting San Francisco.  Mantenere il buon lavoro!!
author: Mike K.

description:
Can't recommend. 

Aside from my 5 star waiter, with the sexy Scottish accent and lovely smile, it was a "meh" kind of experience, with a couple of things that would keep me from ever going back. But let's start with what was good. 

The kid at the next table had spaghetti with tomato sauce and it looked and smelled awesome. Simple dish done right.  There is an artistry to getting easy things right, and there it was. Poor kid though, she was bored to death. She kept looking at me with "please, please pull the fire alarm" all over her face.  Sorry little one. You're gonna have to save yourself. 

The wine list was low end and we should have just had cocktails.  Won't make that mistake again. Instead we ordered what turned out to be a very pedestrian bottle of chianti. Whatevs. Not a tragedy.  We shouted over the incredibly loud noise of the dining room and agreed it was drinkable if not notable.  Did I mention how loud it was in there?  It was very hard to hear each other speak. 

Which reminds me ... Italian. I dont speak it except for polite greetings, responses and inquiries. So to me it sounds like it has two settings, making love and having a fight. Just an observation. 

The food we ordered - the award winning gnocchi and the special ravioli - were both entirely fine, but not special. Satisfying in a red sauce kind of way. We passed on desert. 

To summarize: okay food, meh wine, too freaking loud.  Too many other options to give this one another try. 

The waiter, though. Five stars.
author: Quinn A.

description: Sat at the bar and the bartender, Dan, is the best. Knowledgeable, personable, and provided an excellent service.
author: Aphrodite L.

description:
Sooo good. Simple, classic Italian food with authentic Italian ambiance and waiters.

The restaurant is in a great location in north beach, lots of space, high ceilings, paintings on the wall.

The bread is okay, not great, but typical Italian-style. We brought our own wine, and corkage fee was only $20! Pretty cheap for SF.

For starters, I tried the caesar salad which was really good, but definitely super creamy and cheesy haha. Probably 1000 calories, but delicious.

For the pasta, I split the gnocchi and pesto pasta with my boyfriend's mom. Both were delicious, I'm not sure which I liked better. 5/5. I usually don't love gnocchi, but it was really good in the tomato cream sauce and not too doughy. The pesto was also creamy, yum yum. I tried my boyfriend's pasta, a special of squid ink pasta with seafood. It was also really really good.

Then they brought us a free tiramisu for my boyfriend's birthday! It was also really good and spongey.

Overall, can't wait to go back!
author: Jenna G.

description: I'd been to a handful of Italian places in the area, and this was the best of the lot. The combination of classic white table cloth ambience, with a menu marginally different than "classic Italian" was the perfect dining experience.
author: Matt H.

description:
Buonasera!
This is a great neighborhood restaurant off the tourist track. For the three of us, we ordered the award winning gnocchi, pappardelle w/rabbit sauce , porterhouse sliced "pupu style" (if you're from Hawaii, you know what I mean) and veal saltimbocca. 
The food, ambience and service were impeccable. I read the Yelp hype about the gnocchi and was disappointed bc I was expecting more. I guess that's the problem when there are rave reviews. 
I'll definitely return for some other items on the menu that I would like to try. 
Ciao ciao, amore Firenze di Notte.
author: Valerie M.

description:
We were craving some Italian food and wanted to venture out from our normal spot. After doing some searching we came across Firenze. We called to make a reservation about 30 minutes from the time of the call and had no issues. When we arrived we found ourselves in a classic Italian type of setting. A bar immediately when you walk in and a dining room to the left. The dining room is filled w/ numerous tables for seating. It's decorated w/ bottles of wine along the walls.

Our server quickly greeted us and shared the specials. He, along w/ the rest of the staff, would continuously check on us throughout our meal. We had some trouble making choices of what to eat, but had a good idea. When we asked what some of the best options were, our server mentioned two of which we were leaning towards.  

PAPPARDELLE TOSCANA - Large Noodles in Rabbit Sauce 
I was REALLY excited about this due to loving rabbit. Although this states on the menu 'award winner', I didn't taste it. I felt there wasn't enough of the sauce to noodle portions. I had to even ask for more sauce. 


GNOCCHI FIRENZE - Potato Dumplings in a Light Tomato Cream Sauce
Again another 'award winner', however my girlfriend who absolutely LOVES gnocchi wasn't feeling it. She said although it was like little pillows. They were larger pillows than what she's had before and it too lacked flavor. 

It's easy to get lost in a corner of this place w/ your sweetheart. And w/ so many options to choose from you're bound to find something you like. Enjoy!
author: Kevin Z.

description: I would not recommend this place...the quality we experienced last Sunday for lunch was not consistent with the 4-star Yelp rating. Unfortunately, all it took was the overcooked pasta. I ordered the fettucine with wild mushrooms and sundried tomatoes, and my friend ordered the pappardelle with rabbit sauce. Both noodles were far from al dente and the pappardelle were falling apart at a lift of the fork. I wish I could say that the mushrooms and tomatoes redeemed the rest of the dish, but they were not special either. I've had better sundried tomatoes from Costco. It's true that Firenze by Night is in a historic Italian neighborhood but you can find better Italian food elsewhere in the city, especially for the ~$20 prices.
author: Laura C.

description:
4.5 stars. We made a reservation for 7:45 on a Saturday. We arrived about 15 minutes early and were sat within 5 minutes of arrival. The host was very nice and you could tell they were very busy already. 

We started with the calamari, which was alright, but the penne mare e monti was amazing! My husband and I split the dish and it was still filling. We went to this restaurant because a friend had recommended it and we sure are glad we gave it a try. Highly recommend if you want delicious, authentic Italian cuisine.
author: Jamie P.

description: I found this restaurant through Yelp as my fam and I were looking for a nice dinner nearby. I am SO glad we chose to stop in...I read about the award winning gnocchi and was sold before we even got there. The service was polite and attentive, the ambiance was great - I loved the Italy vibes in the middle of San Fran - and the food was AMAZING. The gnocchi is award winning for a reason, the caprese was to die for, and the bottle of Pinot Grigio we ordered was fantastic as well. I can't say enough good things about this restaurant! One of the best parts was because of the high volume of 5 star ratings on Yelp, I expected a bit of a wait, but we were seated right away (which was great because we were starving) and were in and out of the restaurant. We definitely left satisfied!
author: Aly D.

description:
This restaurant is amazing! I organized a dinner here for my boyfriends birthday on a Monday night. I called ahead of time to reserve a table of 10 and whoever I spoke to was very nice! It made me happy with my decision to go here.

Pro tip - the North Beach garage is a street away and is only $4/hr to park. 

When we got there, everything was set up beautifully on their long table. Our waiter was incredibly helpful in picking wine and food. We got two bottles of the Sangiovese and Primitivo. Both are great choices and very flavorful.

For food, we got the bruschetta and two plates of gnocchi as appetizers to split. Definitely get the bruschetta! It's very flavorful and comes with 6 pieces to share. I actually wound up getting the gnocchi as my main course as well. It's very filling and cooked very well. You can also customize it to add meat and/or vegetables - just ask!

Overall, it was a great experience. I'll definitely come back :)
author: Remy B.

description: Another great restaurant in North Beach. Veal was outstanding and the service was great! If you are looking for a really good appetizer go with the stuffed mushrooms. You will not be disappointed.
author: Keith E.

description:
4.5 stars. My boyfriend had family and friends in town, and they wanted to get dinner, so we left the restaurant decision up to them. I would have just Yelped something, but it's nice to be the one who goes along with someone else's suggestion once in awhile. And what a suggestion this was! Firenze by Night was a fantastic choice, and even though we were baffled by the usage of two languages in the name, we thoroughly enjoyed our experience there.

Reservations were made, which I believe is necessary based on how crowded this restaurant was. It's best to arrive close to on-time since there isn't much room to wait around. There's the bar, but if you have a large group of people, you'll probably be in the way. Anyways, we were eventually seated, and our suave Italian waiter wooed us with his knowledge of the food and beverage menu.

We started with an excellent red wine and eventually ordered our food. The bruschetta was alright, but the gnocchi was to die for. So good! Perfect to share amongst everyone at the table. For my entree, I was torn between a few dishes but ultimately got the Linguine Alla Paolo, which has garlic, anchovies, red chili flakes. WOW. I would venture to say that this is one of the best pasta dishes I've ever had. It was definitely on the salty side with the anchovies, but I would highly recommend it. In fact, everyone seemed to enjoy their food, so I don't think there's a "wrong" decision when dining at Firenze. The correct decision, however, is to at least come here and see what it's all about!
author: Stefanie C.

description:
Disappointed! Ordered Petto di Pollo alla Toscana and the Saltimbocca alla Romana, look and taste lacking. This is the first time in my life when I ordered two completely different dishes but they came looking almost the same to me ... quality and craftsmanship not justify the price. Definitely a Black Mirror episode moment!
Gnocchi is ok. Ambiance is average in the big room, people were talking loudly, not that I complain about the noise level but this is something to be aware of if you are looking for a more private place or want to have some conversation without yelling out. They do have a smaller room in the back which was less "crowd" and busy. I would request seating in that room if I want more privacy.
author: Ken T.

description: Had a reservation this evening.  Waited 15 minutes for the host to even acknowledge that we were here.  He was greeting several other people at the bar and completely ignoring us.  I will never dine here again.
author: Roland L.

description:
Firenze by Night is a classic Italian restaurant in Russian Hill, serving up ridiculously fresh pastas in simple sauces. This isn't a place that will give you earth shattering and creative flavors (think Barzotto or Flour + Water), but it will deliver those time-tested truly Italian sauces in a warm environment :). 

We stopped here on a Wednesday night and found it wasn't particularly busy, so we didn't face a wait. Our server was so friendly and attentive and boy did I love the decor! Dangly Christmas-like lights all around that provide little warm glows amidst the dim ceiling lighting. (Pretty solid vibes for a date night!)

They started us off with fresh focaccia bread served with olive oil in which you could add crushed pepper and salt to make your own blend. The bread was warm and heavenly. Just be sure to not eat too much or you will fill yourself up before you get to the delicious pastas!

We ordered three pastas and decided to stick to classics: the Firenze Gnocchi, Capellini Pomodoro, and Pesto Fettuccine. The gnocchi is definitely their star dish. As other reviewers describe it, it really does consist of little pillows of love. It is perfectly light and served in a heartwarming tomato sauce. I loved this dish and found the portion size to be great. The Pesto Fettuccine was also fantastic, with a more creamier Pesto sauce and Fettuccine cooked al dente. I'll describe the Capellini Pomodoro using one word - fresh. The sauce tasted like it was just made, with ripe tomatoes and a good amount of basil. 

We left Firenze by Night feeling satiated - tummies full and heart warmed. Would definitely recommend!
author: Sabina S.

description: Hands down the worst Italian food I've had in the US. Just returned from Florence 4 days ago and my aunt wanted to go to a local authentic Italian restaurant to relive our experience. Granted that is a high bar to relive but I was not even expecting to compare my meals in Tuscany to my meals in SF. Just wanted a decent Italian dinner. With that said I ordered the carpaccio which no joke may have been Oscar Meyer ham with capers and cheese on top. Also ordered the "award winning" gnocchi in light tomato cream sauce which might have been Chef Boyardee - couldn't tell.. and the fettuccine with basil pesto which was fine and tasted the freshest but that was relative to the rest. What a disappointment. Would not recommend nor will I return. Ciao!
author: Krista B.

description: We were impressed. Sometimes restaurants in San Francisco are so over whelmed  with tourists they forget about service and food. Just take care of the masses!  Firenzie by Night is NOT like that.  It's a total wonderful noisy scene with tables full of people having fun, drinking wine, being served great food by waiters who take the time to really help you select the right dish.   I think all the dishes are the right ones.  We had a table for 10 on a busy Friday night and they acted like we had all the time in the world. Yep! Homemade pasta, great appetizers and wonderful drinks. Our server was great and very busy but our water glasses and wine glasses were never empty.  Don't let all the people eating here scare you off. It's worth the wait or next time make a res.  Every visit will be better and better and you will have such great meals. Makes you feel just like going into a traditional Italian restaurant in Italy. Nothing fancy just great food, service, wine and oh I forgot Desserts!
author: Sharon S.

description:
Night in San Francisco and was recommended to try this restaurant which is a local favorite.
We must have stood out a bit as the wait staff did not recognize us as one of the " regulars"! Greeted by the owners son who was quite charming!

Our waiter was so cool, friendly and felt like an old friend. Steered us in the right direction of what to order. Burrata cheese, prosciutto and arugula and bruschetta for appetizers, Spinach salads, and awesome gnocchi, steak, capellini and tubular pasta with shrimp and chicken! Excellent wine selection too!

Unfortunately too full to try dessert.   

A recommendation for you is to try this lovely local find,and avoid all the tourist traps as this is the real deal if you are looking for real authentic Italian!

PS ask where Frank Sinatra used to sit when he would visit for s little nostalgia!
author: Tima C.

description: My husband and I came here because our friends recommended it. It's a cute restaurant, nice ambiance. The food was okay, I think the cook was heavy handed on the salt that day. Overall probably wouldn't go back. Our server was a bit obnoxious and was trying really hard to be funny but it was mostly just insulting.
author: Kristina P.

description:
This is now my favorite place in San Francisco to have an authentic Italian meal.  The service was impeccable. The food was beyond delicious. I love this place.   

Oh and by the way you have to have the Tiramisu!
author: Jesse C.

description: Great food, great service! Can't wait to go back. We had the spicy penne and Caesar salad. Soooo good!!
author: Erica C.

description:
Best gnocchi I've ever had! Our family and friends have gone quite a few times for special occasions and every time has been just as magical! The workers there clearly take pride in their work and strive to make the experience perfect for everyone. 

Food is fantastic! One of our waiters recommended getting two plates of gnocchi to share as appetizers - great idea! The carpaccio was also to die for! 

We've never had a bad meal here. I definitely recommend making a reservation or getting there right as they open, as it fills up their small space very very quickly.
author: Kelly M.

description:
It's entirely possible we hit them on an off night but the food was ok at best and the service pretty bad.
Specifically, over-salted, very mediocre food (honestly I've had a better experience with Amy's Frozen Foods -their Italian entrees actually taste better.)

Add to that an inept waiter - "I'm new" he replied when we called him out on several mistakes, and I say go someplace else. Mona Lisa restaurant close by is a far better choice.
North Beach is admittedly absent of any really good dining experiences but this place really drives the point home.
author: Robert M.

description:
Delicious! Second time I've been here( first was my bachelorette party and I was treated like a queen!). I took my husband for his birthday. 

I made reservations for 8 on a Saturday night. They we're really busy , but we we're sat almost immediately. The tables are close together, which we didn't mind. Our server and busboy were very attentive and clearly knew their trade! 

We started with two appetizers, snails and the clams and mussels. Whatever the sauce the snails came in was nearly drinkable it was so good. 

Dinner was veal scallopini and ossobuccco. Both were very good! Dessert was a piece of tiramisu, which was probably the only thing I didn't like about our whole evening. 

Hands down I would recommend over and over. Wish we lived closer!
author: Amanda B.

description: This place has the most sex possible. Super authentic, literally everything on the menu. Service: tight
author: Karen P.

description: The staff and the owner make you feel like family as soon as you walk in the door. As a north beach local, I love coming here for date nights or celebration. The wine selection is wonderful and not overpriced. The food is to die for. You must try the gnocchi (it melts in your mouth!). I'll be coming back not just for the friendly staff, but for the incredible food as well.
author: Jessica W.

description:
Best gnocchi and sweetest server of my entire life. I'm a gnocchi kind of girl so if it's an option on the menu- I'm getting it. 

Thank you for becoming my new gnocchi go-to in the city.
author: Danielle C.

description: In a city full of Italian restaurants, this one is a must!  It's the best one in my opinion.  It's family run and they do it right.  The gnocchi is the best we have ever had and we've eaten it at over 50 different restaurants.  Hands down the best here.  The veal dishes are also amazing.  The service is superb.  You also have to get the ricotta cheesecake.  The prices are very reasonable for top tier Italian food and great service.  I would recommend making a reservation.  It's so worth it!
author: Mike M.

description: Went here last Friday night and had an excellent meal.  Ordered the Papparddelle Toscano and my oh my - I can understand why its award winning!  Classic Italian restaurant: white linens, dimly lit, and photos of celebrities lining the walls.  Server was knowledgeable and the owner was very friendly, came by with a round of shots at the end of our meal. Grazie!
author: Brian C.

description: I'm not a huge fan of going out for Italian food however, this place changed my mind entirely! The owner of the restaurant was there the night we decided to go here for dinner and he was so sweet. The area is a little small, but, most really good places in San Francisco tend to be. I would definitely recommend trying this place. The wine was delicious, the food was absolutely amazing. I find myself craving their gnocchi, I'll definitely be visiting again soon!
author: Nesha P.

description: I can't quite figure out why there are so many great reviews for this restaurant. If you have ever had decent Italian, this is not your spot. I really wished to have a great meal based on recommendations. Please, please, if you know good food, look elsewhere.
author: Kelly D.

description:
Service was good but the food was not great at all...
We ordered gnocchi and clam pasta but  both of them were not great....
author: Yusuke T.

description:
Wow! Firenze by Night recommended by friend for a good place to celebrate our anniversary . Not good..great.. From the minute we walked in to the time we left . Food amazing, prices very resonable and service fantastic. This will become one of our favorites in SF. 
Love this place!! True Itialian restaurant ..keeping the North Beach experience alive !
author: Janet B.

description: Make sure you try their award winning gnocchi! Beyond delicious. Everything we had was very good. The service was excellent as well. Definitely worth it if you're in the mood for a good Italian meal.
author: Marisa O.

description:
A bottle of white, a bottle of red; Perhaps a bottle of rose instead?!

You know, eating in a traditional Italian restaurant is more that just filling your belly with delicious food; it is an experience and if you are lucky enough to get a real Italian server who is good at the job, you will enjoy the entire experience at an even higher level! 

The first trick is to engage your server in conversations; ask about the specials, the appetizers or the wine (s)he recommends with a certain dish. Don't rush through, take your time, let it flow! I mean come on! You are already dropping a good some of cash for going out to dinner in San Francisco, so why not enjoy every minute of it, right? 

Firenze by Night is a real Italian restaurant, offering real Italian food served by real Italian servers who know all about the dishes they are serving. 

Our server whose name I do not recall (I am awful with names!) was from Sicily, a native of Naples. He had a great sense of humor and  was good at his job. He started us with a Carpaccio, a glass of red and a martini (Yep, me and 007 love our martinis "shaken but not stirred"!) The Carpaccio was awesome.

For main course we ordered their salmon and pasta with seafood specials (do not recall the names). Simply delicious.

To cap the night, we shared a heavenly piece of Tiramisu.

If you haven't read between the lines yet, I LOVE this place!
author: Afshin A.

description:
This place is the second best restaurant i think I've ever been to (the first is in Orange County so that doesn't count here ). The service is impeccable. The waiters are true fans of yours and they want to make your visit special and unique. 
The gnocchi is to die for. 
We have been coming here about once a month since moving to the city June 2017 and tonight i had an interesting question about the menu and prices changing on something specific.  the manager had no problem explaining it to me honestly. 
What a wonderfully family run business. Firenze will always be a favorite of mine.
author: Jordyn H.

description: Edgar was our waiter and was very nice and attentive. Had the seafood pasta which was incredible. My girlfriend had the Risotto and absolutely loved it. The Afogota (?) was great too. Will definately return next time in the city and recommend to others.
author: Joe G.

description: Excellent cooking. Petrale sole was best we've had. Veal saltimboca was perfect. Good service and family feel. No wonder it was crowded early on a Friday night. Just off the Columbus Ave circuit, so not filled with tourists. We will become regulars here.
author: Lee P.

description:
TV has a heavy influence on my life.
Sports, sitcoms, movies, awards shows, and... yes, PBS food shows.  On a summer episode of Check Please Bay Area, this old time restaurant (since at least the '90s) serves quality pasta in SF's famed North Beach for over twenty years and counting.  This was my choice for a  birthday dinner in late August for our rousing group of twelve on an early Friday evening.  We were given a long table in the rear dining room and were the first diners in the restaurant.  Being a big party gave us a better opportunity to try more things, but here's what I tried:

Appetizers (all shared)
1) Bruschetta (https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=5G7E_GwdEDduaqhmgFJWPg&userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q) - Spoiled by living in the Bay Area, we have year round fresh ingredients such as tomatoes which were the star of this app.

2) Risotto ai porcini (https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=QKK7eQIf_L1Nl4AnIIE3AA&userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q) - You know it's good when you wish this was your entrée instead of an appetizer.  The mushroom flavor shined!

Entrée
3) Gnocchi Firenze (https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=dvLF6OKprAEUFdcvRiFIwQ&userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q) - The most famous of their award winning pasta dishes, this did not disappoint.  Simple ingredients but, as so many diners aptly stated, literally "pillows of love".

Our waiter was enthusiastic and helpful in guiding us in ordering our dishes so that we could enjoy their more popular dishes.  Since it was a birthday dinner, he also brought a candlelit dessert that we shared.  Since everyone was very health conscious (including me with another dinner party the following day), this was enough to satisfy us.  
By the time we prepared to leave, the restaurant about seventy five percent full with many locals, given the greeting from the waiters and host.
I later saw the above episode rerun and learned that their Caesar's salad was touted by one guest as "best I've ever had".  
Guess there's yet another reason to come back.
author: Mike C.

description: My boyfriend took me here for a premature birthday celebration, and WOW!!! My mother is "off the boat" from Italy, and this place truly felt like family. I had the famous gnocchi, and my boyfriend had the seafood pilaf. AMAZING. Our server was incredibly kind and attentive, the decor felt like my grandmother's house. All around great experience, will definitely be back time and time to come.
author: Maria M.

description: Loved everything about this place. If you come, you have to try the gnocchi! The server was so helpful, and the wine and pasta was the best...
author: Sam I.

description:
This place is becoming my family's go-to dinner place in SF... big deal indeed!!!

I highly recommend to make reservations... any day... any night!!! It's small and very intimate!

Friendly staff... friendly owner... you definitely feel like part of the familia! 

This last trip... I went out of the norm and ordered their TORTELLINI ALLA ROMANA and I think I have my new favorite! Let's just say I ate the whole entire dish... with 3 appetizers before hand! It was delicious and properly proportioned! 

I also love the fact that all the servers are their own sommeliers! Twice I've asked their recommendations re Italian wines (in my price range of course!) as well pairing those said wines to our dishes... both times... SUCCESS!!!

We'll definitely be back!!!

Continue the good service and the good food!!!
author: Cath M.

description: Excellent food and service. The gnocchi was delicious! Good atmosphere, too. We wanted a good North Beach restaurant to bring our family and this was the perfect choice. We have one food allergy in our group and they were accommodating to our needs. Would absolutely recommend.
author: Amy S.

description:
It took a while for us to be seated even with reservation. Everyone was friendly. 
One minor comment is for the receptionist who keep biting her nails. 
Can't complaint of the service, it was good, the food was delicious.
I asked for seafood pasta fradiablo it wasn't too spicy but then a little pepper flakes on the side made Justice to the dish. 
My son liked the pasta with rabbit sauce. 
For the tab of $ 180 it was worth it.
Will recommend this place
author: flor n.

description:
This was a very nice dinner for 2. It's about $18 / plate and not hard at all to get a table on a Wednesday. 

The pappardelle with rabbit was amazing and the gnocchi was delicious and soft. 

Minimum bottle of wine is about $41.
author: Brandon M.

description:
Excellent food and wine! The fettucine pesto and the award winning gnocchi were wonderful. The Chianti Machiavelli was great! We finished with a caramel
pudding and limoncello! The service was wonderful too!!
author: Sharanya P.

description: We ate here about 10 years ago. And again today. Food is pretty good not great. I had the red snapper special and it was ok. My husband had the prawns and they were good.  We had the tiramisu for dessert and it was average. They did make a good cosmo though.  Service is wonderful though. I would give it 3 1/2 stars but of course you cant.
author: Kim T.

description:
Pretty solid Italian food. Not the best service, but to be fair we had a party of nine people.

I ordered just a salad and asked that it come out as my entree. It did not. A pretty tasty salad. I tried a bite of Gnocchi and it was delicious (light and sticky). 

Our water glasses remained empty majority of the meal and wine was poured whether you wanted it or not (thus leaving less wine for those that had wanted a few glasses).

A good family meal.
author: Rachel R.

description: Great food, friendly staff, beautiful environment.  You won't be disappointed by this place, it's one of my favorite spots in SF.
author: Andy S.

description: I have no idea why this place only has 4 stars. We went during the dinner rush on a Friday and were seated immediately in a cute room with pretty murals and little string lights making the setting very romantic. The waiter brought out complimentary bread (focaccia and French) which were both good, even better that they were free ;). We ordered the gnocchi ($19) and the papardelle with rabbit sauce (both creamy red sauces). I believe the gnocchi was house made because of how tender and fresh it was, the most authentic gnocchi I've had in the states. There was also the perfect ratio of sauce to pasta which rarely ever happens. The papardelle ($19.50) was cooked al dents and the rabbit sauce was actually pretty light and delicious. Finished everything with the ricotta cheesecake which was completely worth $9. It was very light and creamy, perfect ending to a pasta filled dinner. The service was also great, our waiter was very friendly and professional. Will definitely come back here if I'm in SF.
author: Natalie G.

description:
I've never heard of Firenze until my friend introduced me to this place who personally knows the owner.  It's one of those authentic Italian generational family run restaurant in the cusp of little Italy / Chinatown and I was definitely in for a treat.

I rarely eat at Italian restaurants because you know, they can be a bit overpriced.  Or that's how I used to see it because I can "make Italian food" at home with a bottle of Prego sauce and some penne pasta.  Now that I've found Firenze, I think I'll set that bottle of marinara sauce aside.

I ordered the risotto al porcini.  No meat at all but it satisfied this meat eater.  Boyfriend had the ossobuco special (veal shank) with bone marrow.  Meat was so tender and delicious.  I reached over to my friend's gnocchi and it was good.  Portions are generous so come hungry.  We polished off our meals with delicious grappa.

I'm glad I have finally found my go-to Italian restaurant as all the touristy ones in Little Italy / North Beach area has never managed to fully convince me to give up the big jar of tomato sauce from the local supermarket.
author: Bailey N.

description:
This was an amazing experience. We arrived a few minutes before our reservation but ended up having to wait about fifteen minutes because they were very busy. The host was more than accommodating and made us feel comfortable while waiting for our table. 

The food was delicious! We had the gnocchi and tortellini. The gnocchi was great for potato gnocchi and the tortellini was some of the best we have ever had. 

We highly recommend this restaurant for an authentic Italian dinner in the heart of San Francisco!
author: Alexander B.

description: This restaurant was an absolute GEM, I have lived down the street for years and never stumbled across it until yesterday when a friend brought me! It is family owned & operated (literally owner was chef and cousin was hostess...so cute!) The food was to die for, I am obsessed with gnocchi and this was the best I have ever had in my life.  It is really putting my cooking to shame, the gnocchi was so big and delicious...we also ordered it regularly as they offer on menu(I believe tomato but not positive) AND ordered another with pesto sauce (which is off the menu) and the owner had recommended it :) I would say I could not decide which I liked better as both were delightful.  I had chicken with veggies and sides and it was great as well.  My friend had veal...not going to lie I was not sure about it but it did taste great. I definitely recommend if you like Italian food and authenticity. :)
author: Ellie J.

description:
Probably the best carbonara I've ever had.  The tomato, basil and mozeralla was fantastic.  Service was attentive and polite!
Will most definitely be back.....soon!
author: Tony S.

description:
Had the ravioli Della mamma...it's tasty, but I feel as if it was a bit overpriced for some ravioli in meat sauce. Nonetheless, the place really gives you a great authentic feel for an Italian experience.  
Glass of red wine to go with dinner is always a good thing. They do have specials too, which apparently change continuously. Friends of mine at the table got a black ink pasta seafood dinner which she was very pleased with, and another lady at the table got the ossobucco which was also delicious.  
Sergio, the manager that night, was very personable and an all around fun guy to be around.
author: John G.

description:
Absolutely one of the best Italian restaurants in the city. Solid authentic dishes. We started with bruschetta and calamari salad, the calamari was fresh with the perfect chewy texture. We both ordered pastas to share and they were kind enough to split our plates. We had the gnocchi and spinach ricotta ravioli with meat sauce. Both melt in your mouth deliciousness. We were so full but we had to get the tartufo! After coming back from Italy, we've been on a hunt for this dessert and this is the only place that has it (or at least makes it right!) in the city. 

We can't wait to come back to try more dishes. The environment is suitable for a romantic dinner to group celebrations to individuals just wanting to enjoy a solid good plate of food. It's tucked away above the hustle and bustle of Northbeach so it's easy to miss.
author: Angela L.

description: Came here Thursday night around 8:30pm based on a friend's recommendation and was not disappointed. We were promptly seated without reservations and they mentioned their truffle week specials and regular specials. We ordered from the specials and regular menu: tortellini, veal saltimbocca, and a penne/artichoke/chicken dish that was on special. For an appetizer we ordered the prosciutto and melon which was absolutely delicious and perfectly split between three people. The entrees were phenomenal: flavorful, comforting, and everything i had wanted. The service was prompt and friendly, and our waiter made wonderful recommendations for both the food and wine. The environment seems "dated" when you walk in, but It adds to the Italian feel of It. It certainly reminded me of a few of my favorite restaurants in Italy. Would recommend to anyone!
author: Amanda F.

description:
Excellent food. It was the best gnocchi I have ever tasted. I will definitely visit again next time I am in San Francisco.
Everyone in my party enjoyed the food and the service. Thank you.
author: Ziad J.

description: Great food.. The gnocchi was great to share and the prawns and calamari with lemon and wine sauce was absolutely delicious! Friendly waiters.
author: Daisy S.

description: The restaurant itself is quite nice. It does get noisy at times, as restaurants do. I ordered the Pork Medallions which were delicious. I would purchase this meal again. Wine was OK. I drink a lot of water. It was difficult to get my water glass refilled. The busboy was not that attentive to filling my glass which was part of his job. He passed me by several times when my glass was empty. I always had to ask for more water, please. At one point, as he passed by, I touched his arm to get his attention. He continued by and filled other glasses at other tables. The hostess was present at this time and said she would get me water. He came by a few minutes later and said to me "don't touch me". I replied "then refill my glass when you see it's empty".  He didn't fill my glass again!!
author: Sharon B.

description:
Came here for a work holiday party. Unfortunately our large party couldn't get the private room in the back because it was already booked, but we still had a great time and the servers did a good job of accommodating us and all our presents.  

Gnocchi is absolutely bomb.  So good that all 18 of us got a plate of gnocchi in addition to our "main course."  I had the cannelloni biagio, which honestly didn't impress me that much.  Just go for the gnocchi.  

Also, shoutout to the amazing waiter who went above and beyond by fulfilling a random request to find a plastic cup for one of my coworkers haha.
author: Shannon L.

description:
Okay, maybe I am becoming kinder with age but I do feel compelled to update my review.

Yes, it's still dated inside.

Yes, it's still located on the edge of Chinatown rather than the heart of North Beach.

But damn, those pillowy gnocchi are divine! How do they get them so light and pillowy at the same time?! And the pesto - yummmmm!

Ravioli were good and prawns in garlic butter were tasty too.

Oh and I'm not supposed to be eating bread but...the two pieces I did have were well worth the cheat. So soft yet crusty!
author: Mary G.

description:
New favorite Italian place in San Francisco.

Went to Beach Blanket Babylon at Club Fugazi and went here after checking Yelp.  Fortunately we were able to reserve a table last minute (I think is was fate).

The charming and attentive hostess (and essentially the composer of this amazing restaurant symphony) Nadia, who is actually part of this lovely family (along with her equally charming brother who tends the bar) was fantastic and sat us within 10 minutes of arriving.  Longtime former employee, Roberto, entertained us with a trip down memory lane before we made our way to our table.  Cute table against the wall ... white tablecloth; low light - the perfect place for romance or simply enjoying great food and friends/family.  Lovely noise level.

We started with some nice highball glasses of (solid on the vodka) Moscow mules and some delicious focaccia bread with flavorful olive oil.  The warm spinach salad with bacon we split was perfect. I probably could have eaten one myself as a meal ... but then I would have missed out on the delectable tortellini in cream sauce with prosciutto and peas and the signature gnocchi  - perfection!  We lingered over it so we could eat slow and enjoy every bite.

We seriously cannot wait to return!
author: Darlene C.

description: Best meal my family had in San Francisco. Fabio (the waiter), Nadia (the hostess), Luis (the bus boy) and the bartender (forgot his name!) were absolutely amazing and took great care of us. The food was delicious from beginning to end. I highly recommend the burrata  appetizer, the gnocchi Firenze, the swordfish, and the cheesecake.
author: Sara G.

description:
We splurged and tried 3 Italian restaurants in one day, all in the Little Italy area. This was head over heels better than the other two (even though the other two were higher rated).

Great ambiance and even better food! We'll be back.
author: Bruce H.

description: Probably the best Italian dinner I've had. I got the award winning gnocchi and I understand why it won an award-so good!!! To add to the incredible food, our waiter was truly incredible- very attentive, kind and great at his job. This was the perfect way to end my trip in San Francisco.
author: Kristina L.

description:
I make it a point to have dinner at Firenze every time I get to the bay area.

I have had both business and friendly dinners there - it is  great for all occasions.

The food is good and the service even better.  Though not always available - they make a great Braciole - Just ask Nadia  -
author: Rick R.

description: The kind of place you might dream of finding in North Beach. Big menu and everything looked good. The veal shank was excellent. A long slow braise resulting in deep, rich flavor. The Saltimbocca was spot on. Service was efficient and friendly, and the prices were reasonable, particularly after some of the outrageous prices nearby. Two locals went out of their way to recommend, and I see why. Also glad to see families here.
author: Tim S.

description: Excellent food, service and ambiance! Not too far from union square and so worth it! If you love Italian, it is a must try experience! I had the rigatoni with bacon marinara and fiance had the pasta with rabbit sauce and said it was to die for!
author: Tammy C.

description: Wow first of all I am so excited my friend decided to enjoy her birthday dinner here! Literally haven't stopped thinking about it sense we left haha, such positive energy, the family running it was a breathe of fresh air & our server Brannon was a delight. Overall I can't wait to go back, the food was amazinggggggg! Definitely a gem in the city! You gotttta go!
author: Hailey S.

description: We found this marvelous but very crowded restaurant by chance when walking around Little Italy last year. Excellent food and service. Best gnocchi! We will return!
author: Anne E.

description:
This was our second visit to this restaurant and again it did not disappoint! After reading a couple of other Yelp reviews, tried the Gnocchi and this dish was so full of flavor! My husband ordered the spinach/cheese ravioli which was also yummy! The service in this restaurant is superb and many of the waiters are from Italy! We met one of the owners Paola and he was so welcoming and charming. He and his Father own the place. Our server was on target through out the meal knowing when to intervene and when to just observe. I enjoyed the peach sorbet for dessert which was served in the shell of the peach! Very creative and presented beautifully. We also enjoyed a delicious limoncello aperitif! 

When you are in the city and find yourself in North Beach, this is the place you must come and dine at! You will want to return again!
author: Renee N.

description: I brought my sister here for her graduation dinner and we thought it was overall decent. There are plenty of other Italian restaurants nearby that we would like to try and nothing we ordered was that special. We ordered the mozzarella salad, their award winning gnocchi and clam linguine. Everything was average but the service here is very friendly!
author: Louise X.

description: Excellent excellent excellent!!! Service is outstanding.... very friendly and attentive!!! The owner is friendly and welcoming to his guests. Service was quick... and all food was outstanding!! Highly recommend for pasta lovers! Locals and tourist will enjoy!!!
author: Jamie G.

description: Would give this place ten stars if I could. Absolutely amazing food and the best service. We had a reservation and ended up having to wait about 30 minutes for a table, and the owner Paulo had three appetizers waiting for us when we sat down. Our server Brandon was so great and gave us the best recommendations - the gnocchi is a must! We had the ricotta cheesecake for desert as well as the best espresso martinis I've ever had - shout out to Alex for being the best bartender in the bay. After dinner Paulo chatted with us about his Nonna and let us try her homemade limoncello recipe. It was amazing!! Really the nicest people with delicious and authentic Italian food. Will definitely be going back soon!! Thank you Firenze for such a wonderful night - you made our trip to SF even better than we thought possible!
author: Kathleen C.

description: Delicious. Fresh & Authentic. Good Service. Recommended to try, and did not disappoint. I was doing a little happy dance with my first bite of the Tortellini. We also had the stuffed mushrooms,also recommend over the standard bruschetta. Th hubby had the cannelloni, which was delish as well. This would get 5 stars except wasn't loving the ambiance/decor. Felt pretty dated, and cliche, which you will find in Firenze so that is probably on point... but prob could use and overall freshening up...replace can lights, remove fake greenery and Christmas lights...those types of details. However, tucked away and a great find!
author: Krista M.

description: It's a fine place but there was nothing stand out about our meal. Not bad and not exceptional. We ordered the stuffed mushrooms, the Caesar salad, the squid ink pasta and the gnocchi. I am sure there are better places in little Italy.
author: Kathy B.

description:
I don't have any photos of our meal there. Let's just say that the decor is straight outta the 80s with a touch of Italian tchotchke.  A lot of the waiters look like retired Italian body builders with pony tails, but they've misplaced their parachute pants ;-D  I'm just trying to paint a picture for you.  It's clear that many of the patrons are repeat customers. The place has a great welcoming atmosphere, good wine and fine Italian food (not a "red sauce" joint). 

I ordered the penne al forno, which looked "boring" with melted mozz on top and meat sauce underneath (not red sauce based) but tasted fantastic.  My wife's salmon picatta was excellent and our daughter wolfed down the  half order of capellini angel hair pasta with butter.  

This was perhaps out favorite meal while visiting the SF Bay for our vacation this year.  If we lived in the vicinity we'd definitely be repeat customers.
author: Jonas A.

description:
We had a group of eight good friends and Firenze by Night handled us with ease. The gnocchi we had as appetizers - delicious. Salads were crisp and flavorful my friends had Caesar and I had a had romaine heart with Roquefort crumbles.  Sea Bass, Squid-ink fettuccini with seafood, and Oso Bucco on special. 
I had the melt in your mouth veal shank and loved it. The Sea Bass was praised and no one had a bad thing to say - one friend, a Firenze regular, lamented that he would have preferred his customary fettuccini order. But still enjoyed the special.
Service was polite and professional and efficient.
Four stars only because the noise level made conversation problematic and the polenta just missed the mark.
author: Kate B.

description: Dinner with family and I kid you not, the food here is amazingly great. From the award winning gnocchi, squid ink seafood pasta, pumpkin ravioli, cannelloni, and sole... amazing. This is truly a gem. Best in all of Northern Cal. We will see you again.
author: Alex L.

description:
Excellent service.

Nice wine selection.

Nice atmosphere.

Food was good but fell short of my favorite local haunt a couple blocks away.

I heard they had the best gnocchi but I prefer Sodini's round the corner.

Later.
author: Jim W.

description: I hosted a Birthday Party for my Husband on July 8th.I had spoken to Nadia Giusti about the particulars and she was professional and kind.She designed a menu that fit the needs of our guests. Sergio and Paolo Giusti were also wonderful to work with.My Husband and I have been going to the restaurant since they opened.The Food,Cocktails, and Ambiance are very solid . Fabio was our server,he was phenomenal, paying close attention to our group,making sure all wine and water glasses were full at all times,clearing and presenting courses at the perfect time,he was attentive without being intrusive. Professional and Great Personality!THANK YOU TO EVERYONE AT FIRENZE BY NIGHT FOR MAKING MY HUSBAND'S PARTY PERFECT!!!The Food, the service,the ambiance,but most importantly the personal and caring attention to detail is second to none! Grazie Tanti, Jennifer Giordano
author: Jennifer G.

description: Classic Italian-Italian (as compared to the mafia-papered Italian-American restaurants that litter this country) restaurant in North Beach.  The Pappardelle and Gnocchi are some of the best I have ever had.  The owner's son (Paolo) and one of his daughters (Nadia) are often there in the kitchen and out front creating a fantastic customer service experience.
author: Ben M.

description: If you're looking for an authentic Italian restaurant in Little Italy and don't want to sit through an hour and a half wait time I highly suggest Firenze by Night. After going around to 3/4 restaurants and being faced with an hour and half wait time at all of them a local overheard us talking amongst ourselves about where else we should try. He suggested Firenze and told us even after he moved out of the area he still comes back just for Firenze. We arrived and the entry way was packed so we thought for sure it was going to be at least an hour. The host/manager came over and we asked how long for a table of 4, he told us "I'll be back in 5-10 minute to take care of you all". We all thought that meant just put our names on a list or something but he did. About 10 minutes later he came over with 4 menus and told us to follow him. On top of the great service, the food was incredible and authentic and exactly what we were looking for. I would highly suggest Firenze!
author: Alice G.

description:
excellent restaurant. Service is spot on, professional and discrete. Food is outstanding. We were a party of 4 and we ordered for starters;  antipasto platter, Buffalo Mozzarella with Tomato and Basil, and Mussels and Clams Marinara Style. They were all excellent. The Mussels were the largest I have seen. We then shared a order of GNOCCHI FIRENZE !!!
OUTSTANDING!!!! I have never had gnocchi this light. It was so light and airy!!! Entrees were
stuffed trout, veal, Quail in Barolo Wine Sauce and Roasted Chicken with Mushrooms, Garlic, Rosemary and White Wine. We ordered a selection of deserts all excellent. WIne either by the glass or bottle is reasonably priced. We all agreed the food,service was excellent.
author: Peter F.

description: Great place for our group of 30!!!  The food was excellent and the use of the private room was invaluable. The wait staff was very attentive. We'll definitely return.
author: Scott G.

description: Fabulous Italian restaurant with and authentic atmosphere. A hidden gem and loved every moment of my dining experience.
author: Mary F.

description:
OMG. Let me start off by saying that this experience was the highlight of my trip to San Fran.
I have never - ever - had authentic, gourmet, Italian food, that got me in and out of there in less than an hour and a half! We were in a rush, so it was perfect.

My group of 5 came in just at the right time, as we had no reservation and they literally had 1 table available to fit us. As we were seated, we were in awe of the atmosphere. Romantic, yet perfect for an evening out with friends.  Our server's name was Michael Pacini and he was immediately very warm, welcoming, and his Italian accent was adorable! So accommodating!

Two of our group ordered the Special Meat plate of the day (of which I, of course, forgot what it's called), which was basically veal wrapped in proscuitto, served with veggies and polenta, and also the seafood pasta special, equipped with clams and shrimp.

 The special meat was aromatic, very delicious, and melted in your mouth. Those flavors!

The seafood pasta special was...ok. it definitely need a little more seasoning but it was edible.

The rest of the group ordered the two award-winning plates to share: the Gnocchi and the Papparadelle Toscana (Rabbit Sauce). Oh man....one bite in and we immediately knew why they were award winners! The flavors were bountiful, the texture superb, and I just couldn't believe all this was prepared in less than 20 minutes. 

I swore I would come here, every time I was ever in the Bay from here on out. If you've never been, you'll definitely want to. All this and our bill only came out to $88! For 5 people to get stuffed!!

5 - stars for Firenze all across the board. I can't wait to come back here!
author: Michelle M.

description: The food here is pretty good. The gnocchi is amazing. The dessert called Tartufo is a must have. The rabbit sauce pappardelle was alright. The tiramisu has a little too much coffee liqueur in it. Service is pretty fast.
author: Ash M.

description:
This review is over-due. Me and my honey went here for our 5 year anniversary a couple months ago and absolutely loved everything about this place. The ambiance, the staff, and the food. They made us feel special and like we had been there 100 times. 

I ordered the seafood linguini special with a white wine sauce, garlic, clams, and mussels. I am lactose intolerant and generally not a fan of Italian food, but this dish absolutely converted me! So light and no dairy naturally without modifying it- perfect. I even got to experience desert, which is hard for a DF diner... Zabaglione with fresh strawberries.. UGH I DON'T EVEN LIKE SWEETS! So bomb.com.

Absolutely recommended for a traditional Italian meal with just the right vibes.
author: Nika C.

description: We took my wife's sister and our brother in law to Firenze by Night for a 50th Anniversary dinner. We had a window seat, a great place. Service and food were super. We all had a wonderful and pleasant time. The ladies are Italian and their verdict was that the food is authentic and great.
author: Brian K.

description:
This neighborhood is chock full of old school, neighborhood restaurants.  But Firenze is kinda special.

So what sets Firenze apart exactly?

Sergio.  The owner is sweet, good natured, & talented in the kitchen.  This restaurant is not just a business he owns, it is an extension of himself.  He's naturally hospitable, too.  If you come in more than once, he'll remember you, perhaps shake your hand or sit at your table for a moment, & make sure everything is to your liking.  Who doesn't want to be treated like that?

The steak.  Italian style meat & potatoes is a must here.  Remember this is old school, though.  It's different from, say, a steak at Alexander's or Boulevard.  This is more on par w eating at your nonna's house.

The gnocchi.  Sergio nailed this dish decades ago.  They are pillowy, tasty, creamy, perfection.  An indulgent dish to revel in.  Worth every calorie.  Diet tomorrow.

The escargot.  Ooh la la.  The garlic, olive oil, & caper sauce they are prepared in is fantastic.  I eat extra bread just to sop up every bit of these dreamy drippings...a lot of extra bread.  Diet tomorrow!

There are a few dishes that can be hit or miss.  But if you let Sergio know what you want/like, or stick w the stars of the menu, you will not be disappointed.  

4 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description: This place is great! super cute - very authentic and old school neighborhood vibe. if you like papperdelle get it - it's some of the best you will EVER have. we also had fettucini with meatballs - also very good but pretty basic. The breaded sole with a lemony vinaigrette sauce was good - I like it but my partner thought it was too saucy. The homemade focaccia bread is amazing! portions are big! so don't order too much or don't eat all the bread. This place is def worth coming back to - especially if you live nearby. decent pricing too.
author: Ruby B.

description: Since living in Italy for 5 months last year, I have been looking forward to dining here for quite a while. I was hoping it would trigger nostalgia, but it fell short. Of the two appetizers we ordered, the mozzarella di bufala and fagioli, both were terrible and devoid of flavor. Their two award winning pasta dishes were a redeeming factor (although I wish the papparadelle was served with more rabbit sauce). The gnocchi was some of the best I've ever had, melting in my mouth. We enjoyed a bottle of Gaja Promis and the atmosphere at 8pm on Friday was certainly lively. Can't fault the service either, but overall a disappointment for us.
author: Jaclyn B.

description:
Came here 20 years ago. 

Walked by it yesterday, I remembered it. Ended up there for dinner with a friend. She had the spinach salad and the gnocchi. I had the tomato salad and the mushroom fettuccine.

The gnocchi is award-winning, and I would've had that had I been able to eat dairy. But, the Fettuccine is just as amazing.

Food quality, service standard, everything; this place is well worth it.
author: Mike K.

description: The food was delicious and our server was attentive. Kept the drinks flowing and we had a great evening. We'll definitely return!
author: R A.

description: This place was amazing. The service was great and the food was extremely fresh. The homemade gnocchi's melt in your mouth. I definitely recommend this restaurant.
author: Laura F.

description: Must have been a great place in the 90's, but has since lost its luster. Food is subpar.
author: Casey M.

description:
The daily special got me.  Shrimp/squid/clams/muscles with red sauce and linguini.  I'm always skeptical of people that claim the shrimp tastes of ammonia, having never experienced that myself.  I try and give places a fair shake, but I'm struggling to get over the idea that the "daily special" was an attempt to sell the shell fish that was quickly approaching its serve by date.

I regret this review because the service was great and that makes up for a lot in my view but let's be honest when it comes to shell fish the felonies are: over dress it, over cook it, or to try and get an extra day out of it.  

You got my 20$, but unfortunately that's gonna be it.  I'll keep looking for someone who does it better/right.
author: Troy G.

description: Ordered the gnocchi with chicken - it was so good. We sat at the bar since we didn't want to wait at the table and the barista made us some really good cocktails - pins cup and lemon drop.  Fun night out and very yummy dinner.
author: Sonal S.

description:
3.5 stars  We made an impromptu visit to Firenze by Night upon the recommendation of a local Italian shop owner. We enjoyed our meal here.  I think the gnocci is what they are most known for here and unfortunately we did not order on this visit.

Upon entering the restaurant on a Friday evening we were warmly greeted by the host and promptly seated.  Our server was Italian and was eager to take our order. I felt somewhat rushed, especially with it being our first time here, but otherwise he provided great service.  Prices are on par for surrounding restaurants, you will pay roughly $20 for pasta dishes and $32 and up for seafood specials.

4 stars Bruschetta for a lovely starter

4 stars Hand Made Pappardelle Toscana with Rabbit sauce, 4 stars
This was good, although some of the pasta was slightly overcooked

3 stars Fettuccini "Bon Gustaio" with wild mushroom, garlic and sundried tomato
pasta was on the verge of being too al dente (and I love al dente pasta), some of the wild mushrooms tasted chewy-reminded me of being reconstituted from dry. I inadvertently expected a cream sauce not a red sauce and I did not love the red sauce.

3.5 stars Sea Bass-Seafood Special
Large piece of sea bass sliced very thin and quick sautéed with olive oil and lemon, this was our first time seeing a sea bass preparation cut thinly like this. The polenta and vegetables on the side were a scant portion, the seafood had a nice flavor and tasted fresh.

Nothing stood out for me as mind blowing in taste, but nevertheless we had an enjoyable experience here.
author: Dawn F.

description:
Came here cuz of that show 'Check Bay Please' and 3 stars for the attentive staffs because I had better Italian food!

Ordered:
Gnocchi Firenze (Award Winning) - OMG, false advertisement because it was BLAND! Maybe award winning for its blandness! 

Papardelle Toscana (Award Winning) - getting old & they really need to stop advertising 'award winning' when it was alright & nothing special!

Penne Mare E Monti - Mediocre

Pollo Con Funghi - Decent

Bistecca Alla Fiorentina - Alright

Ravioli Della Mamma - Mediocre 

Linguine Con Vongole - Alright

Calamari - greasy & nothing special
author: Katy N.

description: Well, we had a very mixed experience tonight. We loved the service,  and the ambiance was fun, but honestly the notion that this is place is authentic just isn't so. I lived in Italy and have Florentine relatives and I know that this food just wouldn't pass muster with them. The "ribollita" soup, which is an absolutely delicious classic Tuscan dish -- just wasn't at all ribollita. The waiter confessed that it was actually a "minestrone" but it tasted like it was out of a can!  On the other hand,  the pleasant surprise was the gnocchi and its flavorful sauce -- very delicate and tasty. The seafood with squid ink pasta was overly fishy  -- not great. We spent a lot of money on this meal so if I had to do it again I'd go somewhere else that's less expensive and doesn't draw such high expectations.
author: Andi S.

description: Great authentic Italian Restaurant in North Beach..  One of my favorites and the owners are awesome!!
author: Freddy B.

description: Awesome service and great food ! My boyfriend wanted chicken parm which wasn't on the menu and the waiter had the chef special make it which was awesome and a huge portion! The host (pretty sure he was the owner) was super nice and attentive and even came to check on everyone once they had gotten their food. Overall it was a great experience !
author: Lauren K.

description: Came here for a night with Grandma, sister, and wife.  All the food was excellent.  The pasta was great, gnocchi was awesome.  Everyone had a great time, and we even met some people next to us who were nice, felt like an overall family atmosphere, casual.
author: Joey M.

description: Such an incredible restaurant and such an amazing family. I was so glad to finally go after meeting Mrs. Giusti--funny enough in an uber ride! She was so kind and we chatted for a while about the restaurant and her family. I have to say, she didn't disappoint. The restaurant is just as good as I imagined; the environment is warm, the staff are lively and happy to see repeat customers, and the food is great! We had the specials of the day and some chianti and enjoyed dessert too. Looking forward to returning and trying some of their classics next time!
author: Kristan S.

description: Super disappointing, waay overpriced for what it is, basic supermarket food, total touristic rip off. Whine bottle of $50 was  such a shame!!!
author: Karolina S.

description: I really wanted to like it but the flavor was lacking. Pasta dishes didn't have much flavor. It's just okay. Service was very good and staff is nice.
author: Annie P.

description: Quite simply the most delightful dining experience I've had in a very long time. This is the kind of place you will remember as a highlight of your trip or come back to time and again if you live nearby. Everything was amazing but what stood out the most was the warmth of the staff and the overall charm of the place. If you're asking around for "the best" Italian food and atmosphere... Look no further. This place is special.
author: Allen C.

description: Food was awesome - service on point - ask for Edgar - great waiter - ate there two nights in a row - pasta superb - appetizers out of this word - highly recommend
author: Tom M.

description: My favorite restaurant- period!  Great place to  entertain out-of-town guests, family gatherings, or for birthdays.  Best minestrone (Ribollita) ever.  Authentic Italian food by real Italian family.  Not a North Beach touristy restaurant.
author: Lou B.

description:
Read this for an honest and legitimate review of the restaurant. 

Around $18 for a kids portion of pasta. The "Award Winner" pasta tasted okay but it wasn't anything special. I don't see why it would even be label "Award Winner" in the first place. There was a couple of other items my table wanted to order but we were told many of them would take 45 minutes to prepare. The meal doesn't come with too much. No soup or salad, but they do provide plain bread with nothing else. Whole table left hungry and had to eat again a few hours later. Atmosphere and service was good
author: Steven W.

description: We switched our dinner plans when told we needed to eat here and I am so happy we did! The food was wonderful and accommodated my dairy and gluten allergies. The stuffed mushrooms were amazing and a must try. Our entire table was more than happy with their food and the portions were perfect. The waiters were helpful and very kind! Will definitely be back!
author: Denette M.

description: Our Uber driver recommended Firenze and we are so glad!! The waiters were flexible with our food allergies and the food was AMAZING.  The stuffed mushroom appetizer is a must try!
author: Kerstin J.

description:
Great little(not so little actually) Italian place. The gnocchi was great. So we're the jumbo prawn is red sauce. The house bread was surprisingly not so fresh..was very disappointed. Overall a good place for date night. 

The wait times if you don't have a reservation is insane..so do make reservations well in advance.
author: UltimateFoodCritic F.

description: I went to Firenze, Italy last summer and when we decided to have Italian in SF, I immediately thought of this place. I had seen it before on Yelp and it served typical dishes that we tried in Firenze so we booked it. The owner was really nice and since I know Italian it was a pleasure to speak a few Italian bits with him, he reminded me so much of my dad - filled with energy. What a character. We had booked a table for four (this place is only open for dinner by the way) and we arrived 15 min early but the owner wouldn't sit us until the full group showed up hahaha - I thought this was very original because most places will usually make you sit right away. But we didn't mind waiting. He saw me being a bit tired so he decided however to make us sit before our friends actually showed up (which was like 5 min later). We had a nice table. The interior design is really beautiful and not pretentious at all. Nice decor, art and tables have space between them which is nice. The place was absolutely full and buzzing. Between the four of us we ordered the bruscheta (which was normal but heavy on the garlic a bit), a Chianti bottle of wine (which was bit vinegary but I guess most chiantis are like that, suggest to try a different wine) ravioli della mamma which were really nice, risoto porcini (which was fabulous, my God the taste of porcini was insane), veal saltimboca ( a real winner) and sadly I went for the pappardelle toscana with rabbit sauce but have to say it was a let down - the ratio of pasta versus sauce was not in balance, there was way too much pasta and way too little sauce and it felt watered down in terms of taste. Overall I had a lovely experience so will definitely be back to try more dishes. We ended it with the truffle chocolate ice cream which was soooooooooooooooo good!!! Bon Apetito :) The staff was very friendly and the owner came to check on us couple times during our meal and at the end so that had a nice touch since the place was so busy. Will definitely be back for more.
author: Heliana M.

description: Amazing!!! Not only was the food phenomenal and the best Italian food I've ever had. The owners are absolutely a delight. You feel like family coming to this restaurant and I'd highly recommend this restaurant to anyone in San Francisco. Make reservations though, because it's a very popular place.
author: Alyssa H.

description: Great ambience and good food. A local recommended and it didn't disappoint.  If you want to eat what the locals eat, this is the place!
author: Elizabeth S.

description:
Wonderful family owned restaurant recommended by the concierge at our hotel. I had the pork tenderloin and my husband had linguine with seafood -- sorry I can't remember the dishes names. The host, who I can only assume is the owner, was very polite. The waiter was excellent, best in a long time!  Also they were real Italians ("real";) so the accents and periodic Italian words really added to the experience . 

Not really related to the restaurant: we needed to catch a taxi and asked him about calling for one. So he ran out into the street in the middle of the nearest intersection and flagged one down! 

Our party of four, with a bottle of wine, four salads and four entrees spend $175.  If you want delicious Italian, go here!
author: Genea S.

description: I like Italian cuisine but rarely excited by its limited interpretation in the US, which means pasta and more pasta. This restaurant's menu doesn't stray much from that mindset but have to say the pasta dish I had was one of the best. The waitstaff is Italian and / or speaks Italian, so it made the experience that much more authentic.
author: Carlos F.

description: Th best Italian restaurant I've been to in SF. Paolo and Sergio are the best and will accommodate anything you need. Please don't leave without eating the gnocchi!
author: Raj K.

description:
I was in the neighborhood, on my way home and I was craving gnocchi. A quick yelp search rated Firenze quite high for best gnocchi in the area so I decided to check it out. I arrived at 630pm on a Thursday night, without a reservation. Much to my delight, they didn't insist I take a seat at the bar and did offer me a table. I asked the host about the gnocchi and she told me about two sauce choices that aren't even on the menu and raved about the tomato cream sauce. My server was quite attentive and nice and when I asked him for his gnocchi recommendation, he immediately said the pesto sauce. It's all homemade, along with the pasta so I gave it a try. My server even recommended a wine to pair with my gnocchi. Sold!

All in all, I didn't feel rushed and everyone was great, checking in on me to see how I liked the food, etc. Even the host got in the mix when she saw the sauce I'd chosen. 

Prices are reasonable. The menu variety is amazing. The fake wine vines and lights are a bit odd but if you don't look up, you won't see them.

This place is just off of the beaten track of Columbus Avenue so I'd never seen it. Now that I know it's there, I'll definitely be back.
author: Tera K.

description: Fantastic food and fantastic service! We ordered the seafood fettuccini, grilled swordfish, pesto fettuccini, Caesar salad, and bruschetta - all of it was amazing!
author: Jenna B.

description: Our group was given a delightful welcome into this quaint establishment. The staff helped us squeeze a mobility scooter into our seating location. There a few larger groups of locals gathered here who seemed to be enjoying themselves immensely. And soon thereafter our 7 person group of out-of-towners was doing the same. The food was well received by all and I can personally testify that the Gnocchi is worthy of the accolades that have been bestowed on the dish. Kind thanks to Paolo and the staff for making us feel like family.
author: Rick L.

description:
The Seafood Linguini and Veal were FANTASTIC!
The Waiter-Michael or Michaeli (as he told Kristin and I) was AWESOME
author: Duane Z.

description: I've been hearing about FBN for a long time and was finally able to try it for myself. It did not disappoint! Salads-great, not too big. Bread/drinks-super, and the Pasta-fantastic! We shared the pappardelle and gnocchi like many others, I got an inside tip to have the gnocchi w/pesto and it was amazing!  Deserts were very good-not huge though, plates were clean with 3 deserts for 5 people. We had the cheese cake, the chocolate gelato thing with cocoa powder, and the tiramisu-which was good and boozy!  Lastly, we parked around the back in the bank parking lot for $15, worth it for the convenience.
author: Christine J.

description:
How best to describe, the pasta was tasteless and over cooked, the buffalo mozzarella was hard as a rock, the tomatoes weren't ripe, the sauces were just terrible is the taste department.

All in all, when you think of what Italian food would taste like if you go to North Korea, this is it.

Please, I'm begging you, don't go.
author: Dylan I.

description: Firenzies by Night was highly recommended to us by some nice firemen we met at O'Leary's... our meal exceeded our expectations. I ordered Petrale Sole, my husband ordered Osso Buco. The Caesar salad was killler...fresh, handmade gnocchi to die for! Ordered Tartufo Cappuccino... come on now . Staff was amazing. The owner was very cool.
author: Cheryl P.

description: Good food and good service. I would definitely come back next time I'm in San Francisco.
author: Charlie M.

description: Every thing is made from scratch. This is our new Italian restaurant in San Francisco. From the appetizers to dessert everything was excellent.  The  waiter was very knowledgeable and personable. It feels like you're in Italy.
author: Diamond Valerie F.

description: The gnocchi is absolute perfection!  You don't ever need to try anything else.  Fun atmosphere with great, attentive service.
author: Jenene M.

description: I could write 5 pages about how amazing this restaurant is. I have been coming here regularly for more than 10 years now, and have gotten the gnocchi every time. I have tried the other dishes, but that is always the best. They fit me in when it is busy, and service is always great. I have always intended to try the desserts, but have have never been able to, because I have been so full by the time desserts come along.
author: Kaitlyn C.

description: Again, an enjoyable dinner in my fav old school, North Beach Italian Restaurant. Carpaccio superb and Veal Saltimbocca off the charts, really. Very fair portions, don't downsize! Chef Paolo a most hospitable restaurateur, Grazie, the Mrs. and I truly enjoyed ourselves last night.
author: Art M.

description:
My mom and I went here after our "date" to Beach Blanket Babylon. I wanted to go somewhere nice, nearby and not super fancy. This place fit the bill on all accounts, but I wouldn't call it a great meal. We were also seated quickly despite it being a busy Saturday night.

I am a sucker for "award winners" so I had the rabbit pasta which tasted a lot like canned Chef Boyardee. I have a feeling they called the item with the greatest profit margin an "award winner" to trick people like myself. My mom got the pork special and it was oddly expensive and mediocre tasting. The prices for the specials are not printed on the menu and in our case the waiter was so frightening I wouldn't dare ask. Really the waiter is what ruined it, his Italian accent seemed fake and he was exasperated like a Frenchman. I really had no idea what he was saying either. In fact, our waiter was so much of a pain in the ass that my mom and I decided against asking about the free Yelp check-in desert. 

The owner seemed really chummy with folks and I liked the ambiance so I might try it one more time if I am weakened with hunger in North Beach, but probably not because that area is filled with great food.
author: Becky S.

description: Best authentic old school kind of Italian restaurant . Their gnocchi is perfection and Sergio is the best!
author: Elizabeth G.
