description:
2.5 Stars for the egg and cheese soup:
-Too salty
-Had the add half a cup of my drinking water to help dilute the salt

3 stars for the seafood black squid linguini
- did not had an all around balanced flavor
- clams was fresh but only had around 4-5 
-black linguini was al dente - above par
- shrimp was below par - a bit salty
- squid and calamari were alright (lack of incorporated flavor with the pasta)
author: Roul L.

description:
Located in North Beach this little restaurant is a gem. The hostess was welcoming and while quoting us a 30 minute wait, we had a cozy corner table within 10 mins. 

The bartender, Lago, was friendly, welcoming and gregarious. He promptly delivered our drinks and kindly offered to transfer our check to our table....no requirement to "close out our tab".  He was most definitely our favorite interaction of the evening. 

The food was delicious. We had the calamari, prosciutto and melon, and caprese  appetizers and a delicious spinach ricotta ravioli and fettuccine dish. 

Our waiter was friendly and attentive although he seemed a little rushed and that he was servicing quite a few tables. 

Overall a great experience and would recommend.
author: Jessalyn F.

description: Love eating here every time in San Francisco. It feels like an authentic Italian experience.
author: Aaron B.

description:
Came here to dine early, around 5pm. Excellent service and food. Be sure to arrive early since the places packs quickly, even on weekdays! Came here on a personal recommendation and will be coming back. 

Shout out to the bartender Dave for serving excellent cocktails with our food. 

I ordered the ravioli and it is among my favorite dishes now. If you are in the city for a visit, or live here, come for the food, the atmosphere, and the family that runs the diner. It is a bar above the rest in dining experiences. You will feel welcomed and be welcomed. 

I tried some of the gnocchi dish and the veal dish and will have to come back to keep trying their dishes. Each one is special and well made. 

Thank you, Firenze by Night, for the excellent meal!
author: Kevin J.

description: This is probably the best place in north beach they have the best pasta, wine, appetizers and I love their sautéed chicken with mushroom  the staff are friendly and very helpful.great restaurant
author: Liza G.

description: A very good Italian restaurant in North Beach. The have a great gnocchi. Nice atmosphere, good wine selection, and good desserts.
author: Peter K.

description:
OMG!!!  Ask for Edgar as your wait person and then buckle up and be prepared to fly high with the food and the service.  The food was absolutely divine.  And Edgar was spot on with his suggestions.  He suggested that we split the bruschetta and order 1/2 order of the gnocchi and 1/2 order of the pappardelle with the rabbit sauce.  Then we ordered the porterhouse steak
 to share.  All I can say is the 1hour trip to eat at this restaurant was truly worth it.  We can hardly wait to go back.  By 6pm the restaurant was filled so do yourself a favor and make reservation in advance.  Don't forget to order the spinach salad, hmmmmm.  And the tiramisu was the topping of the cake.
The chef/owner's daughter is delightful and very cordial.
author: Kathy G.

description:
Recommended by some locals so I decided to cancel my existing reservation elsewhere. Firenze by Night is located pretty much right at the Chinatown and Little Italy border. It was more neighborly than touristy and a place frequented by celebrities as evidenced by all the autographed pictures on the wall. 

We sat and like most Little Italy trattorias the staff was purely Italian. We knocked out our drinks, app, and dinner order in one swoop. 

The prosciutto and melon was simply simply that. I can't say it was spectacular - just a combination of something salty and something sweet. 

The waiter allowed me to return my soda and alcohol drink that he suggested when I wasn't really enjoying it. I appreciated his levity. 

Ok, no I've had many tortellini alfredos but this was just incredible. I found myself having each one in a whole bite. I soaked up some of the sauce with the complimentary breads. The vegetarian lasagna of which I never though I could savor, was equally fantastic. 

Overall- good environment, great food, and fun service.
author: Rich C.

description:
Ordered the antipasto,  pappardelle toscana, that night's special squid ink pasta with seafood mix, and the tartufo di cappuccino.

The selection in the appetizer consisted of three meats, tomato with mozzarella, a fish spread, and a vinaigrette calamari. Overall, the dish went well with the bread especially the fish spread but was nothing extraordinary.

The entree sizes were generous. I really enjoyed the squid ink pasta. The sauce coating the noodles was flavorful and not overly heavy. The pappardelle toscana tasted good but was not spectacular. 

I enjoyed the dessert. The coffee flavor was rich and smooth. The gelato was coated with malt pieces which added a nice crunch.

I would try this restaurant again for special occasions with family.
author: Heather L.

description:
Not sure what the big deal for this place. Good casual ambience but the food is just so-so.

We had the recommended papardelle toscana and the pasta was overcooked. The special of the day petrale (sole) was actually pretty decent. Slightly breaded with just the right amiunt of lemon juice and olive oil.  We also had the Tomato Estiva ( tomato with onion and caper). The onion was a bit strong for the amount of tomatoes. It was ok.

Was under-whelmed given the reviews.
author: Rebecca C.

description:
Hands down my favorite Italian restaurant in San Francisco. The real deal. From the moment you walk in the door you are treated like a superstar.

I'll stop talking about the amazing service and focus on the food now. It's an absolute must that you order the mushroom stuff with sausage appetizer. From that point on my only advise it order whatever appeals to you when you read the menu. You really can't go wrong with any of their entrees.
author: Andrew M.

description:
Unfriendly waiter that got annoyed when we asked questions regarding the food and he made you feel as if you have insulted him when asked to have a specific sauce without the tomatos.  

The answer was: 

No, the sauces are already finished and ready to serve 


Food was okay but nothing more than average and the Risotto was quite tasteless


Only 2 Toilettes for the entire restaurant so you have to wait in line to take your turn. 


Very bad accoustic, very hard to talk to someone sitting more than 1 seat away from you
author: Robert K.

description: We adventured here after a recommendation from an acquaintance. Just in town for a few days, and we were not disappointed with our experience. We had the stuffed mushrooms and gnocchi which were both wonderful. Our server, Edgar, was personable and informative and couldn't have made us feel more welcome. He had great knowledge of the restaurant and allowed us to try the limoncello, which was unmatched by any other I have tasted. We were more than pleasantly surprised by the authentic feel of the restaurant and enjoyed all that it had to offer.
author: Sosa O.

description:
Heresc what the 3of us  ordered
Caesar Salad:  fair, nothing special
Greens Salad: fair, nothing special
Hot Spinach Salad: fsir, way too much oil, bacon had stale old taste to it.
Bread: Focaccia was good, bread inferior dry quality(I wondered where was that good  SF sourdough...not here for sure!
Special Squid pasta with mixed seafood in wine sauce: nice presentation but wine sauce and seafood lacked flavor. Needed more seasoning, wine and butter.
Gnocchi in tomato cream sauce: very good, tender and fluffy and sauce was good too.
Pasta with meat sauce: Okay, nothing great.
Decaf Cappucinos: fair, weak coffee taste.
Caffinated Cappucino: Good but not the best.
Service: Good but a bit obsequious waiter.
Staff: was attentive.
Door has "five star restaurant" on it? Who says?
Not a 5 star by all means. Get real.
Reason for 3 stars - the gnocchis...(only thing worth coming here for.
Thec rest a 2.
author: Girly Foodie F.

description: Beautiful restaurant and very tasty food. Also very close to Beach Blanket of Babylon.
author: Ilana G.

description: One of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco my now husband and I have spent many nights there visiting from Southern California we love the service we love that it's family owned the cioppino is amazing the garlic breads to die for but most of all is the feeling that you get from the great customer service oh by the way we're probably going there tonight
author: Janet L.

description: My favorite place to eat anywhere I've travelled let alone in SF. Great service,great food and best of all authentic as can be. The regular menu items are fantastic but if one of the specials sounds good to you do NOT pass it up. Can't go wrong with the papardelle in rabbit sauce or the gnocchi but the daily specials are really where it's at. Great wine list and a full bar at reasonable prices too!
author: Bob F.

description:
Went here recently before catching the Beach Blanket Babylon show up the block.  We just Yelp'd the place before showing up and it looked like it got good reviews so we decided to have dinner there.   No line, no wait, immediate table at about 7pm, that was definitely a plus!  The place was busy but not every table was taken.  

For appetizers we had the tomato/mozz/basil thing and carpaccio.  Both were very light and delicious!   For our entree we had the Fettuccini buon guistao(sp) and the Parpadelle Tosca with rabbit sauce, I love the wide noodles and the rabbit bits in the sauce made it tasty. Both were very tasty and freshly made.  We definitely enjoyed our meals.  Oh we had the pannacotta with fresh strawberries for dessert to share. Great way to end the meal.

The ambiance/decor is a bit dated but it adds character, service was pretty good, our waiter seemed very serious so we were glad we didnt need much after we got our food. Very serious face and not much chatting at all, I only saw him smile once when he was talking to the other waiters.  All the waiters and staff seem to be actually Italian with accents and everything, the owner seemed very nice with greeting people etc.   

A definite recommend, good location near a lot of things to see/do nearby.  If only we could remember where we parked.  haha!

For 2 of us, with apps, entrees, few glasses of wine and dessert was just under $100. 
I was expecting to spend this amount but I wasnt dissappointed in our choice for dinner.


Happy eating!
author: Willy M.

description:
What a charming, lovely restaurant that displays the city at its best. 

Food: We ordered an appetiser and pasta to share followed by our own entrées. The portions were very generous. 

Burrata: I don't have much of a palette but I thought it tasted great. It was creamy yet light. The tomatoes and basil that came with it were average but I still finished it all. 

Pappardelle with Rabbit Sauce: there is a reason why this is such a popular dish, it was wonderfully made. The pasta was one of the best we've had and the rabbit sauce was meaty, flavourful, and seasoned so well. 

Quail: I liked the dish but unfortunately my birds were overly stuffed and somewhat dry. The mushroom sauce was a little overwhelming. Vegetables and polenta however were great.

Veal: we thought this one had a really nice cream sauce and was very hearty. 

Tartufo: an excellent ice cream dish that was delicate and rich. It was a little difficult to eat as the ice cream kept sliding away from our spoons. 

Service: we had such an affable, affectionate waiter. I fell in love with him the moment he asked us what we wanted to order. He joked with us, made us feel really comfortable, and we appreciated his efforts in ensuring we had a good meal. We noticed that he even brought out a special plate with bite sized pieces for a family seated across from us who had a toddler with them---they hadn't even asked, he just did it.

It's small actions such as these that really won us over. 

Ambiance: admittedly it's a little gaudy but it has a casual, relaxed atmosphere with dim lighting and cheery patrons. It has a lot of character. It's romantic, fun, and a great place to bring an SO or your family for a nice meal.
author: C. K.

description:
I left feeling embarrassed. The hostess chased my girlfriends and I down a block after we left the restaurant claiming that we "never paid" and left only "$5". 

Hold on! We used 3 debit cards to pay, left three signed receipts, and showed our own receipts that we paid. The hostess did not sincerely apologize for the mistake... or the fact that we felt embarrassed as passer-bys stared at us. We went back into the resturaunt to speak with the "manager", and the same hostess greeted us with a "whats up". WHAT DO YOU MEAN "WHATS UP"? You just chased us down and made a scene. Way to treat your customer. She claimed she was the "manager" as well, and was very defensive about the situation. Great. More reason to call her out-- Her name is Nadia.

Here's why I think they chased us down: Because we left a $5 tip for our waiter. Our waiter (1) forgot to bring us complimentary bread (even though tables that arrived after us were given some) (2) when we asked for garlic bread (since we weren't being served ANY bread), he adamantly said they don't carry any with an attitude (3) he would splash water all over us when he refilled (w/o picking up the glass) (4) he seemed to rush us out of the restaurant as he put the check right in the middle of our 4-person table. Weird. 

He anxiously stood by our table as we left to pick up the check book. Obviously the waiter wasn't too happy with his tip, told the "manager" we ditched on the check, and she claims it was a "mistake" that they couldn't find the THREE signed receipts that was left IN THE SAME CHECK BOOK AS THE $5. Yeah right. 

We're 4 girls, in our mid-20s, with well-paid jobs. I've never left such a small tip before. AVOID THIS PLACE AT ALL COSTS. 

To Nadia--- A customer should never leave your restaurant feeling embarrassed, or even have the entire dinner party go onto Yelp to write such bad reviews; I wouldn't have done this if you didn't make a scene-- Double check before you accuse your customer!! And do something about your waiter's behavior. I will be telling all my friends, family, and co-workers to never go here.
author: Bren H.

description: Good food, good service. We've heard about this restaurant for awhile now and I'm glad we were able to check it out. Thanks for the good meal!
author: LJ M.

description: Our waiter came with a cute Italian accent, however, they forgot our salads and our drinks. We had to remind him when we requested the bill and he made us feel like we forgot to order. Will I come back again? Hummmm NO! We were recommended by our concierge but I think she definitely got paid referring us here.
author: Ani K.

description:
Sounds trite, I know, but walking into Firenze by Night transports you to Italy.  I was skeptical from the Yelp reviews but as soon as I arrived, every positive comment from the reviews I read came true:
Authentic, homey Italian!
Staff warm and friendly; decor a perfect fit (just like your favorite pair of shoes); food--absolutely delicious:  the bruschetta, stuffed mushrooms; veal parm; vegetable soup.  It all tastes like it was made by your Italian grandmother (for those lucky enough to have had one).
Impressive selection of Italian wines at reasonable prices.
author: Kevin W.

description: Last night in San Francisco, what to eat? I wanted some Italian food, and my husband says, "sounds good, baby". (He's a good man)...yelp reviewers say that Firenze by Night can't be beat. Well, you all were right. I had their famous gnocchi in a creamy tomato sauce, my son has ravioli, and my husband shared the pork tenderloin special with our daughter. All were delicious. I know because I tasted everyone's. I had an affordable glass of red wine. We finished off with chocolate mousse, tiramisu, and cappuccino. The place is crowded, but full of charm. The maître d' was professional and charming. Our waiter was exceptional-Attentive and informative. I highly recommend this well-established, cozy restaurant.
author: Steffie S.

description: If you're looking for the greatest gnocchi to ever grace this earth, look no further. The wait staff, host, bartender, EVERYONE basically are wonderful. The food is served hot and the prices are pretty in line with most Italian restaurants in the city, but the quality of the food/service makes it the best place in SF to eat Italian!
author: Matt P.

description: The greatest Italian food I have ever eaten. A New Yorker visiting San Francisco. The owner, Sergio Guisti,  has created one of the greatest Italian cuisine experiences of my life. Don't expect heavy red sauce and garlic. The menu is extensive with nuanced authentic Northern Italian specialties that reflect the brilliant conception of its owner and children, Paolo and Nadia. Spinach salad, Bruschetta, pastas, fish, meat, light fluffy Ricotta cheesecake, Limoncello...I could go on and on. If anyone visits this beautiful city you must experience this exquisitely special restaurant. A family owned and operated restaurant jewel. Buon appetito!
author: Mark B.

description:
Do not go here if you live in SF and appreciate quality food and peers who enjoy the same thing in a nice, sophisticated setting. I shouldn't have been fooled by the pretty picture on the Bloomspot deal.

If you are a tourist, loud & rowdy, and/or a 30 or 40-something who thinks (and dresses, and think you can drink like) you're a 20-something, this is the place for you.

The food was fine - 3 stars, nothing outstanding, but just the whole experience

1) Should I even made a reservation at all? I showed up and they barely acknowledged I was written in the book. It seemed to all just be about what was available at the moment. I had to flag down waiters but I guess once I did ask, they were pretty sweet to me (before rushing off to do their thing and ignore me once again).

2) The owner (I think - dude with silvering hair pulled back in a ponytail) - what a guy. Very Italian. Says bye to every group leaving like he knows them. Each time I asked him about my reservation or the menu he got closer to me and more physically intimate. First he held my hand and rubbed the inside of my wrist. Next time he put his hand on the small of my back. Next time he got a little too close for comfort. 

3) The decor! Ugh! Tacky tacky all the way. Reminds me of those Carnival cruise ships that haven't been redecorated since the 70's. There's a painted blue sky, a fake Michelangelo statue, a fake skyline of Pisa or some Italian town, and fake vines running along the ceiling. My eyes were in pain.

I guess I'll talk about the food, though they really didn't make up for the ambiance at all. We got the 2 dishes that everyone seems to rave about:

* Gnocchi firenze - 3 stars
(Potato dumplings in a light tomato cream sauce $11.50)
This was fine.. I really can't say much else about it.

* Pappardelle toscana - 3 stars
(Large noodles in rabbit sauce $10.95)
Once again fine, though I thought the meat was too pulled apart - ie you never got a good chunk of protein, it was tiny bits all mixed up in the sauce.
author: Ziyan C.

description: GREAT FOOD! Family style neighborhood restaurant. Everyone is a local. Wonderful staff & service. Our server was Edgar and he really made our night. Attentive and super nice! Great guy!
author: Helga F.

description:
When some friends suggested we go to Firenze by Night, I thought of Donatello, Leonardo, and Michelangelo.  Not the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles but the sculptors/artists that were from Florence/Tuscany area.  I was expecting to see a Statue of David or something.  But instead when I walked into Firenze by Night Ristorante I saw a photo of Ted Lange from the Love Boat along with photos of a bunch of celebrities.   I thought, "ooooh, nothing says authentic Italian food like Ted Lange in his white tuxedo.."

Looking at the menu, I really liked the unusual entree options they had.  Rabbit and boar, along with normal stuff like veal, chicken, fish, etc.  So we settled on:

Cozze e vongole marinara:  a simple dish of Mussels and Clams with marinara.  I liked this appetizer and would order it again if I came back.

Vitella con porcini:  veal sautéed with porcini mushrooms in white wine.  This was ok.  The veal was tender and the flavor was nice.  The baby cow didn't die in vain...  I wasn't feeling the polenta.  But the veal itself was fine.

Pappardelle al Cinghiale:  this is a thick pasta with wild boar.  I heard this is a native dish of Tuscany.  It had a very light sauce, simple and good.  

I thought the service was friendly and efficient, no complaints.  I liked the ambience and feel of Firenze by Night.  The noise level was low so it was easy to converse with my friends.  Me personally, I'd lose the old celebrity photos, it kind of takes away from how nice this restaurant looks.  The map of Italy in the front of the place is a nice touch though.  All in all a decent spot for Italian food.  And maybe a little taste of  what food in Florence would be like, By Night of course.
author: Michael L.

description:
We were looking for a good Italian joint and this place was recommended to us by the bartender at Grant and Green right down the street. We walked in on a Thursday night around 8:00pm and were seated within 10 minutes. The place was packed! Our server was very friendly and on point with everything.

Appetizers: 
Calamari - not fried, but was still delicious.
Bruschetta - amazing and the bread was much better then the table bread provided.
Caesar Salad - light, not too much dressing and good flavor. 

Entrees: 
Fettuccine Pesto - simple, but delicious and flavorful
Gnocchi Firenze - the handmade gnocchi was to die for and the sauce was amazing too. This dish would be great with a protein
Penne Mare e Monti - Very good!

The portion sizes were perfect. We ended up so extremely full that we weren't able to order dessert, but I am sure it is delicious as well. 

I would definitely go back, but recommend reservations on the weekends as I am sure it gets quite busy!
author: Megan R.

description:
If you want AMAZING SERVICE and EVEN BETTER FOOD, come here. From the moment you walk in you are greeted with a smile and a hand shake by the owners and then once you look around, you realize you have stepped in to an authentic Italian family style restaurant. Pastel colors, mirror walls, grape leaves-the whole nine.

The Food: I am not a Gnocchi person- AT ALL and I ate the entire plate! My opinion is forever changed because of this place. It is light, fluffy and the sauce is just......You can't even describe it-It is so good. Don't leave this place without trying it. 

The Bruschetta, the bread was soft yet toasted so you could actually bite into without tearing your gums up or covering your shirt in crumbs. Flavoring was delicious and rich. Superb. 

The Seafood Pasta Special- good portion of seafood, sauce was delicious and I WILL be ordering this again. 

I cannot reiterate how good the service was. I watched the waiter keep an eye on us the entire time. He knew the perfect times to come over, waited for people to return from the restroom to take orders and offer desert. It was refreshing to see people be great at their jobs and the owners were sweeter than words. 

Come here, you won't regret it!
author: Britt S.

description: Amazing authentic Italian food and amazing service!!!!  We felt as if we were in Italy... The pasta was homemade and very fresh!  We all cleared our plates.. Not a drop left. Great service!
author: Marissa I.

description:
This is a small and cute italian restaurant located away from all the touristy places on Columbus. Great spot for a date or a dinner out with friends. Expect great authentic italian food and some buff italian waiters serving you does not hurt either :)

We ordered one of the specials which was veal wrapped in beef served with vegetables. The meat was cooked in a red wine sauce and was very flavorful but I wasn't too impressed with the dish in general. 

The pappardelle toscana was excellent though! The pasta tasted like they made it fresh in their kitchen and the sauce tasted homemade as well. I like how there was just enough sauce to coat the noodles and it didn't overpower the whole dish.
author: Sheena N.

description: What an amazing meal we had tonight. The best gnocchi we have ever eaten in their light red sauce. Unbelievable!  We enjoyed their evening specials one was halibut in a tomato caper sauce.  The other was veal topped with eggplant and cheese. Both dishes were excellent!  The young bartender made our Soco Manhattans just like we requested!  What an enjoyable evening at Firenze s!
author: Fred W.

description:
Had a nice dinner here before walking to Beach Blanket Babylon.  They didn't have masala on the menu, yet they made me chicken Marsala upon request:)
White linen tablecloths add nice touch to this quaint restaurant block and half off of main North Beach Street.  Can walk to Main Street for ice team, cappuccino or visit the fabulous bakery
author: Pam H.

description:
Yes, the gnocchi really are that good. Usually gnocchi leaves you feeling bloated and heavy due to all the cream and cheese, but these were coated lightly in a tomato cream sauce that was perfectly proportioned. The salad I ordered was decent and wine was ok, the real standout here was the praised and prized little pillows of heaven. 

My friend and I split the gnocchi and a salad and each had two glasses of wine-- paid about $40 each. Not the cheapest meal. Next time I will skip all the frill and order those gnocchi to go.
author: Christine E.

description:
Paulo and team took care of us! I had visitors in from OOT- 6 people. We started with a beautiful appetizer of Prosciutto, calamari salad, bruschetta, and Caprese salad. Course 2= gnocchi with meat sauce and pesto sauce side by side! course 3 were various entrees that are all fantastic- Swordfish, Veal, Shelfish- everything was fantastic!
I was given high praise fro bringing friends here- I highly recommend Firenze! The food is great and the people are awesome too!
author: Mike M.

description: Excellent service and food! Also, travelers, this is one of the few restaurants that stay open past 9 on a Saturday. Everything was delicious, but the table favorite was the lasagna! Oh and don't skip the tiramisu. Light and airy. Yummy! Thanks, Paolo, for the great welcome and thanks to the bartender who makes a mean lemoncello and the attentive server from Florida!
author: MarMar A.

description: Food was amazing, we got the calamari, Caesar salad and the fettuccini pesto. The staff was incredibly nice and attentive without hovering! Will definitely be recommending this to family/friends in the future. Thank you for such good service!
author: Lauren A.

description: This is hands down the BEST Italian Restaurant in San Francisco. I literally eat here EVERY time that I have to come to the city. Family owned and fully authentic, does it get any damn better?? No
author: Ben T.

description:
I really disagree with the current four-star rating here. My friends and I had an overall "fine" experience at this restaurant, but I expected a lot more based on the Yelp rating and everything I had heard about North Beach dining. Unfortunately, we left extremely underwhelmed.

Craving Italian, we had decided to find a cute spot in North Beach. We did some walking around and 'menu shopping,' and settled on this restaurant, glad there was no wait. Not knowing anything about the spot, I asked the host (half joking) how he felt about the restaurant and if we should eat there. His response? "Well, you're here now - might as well sit down." Without another word he plopped our menus down on a table and walked off.

First impressions: The ambience is kind of boring and outdated. The tables are a little close together for comfort. And everything feels like it hasn't been updated in forever. Sure, they may consider it part of the old-Italian charm - but when your menus are printed pieces of paper under torn, dirty plastic... I'm not sure I'm buying into it.

Our waiter was nice enough, and had a very authentic Italian accent. Definitely scored some points on that front, however he was not particularly helpful with the menu and his visits to the table were infrequent at best. Several times throughout the meal we were left waiting, searching for refills on water, parmesan cheese, and we waited especially long after our plates were cleared before he came back to offer dessert or the check. In fact, he didn't actually OFFER us either of those things - we had to flag him down eventually, signaling we wanted to leave from across the room.

The food is FINE but very overpriced for what you get. I paid $8 for a salad that was a few bits of mixed greens, a couple shreds of carrot and 2 quartered grape tomatoes. I expected more from the pasta dishes, but they were cooked 'just alright,' with nothing memorable about them, except for the fact that my fettucine with tomatoes and mushrooms kind of tasted like Chef Boyardee. My boyfriend's artichoke chicken was overly salty, and the other two dishes we had were decent - the gnocchi and the melanzane both worth eating but small on the portion size, and the eggplant (melanzane) really should have come with a side of pasta or something.

It is possible I'm spoiled by Boston's North End, but I certainly won't be back to overpay for a mediocre Italian meal at this spot. In fact, I'm a little jaded on North Beach in general... but I'll keep exploring.
author: Catie F.

description:
We wanted to have dinner in the North Beach area on our recent trip to San Francisco, trying to find the charm of the place that we read so much about. 

I looked into lots of restaurants in the area, I was looking for a place less touristy, without a super cheesy decor, w. more interesting food, reasonable priced and more authentic. Firenze by Night seemed a good fit.

We stopped by one evening for dinner and the place is cute, cozy, with some nice indoor lights. We were seated at a small table too close to the kitchen (noisy corner). I asked the host if we can be seated somewhere else and he said "no", they were waiting for bigger parties.
We realized that this place is better for bigger parties, not for couples out on a date or smaller groups.

We weren't thrilled, but stayed. Got some bread from the house (nothing great) that we dipped in olive oil and a couple of glasses of Chianti ($8 a glass). The waiters are Italians, that's nice. 

I ordered the Tortellini Alla Romana (w. peas and prosciutto) and my husband got the Cannelloni Biagio (pasta stuffed w. chicken and prosciutto, ricotta in a marinara sauce). The waiter told him that his dish would take longer to make (30 min.) since it's made from scratch. We were cool w. that. No rush, we were on vacation. But they brought the food very fast, too fast. So, way less than 30 min, maybe 10?  

The food was good, but nothing outstanding. We skipped the dessert. The waiter was lingering too much around us, but when my husband wanted to pay the check, somehow the host picked it up. The host gave us the wrong change (less than was owed), when my husband went to ask him, he was denying he took care of it. Then some manager (I guess) got involved, the host came back with the explanation " these new bills stick together" and brought the actual change (more).

The meal was the most expensive that we had while we were in San Francisco (this place is the only one that is more expensive than their online menus- with 2-3 dollars more for each item) and it was the least satisfying meal we had on our trip. It wasn't bad, but we didn't enjoy it as much as we hoped. The place lacked  atmosphere, we didn't feel welcome and felt a bit hassled, taken advantage of rushed out and didn't enjoy the "bill incident''. I wouldn't come back to this place!
author: Jo S.

description:
I just came here for dinner with my friends. They keep the bread coming which was nice since I was really hungry and the food took awhile to get to our table but I digress since the place seemed pretty busy. I had to order the calamari which is more of squid salad instead of the fried variety and I rather enjoyed it except for the fact they skimped on the actual squid portion.  We all tried each others dishes and the consensus was that it was all good but not awe inspiring. the daily special chicken dish was well cooked but a tad bland. I liked my gnocchi as it had a great texture and the sauce was creamy while not overwhelming. The Rabbit pasta which was the other award winning dish was overcooked and over salted. 

Service = 4 stars
Alcohol  = 4 stars
Food = 3 stars
price = $$$

overall a good 3.5 stars for a great ambiance and great service with good comforting home style italian food but every once in a while you may get some overcooked pasta.
author: Norris T.

description: Service was great! Food was fantastic! It was packed on a Saturday night, so be sure to make reservations. Definitely returning.
author: Pam B.

description: I use to be scared of eating rabbit but after eating here I had their pasta with bits of rabbit and it was delicious. The bruschetta was some of the best I've ever had and their bread is really good too! The only downfall is the price but for north beach it's normal price
author: Samuel B.

description:
Completely disappointed with my experience here. Food was terrible and the service was just as bad. 
This place was definitely an old school Italian restaurant and I was looking forward to it. The tomato sauce tasted like it came out of a can. The Gnocchi (award winning) were poorly made and all different sizes. Some were tough and some were mush. My brother had the veal which was paper thin and flavorless. 
Since we were there celebrating a birthday we got a piece of Tiramisu. We all dug in and we all made the same face. It was so fucking disgusting I had to spit it out. 

Service is another area that was just bad.  10 guys running around and they seem really busy but we didn't get much attention at all.  We had to ask for things like butter for bread multiple times. When we sat, the server over us bottled water or pelligrino. We declined and one of us ordered clubs soda and we were charge $3.50. I know it's not free but a little insane, especially when we paid almost $30 an entree for jar quality Italian food. 

The owner was also very strange, drinking at the bar. Uncomfortably touching us as we left. 

I would say, don't go here

Hands down one of the worst restaurants I have ever been to. Thoroughly disappointed.
author: Justin L.

description:
This is my favorite Italian restaurant in the city. I love how authentic they are. All the owners of this place are super nice and make you feel like home. Their food is amazing. Anything in the menu is great not only the award winning menus. 

Just ask for anything to recommend. You will be surprised in a very good way! Also their wine prices are really reasonable. 

My favorite is their tiramisu.! It's a must. I will never share my tiramisu with a friend. Order one each. It is not possible to share.
author: Kathy J.

description: This is my favorite Italian restaurant in SF.   Less known than the rest but true Italian food. Gnocchi and Sole are incredible.  We got here every time we visit SF....
author: Kim P.

description:
Great food and authentic atmosphere
Would get a 5 star if wine list had better choices.
Worth the trip.
author: Ricardo A.

description:
Classic Italian restaurant with pretty good food.  In North Beach finding a good Italian is a bit hit and miss, this is worth a visit.  By no means outstanding but you wont be disappointed.

Service was good.  Restaurant could do with a dusting/cleaning.
author: Des D.

description: First time I ever have a great eggplant in a restaurant. It sounds simple to make a vegetable but you'd be surprised how many get it wrong.  The gnocchi was really good and the tortellini was amazing,  The ambiance was friendly and family oriented.  Our waiter was super friendly and kind. Authentic Italian food!
author: Patricia M.

description: How have I not left a review yet? Delicious. Just came back from Italy and I found myself craving the gnocchi, the raviolis and the tortillini from Firenze by Night...that says it all right there. Not to mention the staff is amazing.
author: Michelle G.

description:
We ordered the Gnocchi Firenze and the Pappardelle w/ rabbit with the gnocchi being the better dish of the two. I thought flavors were a bit lacking and had no depth to it but we ate on... in silence. I've definitely had better elsewhere.

No complaints about service. The server did his thing, took our orders and served it.  Our tables were cleared in a timely manner. 

There are so many great Italian restaurants in the city, ironically not in North Beach where one would think so and the food here was just not memorable to me. At all. 

Teetering on 2.5 stars but opted to round up.
author: Esther A.

description: This place was recommended by a friend. The service was great but the food was really boring.
author: Jessica P.

description: My husband and I went here for a dinner date and the food was decent. My issue is that they used my credit card to not only pay for our bill ($80), they used my card to pay for another table as well ($130). Luckily, I caught it on my credit card statement and immediately spoke to the manager. He basically blew me off. After numerous attempts to reach them, the manager never called me back. Never got a refund and no apology. My bank had to open a case against them for the fraud they committed. Shady service. Beware!
author: Von P.

description: Excellent food, service and friendly atmosphere.  The gnocchi are as soft as a cloud and yummy!!!!  I will definitely be back.
author: mary f.

description: Quickly becoming our go-to Italian place for family visits. Great soups and pastas. Atmosphere is good, service is friendly and energetic.
author: Tinou B.

description:
This place is sooooo very wonderful .
First- the food is delicious! My family loved the gnocchi, risotto ,and tortellini were great! So was the tiramisu!
Second- the staff was wonderful and Sergio  that owns the place is amazing! Sergio really treats everyone like they are coming to eat at his house. He has a wonderful personality. Wish them lots more success for years to come.
author: Cecilia B.

description: My Italian dinning experience in San Francisco was a disappointing one.  The waiter brought us Pinot Noir instead of Grigio and the food quality seemed less than more economical options.  Far from a disaster but far from spectacular either.
author: James H.

description: This restaurant came highly recommended to us for a great date night and now we can't stop raving about it. It's located in Little Italy in SF and may seem unassuming from the outside but is a fantastic Italian restaurant. They are renown for 2 award winning dishes - gnocchi and their fat noodles with rabbit sauce. I couldn't decide which to order to try so the waiter was so kind to offer to let me have half of both on one dish. I could not believe how tasty the rabbit sauce was and could not stop eating the gnocchi. To die for! My husband had the special spinach linguini with seafood (mussels, clams, prawns, etc) and he couldn't stop making "mmmmmm" noises after every bite. This place is definitely one to go to!
author: Mason D.

description:
This place is a must try! From the food made with pure love to the customer service, you will be taken care of and will leave happy, wishing you could eat there every day. 

If I had to recommend one thing and just one thing (there are so many) I'd recommend the gnocchi. Like little buttery Italian pillows, they melt in your mouth. I think I died and went to heaven - a happy, delicious, soft, pillowy heaven. 

I love that it's a family run business. And all of the staff I encountered spoke Italian. It's like I stepped into Little Italy and was apart of the family. I immediately felt welcomed and at home at the same time. 

I will be back tomorrow and will recommend this place to any friend in town. 

Buon cibo, buon vino, buoni amici.
author: Angela V.

description: This is my first time in San Francisco and I'm staying at the Westin in Union Square. I asked the hotel concierge to recommend an Italian restaurant.  Without hesitation he recommended Firenze by Night. I haven't enjoyed an Italian meal in a while so I went with some of my favorites. Mozzarella Di Bufala. Risotto. And tiramisu. Even though I was not that hungry, I couldn't stop. "This is a great place" and worthy of a recommendation. I hope you enjoy your meal as much as I did mine. Delish!! Mangia Mangia! Buon appetito!
author: Doc H.

description:
NORTH BEACH EATING PART II: FLORENTINE CUISINE

"Last Supper"

About two weeks ago I wrote my first series of Italian eatery after Pope Francis was elected. Since this is Holy Week I ate here tonight the day before Good Friday. In Anthony Bourdain's pilot episode of "No Reservations" he asked if you were on death row what would you last meal be. My last meal is already mentioned on my Yelp profile however in keeping with the Italian theme I know what my last Italian meal would be.

I browsed through the website and knew what two I wanted to order: 1) gnocchi firenze 2) bistecca alla fiorentina. When I got there the waiter mentioned one of the specials tonight was the swordfish steak. I've had their swordfish steak here before and it is the best I ever had. I had to be disciplined and stuck with my original choices. And of course I had to have a glass of Chianti. 

If you are craving for meat and potatoes come here for the Italian version. Their gnocchi heads down the best I ever had. Most gnocchis I've had in the past were heavy. Not here as the gnocchi is very light. It is like eating small pockets of pillows. Use your bread to wipe of that red sauce from the gnocchi because it's delicious. The only downside was the bistecca alla fiorentina but that is my fault. Most of the time I like to order my steaks rare. This time I ordered medium rare. Maybe it's been a while since I ordered a steak medium rare because I felt the steak wasn't red enough for me. However the steak was tasty and moist. Why do I like my steak rare? It's because you can really taste the flavor of the meat. The one pet peeve I have is when people order their steak to be cook well done. Having the steak well done kills the flavor of the meat. In addition if you are going to have your steak well done you might as well eat out a GILF. 

Overall I had a very good "Last Supper" dinner. Now it's on to the next Italian restaurant on North Beach for me to eat.
author: Gerald R.

description:
Having lived in Italy for a number of years, I am a tough sell when it comes to Italian restaurants. My BF swore their gnocchi was amazing, it was light and although I wouldn't say amazing, good. 

I ordered penne maré e monté (chicken and prawns), the dish came out and was clearly boxed pasta, and the shrimp were rock shrimp (small, frozen) not prawns. 

Wish I would have left with a better experience, wouldn't say it's a must visit.
author: Michelle Q.

description:
My wife and I just spent a weekend in the Bay Area. We were out hitting some local FUN spots Sunday afternoon and met up with a couple who suggested that we go to Firenze by Night for dinner Sunday evening. Now, I've eaten in various establishments in North Beach many different times during my visits to San Francisco but I had never heard of Firenze by Night so we decided to give it a shot. We are sooooooo glad we DID!! When we arrived, the place was super busy and, since this was a last minute suggestion, we didn't have a reservation. We were greeted warmly by Nadia who was able to secure a table for us relatively quickly. Fausto was our server and he was awesome. He helped guide us through the menu as well as the wine list and was patient and courteous. Fausto was SPOT ON with his suggestions and we savored every delicious bite! As busy as the place was, you wouldn't think Sergio, the owner, would have time to spend with a couple who lives about 1,800 miles away but you would be WRONG to think that. It was almost like spending an old school Sunday Italian dinner at my mother's house! The entire staff was amazing and the atmosphere was incredibly comfortable and inviting. 

Whether you are a local looking for a new fav in North Beach or if you are a tourist looking for an amazing Italian dining experience, get off the beaten path of Columbus Ave and get one block over to Stockton St. and check out Firenze by Night. You will be incredibly happy you did!!
author: Dan G.

description: Gnocchi was 5 stars award winning for sure. Everything else, carpacchio, ceasar salad, was meh.The stuffed mushrooms were 3 stars and Papperdelle was also 5 in texture of pasta but I don't eat rabbit so I would never order it myself.
author: Karen T.

description:
A true Italian restaurant. All the waiters can speak the language. From the outside, it looks like a sports bar, but when you go all the way inside, it has a cozy Italian feel. The food was very good. 

BRUSCHETTA -Garlic Bread with Tomatoes and Olive Oil-nice grill on the bread, but couldn't really taste the garlic. The tomatoes were fresh and perfect amount of basil

CARPACCIO-Thin Slices of Raw Filet of Beef-I couldn't try this, but my hubby said it was good. Wish I could take a bite because it came with mustard. I never saw that before with carpaccio.

FUNGHI RIPIENI CON SALSICCIA-Mushrooms stuffed with Italian Sausage-Very yummy

STRACCIATELLA-Chicken Broth with Egg and Parmesan Cheese-super comforting. I never had a soup like this. Very simple and the egg is what makes the soup. It's more like a steam egg. I can just drink bowls of this!

TORTELLINI ALLA ROMANA-Tortellini with Peas and Prosciutto in a Cream Sauce-no peas and substitute for mushrooms instead. Love it. 

FETTUCCINE "BUON GUSTAIO"-Fettuccine with Wild Mushrooms, Sun Dried Tomatoes and Garlic-very meaty taste. It was hardy and delicious

GNOCCHI FIRENZE-Potato Dumplings in a Light Tomato Cream Sauce-not bad at all

POLLO CON FUNGHI-Roasted Chicken with Mushrooms, Garlic, Rosemary and White Wine-this was amazing! One of the best chickens I ever had. It has a light crust and it was super moist! A ton of flavor. I would come back just to try this again. 

BISTECCA ALLA FIORENTINA-Porterhouse Steak marinated in Olive Oil and Herbs-Hubby liked it. Cooked perfectly, good flavors and it was a huge steak.
author: Karen H.

description:
Wow, I really loved this restaurant. I want to start with dessert and work my way backwards. We shared a tiramisu which was amazing, the dark chocolate cake was really good as well. I had of course their award winning gnocchi which was delicious. My friends had the black fettuccine with creamy cause with clams and muscles, I took a taste of course, also was very good. The polenta was nice and creamy I liked it too. Yes, I liked everything. 

The atmosphere is lively, service is fast, everyone was very friendly and welcoming, make reservations for sure it gets very busy. Prices are very reasonable. 

I strongly recommend checking it out, I know I will be back soon.
author: Rula T.

description: Lovely evening last night at this beautiful restaurant.  Service couldn't be more welcoming.  Delicious food and ample wine list.  Look forward to returning!
author: Leslie K.

description: This is an absolutely wonderful Italian restaurant!  Had dinner here before "Beach Blanket Babylon".  Some the best Italian I've had, great, fun atmosphere and the service was clearly above average. Give it a try when you're in the City!
author: Steve F.

description: Great service and food. I recommend the Linguine and anchovies pasta dish. Reasonable prices.
author: Boon P.

description:
BOMB! 

The food here is quite excellent. It's on a not as busy street away from the hubbub or tourists. I ordered tortellini and changed the sauce to pesto. EXCELLENT choice! 

Also had...
Carpaccio - was actually pretty gross and bland. Will never order this again but their other apps made up for it.
Bruschetta - really good and garlicy! Some parts were a little burned but definitely didn't ruin the dish. 
Variety of vegetables - pretty good! Had zucchini, eggplant, red peppers
Gnocchi - YUM!

Our waiter looked like a muscle man. Everyone had long hair. It was quite italian!
author: Angela L.

description:
YUM!!!
I must come back here again and again and again. The menu is fantastic and we ended up with the specials. So we have to come back!

Having already eaten at most of the restaurants along Columbus, I'm usually trying to find someplace new. Seeing the intriguing sign for the bar next door, brought us over to find out that that was a bar; but hey, here's an Italian place right next door. The menu just looked fabulous and some guy mentioned the food being really good. Did he work there? I don't think so; but was definitely a regular.

We went in with no reservation and was seated promptly. The place is bigger than it seems on the outside and there was another room adjacent to the bar room where we sat.

We started with the carpaccio. It came with a small dollop of mustard which we thought was interesting but a really nice added touch. It was quite god.

The bread was nice and fresh.

The menu. So many good things to choose from! It was a really tough choice and the waiter suggested the Petrole Sole. OMG he was not kidding. It was such an awesome plate of food!
The fish was very tender and practically melted in my mouth. It came with "the basic sides of carrots and broccoli and polenta". Well let me tell you those "basic sides" were seasoned perfectly. They were actually seasoned! I go to so many places that obviously don't care about the sides because they are so bland. Not the case here.
I ended up with leftovers and even those were just as good and tasty as this night. Yum!

My BF got the lamb shank special. I reached over to get a bite and my fork went right into the meat and just pealed a lovely piece out. Falling off the bone delicious! I think he got the same sides and was very happy.

The waiter was attentive. The decor was very Italian and I really liked the painted ceiling. Made to feel like you were outside. Everyone working there is Italian and I love that about North Beach in general.

Had to have dessert and the caramel pudding (basically flan) was light, airy and just the right amount to share after a superb meal.

I will definitely be back!
author: Sandra R.

description: Great find! The menu and specials were fantastic, as was the service. Intimate location, make reservations if possible. Highly recommended.
author: M L.

description: Ive been here 3 times . !st was great. second no so good . 3rd terrible  Its like this they false advertise their prices. they are inconsistent. they take for granted their stars. the wait staff are fonnys that RUN OFF PATRONS , SNOBS WITH AFAKE ACCENT.   if its slow they push you out the door . the food is not fresh, they cut EVERY corner. im coming to town next week and I still see great reviews mixed with bad . the employees are screwing this place up , including the half baked fry cooks . the owner is helping by letting it slide . at lest make your own pasta , and fire someone to get that joint inline.
author: randy j.

description:
I dined at this Italian restaurant last Tuesday and had the snails and the rabbit pappardelle and shortly after became violently ill. We went to the theater after dinner and I spent the second half of the show in the bathroom. I missed a day of work and am still sick  three days later. I have been a chef professionally for twenty years and I am confident that this is the source of my continuing illness.
  I called the restaurant to let them know that this occurred. I made it clear that I wanted nothing, only to bring the situation to the attention of the chef or manager. I found the gentleman(manager) I spoke with to be argumentative and defensive. 
On a brighter note some of the dishes that we had were quite nice, the gnocchi was excellent. The pappardelle pasta was the perfect texture. I just can't give it another star because of how sick I got.
author: Skye M.

description:
I had to revisit my previous post because 

...I came back for the gnocchis. They were remembered fondly in my memory as magical little flavor pillows - if you will.
That memory is now dead. Everything I sampled was mediocre. I don't know if it was just a busy night and the chef was rushed, but the quality was not up to par. Neither was the service.

It was still better than other North Beach alternatives, so for that I grace Firenze with 3 stars.
author: Cassie C.

description: I had been excited to come check this restaurant out. I was a little disappointed with the food. The best part about the dinner was the gnocchi. The bread wasn't really all that great and the Caesar salad was not the best. Next time I'm in SF, I will try another spot.
author: Jeanette F.

description: A great place for a table for 4 men, just off Columbus.  Pretty good puffiness of my gnocchi.  I like red sauce, especially with meat!  I needed two napkins.  I'd definitely come back.  For a 3rd time.
author: Charles C.

description: Good option for traditional and authentic Italian in the North Beach neighborhood.  Also consider the many other options just a little further up on Columbus.
author: Matt F.

description: Not bad but just another average North Beach restaurant designed for tourists. The veal was tough and sparse. The service was hurried then scarce. The noise level was similar to a ball stadium during a home run hit. This would be a two star if not for the price: $295 for a party of 5.
author: Bill P.

description: This place is truly amazing.  The food was great and the service was good but not particularly warm.  We brought friends here from out of state and they were blown away.  I had the calamari pasta and it was one of the most delicious things I have ever tasted.  Truly a memorable meal.  We made reservations and it was really crowded so I think walk ins would have a pretty long wait.
author: Barbara T.

description: Sooooooooo good. The service is prompt and charming. The food is fantastic, the pasta is fresh made. I had the wild mushroom pasta, fantastic. My daughter had had the gnocchi and that picky eater loved it. My mom had ravioli and it was delicious. I'm adding Firenze to my fav San Francisco restaurants. Go there!
author: Scotti A.

description:
This place has some amazing Italian food! My fiancee found the place as we were told in SF, Little Italy is the place to go for real Italian food. We did a yelp search and this looked like a great place to check out.

My fiancee being vegetarian and the carnivore I am, the menu was pretty well balanced for the both of us. We ordered the Insalata estiva, AMAZING! The salad was soo amazingly good...and the waiter was nice enough to split it for us on plates, rather than us doing it ourselves. For dinner he ordered the Gnocchi that was award winning -- and it WAS award winning. I think I ended up eating more of his plate than I did mine. :-) I ordered the tortellini dish. The pasta was okay, I didn't think there was anything special about it, but the cream sauce and the prosciutto  with it, was solid. I probably would order another dish...probably the Gnocchi if I'm back in town for a visit. 

The atmosphere of the place is cozy and inviting. You can definitely dress casual or dressy here and not feel out of place. The staff is super friendly, which is so refreshing! I love when the staff is so cheerful -- makes it so much more inviting!
author: Sonal P.

description:
Great restaurant located in the heart of Little Italy in San Francisco.  You walk in through the bar area to get through to the restaurant and it looks like a place straight out of a Spike Lee movie.  In the bar area, they have autographed pictures on the wall of all of the stars that have come through.  I saw photos of Sophia Loren, Robin Williams oh, and I actually saw Dustin Hoffman in person, he was there!!!  He peeked in the restaurant area from the bar area when we were having dinner.  It was packed!  I wanted to take a picture, but I didn't want to be "that" person, lol.  

The waiters speak Italian as do most of the customers, I noticed.  They turn the tables over as soon as the customers leave, so there's always new people coming in.  It's a well-oiled process they have going on there.  The food, oh the food.  Now I didn't take any pictures because it seemed like people put their phones away in there, was weird.  I was even looking to see if there was a sign prohibiting the use of phones because we didn't see any being used.  The iced tea was freshly brewed and already sweetened and it was delicious!  I could sit there all day and drink it.  Then they bring out the bread, sourdough and focaccia.  The focaccia was different and I hate to keep using the word delicious but dammit it was just that.  It had little bits of green onion and it looked like a pound cake.  I ate one piece and my honey ate the rest.  I was analyzing it and he was munching away.  We should have ordered more, but then the food came and omg it was... well, delicious.  I had the Tortollini alla Romana which was tortellini with peas and prosciutto in a cream Sauce.  This by far, was the best tasting pasta I've ever had.  Wow.  My taste buds were having a party!  It was a healthy portion, and I ate ever last bit of it, em hmm, sure did.  I thought I was going to take a little sumthin' sumthin' to go and eat a late snack later, but this wasn't the case.  The cream sauce was perfectly balanced and the prosciutto was stuffed in the tortellini and scattered throughout the dish as well, along with the peas.  It was a perfect combination of ingredients.  Willie had them fix a dish that was not on the menu, Fettucini with Bolognese Sauce.  He demolished it too, but he savored it and took his time eating, where I was speed eating I guess.  Shoot it was good, it is, what it is.  For  dessert, I HAD to get the Tiramisu and I was so happy I did!  It was so good.  The lady fingers were tastefully drenched in rum, and it held that rum!  He had the Spumone which, of course, is the Neapolitan Ice Cream.  The meal was spectacular, I loved this night, good food, great company and super romantic!  It has become my favorite Italian restaurant in the Bay Area.

Parking is scarce, but our hotel was in the financial district which is close to Chinatown, Little Italy, and Fisherman's Wharf, so we walked everywhere.  They also have all sorts of transportation available, cable cars, trolley, bikes, cabs, etc.  The ambiance is romantic and the wait staff was very kind, accommodating and quick!  Definitely will be back, great experience!!!
author: Lina F.

description: This is an Italian gem on the north side. We had reservations at 7 pm andwere seated as soon as we arrived. The waiter was friendly and knew the menu very well. The bread was delicious and was served with olive oil. I enjoyed the vegetarian lasagna and my friend had a prawn dish with red sauce. A great list of wines including many from Italy. I would absolutely recommend this place and hope to get back here soon!
author: Cathy S.

description: The food here is pretty authentic. Restaurant is pretty small so it's kinda tight and it's pretty loud in there but the food was pretty good. Portions are kinda small though.  Waiters the 2x I went were really nice and helpful.
author: Amy R.

description: We called for a reservation Friday mid morning and they called us back when they opened and got us in. When we got there it was very busy, but they had our table and sat us right away. They were very, very nice. Seriously it was like being at home. You know, they said we were lovely, and just doted. Sorry folks but service is big for me. Ok the food, it was solid. I started with the stracciatella. Very yummy. I had the pappardelle, and the sauce was good. The pasta was just slightly dense. It should have been rolled out thinner, but that's just nitpicking. I wanted to reach for the salt too, but it wasn't extreme. But overall I would recommend and I loved these guys. Look at my reviews and you will see I am super picky about service. If I am out and spending my hard earned, I want to be catered to. Molto bene.
author: Nancy P.

description: This was pretty standard Italian and man is it filling! Portions are big and everything is fine. As a bay area native who is used to pretty amazing SF food, it wouldn't be some where I would take people to thrill them but it met expectations. The gnocchi I had was fine but not the al dente kind with a bit of chew to it that I prefer and my date's pappardelle was fine. These seem to be the two dishes they are known for so I would expect them to stand out a bit more. The decor is pretty tacky italian and the servers all have strong accents which I think all make for the ambiance they are going for. Anyway--my take-away was that this was more of a tourist spot.
author: Lola C.

description: Fantastic find!  Authentic...delicious...Italian dishes.  Wonderful staff.  Brought my cousins here who were visiting from Italy....they said it was their best meal  of their trip!   The gnocchi was a top dish for our table.  Friends who joined us recommended this find!  We will be back.
author: Nancy M.

description: Had the special seafood with pasta in a tomato sauce! Delicious! Had calamari salad to start and the chicken dish with White wine and mushrooms!! Definitely worth the wait! Service was decent but it's because it's heavily packed! Recommend it for authentic Italian food!
author: Lauren K.

description:
As an Italian from NY I can tell you this food is one of the best and authentic in all of SF.

You're not getting a calimari steak from anywhere else. Seriously man. Name another place. You can't! 

Don't bother yourself with reviews from people who aren't that smart. Anyone can Yelp.

Guy who 1 stars because place isn't open yet. What an idiot..." they wouldn't seat my party of 5 before they opened"....um whaaat!?

Or the other jackass..."I know I got the shits from this place because I  am a chef"... stop it. Every restaurant has 1 or 2 reviews like this and guess what...never in my life have I gotten sick from a restaurant. As a decent human being adult I have figured out what I can and cannot eat.

Good and proper Italian food is expensive and not everybody can afford it so don't make up stories mr. Poopy pants.
author: Chastity C.

description: This is my favorite Italian place in the city. The food is fabulous, the atmosphere is very comfortable and cozy, the waiters are incredibly friendly, and Sergio, the owner, very welcoming.  The gnocchi is my favorite dish, but everything I've tried has been excellent. Don't forget to order a salad and to try the limoncello.
author: Erica A.

description: This was the first time that I was here, and I was with a private party.  We met the owners, and they were really nice.  The wait staff was great, the food tasted wonderful, the portions were a bit on the light side, but still delicious.  It has an old world charm, and was very comfortable.
author: Paul G.

description: My boyfriend and I enjoyed a beautiful dinner in North Beach last night at Firenze by Night. I had an amazing caprese salad, which was well priced and delicious! My boyfriend enjoyed the gnocchi, which stood true to its "award winning" title. The atmosphere and decor was beautiful and set a great "date" mood. I will be coming back soon!
author: Marie M.

description:
Truly my favorite Italian 
The gnocchi is heaven the best I have ever had- the rabbit ravioli melts in your mouth.
author: Lisa C.

description:
Another great visit.
The gnocchi and spinach salad were outstanding.
PS - They were filming a commercial while we were there. That staff was very friendly and helpful about being us possibly being uncomfortable. 
Very good experience!
author: Robert M.

description: I've gotten a lot of a ravioli lately as a new SF transplant, trying to find a go to place. Some places have disappointed, some have been pretty good, but finally I found a place that is amazing. Their raviolis were huge! Absolutely stuffed with spinach and ricotta, I legit almost couldn't finish even though there were only six pieces. My bf got the crepes filled with prosciutto and chicken and  was equally filled and impressed. The service was fast, attentive, and super accommodating (especially considering my picky and prickly mother who was visiting and dining with us).  Loved it, happy to have found that go to place.
author: Kristen T.

description: What a horrible experience- we asked change to tip the boss boy and they threw the change back at us. The host was so rude that I will never go back again. He might have had a bad night so then he should have stayed at home. So many Italian restaurants- regret wasting my night at this restaurant
author: Ida P.

description: There were 4 people in our party and all had a great meal. The service was excellent as well as the atmosphere. Cesar salad is a must as the dressing is homemade and excellent.
author: David R.

description:
So my last review was for take out but we dined in this time, I went again last night and I am regretting not taking home my leftovers- granted it was only a bite but I want that bite so bad right now.

Amazing amazing meal! I got the special which was a rigatoni pasta with wild boar ragu style sauce. Omg I want it right now, should I walk up there and get it? Maybe I will. 

We also started with the snails! I made my boyfriend try it, they were awesome!
author: Jordan S.

description: Incredible Italian food, best we had our entire stay in North beach. If you want good pasta this place is a must.
author: Adam M.

description:
Located in a busy part of town (especially on Friday night) and parked in front of the restaurant thinking there was valet parking. It turns out there was not a valet, but the host was gracious enough to move the restaurant's curbside sign and let us park right out front. Very nice first impression 

Now for the meal, which I greatly enjoyed because...

-the ambiance was  casual and inviting, very comfortable 
-Our waiter was fun and engaging, although service was a bit rushed
-the food was great. I had the braciole special, it was very tender and had great flavor. my wife had the gnocchi in a tomato cream sauce. Nice pillowy texture, yet rich and filling. 
-others in our party had the spinach and cheese ravioli and veal saltimbocca and raved about both dishes

I recommend this restaurant if you are looking for a casual, hearty Italian meal in the city
author: Erik C.

description: First time there, very Italian(fun). We all had the ravioli's they were very tasty we would recommend to anyone.  North Beach is a fun area. Stopped and had gelato at the deli next door on the way back.
author: Michelle D.

description: Delicious Italian restaurant run by actual Italians. Very good!
author: Stephanie D.

description: I gave this 2 stars only because of the award winning Gnocchi which was amazing. The reason why it doesn't get 4 or 5 stars is because of the WORST SERVICE EVER. First, our table was not served with the complimentary bread. Next when we asked for garlic bread, we were told they didn't have any, when the menu clearly states garlic bread is an appetizer. When we asked again, the waiter pretentiously says they have bruschetta and not garlic bread. It's the same thing!!! All night we felt rushed, and had a very rude waiter. At the end we paid and left but not before we were accused of skipping out on our bill. We asked to speak to the manager but nothing was done other than an apology that didn't seem very sincere. I'm sorry but the food is not good enough to come back again. Never coming back or recommending.
author: Manjit B.

description:
Call me bella again.  Hot Italian waiter, you made our girls night out so much fun!  Just the right amount of flirty and helpful.  

So, obviously, no problems with service.  My food, ooooh, such good food.  We each ordered a different dish and passed plates, and had the gnocchi as an appetizer.  The gnocchi was so good, little pillows of creamy soft goodness.  DELICIOUS!  But I couldn't eat a plate of them, too rich, so a few as an appetizer was a better choice.

I ordered osso bucco, it was so tender and the sauce was beautiful, flavorful and well balanced.  The marrow popped right out and onto bread for me to enjoy.  The polenta was ok, creamy but a bit bland for me.  I also tried pork chop with gorgonzola and artichoke, clam linguini, and sword fish.  I skipped the chicken ravioli.  The sword fish was AMAZING.  It was a thinner steak than I'm used to seeing, but had a beautiful smokey flavor while remaining tender and moist.  

We got good advice about wine, my martini was well made, the staff were welcoming.  I'd definitely go back.
author: Rebecca H.

description: We don't go in for Italian much, so I cannot claim to be an expert, but I do know what food prepared with care tastes like, and this is it!  First, our server was an honest-to-goodness, enthusiastic Italian!  We skipped an appetizer and had the Linguine tuto Mare, which is mussels, little neck clams, squid, shrimp, and whitefish over linguine marinara, and the Tortellini alla Romana, which is stuffed pasta with prosciutto and peas in romano cheese and heavy cream.  The medley of seafood in the linguine is awesome and although I'm not a fan of uber rich dishes, the tortellini was pretty good!  They are doing Italian right.  Rich flavors, sizeable portions, and an intimate family feel.  You will be glad you stopped in!
author: Nyemike O.

description:
Pros:
-Short to no wait (all the other restaurants had an hour wait)
-Average food (at the time we were starving and it tasted good, take that hunger away and it's probably a few steps above Olive Garden food)

Cons:
-Service seemed untrained and lost
-Decor seems like a nice Italian restaurant from the 90s



Hungry and don't want to wait in line? That's why we came here recently.

We were seated quickly, but the table was dirty. The wait staff looked at our table again and asked us what the stain was. Wow. I can't believe you're asking me, but that's pasta sauce. He looked at the tablecloth in sheer disbelief and said it was a clean tablecloth. He went on a little longer about how clean the cloth was and proceeded to run his hands over the stain. What I couldn't believe was how long he decided to spend with this cloth instead of acknowledging that it is dirty and simply removing it.
No apology and no offer to move us to a clean table. We were later offered to have the wait staff replace the cloths, but forget it. We're already seated, let's just make the best out of this and move on.

At this point, we've ordered our food and were chatting with one another. Wait staff brings out bread, while holding orders for other tables. He ends up spilling sauce all over my friend's jacket/back. - To be fair, they were quick to apologize to him and tried to clean my friend up quickly with dry towels. Little bit of club soda would've been a nice touch to help get out any stains, but dry towels was probably the best the employees could've done.

Here is where they earn their 1 star. The food at Firenze was good - we devoured it so fast that I can't even remember what we ordered. I am just left with a thought of that was tasty...But you should probably also know, we were starving.

Overall, if I was already in the area and did not want to wait for another restaurant, I wouldn't mind giving Firenze another try. Maybe we were just unlucky that night and they'd do better next time?
From what I saw, wait staff seemed untrained and confused. This is probably due to poor management. I would suggest retraining the front of house staff and possibly hiring new manager(s).
author: B M.

description: We went there on Christmas Eve and had the most amazing food and LOVED the service! We are making this a new tradition and HIGHLY recommend!
author: Erin S.

description: Excellent!!! The best Italian restaurant in the sates! We order 1 appetizer, 2 main entrees, 2 desserts, one bottle of wine, 1 one expresso = 116 dol. if I could, I would give 10 stars to this restaurant.
author: Santos C.

description: A definite 5 stars for this amazing restaurant! The food is delicious and very pleasing. I started with the Spinaci Salad; it was sublime with real pancetta and perfectly and lightly dressed. The portion size was perfect, not overwhelming, just the right size with really fresh spinach, very crunchy pancetta and pine nuts. The evening's pasta specialty was linguini with seafood a white wine sauce. I had a half portion and it truly was well balanced with the flavors of wine, lemon and garlic. It was a pleasure to eat. I also eat a dessert, a chocolate tartufo, it was spectacular! Prices were pretty reasonable considering the competition in the neighborhood. I will be coming back.
author: Sally M.

description:
+ yummy cannelloni biagio, which is a crepe stuffed with chicken 
+ good bread
+ nice atmosphere
+ decent prices

- waiter was kind of rude
author: Margaret R.

description:
HOLY F*CKING GNOCCHI

Yes it has won awards - and yes it deserves to.  Get the gnocchi, and if you need some protein get it with the bolognese.  

Gotta love the authentic Italian staff as well - such charmers!
author: Lindsey G.

description:
Three meals. 
All said was best they'd ever had. Speaking for myself, the rabbit pasta (award winning) might be one of my top meals ever. 
Pesto pasta. "Wonderful"
Tortellini with peas. Amazing. 
Will definitely be back.
author: Rob S.

description:
Anything less than a five star review is just a hoax. Firenzes has the best Italian, the best service and an all Italian staff. How could you go wrong? Pesto gnocchi is the best dish I've ever eaten. 

Boom. Go to firenzes.
author: Becca P.

description:
The best Italian I've ever had. We went based on a friends recommendation. Had I walked or driven by I probably would have kept going. 

I had a Caesar salad to start. The dressing was tossed prior to serving, delicious and not too heavy. Gnocchi Firenz was my main course. The house made pasta as delicious! Light and perfectly prepared, not heavy or sticky at all and the sauce was superb with it. Even though we were all full we had tiramisu and ricotta cheesecake to share. I'm not a tiramisu fan but it was pretty good. The cheesecake was light and airy. If I'm ever back in the area I would definitely come back.

Service was fantastic too!
author: Kim G.

description: Best Italian I've had in a long time. Service was great and food was awesome. Definitely go back next time I'm visiting San Francisco
author: Jeff W.

description:
Great date place!

My friend and I ordered the rabbit sauce pappardelle and the gnocchi firenze.

Pappardelle was slightly heavy for me, so I recommend it if you're pretty hungry.

Gnocchi firenze was fluffy and flavorful. These little pillows were done very thoughtfully and you could clearly taste the consistency between each one. I wish there was added prosciutto. It would have topped the dish really well.

Ambience is perfect for yuppies on dates. the surrounding crowd is slightly older, the interior design felt very italian-y and home-y. the combination set the right mood in my opinion. It wasn't loud, everyone's cheerful, and it was nice seeing older couples' approving nods of "aww look at that them two youngin's on a date." 

overall, 5/5 one of my favorite date places now.
author: Vi T.

description:
Mediocre food and terrible service. The prices on the menu were significantly higher than that posted online, which really started the meal off wrong. The management should listen because of this experience I refused to order anything after the main course. No dessert, no extra drinks, and no coffee.

Our waiter literally never asked us how anything was and was really focused on the large party next to us. I asked him for another glass of wine and I had to remind him about 15-20 minutes later. He acted surprised, as if I was rushing him! I couldn't wait to get the check.

We ordered the eggplant in marinara sauce and Pappardelle/rabbit sauce. The sauce had no love-at all. There was a lone slice of lamp warmed mozzarella cheese on top the unimaginatively arranged eggplant slices. It was terribly presented and no mind was paid to details.

The pasta was good, the sauce was pretty bland, but can't complain too much.
author: Steven L.

description: I was with my friend from Naples visiting the city by the bay and we happened upon this restaurant. The food was amazing, service was awesome, and my Italian friend said this was a true, authentic Italian restaurant. It is not a tourist trap, but a local luxury. I recommend it to anyone
author: Beshoy G.

description: Best Ravioli. My boyfriend and I went on a romantic dinner date in San Francisco and ate the best homemade cheese ravioli we have ever had in our lives. I still think about them, they were little morsels of fluffy, cheesy heaven. Plus, we had a nice chat with the sweet owner. He told us a story that he made Frank Sinatra the same ravioli's we were eating.
author: Poppy S.

description: Disappointing. My hubby chose this place due to a bartenders recommendation. Hubs ordered the "award winning" gnocchi and was happy with it. I ordered the veal with porcini mushrooms and I'm still traumatized by the experience. It arrived cold and the meat was almost a "beef jerky" texture. It was topped with a cold, gelatinous sauce ;(. This was one of the most disappointing and offensive meals that I've ever had. I tried my hubby's gnocchi, and while it wasn't as offensive as my dish, it certainly wasn't anything I'd ever go back for seconds for. It was kinda bland and I was expecting something more flavorful due to all the hype. The complimentary bread was good and our waiter was ok.
author: Shawna M.

description: My husband and I had a fabulous dinner at Firenze by Night last Thursday.  I chose this restaurant because it's just around the corner from Beach Blanket Babylon, but it far exceeded our expectations.  It's rather small and tables are close together, but the restaurant is very warm and inviting.  Our waiter Luis (Luigi in Italian) was superb--very friendly, efficient, and accommodating.  We decided to share our spinach salad and clam linguini as we were just visiting from Southern California and wouldn't be able to take leftovers home.  Luis kindly split both the salad and the linguini into separate plates.  I wasn't expecting much from the clam linguini (my husband's favorite), but it was outstanding--lots of fresh clams and perfectly al dente spaghetti.  We chose spumoni for dessert--the best spumoni ever!  This restaurant didn't have the "touristy" feel like many North Beach restaurants.  Highly recommended!!!
author: Jean K.

description: One of the last long time traditional Italian neighborhood restaurants left in North Beach.  Nice interior setting, full service bar, great service from longtime Italian wait staff.
