A few of the table are squeezed in so if you're in one of the main travel paths for waiters it can be a bit annoying.  Food is excellent.  We are loved our entrees.  Sole, Osso Buco, sward fish all excellent.  Overall great, highly recommend if you're in NB.  Highly recommend reservations.
author: Jake A.

description: The meal was delicious!  Everyone in our party had the specials. I had the sole fish and it was good but what was even better was the braciole wrapped with veal. It was so tender, it fell apart and melted in my mouth. I was not crazy for the side dish of polenta but the veggies that accompanied our meal was great. I had heard about the gnocchi do got it had an appetizer. They were so light in a wonderful red sauce. It was great to dip the bread in the sauce and the gnocchi just melted away in my mouth. Our service was superb with a waiter from Italy and we had great wine. Definitely would come back in a heart beat!!!
author: Maria T.

description:
I would give this place 4.5 stars based on the food I ordered, but my friend who dinned together with me would have to disagree (you can read about her experience elsewhere). We shared a calamari appetizer, which was superb. The calamari was soft and juicy, the white vignette was a perfect addition, and the veggie in there made it super healthy. Then I ordered the "award-winning" gnocchi, which was truly amazing. Each individual gnocchi was huge (the gnocchi I've had before are usually a little bigger than soy beans), but theirs are probably 3 times as big. However, the gnocchi was so soft, creamy and savory. The tomato cream sauce is a perfect combination!! 

The environment was not as romantic as I expected (you know, Italian restaurant = super romantic??). The service was fast and thoughtful (they let me charge my IPhone, which I must say, was indeed life-savingly important!!)

The only drawback, in my opinion, is the fact that it is quite pricey. If I didn't get a Bloomingspot deal, I would have regretted spending that much money on the food. Each main dish is usually from $15 to $25, plus appetizer and dessert, you do the math. So if you are on a tight budget, you may want to reconsider. 

P.S., the David statue was awesome XP, minus the covering :( (why cover it up, totally defeat the purpose of having it there)
author: Maggie L.

description:
Authentic, solid, tasty Italian food - I was so excited to see a Bloomspot special $40 credit for $20 as a friend highly recommended this place, and I've been waiting to try it!  A friend of mine is moving away soon, so this was a perfect place for us to catch up before her departure (sad...).  

I had:
* Mussels and clams in marinara sauce appetizer (Yum!  This was a sizable appetizer, a full bowl of marinara, steamed mussels and clams - but I sure ate it up, mmm!)
* Gnocchi (award-winning, fluffy, hot, tasty and oh so yummmm! I would highly recommend this dish!!)
* Spumoni (good classic, loved it)
* Glass of Chianti (always a classic, went well with my dinner)

The service was a-ok (yes, loved the Italian accent), and it's a charming place on the border of Chinatown/North Beach, easy access by Muni 30 or 45.  We had a lovely window table - aw, loved this dining experience!  

Grazie - yum!  I WILL be back!!
author: Maile N.

description:
Truthfully, I wanted to give this restaurant a 2 star review.  I gave it a 1 star rating to contribute to bringing the overall rating closer to where I think it belongs.  There are so many places like this on Yelp in San Francisco, which show decent reviews that are totally unjustified.

In this case, the price to quality/value is misaligned.  It's way too expensive for the quality you get.  The tiramisu we ordered was previously frozen and had that freezer flavor and a stale crust to it.  Totally unacceptable.  The waiter was energetic and friendly, but when I brought this up to him he simply said it was fresh and didn't offer us another option, not did he remove it from the bill, which by then was already inflated with mediocre food.

I regret going, and hopefully this review will help another person avoid this place.  There are just so many great places to try in the city, and it's a shame if you end up here because of these inflated reviews.
author: Salar S.

description: I just luh dis place. Daz it.
author: Tania S.

description:
One word, AUTHENTIC! The ravioli sauce has a subtle yet noticeable taste of red wine and tiny pieces of beef. The bruschetta is  made with the freshest tomatoes. I recommend getting a glass of their small selection of wines to accompany your meal. I'm a monthly visitor.

I won't lie and say the service is terrific. On the contrary some of the waiters tend to be a little strange. By strange I mean inpatient and kind of rude at times. It's pretty loud at times! I recommend making a reservation!
author: Cindy G.

description:
Looking for Italian food after typical dinner hours, we discovered Firenze and couldn't have been happier!  I'll admit, I'm a sucker for a waiter who calls me "bella" (as long as I convince myself that he's not making a Twilight reference).  We got very attentive service throughout the meal from the waiter as well as two other employees who brought out meals, refilled water, dispensed pepper and cheese, etc.

The food was superb.  The table bread came with two varieties - a softer bread and a harder one, both excellent.  Stracciatella soup was perfection - very rich chicken broth, not too salty, with creamy egg and fresh cheese.  My tortellini was some of the best I've ever had, with a nice cream sauce, peas, and prosciutto.  And though I really shouldn't have indulged... the spumoni was a great ending to a great meal.  

I'd love to make this my regular Italian place - but sadly, I'm 2500 miles away.
author: Sara M.

description:
We arrived an hour before closing and had high hopes, but they were dashed by average Italian food and some incredibly AWFUL hospitality. 

Our server was actually very nice, this complaint is for the kitchen staff. We ordered the clam and mussel appetizer and the mussels in particular were incredibly fishy smelling and tasted like I licked a day old fish. The server noticed I was picking only at the clams and when asked, I told him the mussels were too fishy for me and he insisted on replacing the dish even though I was okay with just eating the clams. 

So, of course, I was totally surprised when the server brought the dish to the kitchen and kitchen staff immediately began to talk shit in spanish LOUDLY about us!!!  My boyfriend even called out loudly, "Hey, I speak Spanish, okay?"

"Why did she order it if she doesn't like mussels?" and then proceded to hear everything from "P*ta" to "F*ck your mother" in Spanish. My boyfriend speaks fluent Spanish and could hear every word from where we were sitting. 

We were horrified and when the server returned, my boyfriend asked dryly, "Is there a problem?" The server denied the hostility profusely, and went back to tell the guys that we could understand every word they said. They stopped cursing, but kept on complaining!

Our dishes came out and we just sat there in disbelief at what we heard. We were both horrified at our meal and what could have been done to it, yet unsure if they would mess with our food. Maybe they were just venting? Then kitchen staff kept coming over to glare at us, silently! One particularly bold one stared down my boyfriend from the little window and we decided then and there our dinner was over.  

Screw this place with it's AWFUL people and bland food. I will NEVER come back here and I would be hard pressed to believe these people don't mess with your food at a whim. Free to stare down a customer? Free to spit in your food!!!!
author: Annie W.

description:
We (three of us) had a delightful dinner at Firenze by Night.  This was last evening following a Beach Blanket Babylon performance.

We were seated at a small window table.  The place was filled with people obviously enjoying themselves (the noise level can get loud).  I had a wonderful Saltimbocca, my wife and daughter shared a mixed seafood item.  We  remarked on how very good the food was.  We had a bottle of Italian wine (previously had two cocktails from the bar).  Desserts were complimentary (due to a BBB promo listed in their program).

An all-Italian waiter staff (well, not really, our waiter proudly said he is from Sicily).  We had an pleasant conversation with the owner when we left.

And the amazing thing was the size of the bill, very reasonable.

We will be back sometime.
author: John J.

description: We were referred here by the hotel concierge. After driving around the block a few times we lucked out with parking right out front. After dropping the concierge's name we were sat right away on Friday night. (About 6:30) The food and service was excellent. Only reason not a five is the server forgot my wife's coffee during dessert and then put in on the bill. He adjusted it after we brought it to his attention. The food was fantastic. I had a veal and eggplant special which was melt in your mouth tender. Overall a great experience and would definitely go back!
author: Mark T.

description:
We tried to go to Tommaso's and Tony Napolitano first and each had a 90 minute wait as of 5PM on a  Sunday...so we had 2 tired kids on a hunt for a decent meal in North Beach. So we checked Yelp and thought we'd give this place a try as it had decent reviews. I have to say...i was sorta let down...

I can get better and way less expensive carpese salad from costco, sad...but true. The risotto was odd, it didn't taste like arborio rice. It felt like normal medium grain rice.

Gnocchi which had good reviews were decent, though nothing too special and could likely have been seasoned better. The ricotta and spinach raviolis were good though. Saltimboca was decent, though again nothing too special. Food was definitely not cheap either for what we got and the quantity.

The service was pretty good though at least.
author: David L.

description:
Probably one of the freshest and most authentic Italian food I've tried in North Beach.  
Got seated right away even when we arrived early for our reservation.  Greeted by our server upon being seated and was very helpful in explaining each of their special dishes of the night.  

Ordered the mussels and clams for appetizer, with Lamb Shank and Papardelle in rabbit sauce (don't expect chunks of rabbit meat).  Mussels and clams tasted so fresh, it smelled and tasted like the sea itself.  Lamb shank was to die for!  It was literally falling off the bones!  Papardelle came out a lot more bland than I expected.  I felt like all I was eating with pasta.  I told my server and he was more than happy to switch it out to another dish to my preference.  Great service!  He saw that I like seafood and went ahead and ordered me their seafood linguini dish.  EXCELLENT!! You must try their seafood dishes, because they just taste so fresh!

Tried something new and ordered an Italian dessert of a chocolate cake with ice cream and gelato in the middle topped with hazelnut - delicious!  (Sorry, forgot the name since it was in Italian.)  By the way, their focaccia bread in their bread basket is sooooooo soft and yummy, tasted homemade !
author: Nancy S.

description:
The ambiance was nice. The food was just alright. They probably get authentic points, but I didn't find myself absolutely raving over the dishes.

I ordered the special which was comparable to the Linguine Frutti di Mare found at Buca Di Beppo (i know, lame comparison, but it really was similar). It came with lots of seafood. I also got to pick at a bunch of other dishes that our table ordered including the gnocchi, another special of the night with veal and pasta, and the calamari appetizer.  Everything was pretty average and nothing more or less.

Conclusion: Comforting food at uncomfortable prices.
author: Danielle G.

description:
Firenze by Night Restaurant....well it is the best. When we dine there we can't wait to get back. Sergio is the greatest host/owner in the city. I don't know why it is as we are Irish and feel right at home there.
Sincerely,
Bob Norman
author: Robert N.

description: Family operated business. Everyone is Italian, heavy accents. Love it. Packed house but we got sat promptly at the time of reservation. We tried the special suggested by our server, ossobuco. Very good. Ribolita soup was "ok" compared to the one I had eaten in toscany, Italy. Quick service and food came out quiet fast too.
author: Jenn C.

description:
Firenze had some good food and the service was nice as well. I wish I could give it higher marks but I just found the total experience solid but not amazing. However, we enjoyed the Gnocchi Firenze and especially the Penne Mare e Monti which was a pleasant surprise.

There are a couple better places around the area I like better but with that said, I would have no problem coming back to Firenze if it happens to be easier to get a table than the others.
author: Rafael C.

description:
Have recommended this place to a few people and have never received a complaint. They pull off the "cool, small Italian joint you love to go to" vibe really well. Service was perfectly Italian - attentive, dramatic and flirting with every woman like it was his job.

I still love the gnocchi (mandatory and recommended as a app, never an entree since it's a gut bomb), bruschetta is simple but good, buffalo mozzarella app is terrible, angel hair w/ tomato basil sauce was simply incredible and the veal porcino was average.

Get here.
author: Jeff F.

description: Our waiter had the worst fake italian accent ever. And i didnt appreciate paying $20 for a plate of noodles. But I would probably come again because the food was fire af.
author: Anjani N.

description:
Open says a me.

We found this little spot open on a Thursday evening after 9.  There was hardly a soul inside, and those that were looked like they were wrapping up their meals.  By all rights, they could have turned us away, but they didn't.  the food is a phenomenal representation of Italian cuisine and the service is inviting.  I would definitely recommend a stop in.
author: Eric L.

description:
I don't understand .. how can I live in SF for my entire life and not given this place a try?! I've been deprived of the finer things in life.

Our Italian waiter was extremely friendly, attentive, and funny. Constantly kept our wine glass and water glass filled while cracking corny jokes at the same time!

The Calamari Vinagrette was perfectly sauteed. The gnocchi is ABSOLUTELY THE BEST EVERRR !! It melts in your mouth. The Risotto was perfectly cooked and spiced. The rabbit sauce pasta didn't awe me that much, but overall, I was extremely satisfied !

Plus, decent price for amazing Italian food.. where can you go wrong?!
author: Brenda C.

description:
You know what totally makes my day? Guys with dreamy accents. 

At Firenze by Night, these waiters are all over that. They got that dreamboat Italian accent and the charm. 

Roberto was amazing. A member of my party was over an hour late. He never even flinched and continued to treat us with terrific service, checking in with us to make sure we were ok, trading jokes left and right. When my friend arrived super late, he immediately started joking around with her. Best part was that we had ordered in advance and he made sure that her plate was kept warm the entire time, so that she had a warm hot meal. 

Food ain't bad, but with waiters like Roberto, you get a magical experience and excellent service.
author: Rebecca H.

description:
I went there yesterday, the service was great and the food is OUTSTANDING.

I ordered the Gnocchi, I gotta give it a try since it is an award winning dish. 

My husband ordered the special of the day which I forgot the name, but it looks like a seafood linguine...and  OH MY GOD..it was SO TASTY and I kept eating his dish..haha

I will go back and get my own seafood linguine next time!!
author: Nicole A.

description: One of my new favorite place to dine in the city. Very pleased with the entire meal. Will be back. Thanks again Fabio.
author: Tim K.

description: Incredible food. Not cheap, but worth it. Ravioli was unreal. My picky wife loved her Fettuccine Pesto.
author: Jake W.

description:
I went to this restaurant with 5 other people and we all had the same opinion... it was good but nothing amazing. Most of the dished tasted like they would at any decent Italian restaurant. One of the people got a dish with their meat Bolognese sauce and everyone seemed to think that was the best dish at the table.

Restaurant is in a nice part of town but was average inside and was a bit on the expensive side. I would try someplace else next time.
author: Bill E.

description:
listen, the GNOCCHI IS TOTALLY THE BUSINESS, YO.
delicate little potato dumplings with their creamy tomato sauce = get it. NOW.

Do not get the cold eggplant & zucchini appetizer, not good at all.

I like the shmoozy Italian waiters, makes me feel like I'm getting slightly violated and a good meal at the same time, awesome.
author: Rina M.

description:
By far the best gnocchi I've ever had. Granted, it was the first time I've had gnocchi, but I fell in love with it - so that has to mean something.

This is a very romantic restaurant and has a very authentic feel - our waiter even had a thick Italian accent! Score.

Everything at this place is perfect for a date or an intimate dinner. I loved the feel and look of it. I would love to come back. & since the gnocchi was amazing, I'd probably get that again, but I'm almost positive their other pasta dishes are just as good!

Highly recommended.
author: Junel S.

description: Came hungry, left unbelievably happy with a smiling wife. After all "Happy Wife Happy Life" right? Our server was from Firenze & the entire place was filled with Italians. If the locals are prevalent that means it's good in most cases right!? Will definitely return to this restaurant next time we're in SF
author: Daniel U.

description: Our waiter was super awesome, really nice strongman, hahaha.  However, it was recommended to us because their pasta was home made.... This did not seem the case at all.  The angel hair was clearly boxed, and overcooked.  Decent atmosphere and good service, and a big bowl of mediocre.
author: Drew W.

description: I've been here twice. The first time I went I ordered the tortellini. It was phenomenal. Cream sauce, peas, perfect pasta. The second time I ordered a "special "and it was the  petrale sole. It was fried, soggy and mediocre flavor. Veggies were drenched in butter.  My feeling is they do Italian really well but not to venture far from pasta.
author: Michelle K.

description:
Stay away from the Parmesan!!!!!  It completely ruined my Gnocchi...it tastes like the cheap, pre-grated, preservative-loaded crap you get in the little packets at Pizza Hut!!!

The meal started out pleasantly enough; service was timely...until I finished my meal.  My girlfriend was still eating but the waiter repeatedly asked if she was finished and tried to take her plate.  If she stopped for so much as 10 seconds to talk with me, the waiter would swoop in and try to take her plate.  Very frustrating!

Overall, the food was a solid 4 stars (avoid the parmesan) and the service was about 2.5 stars.  I would go back as long as I got a different waiter.
author: Eli S.

description:
Loved the Vitella Alla Medici! I've tried it at other places before but was never impressed until this one. It was well done yet tender; with a touch of cream but not too greasy. The basil taste mixed with sprinkles of pine cones was just phenomenal.

Their waiters are from Italy. So they don't speak very well English, which I didn't mind at all. Didn't get to try their wine because I had to drive; but their list looked fantastic. 

I took off one star because of the pasta. I ordered the top recommended award winning pasta. But it came out too soft. And because of that the flavor and fun of eating pasta got discounted. 

Overall I loved this place. Would definitely go again next time I'm in town!
author: Xiaoshan Z.

description: This is one of my favourite restaurants in North Beach. Excellent service, great food. Even the simplest Cesar salad is really great. I adore their Bresaola con arugula and veal medalions. Nice ambiance of true Italy!
author: Kate V.

description:
Came here on a Thursday night after yelping and seeing good food and service reviews for this place.  My boyfriend and I went in and were told that the wait for 2 people would be 15-20 minutes.   Yes, it did seem busy (probably due to the holidays), however it didn't seem like it was a 15-to-20-minute-wait-busy.  While waiting, I saw several tables open and thought that it was odd that we were told there would be a 15-20 minute wait.  After about 5 minutes wait, we were seated at one of the open tables.  

I am giving this place a low rating due to the sub-par service.  We had an unusually longer than usual wait for everything: for a waiter to come, for water to come, for bread to come (when the bread did come, it was refrigerator cold).  Overall, we felt like we had very short and curt service from the waiter.  I did observe and saw that same waiter spent a bit more time and was more attentive with another party...

This restaurant has your simple traditional Italian fare.  My boyfriend got the meat ravioli and I got the gnocchi (yes, it was soft and like little pillows).  I give them an extra star as they were able to accommodate my special dietary restriction.  Other than that, we will never come back nor will we recommend this restaurant due to the sub-par service.
author: Teresa C.

description: I don't often enjoy Italian restaurants, but I will be returning here! Amazing food and great service!
author: Donna J.

description:
Sergio by himself make the place!
It's great to have fun while you are having superb Italian food.
author: Stefano C.

description: Service is good but food sucks. Ambiance is classic cheap and cheesy little Italy. They had 2 Spanish guys cooking up the so called "Italian food". To start the bread was clearly not fresh and no warm at all! The "award winning" pasta was overcooked. (I'd like to know who exactly gave these people an award") the buffalo mozzarella tastes like the pre sliced shit I get from Costco. As a New Yorker coming to a restaurant rated 4 stars I am very disappointed and still hungry.
author: Danielle D.

description: Along with all the other tourists leaving the 5pm show of  Beach Blanket Babylon for a North Beach Italian American meal, our group of 6 went to where we had a reservation based on Yelp .  It is Sunday night--the place is loaded with tourists--the ABA convention was in town-there was a Giants game, and the place has a local following.  They were slammed, but did a good job.  Nice Italian wine list. I had the papadelle with rabbit ragu.  The chef won some kind of cook-off with this dish in Florence and it was well deserved. Place has some authenticity--the waiters called the women in our group Bella--FANTASTIC sour dough focachia   Great company, so we had a great dinner party.
author: AV G.

description: This was by far the worst "Italian" food I have ever tasted. I loved the ambiance of the restaurant. I was SO excited to try the food! But my veal ravioli (that night's special) came out under a heap of brown sauce. It was the least appetizing plate I've ever seen in an Italian restaurant, until my boyfriend's dish came out. He ordered veal with mushroom sauce (a slightly different colored pile of brown) that had plop of polenta on the side, next to boiled carrots (cut to the shape of those in a child's lunchbox) and boiled broccoli. BOILED VEGETABLES on an ITALIAN plate?? Unheard of. What is this, the Midwest?? Then I tasted the food, and my veal was like Chef Boyardee's: I could see little mashed carrots inside of the "pre-chewed" brown meat. And it was so unfortunately salty. My family is from Brucoli and Gaeta, and I know how Italian food should be made. Next time for dinner if I want Italian food, I'm going to my mother's house.
author: Jacquie O.

description:
A-M-A-Z-I-N-G

And here is why:

Authentic. You can tell right when you walk in that Firenze by Night Ristorante is the real deal. Why? Because it is made very clear that the owner (also the host and head chef) and all the servers are actually from Italy and grew up eating and enjoying authentic Italian food. 

Food=Awesome. Firenze by Night has won many food / restaurant awards. And, since the food is incredible, each and every award is well deserved. Specifically, I would suggest the gnocchi--it is hands down the best gnocchi I've ever had. The pasta is so soft it literally melts in your mouth. 

Service=Awesome. The servers and host are very nice and make you feel welcome. The restaurant becomes extremely busy but the servers are on top of it. They get customers, in; seated; eating and on their way as soon as possible.  

One downside to this place: it is crowded and loud. Clearly, everyone wanted to come here; thus, this place was so packed I could barely move (even when sitting). Therefore, if you don't have reservations--get ready to wait (however, totally worth the wait).
author: Renee R.

description:
This is a quick review because my experience here was relatively quick. Came here on the recommendation of a friend who raved about the Pappardelle Toscano, which is a wide noodle pasta in a rabbit meat sauce. They label it as "award winning" in the menu. Because my friend highly recommended this dish, 2 of my other friends ordered it. I got to say, my friend was spot on. Wide noodles, cooked perfectly in a nice light sauce. I don't like pasta that is overly cheesy. i feel that a pasta that is overly cheesy is trying to hide something. My only gripe is I was hoping for more rabbit in the sauce.

So why only 3 stars. Our server was a little short with us. Gave quick, unhelpful answers to our questions, and acted as if we were a waste of his time. I think we all got that sense as we ordered quick and asked for our checks pretty quickly. 

I was also happy to leave as they primarily served wine, and down the street was an incredible Belgium beer place that made me forget all about the lousy service.
author: George Y.

description:
My husband and I had dinner here last Saturday. We were wandering around North Beach and had stopped to ask a local what he recommended, he said to come here, and I can see why.
The service was GREAT, very professional, friendly and attentive. The food was amazing. My husband had the veal ravioli special, veal stuffed ravioli with mushroom sauce. I normally frown when he orders veal but this was to die for!!!
I had the porterhouse steak, It was cooked perfectly, served with pollenta and veggies, and HUGE! I could only eat about a quarter of it. 
My husband is Italian and went home raving about this to his entire family, when someone who has had homemade Italian food their whole life is telling there dad he needs to eat here you know it's good!!!!!
author: Danea LeAnne S.

description:
Since I've been back from my trip to Italy, I had been in search for good Italian food in North America. For my recent visit to SF my sister took us here without a reservation. Highly reccommend a reservation even for a weeknight. Luckily the owner was able to prepare us a table within 20 minutes (4 adults, 2 kids).

We all shared:
- Carpaccio
- Mussels and clams in marinara sauce
This was a big hit with the adults and kids
- Seafood Linguini (evening special)
I had to fight with my 2yr old niece for my turn to eat this ;)
- Risotto with sausage and mushroom (evening special)
- Gnocchi
split between the 2 kids, came late, but still good
- Parpardelle Toscana
- Quail in wine sauce
- Bistecca Fiorentina
Been waiting for this one and it didn't disappoint!
- my sister had a glass of Chianti

We all agreed the food was very good and we did over-order, but that's okay. What surprised me the most was our bill only came up to $180?! I was expecting twice that amount.

The -1 star is a bit harsh, it's more -0.5 star as I am comparing Firenze by Night to my lovely seating and service in Italy where service is calm and I get to have my table for the rest of the night... I guess quick turn-overs are still important in North America.
Waiters were flying all over the place as it was very busy, but still good service.

I would gladly come back here for good Italian food outside of Italy!
author: Daphne L.

description:
When a restaurant has a passion to serve quality food, it shows.  The opposite is true for this place.  Lacking passion, they seem do just enough to justify charging money for food, which shows in their service, decor, and food.

The first sign of trouble was their bread basket.  Stale and old.  Next, for starters, we tried Antipasto Della Casa ($14.50) and Prosciutto e Melone ($9).  No premium quality stuff here.   Everything tasted like something I could get at Safeway.  Then comes Gnocchi Firenze ($13).  Award winning?  Which award?  It was not bad, but not that great.  One item which was pretty good was Linguine con Vongole ($13.50), which had the right amount of clam sauce with perfectly cooked pasta.

As for their decor, which looks like a half-hearted effort to create a scene in Italy, it reminded me of decor at Goood Frikin Chicken (http://www.yelp.com/biz/8TSk-heAZkXC2vO0yV0CQg).

I am starting to wonder if it really is true that the best Italian Restaurants are not in North Beach.  But how could that be?
author: トモ T.

description:
"Oh please don't stop talking, his accent is so sexy" - Friend

Parking was a pain in the ass but what do you expect on a Saturday night at a neighborhood like this. The view of the city as we were driving around trying to find parking was amazing though. 

When we entered the restaurant, they happily greeted us and seated us promptly. Initially I thought the place would be moderately decorated - judging from the photos on yelp - but the ambiance was surprisingly really nice and romantic. My friend couldn't stop spazzing over our waiter's accent and all she wanted was for him to continue talking haha! Our waiter was really nice and funny. He was also very patient and took his time explaining everything to us.

I ended up getting the Penne Mare E Monti and substituted the light tomato sauce with pesto sauce and ohhhhh myyyy goddddd! It was SO GOOOOD! ItJust thinking about it... JIOI$UY#@*$&#@@#H$I@$#$!!!!!! Yeah. Moving on. My friend ordered the Buon Gustaio and had it with cream sauce instead whatever it was suppose to come with. She said it was amazing and I couldn't help but to agree more after trying some myself.

Definitely will come back here again!
author: Simon L.

description:
The servers are very nice, great service. I had the mussels & clams appetizer ($12). Plus it's a very cute looking place.  It was good but I was definitely expecting more. The sauce was good to dip bread on though. 

I got to taste my friend's gnocchi and I have to say, sorry but it is not the best in te city. I definitely had way better, it was too mushy and the flavor was lacking.
author: Linda L.

description:
Picture this: upon arriving starving and tuckered to our hotel, friendly desk agent recommends this place for dinner.  We go.  We eat.  We are satisfied.  Is it the best italian food there ever was?  Not by a long shot.  Is it solidly decent with good service?  You bet.

Hubs got a rabbit pasta dish, which was admittedly, quite scrumptious.  My pasta with shrimp and chicken?  "Meh" sums it up pretty heartily.

So perhaps the dishes are hit or miss.  As for decor and ambiance, it's a pretty classic old-school Italian joint, with autographed photos on one wall, a giant mural of Florence on another wall, dusty chianti bottles, the whole she-bang.
author: Rachel S.

description: Always a great spot for a nice romantic dinner with the wife! Service. They always go above and beyond. Food. I had the Leg of Lamb most recently and was it was delicious. If you have been to SF and haven't visted this gem! You are definitely missing out!  5 Stars across the board!
author: Kyle W.

description: Worst food ever. Ravioli with ricotta and spinach smothered in bolognese was over seasoned and tasteless. Mussels and clams in tomato sauce were fish smelling and sauce was literally red water. Cancelled dinner order and left
author: R P.

description: The Gnocchi is amazing and great customer service.
author: Sadaf S.

description: Went here when I was on vacation. The decor is a little over the top authentic Italian but the food was great!! Most authentic Italian place in SF in my opinion. Our waiter was even from Italy. Will definitely go back next time I am in SF
author: M Z.

description: Excellence defined, from the superb service to the fantastic handmade pasta to the pleasantly bustling dining room(s) to the marvelous balance they strike between lusty and refined flavors.  Notable wine list.  The bruschetta was lovely; the toast was perfectly browned and the topping was perfect.  The pappardelle's thickness and noodle consistency was sensational.  The sauce was wonderful.  The gnocchi was the best I've had.  It was perfectly balanced between al dente and feather-soft.  The accompanying creamy tomato sauce was a perfect blend of robust tomato flavor, cream and herbs for a light, elegant finish.  Can't wait to be in San Francisco again so we can try something else!
author: Sarah L.

description: Really great food. Great wine. Also, the dessert was amazing - it melted in my mouth and all over my hands. Mmmmmm. Chocolate. I will be back for more of this chocolate goodness.
author: Ryan S.

description:
Went here with a couple friends recently and was psyched to enjoy such a great place in the heart of the too touristy North Beach area.

Great full bar, fantastic service and spectacular food. As many people have said, the gnoochi is especially fantastic. They have a white and red option. Order them both and share...yum.
author: Jason H.

description: I made reservations for 7:00PM but half of my party was running late, so they wouldn't seat us. They didn't tell us this, but after standing around and seeing others get seated that arrived after me, I caught on. Once we were seated, we could barely hear anything the waiter said since the main dining room was so loud. He got our orders of wine wrong and scurried off before we could correct him. I ordered the pappardelle with rabbit sauce since it boasted being an award winner. The presentation was simple and had small pieces of meat throughout the sauce, and the taste felt under seasoned. My boyfriend's chicken dish was nothing spectacular, and I also sampled some of the porterhouse steak which seemed more like an overly charred T-Bone in my opinion. The only dish I liked was my friend's veal ravioli which was a special that evening, but I doubt I would return to this establishment for that.
author: Monica V.

description:
Well, for a Monday night this place was full at about 7:30 and rightly so.  Our waiter, an authentic Italian gentleman had a great personality and was helpful.  The service was also very Italian so don't expect to be up and out if you're eating here.  Sit back and enjoy.

As for the food I had the pasta in rabbit sauce.  It was reasonably price, very good and filling.  We also had a traditional bottle of Chianti, which was pretty standard.

Finally they offered us some free limoncello and being that I'm part Jewish I LOVE free things, so we gladly accepted. 

Another cool thing about this restaurant it is feels cozy with cool little things all over the walls.  I'll be back!
author: Josh D.

description:
I'm not really sure why this place has such great reviews.  Maybe I need to go back and give it another try, but based on my first experience, I'd recommend giving this place a skip and trying one of many far superior Italian restaurants in North Beach (Pinnochio is one of my faves)

The service at Firenze was great - no complaints there.  They even split our pasta onto 2 plates for us without us even asking since they knew we'd be sharing.

The food was the real disappointment.  The mozzarella in the caprese was dry and the tomatos felt overripe.  The pasta was overcooked and the sauces were nothing exceptional.  I really felt like I could boil some pasta myself at home and dump some ragu on it and it'd be better.

The prices are not bad, but given the quality of the food, we were really disappointed.
author: Gowri R.

description:
What can I say about the delicious Firenze by Night Ristorante that hasn't already been said? I mean,  the gnocchis here are little pillows from heaven that melt in your mouth in seconds (I'm serious, you won't find better made gnocchi than here). Oh and the Vegetable Soup (Ribollita) is to die for.. not sure how something so simple could be so delicious! Bruschetta is done well here and could eat a whole bucket of it.

This past weekend, I decided to take advantage of one of their specials: Pumpkin Ravioli with Browned Butter and Fresh Sage. It was scrumptious and didn't even leave a morsel of sage twig on my plate. 

Besides just the food and ambiance, you get true Italian authenticity. It's quite a cozy/family environment but a grand place to dine for a night in North Beach.
author: 3beeskitchen ..

description: Our concierge recommended it and it did not disappoint. Firenze had terrific food and service. They didn't have chicken Parmesan on the menu but they made it anyway - and it was delicious! Also, excellent desserts and wine choices.
author: Matthew A.

description: 2.5 if I could but I'm leaning towards the smaller side of numbers... cold bread, piping hot soup (with no to go container for the large amount of leftovers, not even to go coffee cups to place it in), piping hot pasta...I burned my mouth on both items, the tortellini was so so bland. Can't come back...if Trattoria Cantodina wasn't closed and we hadn't gone to E Tutu 2 nights ago...would have never spend the awkward time here...almost wish I walked back to stinking rose and tried their amazing looking house garlic rolls.
author: Candice H.

description: Been eating at Firenze for 8 years now and need to give them a long overdue thank you for so many years of outstanding food, service and friendship. Walking in there feels like home every time and this has been true from my first visit all the way through my latest which happened to be yesterday! The Guisti's and the entire Firenze staff sure know how to make you feel warm and welcomed every time! Not to mention also leave with a full, happy tummy each time as well Brought a friend from LA in with me last night who can't get over how unbelievable his experience was and is already looking forward to his next visit so he can try out more of the menu. THANK YOU ALL!!! And see you very soon!
author: Melissa H.

description: All I can say is YUMMO! Enjoyed every bite of this authentic Italian jewel. Definitely our favorite restaurant in North Beach!
author: Carol A.

description: Amazing food and service. Best Italian food I've had in the U.S. I don't usually like gnocchi but this was excellent. We had the seafood linguine and penne with chicken and prawns. We needed with tiramisu. Everything was very good. Best meal we had in San Fran! Server was extremely attentive (and it didn't hurt that he looked like Robert Downey jr.) it's a definite must if you like authentic Italian food!
author: Ashley L.

description:
Why is it that the restaurants which advertise gnocchi as their speciality and "award winning" always disappoint? While the sauce was delicious, the gnocchi were very chewy. The sides for all the entrees were a very bland and undercooked green bean  and carrot stick combination with 3 small slices of potato. The service staff were unprofessional and incompetent, regularly mouthing off in italian under their breath and the tone didn't sound very complimentary. They mixed up the very clear instructions of splitting the bill resulting in the wrong card getting charged substantially more. 

Sure am glad to have far better and more welcoming options on the peninsula.
author: Lee I.

description:
We had reservations for a birthday dinner consisting of ten people at Steps of Rome in Northbeach but when we showed up on a Saturday evening, their doors were locked up tight because of 'oven problems'. Thanks for giving us the heads up... 
What were we supposed to do with ten people on a Saturday night last minute?

A potential disastrous situation was resolved when Firenze by Night was able to accommodate us. They put something together on a busy Saturday night and it was absolutely amazing. The service was superb and the food was even better. Paulo, the owner, went above and beyond for us and made my birthday a memory I will never forget. HIGHLY recommended!
author: Kristina T.

description: We came here for a conference and were looking for some upscale seafood Italian food.   It's definitely here.  Excellent service. Made me wish I knew Italian.   We made reservations but arrived early.  There were crowded but seated us right away.  You can tell there customers are treated like family.   Food was absolutely  incredible.    I love scallops shrimp, and mussels.  They did not disappoint Wine list had some reasonably priced options as well.  I had a seafood linguini    Price was as expected for fresh seafood  . Afterwards felt great that we had come here.  Great romantic night out
author: Joel R.

description:
Our anniversary party of 10 was guided here by the concierge of our hotel and we were so pleased.  We were greeted, and the table was waiting.  Our excellent waiter suggested a family style appetizer, which was served individually, excellent choices.  We each had a small taste of the delectable gnocchi, WOW!

We all had something different and each of us was pleased.  Rabbit, veal, pasta, shrimp....All Outstanding!

Everyone loved the waiters speaking Italian, and the feel of the restaurant.  

A smooth dining experience, perfect food, the highlight of our five days in SF.
author: Lisa M.

description: The food is decent.  I had the Linguine Con Vongole.  The flavor was good but I think the clams weren't washed too well because some of them were still gritty and sandy. My husband ordered the gnocchi and I thought it was well made.  The gnocchi was not soggy at all and the sauce was really savory.  We thought it was odd that the server took forever to check back on us because the restaurant was pretty empty.   It wasn't as if he was extremely busy with other customers.  He was really nice to us though. We weren't sure if he just meant to leave us alone to enjoy our meal, or if he forgot about us. The restaurant vibe was pretty intimate and it's pretty quiet when we went, so if it's slow there, it's a nice place to have dinner and conversation with your date.
author: Shirleyanne A.

description:
I went with my friend that keep raving about wanting to go, so the night that we had off we went. We made a 6:30 reservation, and the male server was very attentive...(big flirt will not get you a bigger tip).

I had a wine to start with our apps, the snail with garlic and capers. She want to have the gnocchi and we split everything, they even split the gnocchi into two different plates for us. The snail dish, though tasty, not worth the $11, since it was only 5 pieces of snail....

Still attentive and still a big flirt, our server brought over  our main dishes came. I ordered the linguine with anchovies, red pepper fakes and garlic; my friend ordered the special of the day, a seafood linguine. I liked my dish, it was good, but i dont really think it was worth the $15. I tasted my friends dish, it was a little to fishy for me, the mussels were frozen not fresh, so it had a saltier taste than normal. 

We skip dessert just because we were full, and neither has a really big sweet tooth. SO the grand total not including tips: $75 dollars. After splitting and tipping, we both owe $43, for one person that is little too much. 

I live in the East Bay, so I rather just go to Filippo's in North Oakland, better prices and i believe better food. Also, FYI both of us the next morning did not feel well, and had to go to the bathroom for minor gas and diarrhea problems....
author: Mei L.

description: WOW! Can you say homemade!!! This place is legit. Placed on the outer reaches of Little Italy, and tucked between a variety of other establishments this one may be easy to miss. But I must say it is worth seeking out. The front signage is simple, and when stepping inside it was quiet, fairly plain but oozing with charm. The dimly lit bar area is the first thing you see, but beyond that the cozy little dining room will call your name. The tables, covered in white linens and adorned with a bottle of olive oil that will eventually call your name. It was that good....and that was just the olive oil. Can you imagine? The three in my party ordered veggie lasagna (which was claimed to be the best mean in San Fran over the course of five days by my sister) the Gnocchi, and an amazing carbonara stule pasta. All three were packed with flavor and clearly made from scratch. The best kind. It feels like the place could have a mob meeting going on right in the back at any given moment. That comment is meant to speak to the authentic feel of the place, not a nod to anything else. I loved this restaurant and will return on my next visit to this city for sure. Go, find it, do yourself a favor!
author: Susie M.

description:
We love this spot! Food is always delicious! The Staff is always so friendly and make really great food and wine recommendations. 

The ambiance is really kitchy and cute and we always feel welcomed and like family.
author: Danielle S.

description:
Came here for the little bites of heaven formally known as gnocchi. The gnocchi deserves 5 stars. Other than that, the rest of the food was average. We had the Buffalo Mozzarella with Tomato and Basil as well as another Pappardelle Toscana for the second entree. For the Pappardelle being an "award winner", it was disappointing. There was a lack of sauce, which I kept on compensating with more parmesean.

As most Italian restaurants are in North Beach, Firenze caters to tourists and the staff puts on the Italian facade with their accents. Still a quaint, romantic, intimate venue.
author: Brian L.

description: Great little restaurant in North Beach.  Outstanding traditional Italian fare.  Superb service.
author: John W.

description: I've been to Firenze by Night twice now since living in SF and it is my go to Italian restaurant. Service is great and portion sizes are big for the price. Great atmosphere and quick service. I recommend the stuffed mushrooms, risotto, and anything with the pesto sauce. The peach sorbet was great too! My only disappointment was our server did not include the leftover bread when he packaged our leftovers up. I will request this next time:) Definitely worth checking out!!!
author: Ava M.

description: The most amazing Italian food ever. We went back two times while we stayed for 7 days. Ravioli is amazing along with the penne with shrimp and chicken. All of the servers treat you incredibly!!! Great service and amazing food. Must check it out.
author: Kaylie S.

description:
After taking in the show Beach Blanket Bablon, and then walking over a few blocks to this wonderful place Firenze by night, we could not have had a better night in the city. The food was great, service was divine... Drinks so so a little light on the pour.. but everything else was outstanding.  The place as busy too, which gives it a fun feel.
We would go back here again, our next trip.
author: Cyndi D.

description: Best gnocchi I have ever had!  I sat at the bar enjoyed a glass of wine and really felt like I was in Italy!  I also had the swordfish special amazing! Thank you I will be back!
author: Big B.

description: 5 stars. Really. This is the best Italian dining experience I have had in 10 years. I brought a party of 9. It is an old school white tablecloth restaurant. The waiter was impeccable. Obviously Italian is his first language. He described the dishes beautifully. We had snails and fresh mozzarella with tomatoes for appetizers. My party had lamb shank, ravioli, lasagna, gnocchi, (they are famous for the gnocchi) and he brought us each a small plate. Omg it was amazing. Light and fluffy, not heavy at all. I had veal Marsala and it was the most tender I've ever had. 3 bottles of wine, flowing beer and cocktails, apps, salads, dinner and desert with espresso for 9 people for $700 including a 20% tip.
author: Zen K.

description:
The waiter was very knowledgeable and charming.  Drinks were out immediately after we ordered them, and the food didn't take too long either.  The bread was different than normal restaurant bread, but good (especially after dipping in olive oil).  I got the special (linguine w/ marinara - I asked for extra spicy & garlic, and they made it perfectly, and I have enough for lunch tomorrow).  My friend ordered the ravioli, and was very happy with it (and wasn't able to save any for lunch tomorrow).  We each had one drink, and the total was $60 after tax & 20% tip.
I would rank this a 5, as I have no complaints, but I try to reserve 5 for places that are really unique & I would go out of my way to visit.
author: bret s.

description: We met friends there from out of town and had a fabulous dinner food was excellent and the  service was fantastic! Can't wait to go back. My fillet of sole was the best I've ever had..
author: Dave N.

description:
I'd like to give this place a BIG, FAT ZERO!!!!

 Not knowing they opened at 5PM, we had arrived at 4:30 PM, looked at the store front menu and proceeded to walk in when a worker told us...not open till 5pm. OK. They wouldn't allow a party of five in for a drink or seat us to look more closely at the menu. 

 So, we walked for a few minutes and returned. It was 4:55 PM. The two workers were now 'BUSY' smoking in FRONT of the restaurant! We figured they wouldn't mind if we were five minutes early. Nope. They did NOT invite us in. They did not make us feel welcome at all!! What the hell is the big deal about guests arriving a few minutes early? Did we interrupt their smoke time? We said, screw it. These guys are A-holes and we aren't going to waste another minute waiting for them!!!

You would think in this economy, they would welcome guests even a few minutes early. NEVER AGAIN for this place.
author: G A.

description:
I love this place.  The food is great, it's always packed, the service is good and you can practice your Italian with the waiters, maitre d, bus boys or the kitchen staff.  

Also, I've been partial to Gnocchi with pink sauce since I was a kid and they have it on the menu, if you like it too then come here because you won't have to try to explain to the waiter how to make the sauce ;) .  But I've tried a lot of other dishes and they have all been good like the penne allo zenzero, peppardelle toscana, the quail in wine sauce, the roasted chicken . . . oh and the osso bucco is reallllllly good the meat falls off the bone and the sauce if so flavorful you could eat it alone.

Regarding the dessert menu I'm not a big fan =/.  I realllly wish they had zabaione  . . . if you want dessert go to Victoria's or Stellas
author: Erin B.

description:
Waiter was a serious character and he made our experience awesome! He brought us some shots of something, just because we were having a good time with our other drinks. Also, he spilled a little something on me...no big deal.
Food was seriously tasty too!
Had a special seafood pasta with red sauce, ans it was nice!
author: Heather G.

description: Went here with friends last night. They are regulars but it was our first visit. I will definitely be back. The food was DELICIOUS! The service impeccable.  My husband and I both started with the spinach salad - its served with a warm dressing and was so yummy. The gnocchi was melt in your mouth delicious. I've tried a lot of gnocchi and it was definitely the best I've had. I like that the restaurant is family owned, family run business. The staff who are all italian have worked there for years (i'm talking 20-25 years) They clearly take great pride in providing good service and helping you enjoy your evening!
author: Karen O.

description:
Had the Pappardelle Toscana (large flat noodles with rabbit and rabbit cream sauce) and the Linguine with crab meat and lemon sauce. Everything was delicious! 

I was a bit let down my the portion of the plates. We had been walking around the city for quite a bit and worked up an appetite. Thank goodness for the bread or else I would've left still hungry. 

I also felt a little intimidated and snubbed by the waiter. I guess we didn't dress properly or look mature enough to be eating there, so he didn't seem too welcoming. But maybe that's just me.

But overall, still very good and worth a try.
author: Natasha S.

description:
A very well decorated Italian restaurant in North Beach, ideal for a date night.  We were here for dinner on a friday evening and the place was packed, but since we had reservations we did not have to wait for more than a couple of mins.  The folks who work here were friendly and the service was good.  

The menu had some interesting items on it, but I decided to go with the some of the most popular dishes on the menu.  
(1) for appetizers, we ordered 
(a) Verdure ai ferri - marinated grilled zuccini and eggplant - it was cold and the dish was meh.  we could have totally gone without this dish.    
(a) Bruschetta - simple yet tasty, the garlic bread was toasted to perfection and the diced tomatoes were seasoned perfectly. 
(2) the main course, Gnocchi firenze - A potato gnocchi in a light tomato sauce - it caught my eye as the dish was listed as a award winning pasta. When it listed as an award winner you have gotta give it a try right.  the gnocchi was very light and the creamy tomato sauce gave the dish a bit of much needed acidity.  I can see why this was listed as a award winning dish. 
(3)and for dessert, Tiramisu which was just average.  

Overall the dinning experience was good and probably worth checking it out once.
author: Nithya S.

description:
I came here on the recommendation of a foodie friend.  Maybe my expectations were too high, but I thought this place was just okay.  We ordered two pasta dishes - the rabbit ragu pasta and the daily special which was a seafood pasta.  

I will give them credit that the seafood in the pasta, while not high in quantity, was some of the best seafood I've ever had.  Maybe I should have ordered seafood instead of their "award winning" pasta?  The rabbit pasta was okay, but a little bland.  I LOVE the rabbit pasta at Bottega in Yountville, which is far superior to this.  

The service was very good and it was a fun atmosphere, but alas, my search for quality Italian food in SF continues...
author: Karen B.

description:
I usually avoid North Beach Italian restaurants because of the tourist factor which often means compromised food quality.  In the neighborhood and hungry, I conceded to try Firenze by Night since it had 4 Yelp stars after close to 300 reviews and a positive Elite buzz.  The kitschy decor made it seem touristy, but the food was definitely above tourist trap level.  It was more the quality of a neighborhood joint that is not a destination, but ok for a modest meal.  I think I prefer the more innovative Italian joints like Delfina, Perbacco and Credo.

Carpaccio: The beef was thinner than typical carpaccio and fattier too, I wasn't so much a fan.  Reminded me of those eye round slices put in Vietnamese pho.  The olive oil and capers were fine but I found the dijon mustard on the side to be too overpowering for the delicate raw meat.

Pappardelle Toscana:  One of the house specialties and lived up to being a decent dish.  Very hearty and satisfying noodles.  The rabbit sauce was full of flavor but light on the meat chunks.

Gnocchi Firenze: This was another house specialty, though not sure why on this one.  The gnocchi were limp and bland.  I'm beginning to favor the way some places pan sear the gnocchi to give it some texture (which is not done here).  The creamy tomato sauce also lacked any pizazz.

Tiramisu: Satisfactory.  Lived up to having the creamy zabaglione and moist savoiardi.  Could have had a stronger soaking on the savoiardi though.

Limoncello: I asked if they had any house made limoncello and received this.  Wasn't chilled enough to really hit the after dinner spot.  Also, nothing wow about the flavor.
author: Adam B.

description:
When having a drink @ a no name bar on Grant Ave., some knowledgable natives 
recommended this restaurant heartily!!

We ate here before going to the theatre nearby. We enjoyed the ambiance and the delicious Italian cuisine !! The service was prompt and waiter friendly. Delicious entree and dessert--what can I say?--Tieramisi (sp)  was "to live for".
We'd go here again.  Anywhere else would take a back seat.


Cathy & Bill
author: Cathy and Bill C.

description:
Dined here last night-Simply the best Italian we have had in a long time.

I'm full Italian, been to Italy many times and love Italian food-But this is still some of the best food we have had.

We ate early on a Monday because we had our granddaughter with us.  Our hotel concierge recommend this place because he hadn't heard of the top two restaurants on Yelp.  So we decided to try this place, what the hell.

We were seated promptly-it was a rainy Monday and the restaurant was about 1/4 full.  
We were served by Giuseppe. He was wonderful. He took great care of us. Since our GD was very hungry he rushed an order of ravioli for her which was very nice.

They served us foccacia and sourdough bread with olive oil.  Have not had foccacia in a long time. Very soft and flavorful.

I started with  the tortellini soup.  The tortellini were very good and the chicken brodo was flavorful

I tried my wife's insalata Estiva which was basil, cheese, tomatoes, oil and onion. It was ok but not for me.

Lately I've been rating restaurants by the quality of the risotto.  I tried their risotto with porcini mushrooms. Very well prepared, the right texture just below al dente.  GREAT flavors and such a simple dish they did a wonderful job.

I tried my GD's raviolis which were good. Spinach and cheese in a meat sauce.  The sauce was slightly bland but good. I just like a spicier meat sauce. But still good just the same.

I got to try my the tortellini alla Romana which is a white cream sauce. I didn't try the torts again since I had them with my soup.  The cream sauce was excellent I would order that again.

For desert we had the chocolate mousse and the tiramisu.  The mousse was  great good flavors. The tiramisu was too sweet for my taste.
 
Overall, this was an excellent experience. The server was great.  The majority of food I tried  was wonderful and we will be back to this place when in SF again.
author: Ralph T.

description: After a great evening at Beach Blanket Babylon we had a delicious meal. The staff was excellent and the food superb. We will definitely be back.
author: Kevin F.

description:
I came here for my birthday dinner a month ago. It took me this long to finally write a review because I simply did not have as grand a time as I had expected.

It was a rainy night and we were afraid that parking would be a doozy but the owner/manager of Firenze was so nice that he signaled to my friend to park at their loading zone. V.I.P. bitches!

We had a party of 12 and we were seated in the back along with 2 other big parties with only one server. So understandably, the server was having a hell of a time taking orders, bringing water, etc. We got snapped at a couple times for asking for balsamic vinegar for our bread. I'm sure he didn't mean it - he was probably just overwhelmed.

I was really looking forward to trying their food based on the great reviews. We started off with appetizers: carpaccio, 2 orders of bruschetta, mushroom something, and calamari. The servings were decent though not as big as I had anticipated. But they were good enough to get us looking forward to our entrees.

I ventured off Yelp recommendations and ordered the veal since I'm a big red meat eater (there's a joke that I must've been a T-Rex in my last life because I have a big head, short arms, and only eat meat). I should've know I'd chosen the wrong dish for me when the waiter didn't ask me how I wanted my meat cooked. When the dish came out, I realized my veal was not a thick cut slab of meat but rather thin slices of meat that only had taste because of the sauce. At least it was a big serving. :/

There's a reason why they're known for their gnocchi though. It was deeelicious! Soft, big, delicate, and fresh. I would totally go back for a plate of that on a cold day. The other pasta in rabbit sauce that they're known for is pretty good too though my friend didn't like it. I think it's because she was plagued with the thought of bunnies being slaughtered. They were nice enough to take back the dish and whip her up something else though.

The dinner turned out to be quite pricey. I mean I didn't have to pay, being the birthday girl and all but still. I don't think I'll be coming back unless it's for the gnocchi.
author: Linh V.

description:
I never thought I'd write such a low review for this place b/c this used to be my favorite restaurant in North Beach, and I'm sorry to say I'll never return.

The food is good, yet it doesn't mean you should treat your customers like they are a burden to you.

My guests and I still had a lovely time because we overlooked the following challenges for the sake of enjoying our evening. :)

***CONS***
1) I don't know how they expect a party of more than 10 people to finish appetizers, dinner, and desert within two hours. No one told me about the time constraint when I made the reservation in the first place, so they were RUSHING to get us out of here. And when I say rushing, I mean, throwing plates of desert on the table (this was the manager actually) and busboys were spilling water and ice on our meals because they were pouring water for us very quickly.

Did they think we didn't notice? I expected an apology along the lines of "We're sorry we're rushing to clear your table, yet this is the situation..."

2) We had a large group and spent close to $900 on the dinner, so you'd think they would have been more attentive and appreciative. Apparently not.

3) I got up to use the restroom and I could have sworn some waiter or busboy whistled at me. Pardon me, but am I at a construction site or an Italian restaurant?

4) Soon after we left, I realized they didn't serve one of the preordered appetizers, but they DID charge us for it. I guess they forgot to put it on the table.

5) Looking around, I could tell the waiters were rushing with other customers too. It wasn't as noticeable because most tables had a party of 2-6 people.

6) When we ordered tea, they brought 'warm' water and tea bags (I almost thought I was at a diner). They also forgot to bring tea for several guests until I pointed it out.

It saddens me to write this review because I loved this place. I really did. =/


***PROS***
- Good food
- AMAZING waiter, he really tried to make it a nice evening for us, yet I guess he was pressured by the manager and the staff to hurry up and get us the heck outta there.
- Pretty restaurant
author: Narina A.

description:
Our waiter, Giuseppe, was awesome. He was so friendly and full of life. My friends and I really enjoyed having him there to work with us.
My friend tried the gnocchi and got it extra spicy. I thought it tasted good, until the red pepper kicked in. Then we had a 5 alarm fire in my mouth. LOL!
I had the pasta in rabbit sauce. The actual name? I can't remember, but it was pretty good. My first time having rabbit and it didn't disappoint. The pasta was cooked perfect!
We also got a bottle of red wine that paired really well with what we got. Yum!
author: Rich P.

description:
Nice place. Food is good, but not extraordinary.
Pretty interior. Friendly staff.
author: Natalie L.

description:
PROS: 
- Beautiful and cozy restaurant setting
- Good olive oil 

CONS:
- SANITATION: There was either a BUG or small COCKROACH in the water.  The waiter didn't even apologize, he took the glass away and quietly came back to sneak the new glass of water on our table.  Who knows what else is in our water this time?
Note that he used the same jar where the cockroach came from to serve other patrons before our tables ...

- ATTENTIVENESS: 
       - No water refill so I had to ask for water every time.  
       - Waiter did not clean up our appetizer plates when the main entrees came so I had to stack up my plates in the table corner.  
      - He forgot my order and even joked about it.  It really wasn't funny after all.

- FOOD: The bread they brought out was cold and hard.  The tube pasta with prawns and chickens was salty though it was more decent than other dishes that we ordered.  My gf didn't finish her gnocchi for a reason.  The "award winning" pasta with rabbit sauce did not live up to all the hypes on Yelp.

The whole dining experience was very disappointing.  I felt mistreated and will never come back.
author: De S.

description: This was my 1st visit to Firenze by Night and we were all very happy with our experience.  I took friends from Chicago to dinner before a show.  I ordered the veal saltimboca romana and it was tender and yummy.  Others had pasta with pesto, linguine with clams and the tortellini with prosciutto & peas in a cream sauce.  All of the dishes were delicious.  The restaurant is quaint and can get noisy. The staff treats you like family.  We are very happy that we found this place.  We will be back!
author: Jamie E.

description:
I have a hard time giving such a poor rating because the food really was good, much more deserving of 4 or even 5 stars. I will stick to my rating because of our wait experience. We found that making a reservation means nothing. We waited for 45 minutes for a 9pm while a gentleman ran around, no reservation book in sight, taking other groups who had later "reservation" times and friends of his. It was apparent that he takes a lot of pride in taking care of the guests he recognizes, which just meant that we, unknown guests, were cast aside. Finally, I informed the gentleman that we were leaving, and we were given a table.

The rest of the experience would have been wonderful, our waiter was very kind, the food was quick and very delicious, but we were still just couldn't over our waiting experience.

I would still recommend trying it, hopefully your experience will be better!
author: leah n.

description:
After rave reviews we had to finally check the place out.  We arrived at 7:00pm on a friday night and were seated promptly.  We started with the stuffed mushrooms and the carpaccio.  The mushrooms were actually tender little meatballs stuffed into a mushroom cap in a dark sauce.  Not bad, but not that memorable either.  I regret to say that our order of carpaccio was the worst carpaccio was the worst ever tasted.  No flavor, completely tasteless.  I had the prosciutto melon, which was quite good.  the three others ordered the spinach and bacon and dressing salad that was simply that, a handful of spinach on a plate and drenched with warm bacon grease.  The kitchen must have forgotten all of the other components that should have been in the dressing (no pinenuts or brandy) seriously it was just warm bacon grease.  YUCK YUCK YUCK!

Moving on to entrees, my friend had the gnocchis with pesto.  I have to agree with everyone else that they are the best gnocchis I have ever had.  I had the pappardelle and rabbit sauce which was good however the pasta was overdone.  Another friend had the cappellini pomodoro which he seemed to enjoy (he never shares).  My bf unfortunately ordered the pasta special which was a salmon bow tie pasta in a champagne sauce.  He did not enjoy it at all, it reminded us both of tuna noodle casserole with salmon instead.  Ho Hum...

Our server was very attentive and theatrical to say the least!  

Of my view point, if you go, just order the gnocchi and the rosemary focaccia bread, the rest is just A-OK.
author: Denise C.

description:
Last weekend was our last meal together w/ London friends so we opted for Firenze by Night Ristorante. 

Friends started out with House & Spinach Salads (not me - I'm a salad loather) & they ranted & raved over how yummy they were 

I can vouch for their table bread - the Olive Oil they have to dip it in is *amazingly* flavorful! 

Entrees consisted of the Chicken in Sage Sauce & Pork Medallions for friends - plates licked clean 

I chose their "award-winning" Gnocchi in Tomato Cream Sauce. It was good enough & the dumplings were soft & pillowy but have to say it wasn't the best I've ever had. The tomato & cream sauce was flavorful but maybe a bit bland for the gnocchi - needed something to stand out....

Maybe if they'd offered a gorgonzola sauce choice?? 

Dessert for the table was Tiramisu - homemade spongy cake & cream. Again, good but not overwhelmingly blown away 

Waitstaff was attentive but not overly so - we did have to flag down a few times - restaurant had a great atmosphere w/ tons of people laughing & celebrating birthdays.  It was great fun for us to chat, laugh & say our final goodbyes....until next visit 

BTW - they offer a rockin glass of Merlot! Get it!!
author: Adrienne G.

description: You feel such an authentic Italian feel in this restaurant. The gnocchi was INCREDIBLE!! Best I've ever had by far. My friend got the fettuccine Alfredo and it was also wonderful. Great service. The restaurant is a little dirty but I feel like that comes with the experience a bit. Wonderful meal. Will definitely return.
author: Sara S.

description: Heads up. We allowed a TV review guide us to this restaurant. As you can see by the following comments, the reviews are mixed. It is easy to take faith in a high number of good reviews; and make the plunge. With all of the amazing choices in the City, we should have selected another spot. The decor is outdated and in need of some refreshing. Based on the reviews, we were looking forward to a great welcoming atmosphere, superb food, and outstanding service.  None of our hopes were realized. With advanced reservations, we were seated on the bar side, and on a high traffic path. We waited twenty minutes (20) for water, and another fifteen for the wine to arrive. No, they were not particularly busy, as there were empty tables near us. Two patrons arrived well after us, (and even quite late for their reservation, according to their conversation with the server). Yet, our server began to take their order. Meanwhile, we were still awaiting the water. Our server was inattentive and absent throughout much of our meal. We had to make requests for items that should have arrived customarily at table. The bread arrived late. With the fame of delicious sourdough bread in the City, we were served dry and less than tasteful bread. The admired olive bread, was just ok, at best. Our server made no mention of the specials, which both of us would have made our entree selection. In his defense, he did help with an entree request. Most surprising, the owner, so praised during the TV review for his attentiveness, passed our table seven (7) times throughout the twenty (20) minutes, and made no inquiry as to what was occurring, or if we were in need of anything. Was his inaction, on our behalf, due to him being so busy? No. He allowed ample time to visit, at some leisure, at the bar with those whom he presumably knew. It appears if you are a friend/patron, seated at the bar, you will garner special outgoing attention. When we gently raised our concerns with the server, he simply giggled and blew us off, while making merely half-attempted excuses for being so blatantly remiss. The meal was average to good, but in no way was it exceptional, nor near the level of quality and skilled preparation comparable to other dining experiences we have enjoyed in the area. Oh well, on to the next. No doubt, this eatery has had stellar moments in its history. Unfortunately, it appears the owner has reclined--simply resting on his laurels. Best to you and your dining adventures.
author: BL L.

description:
I decided to try this place due to its popularity on Yelp and was not disappointed. 

Food - I've been here two times, and each time I've had their award-winning Pappardelle Toscana. It is EXCELLENT!!  I'm not a pasta connoisseur but even I could tell that the noodles were hand-made and superbly fresh. This is the best pappardelle I've ever had, even in Italy if you can believe it. 

Ambiance - Walls decorated with a hilltop scene overlooking Florence (I have that same shot on camera), friendly waitstaff, and prompt service. Is it an ultra-romantic place? No. But it's got good food, much better than those touristy places on Columbus.

Overall, I would definitely come back!
author: Stella L.

description: This Italian Restaurant is the real deal.  Sergio and Paulo show the true value of having the owners operating the day to day business.  They care about their customers and consider us family. A very good friend of mine recommended Firenze by NIght and I told Paulo this, we were family from the first time we entered for dinner.  I have been back 4 more times and always had an excellent meal and great service. Yes, parking is easy at the two local garages and the pricing per plate is reasonable.  Wine bottles on the menu are also priced very reasonable.  I truly recommend this Italian Restaurant.
author: GREG C.

description:
I had a Bloomspot coupon- $40 of food for $20, so gave this place a try. Loved the beautiful mural on the wall! The service was great, the waiter very friendly. The interior was decent, but there are a few other places in North Beach whose ambiance i find more romantic. 

We ordered:
Chardonnay
Tortellini alla romana - creamy and flavorful
Linguine with mussels and scallops in wine sauce - too dry for my taste.

Inspite of great service I would rate this place as average, I couldn't fancy this place as much as i had hoped i would.  Just a one time try for me.
author: Payal B.

description:
I really like this place - especially for touristy North Beach. I went a few years ago and just recently rediscovered it.

I like the fact that almost all the workers speak with an Italian accent and that they have different and delicious dishes.

I ordered a ravioli special and although the dish was very rich, it was tasty and the flavors all complimented each other well. We also got some wine and I thought the prices were very reasonable.

This is a restaurant I would recommend for people coming to North Beach, it's good for both intimate dates and large groups as they have a private room in the back. It feels like fine dining and the prices are right.

Firenze all the time, not just by night!
author: Rachel G.

description:
Giving this place 3 stars... but not for the food! BEST GNOCCHI IN SAN FRANCISCO! LOVED IT! However... when I want to have a dinner on a date with my boyfriend I would like it to last longer than 30 minutes. We split a caprese salad for the first course. My boyfriend ate it so quickly and I lingered knowing that our main course would arrive as soon as I ate that last bite. Our waiter kept looking over my shoulder to see if I was done. When I want to go out to a nice dinner, I don't want to feel like I am being hustled so that they can turn tables. I know that this is a tourist place in North Beach but as a resident of San Francisco for 4.5 years now I would like to be able to find an Italian place in North Beach that did not try and have you out in 30 minutes or less. 

I am pretty sure restaurants make money on alcohol... it would have been nice to finish the first glass of wine before dinner ended so we could order a second for our main course. Instead we got that second glass at a local bar!
author: Kimberly M.

description: Loooouuuve the food!! Whenever I visit an italian restaurant the first thing that comes to mind is the heavy greasy cheesy food. But here its just perfectly done. Satisfying the taste without leaving you feeling guilty. Being a vegetarian, found enough good options on the menu. Must try this place.
author: Gayatri S.

description: Super good food. Diamond in the rough worth finding. The risotto was crazy good and the gnocchi were perfect. Go here.
author: Terry I.

description: We sat at the bar for my friend Robvell's birthday.  The bartender, drinks, appetizers and food were unbelievable, especially those mushrooms stuffed with sausage.  AMAZING!!!!  This place is the hidden gem of the neighborhood with the most amazing food and staff.
author: Amy V.

description:
I've been here a couple times, and you can-- and will-- definitely do a lot worse in touristy North Beach.

This place has a delightfully old world SF/Italian flavor to it.  It's just old school.  The food is good, and the first time we ate here it was absolutely divine.

I don't know why, but the second time we ate here the food wasn't quite as good as that magical first time.  But the service was still good and very colorful.  Our Italian waiter was a young, charming Italian guy who really added to the experience.  

If you're wading through the vast number of Italian eateries in this neighborhood, Firenze should be on your short list.  It's close to an SF institution at this point, and for good reason.
author: Dave N.

description:
Fantastic food, service, everything!

We walked in without reservations (the place was packed) and asked to wait at the bar for 5 mins or so and then we were promly seated. 

Our waiter was courtious and quick. Our food arrived piping hot and was DELICIOUS! 

We had stuffed mushrooms, penne pasta with chicken and the tortellini. This is how pasta should be!
author: Darius D.

description:
FIRENZE BY NIGHT is STILL GOING STRONG!  DELIZIOSO SABORS

Years ago I found FIRENZE BY NIGHT and was impressed then.

FAST FORWARD....... The food is still delicious and very pleasing.

It has been a longtime since I ate a really full meal in any restaurant, let alone an Italian Ristorante.  I started with a cocktail that was properly and well made,, Johnny Walker Red, shaken and served up with a twist and lemon!  Excellente!

I started with the Spinaci Salad, it was sublime with real pancetta and perfectly and lightly dressed  . The portion size was perfect, not overwhelming, just the right size with really fresh spinach, very crunchy pancetta and pine nuts.

The evening's pasta specialty was linguini with seafood a white wine sauce.  I had a half portion (I am thrilled they do splits).  It truly was well balanced with the flavors of wine, lemon and garlic.  It was a pleasure to eat, I only wish that they had put in some prawns or lobster.  If I had had the full portion,I probably would have eaten it all!

Swordfish, Yuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuum,   Swordfish is my favorite entree fish.  I was skeptical about how good it could be as it was the size of the oval plate and thinly cut. It was simple seasoned with olive oil, S&P and ALMOST PERFECTLY COOKED (i would have enjoyed it less cooked).  With fresh lemon squeezes it was subtly elegant.  The only thing is that the broccoli was terribly over cooked.....  rather a let down.

THE FINISH LINE................... WOW, YES, A DESSERT
