Seldom do I eat a dessert, when I do, it is normally one that is shared.
There before me was their rendition of a chocolate tartufo. I was expecting one like Tres Scalini in Roma ~ Nope.  It was their version,
it was really good, very light in texture, creamy,  with a scattering of hazel nuts and drizzles of chocolate.  If no one were near me, I might have LICKED THE PLATE CLEAN.

All in allit was a STELLAR DINNER.  I met some people who poured me a glass of their wine and another group of women.  One was a woman of a Very Certain Age with her two, very adult daughters.  They were very interesting and nice Texans.

ONE THORN IN MY SIDE:

R O B E R T..........THE WAITER.  HE WAS VERY DISCRIMINATORY

He served the the Wine Sharers comp Limoncello and a Tiramisu.  Another table he comped apperitivos also.  I was a woman alone, on a Wednesday night and his service was hardly ingratiating and it was insulting to watch him comp other guests.  The Wine Wine Sharers
each had A DISH.........

I dine out on my own because I am a food professional.  Plus. a lot of friends don't eat out because of the economy.  I like restaurants that 
TREAT WOMEN ALONE WELL.

ALL THE   R O B E R T   W A I T E R S   of  THE WORLD 
CAN TAKE A NON-STOP TRIP TO HADES

I'd go back, but   NOT for ROBERT
author: ELINOR H.

description:
Great food! There are always a bunch of specials to choose from too.
I always get the gnocchi and veal 
This is my go to Italian food in SF
author: Vince C.

description:
We are not returning, having been there multiple times.  Party of ten in main dining area were not conversing loudly but yelling.  We requested the host  to speak to them.  He did and for a few minutes it was pleasant.  Then their waiter walked up to their table and began shouting as if he were at a sporting event.  The group resumed their noisy way.  The host was too inexperienced in maintaining a pleasant atmosphere.  SF has many Italian restaurants some are noisy without being over the top with noise. 
C.H.
author: Herb H.

description: Amazing food and service!  What a great family Italian restaurant.  Family is from Lucca, Italy.  Near Florence.  Great vibe, small and cozy.  Made us feel like we were back in Italy!  We will definitely come back if we are in San Francisco again!
author: Kathryn L.

description:
It was date night with the wifey. We were going to see a show down the street and I needed to find a good place for a delicious, but still romantic dinner. I read all the review exclaiming the authenticity here and decided to give it a try. I have refrained from eating West Coast Italian because I am very loyal to my East Coast pseudo-Italian-American roots. If you want authentic, they got it. But all in all, it really doesn't matter because the food is fantastic regardless. We had a reservation on a Friday night, so we just had to wait 5 minutes or so for the host to notice us. We were seated promptly by an extremely friendly and helpful American waiter (I point that out to say that we did not have an Italian speaking waiter as others have mentioned, but that did not detract from experience nonetheless). 

I immediately trusted our waiter for some odd reason. Maybe he just looked like he ate well, but I felt that I could take his opinion with confidence. He recommended the Italian sausage stuffed mushrooms over the mussels to start, which was an excellent pick. He recommended the Syrah, which was another hit. My wife couldn't decide between the gnocchi and the tortellini alla romana, so he suggested doing a split plate of both (still for $16!). I was trying to decide between the saltimbocca alla romana or the braised lamb special and he recommended the special for the hungry patron. Honestly, he was right on all counts. 

The stuffed mushrooms were actually not greasy and came in the amazing savory and flavorful jus. The sausage was great. I am by no means a gnocchi connoisseur, but they were very soft and I believe I saw them aptly described as pillowy elsewhere. The tortellini were of course delicious and the sauce, to die for! However, the ginormous braised lamb shank was clearly the star of the show (even at $26). It was, as described, falling off the bone and so flavorful with a sort of mushroomy gravy. the polenta that came with it was very good also, although I did not get to eat much of it. 

What really set this place apart for me other than the food was the ambiance. It felts very homey from the moment we walked in. I felt like I was in a family-owned Italian restaurant, not some tourist trap with white table clothes and blue glasses. It felt very sincere. We did not have any complaints about the noise and carried on a casual conversation without any problems. All in all, this is a great place for a nice night out. Won't be back too regularly for financial reasons, but hey, gotta go out on dates sometimes.
author: Miguel V.

description: I've been coming here for years.  Love all their food. They accommodated my party of 5 near closing and didn't rush us out. Excellent service and fantastic food.
author: B L.

description: Amazing food, friendly staff! A nice cozy little spot to grab some awesome italian!  The gnocchi were out of this world!! Check it out you'll love it!
author: Sean H.

description:
Favorite Italian restaurant in San Francisco? WITHOUT QUESTION!

I've wanted to try Firenze by Night since some girls mentioned it on the Dirty 30 bus ride back to the Marina. I logged it on my "places to try list" and hadn't given it much thought since....BUT

a) I spent 12 days in Italy over the summer and have really been missing the entire experience- especially the cuisine AND

b) Bloomspot had a coupon- $40 of food for $20 SO

Naturally, the boyfriend and I decided to give it a shot on Friday night!

Upon entering Firenze, I immediately felt like I was back in Florence..Well ok, not entirely. Firenze is on the brinks of China town, so it's more like eating Italian food in China...but the mural on the wall of Florence certainly added to the ambiance, as did the twinkling lights and the wait-staff saying "Prego" "Bueno Serra" etc... I loved it! Our server was friendly and attentive, and the ambiance is "nice" without being stuffy. Environmentally speaking, there's nothing about this place I don't like.

We ordered:

Peju Sauv Blanc (Love, love, love Peju!)
Ceasar Salad (Good, but pretty standard as far as Ceasar's go)
Ribolitta (sp? Vegetable soup- this was delicious! I liked it more than the order I got in Florence. Apparently, this soup is a Florentine special.)
Penne Pasta with Shrimp and Chicken- (this was delicious! the right amount of sauce, shrimp, chicken, and oh so flavorful!)
Linguine with seafood special (I didn't have this but the boyfriend insures me it's his favorite pasta dish- EVER to date)

We will absolutely be back to Firenze! I'd like to take my mom and sister so we can all be nostalgic about our trip.
author: Annalise F.

description: A little warm inside but food and serivce was great.
author: LJ E.

description:
Our concierge recommended this place as where the locals go and the food came highly recommended. We were not disappointed! The food was great!

The "waiting" area is very small, so if you are going on a Friday or Saturday night, come with some patience. The place was packed! A good sign, right?

I would love to give this restaurant 5 stars, but the service was lackluster. Our waiter seemed aggravated that we had ordered drinks at the bar. We were seated against the wall, so the waiter would have to walk around other tables to get to us. He couldn't be bothered to do so, so he tossed our dinner and dessert menus onto our table and did the same with the bread basket. However, he could be bothered to come over to the table when it came time to give us the check. After we received the check, we sat there for a couple minutes and the waiter returned to tell us "thank you, you have your check now". We basically were rushed out of there. Not something that I like to have happen while I'm on vacation.
author: Heather S.

description: Are you seriously saying this is the best gnocchi ever? This is an embarrassment for them. Cause I have never had such soggy and tasteless clumps of dough in my life. Service was ok. Swift fast. Not too friendly but it's not rude either. Place is cramped. And old school Italian
author: Xin S.

description: Mixed review, they actually try to pass off BV Napa Valley Cab as BV Rutherford.  Any cab fan knows that difference in taste never mind price.  I had. Quail Borollo, my girl had a chicken pasta dish that really was same as mine with chicken substitute.  Good meal, poor execution, and the wine fraud is a real red flag!
author: R S.

description: Came here for a work dinner with quite a large party. Service was very friendly and attentive. I had the vegetarian lasagna, which was delicious. I would definitely come back here!
author: Cat R.

description: Great little, family owned Italian restaurant filled with Italian speaking waiters. Great atmosphere, wine list, apps, and entrees. They are known for their gnocchi and rabbit sauce dishes. Unfortunately, I'm gluten free and couldn't try either of those. But the waiter was knowledgable about what was and was not gluten free. I ended up having the veal! It was amazing!
author: Lindsay P.

description:
Solid place and a must visit for everyone. We live in the south bay and discovered this place using the yelp app.  I love the fact that this place is open late during the weekday nights.

The food combined with the humor of the owner/Chef made me a fan. They made us feel really special and we will definitely go back to try more stuff.
author: Jeev S.

description: One of the worst italian food I have ever eaten. Worst tiramisu ever. The only thing I ate completely was the bruschetta.
author: Setu G.

description: Wonderful experience!  We are in SF for the night and had tried another restaurant up the street but they had a two hour wait so we came to Firenze and we are so glad we did!  My wife cannot have red sauce but really wanted to try the Ravioli Della Momma. The waiter was more than happy to offer her an Alfredo cream sauce that was out of this world. The whole dinner and staff was amazing. Very attentive and the place is as authentic as they come!  Almost entirely from Italy or first generation ItaloAmerican.
author: Steve A.

description:
We went here for my birthday dinner a few nights ago. The interior is super cute and dimly lit. Inside were mostly groups and couples. Loud at times. The space isn't huge so reservations are a must. The waitstaff is definitely a treat. Italian boys? Drool. 

It was a Friday night so it was super busy. The waitstaff seemed rushed at times but they calmed down towards the end of the night. Friendly and lively. As a group of girls we definitely enjoyed their comments regarding beautiful women. =) It did help that it was my birthday so I definitely had no complaints regarding the attention.

Now on to the food! We all shared the bruschetta and cesar salad. Both were OUTSTANDING. I had the linguine vongole which was the best I've ever tasted. Excellent food and great service. I will make this my to-go spot for Italian from now on.
author: Katie Anne N.

description:
Food=Awesome
Drinks=Strong
Service=FANTASTIC

I came here on a busy rainy night with 4 other girlfriends and the place was jam packed.  We started at the bar with a couple of cocktails from Chris.  Seriously, one of the sweetest bartenders I've met.  I just asked him to make me something sweet and strong and he definitely delivered.  We kept the alcohol flowing the whole night and Chris definitely was a good way to start the evening.  

Once we were seated, we were already somewhat loud because of the liquor, but all the servers were sweet nonetheless.  Our water Guisepee was so attentive and freakin adorable.  For appetizers we ordered the gnocchi, carpaccio, and bruschetta.  Like many of the other reviews, the gnocchi are pillows of love in your mouth.  Definitely met my expectations.  The bruschetta was well seasoned and the carpaccio was very frush.  

We then ordered the mushroom risotto, canneloni, ravioli, rabbit with pappardelle, and the special which was wild boar.  It sounds like a lot of food but we were able to finish every bite.  Everything was so tasty and authentic.  

Lastly, we had the ice cream truffles for dessert.  What a way to end a fantastic dinner.  When I'm back in the bay, this is a spot I'll be returning to for awhile.
author: Melanie S.

description:
I'm such a fan!!

Had a party of 40 going there for a work function and decided to come here first because I can't be the foodie picking the restaurants and then look like a fool. 

So, 3 of us went the first time and had a fantastic dinner. As stated, their gnocchi are so amazing! I adored them! We split this and the carpaccio as appetizers. I then had the shrimp with a garlicky tomato sauce, my cohorts had the bracciole (special) and the veal scaloppini. Each plate was served with potatoes and beautiful mixed veggies that were perfectly crunchy. Everything delicious! We had great wine and awesome tiramisu as well. The service was impeccable. I could now vouch for bringing my co-workers! YAY!

The next week we brought 40 people in after a Go Game scavenger hunt. Paolo was extremely accommodating through the whole process and everyone really enjoyed their food. We had prosciutto and melon and bruschetta to start, salad, the pasta course was (of course!!) the gnocchi, and then 3 choices between the salmon in wine sauce, the veal with capers or the chicken with garlic and white wine. The dessert choice was cheese cake or spumoni. Everything was excellent and there were a lot of rave reviews. 

I would highly recommend this place for groups and I will personally be back for dinner often!
author: Amy B.

description:
As good as this place is its a shame it took me two visits to get to a review! Shame on me!

Came back to get my Italian fix since there aren't any worth trying close to where I live. Plus, I love the City!

Despite the place being busy, there were two tables left so we got seated right away. I started my night with a Caddy Margarita and an appetizer of Prosciutto e Melone. Love this appetizer and make it at home but food always seems to taste better when someone else makes it! ;)

Last time I came, I had the gnocchi and I can say it lived up to the hype! This time, all temptation to reorder set aside, I decided on the special of chicken breast stuffed with veal and porcini mushrooms in a light tomato sauce and fresh peas, steamed veggies and potato slices on the side and a glass of Syrah.  

Heavenly.

The chicken breast practically melted in my mouth, the veal and porcini mushrooms along with the sauce was nothing short of savory rustic flavors bursting in my mouth (oralgasm ?! I'd say so! ) Needless to say I finished the plate. Normally, I have a left over of some sort!

Our waiter who's name I forget, was good but not as good as the first waiter we had previously. He had a thick Italian accent and everything was "Buon Appetito!" 

Dessert was a given. I swear, as a baker, hands down this place makes THEE BEST Tiramisu. If only words could explain.... 

So if you have and Italian craving to satisfy or just cant decide which Italian restaurant to try in North Beach, this is your answer!

Gnocchi and Tiramisu are musts on the first visit. Guaranteed you will not be disappointed!
author: Jasara B.

description:
Great atmosphere, service, food and value.  Unlike some of the other restaurants in North Beach which are overly crowded, this one you can usually find a table.

One time, ironically, I ran into my parent's neighbor in Charlotte, NC next to me.

Most pastas are under $20.  Each night has had 3-4 special additions to the menu which tend to be pricier but are quite yummy.  My boyfriend raves about the award-winning gnocchi signature dish served every night here.  The rabbit pappardelle is also "award winning" but we both thought it seemed a bit too must like deconstructed lasagna and that the gnocchi was a must better choice.
The bread basket comes with two types of bread--- a focaccia and harder, sourdough like type.   While both are great, the focaccia is excellent.
author: Em H.

description:
Before going to watch Wicked, the boyfriend and I stopped into this cute little restaurant to catch a little dinner. He had made reservations ahead of time, but quite honestly, it was pretty empty when we got there. It wasn't hard to find parking because we pulled up right in front of the restaurant, and a host from inside came outside to move the sign that they had on the street, which I thought was awfully sweet of them. 

When we were seated, I noticed that all the tables were pretty close together. I wish there was more room between the tables for some privacy, but the people who come in hear seem to be neighborhood regulars who are all so sweet, and not of the sketchy type. 

Because the restaurant was so small, the service was pretty attentive and super nice. We started the night with their bruschetta by recommendation, and I was not disappointed at all! I must say that everything was pretty fresh and seasoned perfectly. 

I had ordered one of the specials, but it was a really big portion and just okay. Something with beef and potatoes? I did get bored of it quickly so I switched with the boyfriend for his gnocchi. He was happy because he's a boy and boys like meat. I was in love with the gnocchi! It was soooo good and soft! It definitely is something you want to let melt in your mouth and savor the taste. 

For dessert I wanted something like so we tried the peach sorbet which was served in a peach! I thought that was such a cute touch. It was super yummy and a perfect portion to share. It was so yummy that I was smiling while eating it! 

Upon leaving, the guy came outside to open the door for me which I think was top notch service! I definitely would come back and try other things on the menu. and if I don't like it, I can always steal my boyfriend's gnocchi again.
author: Crystal V.

description:
So, it's the end of a long day in San Francisco - I've flown across the country to work with a local office, and the day has run long.  The company's put us up in Rube Central down in Fisherman's Wharf, and we're desperate to avoid the overpriced seafood-huts on the waterfront jammed full of tour-bus hordes.

Our previous venture into North Beach by foot led us to a slick-looking joint with undercooked pasta and a dining room with lots of empty seats.  To be perfectly honest, we were a little leery rolling up on Firenze by Night's old-school and slightly worn decor.  Our fears, however, were neatly dispelled.

The wine list is serviceable, with solid Italian offerings.  We made good with a not-unreasonably-priced bottle of Vino Nobile di Montepulciano.  Starters consisted of a nicely flavorful bruschetta, which was a pleasant surprise after having plenty of bland tomato topping on toast in the past, and a gorgeous plate of shaved Bresaola (cured beef) and arugula.

As an entree, I ate a dish of veal cutlets in a creamy pesto sauce.  The veal was perfectly cooked and tender, and the sauce was rich and flavorful without overwhelming the meat.  Roasted mixed veg and a bit of penne rigate with tomato sauce were served on the side, and were pretty forgettable.  My coworker's dish was a risotto with mushrooms, herbs, and roasted chicken that garnered high praise.

Service was good, even with all tables full.  We neither felt neglected nor rushed.  We were greeted promptly on entering, seated immediately, and our service was handled efficiently.  Overall, a good meal and a good vibe.
author: Rob N.

description: The Pollo Toscana (chicken w/ artichoke in a white wine sauce) was more than excellent and my husband ordered the linguine w/ wild mushrooms (a tomato based sauce, not creamy) was also. The temperature was hot and the food came out quickly. Went on a Monday night, and we had a reservation but didn't really need one. If I lived in this city would come here often!!
author: Hillary D.

description: Great food and service. Gnocchi was great. My table also enjoyed the special seafood linguini and ravioli. The host went out of his way to accomodate us - very nice guy.
author: Kelsey M.

description:
Given its location, parking is impossible. 
the food portions are good, but being such a popular place, I expected something simple like angel hair with tomato basil sauce to be really good but it barely had tomato sauce. One thing for sure, their wine selection is great. My friends had the Gnocci and they all said it was really good and it was a big plate too. Oh yea, the place has very little ventilation so it got warm inside and its really loud so we had to raise our voices most of the time.
author: Jeffrey M.

description:
There were so many good things on the menu my daughter and I ended up ordering 3 pasta dishes and taking home left overs.  It was definitely worth it. 

Of course we had to have the award winning Gnocci Firenze and it was most excellent. The gnocchi was light and the sauce was just right.  Will definitely get this again.

We also had the Penne Allo Zenzero with sun dried tomatoes, garlic, and shallots.  The spice was hot but not too hot.  The flavors blended together very well.

We also had the Cannelloni Biago which is crepes stuffed with prosciutto and chicken.  Of the 3, this dish was not quite as good as the other 2 but maybe it's just our taste since this one didn't have as much flavor.  The sauce was similar to the gnocchi sauce.  

For dessert we had to try their tiramisu and it was excellent.  Creamy filling, light cake layers, and good coffee flavor.  We also had the chocolate tartufo which was excellent as well.

The staff was very attentive. Overall it was a great experience.  Will definitely go back, hopefully soon.
author: Karen S.

description:
We came here through the recommendation of someone my bf knows who lives in the area. I made a reservation to be on the safe side for 8 pm after reading a few other reviews. 

We enjoyed a leisurely trolley ride over from the hotel and walked around the area a bit, it is a very cute neighborhood in San Francisco's Little Italy. One thing my bf commented on is why is the Little Italy always next to the Chinatown? Of course we only have this opinion based on being from NY but I thought it was a good observation.

I was very glad we made reservations, this place was packed by the time we got there. We were greated by a stylish older italian gentleman with a gray ponytail, pointed italian shoes and a $30,000 wrist watch...so I figured this might be the owner. He was extremely friendly as was our waiter, they seem to import these guys straight from Italy because you can tell english is not their first language.

I asked the waiter a quick question about one of the wines being spicy he gave an enthusiastic "YES" and said that I didnt like spicy so then he said well itsa not so spicy and itsa very popular. I really don't think he understood what I was asking but we got a decent bottle of California red. One thing I did notice, the pricing of the food to the wine is disappropriate...they should have more of a variety of wines in pricing. It was either on the low end or the high end so we ended up getting a $45 bottle which wasn't to terrible but I would have preferred to pay $10 less considering the entrees there aren't over $20.

We decided to get two pastas and split an entree since we can't be normal and just get an appetizer and two entrees. So I had to get the famous gnocchi and he got a pepparadelle toscana which is just wide ribbon pasta in a rabbit sauce. We decided to split the veal saltimbocca after some hand signals the waiter understood what we were trying to do. 

The pastas come out and at first we didnt opt for any cheese, after tasting both of our dishes we felt having some cheese would help it out a bit as both of our dishes were a little on the bland side. After adding a little bit of cheese to give it a bit of saltiness I thought my dish was great. The gnocchi were very light and fluffy and not dense so they had more of a melt in your mouth consistency, the sauce wasn't to bad either. My bf's pasta was good but mine was better, he didn't care for rabbit but the pasta itself was cooked perfectly. 

We both enjoyed the veal dish which was not bland thankfully, I'd be a little worried after having proscuitto and fontina cheese in a dish and it still being bland. They split it for us and it turned out to be two good sized portions, the veal was pounded thin with a small layer of cheese and tiny slices of proscuitto, it came with a side of steamed veggies and some polenta which was very buttery.

All together the meal came up to about $100 without tip which isn't bad since half of that was the bottle of wine and we technically got three entrees. We enjoyed the ambiance of the place and the service so if we are in the area again we would go back.
author: Angela M.

description: The gnocchi was great. Service was polite, prompt, and attentive. The snails were a great appetizer. Also had some sort of caramel pudding for dessert.
author: Anpan W.

description: I just finished my 2nd visit here. The first time was so fantastic, and I was really looking forward to this meal.  It just didn't hold up. My waiter seemed like he was having a bad day. The service was fine, but he was surly and not one smile the whole service. The papradelle was good, but not great. When my bill came, I politely asked if they would call a cab for me. The waiter told me to walk down a block and hail one myself. Not what I was expecting and I don't think I will have to go back a 3rd time.
author: Shelley C.

description: Amazing atmosphere, along with the authentic Italian waiters. Really, the amazing ravioli, gnocchi, and other pastas are just an added bonus, which i may remind you, are some of the best pastas i've tasted.
author: Dillon P.

description: Energetic world class wait staff, great food, and classic ambience make dining here a memorable experience. My companion and I were completely charmed. We had the gnocchi and ravioli entrees, which came combined onto a serving plate for each of us. Quite a delectable pair of pasta dishes! No wonder their gnocchi gets raves. We followed that up with today's veal special, so tender we didn't need our knives.
author: Dan R.

description: Came here for dinner because my friend had a voucher.  I tried the lemon fish special, which was suuuuper pricey and not worth it.  I think I need to stop ordering simple white fish at restaurants!  Probably ordered the wrong thing though!
author: Lily N.

description: Great food and friendly atmosphere, I would recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for very good, delicious Italian food.
author: Sanna D.

description:
Yum yum to that gnocchi
Canneloni was aight
customer service: good
author: Rina L.

description:
The gnocchi were delicate pillows of savory deliciousness. My date had the wild boar rigatoni. He raves about it to this day.

For an appetizer we had the mussels and fresh mozzarella, both were delicious, but the mussels were the star, because the sauce they were put in was fantastic.

This is by far my favorite italian restaurant in the city. I even came here on my birthday. 

Service has been top notch both times I've been here. The first time I went, I didn't have a reservation but we only had a 10 minute wait, and we sat at the bar and had a glass of wine while we waited. The second time, we did have a reservation and they sat us right away.
author: Laura P.

description: Wonderful restaurant! Great atmosphere. Enjoyed the beautiful mural of Florence. The food was excellent. We tried the seafood pasta, sole special and gnocchi. All amazing. Also had the burrata  appetizer and incredible stuffed mushrooms. And the egg drop soup was delicious. Can't wait to return and try it again. And Fausto our waiter was amazing. He was pleasant and so efficient.
author: Patti A.

description:
Not actually perfect but no reasonably priced restaurant can be. 4.9 stars, ok? 

My girlfriends and I had reservations and we called and said we would be late. No problem. We got there and did have to wait about 20 minutes but it was Saturday night at 7:45-- busiest time of the week for most any restaurant so totally reasonable. The staff were too busy to be super attentive but all were friendly and efficient and fast.

Again, it took our waiter a good 20 minutes to get to us once seated but he was clearly swamped. He had the whole back room which included a party of about 20 who were just starting to order when we sat down and as a server myself I know taking the order on a big party can be extremely, maddeningly time consuming. 

Once he got to us he was friendly and seemed to appreciate our quick, no nonsense order. With that much time we knew exactly what we wanted. 

The appetizers were pretty good as was the bread. We had bruschetta and buffaloe mozarella salad and the Italian sausage stuffed mushrooms. The mushrooms were the best. 

I had the Stracciatella soup, which I had never tried before. There certainly could be better stracciatellas than their's, but I don't know how really. Wow! It was excellent! It's so exciting to discover a new delightful food. 

The gnocchi did not disappoint. Best gnocchi I've ever had by a long shot. 

We asked the waiter if the dessert was really that great or what and he sent us to Mara down the street for pastry. Honest and appreciated. Mara's pastries really were delightful. 

Not that pricey for really excellent food. Don't go if you're in a hurry. Ambiance casual and super friendly but not at all divey or shabby. I'll definitely return.
author: Lula S.

description:
Flavorful Italian food with a decent portion size.

My husband had Gnocchi and I ordered Pollo Con Funghi. 
Gnocchi was tasty and a must try, however the taste is only of the sauce, the dumplings in itself have no taste whatsoever. if you want something crunchy(Veggies or meat) or saucy/spicy you may want to order something else, as this is only dumplings in sauce.

Pollocon Funghi was very very tasty. It has right level of spice and sauce. comes with a small portion of grilled veggies and cracked wheat . Everything served in this dish tastes mouth watering.

Space is a little crammed, but over all good ambience.
Its gets crowded after 6:30PM on weekends, so make sure to reserve a table else the wait can be for an hour.

I recommend this place.
author: Neha S.

description:
I took a group of 14 from my company and had a wonderful experience. They followed up to confirm the reservation and we were seated right away. The service was the absolute best service I have ever had. These guys were on it! The appetizers were great and the dinner was even better. Literally everyone bragged about their meal.
I cant say enough about what a great experience this was for the group. I will say that it is a little loud but not uncommon for the North Beach Restaurant scene. I will be back soon.
author: John R.

description:
Lots of mediocre, fusion-y(not a real word) interpretations of Italian food in this city. Also lots of "classic" italian spots in North Beach with rich history and lack-luster, over priced entrees. 

Firenze is no joke. The papparadelle with duck ragu was very satisfying, with fresh tasting pasta, generous portions of duck, and a sauce that was neither over-salted nor overly sweet. The gnocchi is as good as everyone says... just try it. The Capone is really fabulous - killer sauce, great texture on the chicken.
author: John S.

description: As a true Italian would, I had been looking for an authentic place in the city for some hand-made Gnocchi. The Gnocchi here is pillowey and melts in your mouth, it is just purely devine. I have also had the lobster ravioli and the boar pasta (both specials) which were great, but the Gnocchi remains my favorite. The portions are large and SUPER inexpensive!!! Most of the wines by the glass are under $10 and really good.
author: Jenna Q.

description:
On my first ever visit to San Francisco, I came to Firenze by Night and had a really memorable experience. Good food, great service, fun atmosphere. Me and Hot Mike were trying to figure out where to go for date night and decided to give it a 2nd go around here.

For the most part, it was a fantastic evening. We were seated without much of a wait, the staff was really friendly and animated, lots of ciao bella's and italian which made me feel right at home. We had a corner table which was fine because we didn't want to be in the middle of the fray. Ordered a plate of antipasti, stracciatella, insalata di spinachi, gnocchi and a veal dish...oh and tiramisu.

For me the star was the stracciatella soup which was light and perfectly seasoned. The gnocchi were great as well but the problem came when the chef plated both the gnocchi and veal on one plate (we were sharing the two dishes so we each got a plate). They were separated by a very sad pile of over cooked vegetables (the usual suspects, broccoli, cauliflower and carrots) and the plate wasn't hot which gave us about 5 minutes to eat everything before it started getting cold.  The veal was completely forgettable and that sucks because veal isn't cheap.  Really disappointing actually :/

Tiramisu was great and I'm glad we ended on that instead of the veal.  All around, Firenze by Night was A-OK.  We had a fabulous time because it was cozy enough where we could easily hear one another, our waiter was really nice and we were the last customers to leave after closing (meaning we were having such a good time we didn't notice).  The food was okay.  I know there are better places to have a great italian meal in SF and I intend to find them the next time around.
author: Rachael B.

description: Firenze is the BEST Italian food in SF. It is all "home made" fresh! Sergio, the owner and his son Paulo always make sure you have the best experience. Eating here is not only delicious, it feels authentic, warm, inviting and fun! The Gnocchi is to die for! Ask for a shot of the home made Limonchello after your dinner.
author: Loren S.

description:
I was up in SF w/a group of about 13 friends -- they were VERY accomodating, especially considering we made the reservation the same day for such a large group. 

First off, I have to say go early and hang by the bar -- the bartender whose name escapes me now is the friendliest, funniest guy we met in SF! If it's your birthday he'll hook ya up with whatever you want and a kiss to go along with it! 

The service was great --friendly and prompt, which sometimes is lacking at Italian restaurants. The food was very good... not sure if I'd give it 4 stars cuz there wasn't anything unique about it. It was kind your good hearty traditional Italian food. 

I had the infamous gnocci and while I thought it was very good it was by no means the best I've ever had. Would I go back? Definitely! Especially with a big group and if celebrating something -- they seem to be very adept and able to handle groups well and provide great service to 'em.
author: Alma P.

description:
Why the fourth star? 
The Insalata di Spinachi was amazing. Warm spinach (not wilted), bacon, toasted pine nuts, & brandy. Perfectly balanced so you could really taste all the flavors. Not greasy like warm spinach-bacon salads sometimes are. The pine nuts were perfectly toasted. Tender fresh spinach.

Why not a fifth star?
-  The atmosphere was dated to the point it felt like an old restaurant.  
- I just don't like it when restaurants have long white tablecloths and the tables are close together which makes it hard to get in an out without almost ripping the tablecloth off the table. I can't imagine the trouble a larger person would have.
- the food was really good, but other than the spinach salad, not amazing

Why did we come here in the first place? 
We realized we'd never eaten Italian food in North Beach.
author: Emily C.

description:
Cute place to have dinner, with pretty good food to boot.

My date and I ordered the gnocchi and a special, which was a chicken cutlet wrapped around some ground veal.

Everything was quite tasty.  The portion was a bit small for what I expected from an Italian place, but not a huge issue.  The service was nice, recommending dishes and wine, and checking up on us.  The space was interesting too, and the bar seemed like a cool place to hang out.

I'd recommend it to others!
author: Robert S.

description: Great gnocchi but there was a cockroach in my food so I couldn't continue. I should've paid attention to the 69/100 health rating on the yelp page.
author: Badrul F.

description: Fantastic service. The gnocchi was cooked perfectly and the sauce was great. Highly recommended
author: James W.

description:
Here is the skinny on a well known Italian eatery that will leave you anything but skinny if you dine here more than once a week : 

Service: 3 stars - 1 for the bartender (more on that below) 4 for table service 

Wine selection: 3 stars - moderate selection needs updating. 

Apps: 3 stars - escargot and salads above average but inspired. 

Entrees: Good but not earth shattering. All entrees were good...just not great. 

Valet and overall experience are pluses. 

Now...the moron of a bartender working Feb 7th in the evening. Many owners read these reviews, so here is a fee free observation from SIX people who dine out 5-6 nights a week in SF. 

Bartenders are frequently, with the exception of the host/hostess, the first and last person you interact with as a guest. 

This guy, who looked like Ron Jeremy on a good day, spent more time flirting with the cougars at the bar than attending to the two elderly couples wanting a glass of wine or the three other parties waiting for drinks - hello!! -- high margin revenue!! 

We are not returning largely because of the average food and the Ron Jeremy stand in at the bar. Repeat business is THE ONLY BUSINESS.
author: Michael G.

description: OMG the handmade gnocchi is incredible. I'm a huge gnocchi fan and this is hands down the BEST gnocchi I've ever had outside of what I had while studying abroad in Italy. Really delicious. Their carpaccio is also very good but as for main courses I never stray from that gnocchi it's far too delicious to pass up.
author: Mandy B.

description:
Came to this Italian place for a group reunion. The atmosphere deserves 4 stars. Cozy yet definitely happening. A good level of general conversation. The service was decent as well. 

Service gets 1 star. However, our food took forever to come. The bottles of wine and champagne took forever as well. Albeit we did have a large group (15?), it took them 2 people at least 4 trips each to get all the glassware.

The food itself was somewhat not memorable. 2 stars.  Almost everyone had the Pappardelle toscana (Rabbit pasta) or the Gnocchi firenze, both apparently award winners. The pappardelle noodles themselves were the right texture. However, the sauce was a bit on the salty side. The Gnocchi was average, could be a little bit less creamy. Hence, even after waiting more than an hour for the food, it still didn't taste fabulous.
author: Yue Z.

description: I am posting this review just to express my first and only experience with this restaurant. My dining companion and I had a reservation for 8:30p on a Friday night. Since we anticipated it would be busy, we arrived 15 minutes early to check to see if the reservation would be honored and have a drink. We walked into the restaurant and it was extremely noisy. Not good. We checked with the host. Our table would not be ready at 8:30, we were told. They were running late. We took one look at the bar area. It was so crowded there was nowhere to even stand. So with that, I decided to use the ladies room. I walked back to the ladies room only to discover I was walking upon a very sticky floor. Then I discover the ladies room to be less than clean. This is getting worse, I thought to myself. Why would I want to eat here? I walked back up the hallway on the sticky floor, grabbed my dining companion and we walked out. That was the end of that. With all the wonderful restaurants in North Beach, we had no trouble finding another restaurant where we enjoyed fabulous Italian wine, delicious Italian meals and absolutely wonderful service in a very nice setting. And to top things off, the prices were much better than Firenze's prices which, by the way, are incorrect on their website. Those prices are way off. I don't know why they wouldn't post a current menu with current prices for their customers. In any event, that was how our evening turned out. I think it goes without saying that we won't be returning to Firenze by Night Ristorante.  Sorry.
author: Rabbit B.

description: Came here for NYE dinner and had a lovely meal. The best part about this place is there's nothing trendy here. No seared brussel sprouts with bacon, no stupid kale salads, no trendy bs flustering up their menu and distracting you from the good stuff. We got beef carpaccio, bruschetta and two extra dirty vodka martinis to start and were very happy. I had the gnocchi and my boyfriend had the special crab meat with cherry tomatoes, asparagus and white wine + butter sauce. Both were very well done, perfectly seasoned and like I said, no fuss. The whole experience was fine dining with traditional Italian dishes and reasonable prices.
author: Jenn K.

description:
Pros:
-Service was good and friendly
-showed up 15 mins late to my reservation at 9pm on a Friday, and was still seated in a reasonable amount of time...mind you, the restaurant was packed
-the "Funghi ripieni con salsiccia" appetizer was good (mushrooms with sausage)
-the 'gnocchi' entree was good - supposedly the best in SF...wish they had tabasco sauce to give it more kick!

Cons:
-crowded, tight aisles
-seat was not that comfortable, though I had a pretty date to look at so it didn't matter
author: Tushar T.

description:
They served bread but wouldn't give me butter.  

i had penne with chicken and prawns.  The pasta was pretty good but not really al dente.  The chicken was great.  Prawns tasted a bit weird and I picked them all out.
author: Niniane W.

description:
Please open a restaurant in Chicago.

Seriously, this place is amazing. On our first visit to SF, some locals recommended this place for best Italian in the city. We sat at the bar and had amazing service and equally amazing food. We literally came back 2 nights later to have a second go-around with the spinach bacon salad and gnocchi. Awesome.
author: Meg S.

description: I'm blown away by the reviews here... We eat in SF a lot and try different places this is by far the worst Italian we have had. Service was good but it started with the wine they didn't have what we ordered so they brought out BV which you see in Safeways ewwww. seafood pasta was too salty to eat and the gnoochie taste like spud potatoes! disappointed
author: Tiffany G.

description: Very good Italian restaurant in North Beach.  The food was very good ( I had the fettucine pesto).  I rate this as very good as there was nothing that was over the top outstanding.  It was good, solid, italian food, like many restaurants in North Beach.  I would not hesitate to go back.  The others in my party also said their dishes were very good, we had no complaints or problems.  The staff were very nice.
author: Steven B.

description: My husband and I came here to celebrate our 20th anniversary. The staff was warm and friendly. Our waiter was knowledgeable about the food and wine. I had the tortellini in brodo (soup) and award winning gnocchi firenze. The soup was delicious, but the gnocchi was, as they say in Italy, fantastico! My husband had the  penne allo zenzero which had the perfect amount of spice. This place was a delightful North Beach find!
author: Cathryn D.

description: Absolutely glorious atmosphere, food, service and vibe. It was my first time there. I had heard a lot about it and was told we needed to eat there. First of all-there was a mix up with the reservation which was my fault. They happily and kindly accommodated our party of five within a matter of minutes. The owner and his son are to die for adorable, sweet and helpful and truly made our night as did our very buff, very Italian waiter who called all the ladies at our table "Bella."  The cocktails were delish, the pomodoro was yummy and the gnocchi was so good that I almost bought a 2nd to go order and didn't care if I had to eat it cold in my hotel room!! Best. Gnocchi. Ever!!! It is very Italian/fun/family owned and I will be back again when I hit the city. Oh!! And our friends needed a cab and the sweet owners son actually went out and grabbed one for them. They were in a cab in minutes.
author: Mandy F.

description:
Its a debate between 2 and 3 stars...3 is being generous. In general Italian in SF is 2 stars. I have yet to find a decent italian (and chinese) restaurant in this area- I guess the Italians never made it past NYc, it is a long trek after all.
 
The gnocchi was good- the sauce wasn't too flavorful but they were a good texture. 
The lasagna was bad- totally flavorless
Veal was tough but had a good flavor
Pasta in rabbit sauce- bad- flavorless watery sauce. 
The italian cheesecake was really good, though not as stiff as italian usually is. 
Chocolate mouse cake was great- such a nice silky texture.
author: Layla L.

description:
We went on a Saturday night.  Had a reservation, and were seated within minutes of entering the building.  Being a Saturday night, it was packed with people, always a good sign =D

The food was really good, I ordered the pasta with chicken and shrimp, my boyfriend had the calamari salad with polenta, and our family ordered the ravioli and a couple other things. 

For how busy they were, the waiters were quick, friendly, and the food came out relatively quickly.

Along with other reviewers, this is  Fun restaurant. 

The only con I had to say about this place was where we sat.  We got one of the tables right next to the bar, and at one point, one of my friends had a man's ass quite literally in her food.  There are only a few tables that are this close to the bar, so keep your fingers crossed you get a table more out of the way of that location.
author: Lauren R.

description: This was my first visit; I was pleasantly surprised!  While very small and a little warm inside, the wait staff was friendly and attentive.  The food was very good and the wine list had a great variety, esp. considering how small the place is.
author: Sheila K.

description:
Firenze By Night is one of my favorite North Beach spots.  The food is incredible there.  Everything looks and smells so delicious.  I've been 5 or 6 times, and it seems each time it gets even better.

I was lucky that the first time I went to Firenze By Night, I went with a vet.  My friend Kevin is a regular there - and he was able to steer me into some really good food choices.  We were able to split up a couple of main dishes as our appetizers.  The Pappardelli and Gnocchi are both award winning dishes - and that speaks volumes in the streets of Little Italy.  The servers are very accommodating, they split up the pastas and didn't charge for any extras.  My favorite dinner item there is the Prosciutto and Chicken Cannelloni.  It couldn't be more flavorful, each time I bring a new friend to Firenze, I suggest the Cannelloni and they praise this dish every time.

Firenze also has some unique dessert dishes.  Their sorbet is served in a frozen, hollowed out version of that fruit.  I've had both orange and peach.  The last time I was there, I tried a this cake like item filled with a fruit compote, and topped with white chocolate.  It really was the bomb!

If you ever are looking for a spot to eat before Beach Blanket Babylon, or a trip to the North Beach nightlife, I think you should give Firenze By Night a chance.
author: Joel V.

description:
Looking for authentic Italian and great service?  Then stop here!  We are in our mid twenties and were recommended by the locals to go here for great italian.  It certainly surpassed our expectations!  Amazing food, service, and ambiance.  We had the spinach salad, gnocchi, and ravioli.  The gnocchi and ravioli were handmade that day!  It was such a great dining experience that we went back 2 days later and the was just how we remembered it.

The staff here are so accommodating, friendly, and awesome.
author: Jaclyn O.

description:
Firenze by Night is a wonderful authentic Italian restaurant. My family and I love to visit North Beach frequently. This place was recommended to us almost 2 years ago and we have been hooked every since. The owner, Sergio, is often there to greet you as you enter. Very kind and always speaks to you in Italian. We just recently met his son Paolo, who helps his Dad run the place, a classy guy as well. I've never had to make a reservation at this place, they always seem to have room. 

The wait staff is very attentive and knowledgeable, and they seem to remember me (or at least pretend to), which is nice. They have a decent wine selection and a full bar. I've had the linguine futti di mare, pappardelle toscana, penne mare e monti and everything has been spot on. The tiramisu is excellent as well.

So if you want to enjoy good food with good people, then this is the place to come.
author: David H.

description: We spent a wonderful evening, very good food with very good service. The server was a real Italian. Only thing to improve is they should not serve canned or frozen vegetable. For a restaurant like this, the side should be fresh veggies.
author: Emmanuella A.

description:
The decor is perhaps the cheesiest in all of North Beach. A statue of David wrapped in an Italian flag, cityscape wall paper, oh it's just what you'd expect from a tourist trap...only it really isn't! 

The waiters speak Italian, no fake accents here. One of my dining buddies chatted at length with our waiter about the old country. Service was great, the host and waiters were friendly and jovial -appreciative of our business on a quiet Wednesday night. I had the gnocchi firenze an excellent dish. For dessert we skipped the tiramisu and hit the sauce instead, I had my first sambuca - loved the licorice taste. It's served with 3 coffee beans supposedly odd numbers are more lucky than even...

If you feel like spending an evening like a tourist, but with great authentic Italian food instead of tourist fodder give this place a shot.
author: Jeremy S.

description: Nice dinner spot! The gnocchi was delicious, and our waiter was really friendly and attentive. He also kept the bread coming, which is really all I care about.
author: Jose M.

description:
One word. Gnocchi. 

I went here with my honey and a friend after seeing Beach Blanket. My friend and I both got the gnocchi and by the end of the meal my honey wished that he had too. I had to defend my plate from his wandering fork. That gnocchi was melt-in-your-mouth delicious.

The service was great too and I like that the restaurant is split up into different areas. The only problem was that we were seated in an area with a very large, very boisterous group. We just couldn't compete and that put a damper on our dinner conversation.
author: Emily J.

description:
We were an hour late for our reservation, and 30 minutes of that was just looking for street parking.  What would you expect in North Beach?  As you walk in, you notice the loud full bar, the Italian dcor, and automatically smell the aromas from the kitchen. The host accommodated us even though we were late.  You can tell that this place has many regulars.  We were sitting next to ladies who were raving about the dishes they were eating and also the desserts that we didn't have room for at the end.  

Funny thing is that with the loud noises and the strong accent of our waiter, we could barely understand him telling us the specials.  And on top of that, he must have mentioned about 9-10 dishes that were not on the menu.  I ended up having the Veal Raviolis special, which was good.  I tasted my friend's order: the Gamberoni Pizzaiola.  The jumbo prawns in this dish were full of flavor.  For sure i'll be back to try more dishes at this authentic family Italian ristorante.
author: Bobby L.

description:
Someone that knows Italian food and grew up in the neighborhood recommended this place to me. He must get special meals because in our party of 6, four of us ate only half our meals.

-their famous gnocchi...was soppy wet and mushy. sure it was light but it's because it was watery. the tomato cream sauce was ok.
-the shrimp (served with tomato sauce) was over the hill
-the bruschetta was just ok. wish the tomatoes were fresher
-the verdura appetizer was good
-the calamari appetizer was ok (not as good as a container of Dinon calamari)

Service was friendly and fast. Decor is super cheesy, complete with a mini statue of David draped in an Italian flag.
author: Marina N.

description:
I lived in S.F for 5 yrs back in the early to mid 90's and opened a number of restaurants for numerous companies and I'd like to know.. What the hell has happened to the Bay Area restaurant scene that "Firenze by Night" has any business? 

I was on vacation from Denver with my son and boyfriend, we were staying at the St Francis and had done the prerequisite site seeing including dinner at Scoma's, Giants game, chili dogs etc. 

We were excited about getting dressed up and going out and having a true dining experience on our last night. Since I had been out of touch for a few years I asked the concierge to recommend a nice restaurant in North Beach he suggested Firenze, I said great and he made a reservation at 7:30. 

We dressed up and headed out, we arrived at our reserved time to find a waiting list and a ponytailed chain laden host who apparently was the owner tell us that he would be right with us. Finally after waiting 25 mins we were seated, the noise of the place was oppressive but this was the highlight.

The server finally greeted us 12 mins after we were seated then proceeded only to take my boyfriends drink order and leave ignoring my son and I. When he finally delivered the drink my boyfriend had to stop him to order our additional cocktails. We ordered a Roy Rodgers for our boy to be told" we don't have those" what ?? He said dew have Shirley Temples, which they proceeded to make with lime juice.

No problem, the food is bound to be good right? .... Most certainly wrong!! I ordered the Linguini Vongole, it was so salty as to be uneatable, it was like having a salt lick coated in linguini sprinkled with small balled up pieces of rubber cement disguised as clams. The gnocchi my boyfriend ordered was no better being so over cooked as to resemble mush pod scouted with somekind of red basil concoction passing as sauce, it would have been better presented as marshmallow soup. My sons Ravioli was the only dish worth the money, but even he at the age of 9 having to wear a tie and dress shoes was so annoyed by the rushed, harried and noisy atmosphere that he just wanted to leave, which we did, feeling duped into paying $120.00 do a meal thy we could have had Chef Boyardee prepare for $9.00.

So once again...., how does a concierge recommend a place like this without a kickback, but more importantly has the San Francisco dining scene sunk to the level that this waste or kitchen space can continue to insult diners with this kind of so called service and food?
author: Cheryl D.

description:
Earlier in the week, Matt read the cheapo San Francisco Daily newspaper and saw that this famous North Beach restaurant had a couple of promotional delicious deal meals. Matt says, "Once in a while, we deserve a great dinner. OK, let's go!"

Matt made reservation (which is highly recommended) for the both of us, because the restaurant is constantly busy, especially during dinnertime. Matt had one of the specials, which is 24 oz. Porterhouse Steak Combo Meal. The meal comprised of a thick 24 oz. Porterhouse cooked medium-rare, like Matt wanted on his steaks; grilled vegetables and baked potatoes. The succulent steak was very juicy and teamed well with buttery and tasty sides. For $30.00, the meal was quite possibly one of the better meals Matt had in a while.

Wife had the other special, which was the Firenze Gnocchi. The $15.00 potato-dumpling dish was covered in a creamy and rich Tomato sauce and a side of tasty Garlic-bread with her dish. As evidence proved, the garlic-bread was loaded with garlic, wanna kiss her? (wait in line, damnit). She also had a very mild glass of Italian red-wine, which paired well with her meal as well.

And yes, we can't conclude our meal without any dessert from this place, according to her suggestion. We wanted the Dessert special for the day, but the restaurant was out of that particular seasonal fruit in order to make the dessert. So we went right to the dessert menu and we split an order of the Cream Caramel Pudding and Ricotta Cheesecake. Both of the desserts were very appetizing, but extremely rich for Matt's sweet taste buds; so wife ending up eating 75% of both treats. Are you surprise?

Yes, we had fun and we'll definitely come back to one of North Beach's finest institute for another great dinner and hopefully get that dessert that we missed.
author: Matt G.

description:
The gnocchi is amazing here. I highly recommend you get it if it's your first time. It's served with a creamy tomato sauce that's halfway between marinara and alfredo. The servers were friendly and attentive.
The decor is a bit cheesy and dated for the cost of the restaurant however.
author: Ethan J.

description:
OHHHHH MYYYYYYYYYYY Gnocchi!!!!!

Our hotel recommended we try Firenze by Night for dinner, and I'm so glad we went with it!  Everything about this place deserves 5 stars.

The service was impeccable!!  They were able to accommodate any request we made within seconds!  Every time we ordered a new drink from the bar it was there in about 5 seconds.  I felt like we were being taken care of by the entire staff rather than just one waiter, but our waiter (Michele) was so awesome!

We asked Michele if we could start with the Gnocchi as an appetizer to share because we had read so many awesome reviews about it on yelp.  He said that was an excellent idea and it seemed like it was at our table in minutes!  It was in separate portions and it was the perfect amount!  

I've never had gnocchi that I've thought was good enough to order again, but I could eat this gnocchi every single day for the rest of my life!  It was so rich and creamy!  Definitely recommend this dish for absolutely anyone even if you aren't a fan of pasta!  And as we did, you could get it as an appetizer instead of your meal.  

Next I explained to Michele that the Ravioli della mamma looked so good to me but that I'm not really a fan of meat sauce.  He said he would have them make it for me however I would like!  Wow!!  So I asked for the Ravioli della mamma with a cream sauce.  It was the perfect dish.  I enjoyed every single bite.  

I believe he changed the two dishes my friends ordered according to their taste as well.  

We also had lots and lots of bread and wine which made the experience even more enjoyable.  I can say this is hands down the best Italian dinner I've ever had!
author: Amy B.

description:
This blows Ti Piacerá (nob hill) and other Italian restaurants (maybe not Emmy's Spaghetti Shack in the Mish) out of the park!

Went on a rainy Tuesday, hardly anyone there -- AMAZING decorum, small staff, all of whom seem authentic.  Great service, great food, perfectly portioned and reasonably priced, so you can enjoy a few items.  

Fagioli: one thumb up, one thumb sideways
Pappardelle: two thumbs way up
Gnocchi: two thumbs way up

Enjoy the awesome woody ambiance and indulge in authentic Italian food here, but gooooood luck parking.  I would strongly suggest taking the 30 if you are a ways away from downtown; if you're nearby, walk!
author: DJ Y.

description: The food was forgettable. Tagliatelle was not al dente enough. The food is not worth the money.
author: Devon S.

description:
Let me just start off by saying the waiters at this restaurant are awesome. Enthusiastic and very attentive! Haha, or at least, he was to my party! That was definitely a highlight of our dinner. The water refills were also very quick. It was quite amusing to see my glass refilled pretty much every 10 minutes. lol.
I got myself the angel hair pasta... Something you definitely can't wrong with at any Italian restaurant, right? I wasn't too impressed though, sadly. It was kind of... Tasteless to me. 
And their award winner.. gnocchi.. Two people in my party ordered it and felt it was somewhat tasteless as well. They had to ask for peppers to add flavor. I'm not saying this place is terrible, but my party and I didn't... fancy this place as much as we had hoped we would.  
The bread was good though!! (: ?
author: Susan Y.

description: Get the gnocchi! The rest of the meal was good but nothing to sing about. Service was alright, checked in couple times throughout the meal. Remember to get the gnocchi.
author: Eve C.

description:
This is a cozy place with really great food!

The staff is super friendly. 

You should try their gnocchi....SO GREAT!

Overall...cozy,tasty,friendly!  I would love to eat there again.
author: Julia G.

description:
We had such a delightful visit last night.  Paolo treated us to a nice table by the window, told us the story of how how his parents had opened the restaurant, and how they still make pasta fresh daily.  After appetizers, we had the gnocci, pappardelle, and the Petto di pollo alla toscana.  Our waiter made a great wine recommendation in our price range.  
They were very attentive and aware that we were heading over to Beach Blanket Babylon, and made sure we were on our way in plenty of time.
Can't wait to come back!
author: T C.

description: I really like this place. Reasonable prices, fantastic traditional North Beach food, perfect location near the heart of N.B. and the full SF Italian experience. All the pasta looked great. I had the gnocchi and my date had the tortellini (which I borrowed liberally when I saw she could not eat it all).  It doesn't get better than this in this price range.
author: Jeff M.

description: Cocktails great...food is amazing 3rd Italian dinner this weekend and by far it was the best:). I had the gnocchi and my boyfriend had the pollo all a Toscana....simply great Italian food!
author: Angela S.

description: Not the best Italian. The eggplant parmigiana was good but their other dishes were average. Long wait to get the food. Would pass next time on this.
author: Mihir M.

description:
I have to say I might be a little biased on this one. My waiter flirted endlessly with me and my friend, but isn't that one of the perks of Italian restaurants?

Classically delicious. The waiter was phenomenal (and pretty good looking, not like I'm judging the restaurant by that). And the food was spectacular. I had such trouble choosing between the risotto special and a pasta dish with rabbit marinara. I know, rabbit marinara - really? And yes, really. The waiter told me it was his favorite dish, and well, it might as well be mine. (see photo "parpadelle in rabbit sauce" for proof of deliciousness)

Everyone there is friendly. The wine is superb. The food is outstanding. There's no reason to walk a little off of Columbus to find this restaurant. 

Oh, and thanks Yelp for helping me find this place! My friend and I wanted some food but didn't know what was in the neighborhood. So I hopped on to Yelp and found this option. 325 people can't be wrong!

Note: The bathroom will leave you wanting. It's totally clean and spacious (by SF standards) but the fact that it's down this tiny hallway filled with additional chairs and only a "one person at a time toilet" makes me a little sad. Not sad enough though to avoid this place.
author: Lauren P.

description: The food was decent, basic Italian and would get 3-4 stats, but the management gets 1 star. When we arrived we were told there would be a 10-15 minute wait for a table so we sat at the bar and had a drink. A group of the same size came in after us and they were told it would be a 15-20 minute wait. After about 5 minutes they went over to the manager and started talking to him. When the first table opened up, they got it and we were left waiting even though we'd been there longer and neither of us had a reservation. Not professional, and I won't go back, especially since one can get similar quality food in plenty of other restaurants in the neighborhood.
author: Sunshine S.

description: This is one of my favorite Italian restaurant in North Beach  The service if excellent friendly helpful the decor is perfect and the food portions are large tasty and plated perfect clean.Everyone in are party always brings home leftovers  I highly recommend this restaurant
author: John W.

description:
After reading the good reviews on Yelp and then getting two recommendations from some local industry people, I decided I wanted to dine at Firenze.

First - let me say - make a reservation.  I didn't know I needed to do this and we went in on a Friday night for dinner for my birthday.  Luckily we got there a little early and they were able to squeeze us in (went to another local place for drinks - their bar was packed) a little later.  Which was fine, as we were in no rush and the owner(?) at the door was very sweet and accommodating.

So when we finally sat down, we were not disappointed.  We started with the carpaccio, which was really good.  My friend and boyfriend hadn't tried it before and both liked it.  We also liked the mustard it was served with - I haven't tried it this way before and it was nice.

For dinner I had the veal saltimbocca - delicious!  Also loved the creamy polenta served with it.  My friend had the gnocci that they are famous for (never tried gnocci before) and loved it.  His plate looked clean after dinner!

Dessert was the chocolate tartufo (I think that is the spelling!) - and it's ice creamy and really tasty!

The ambiance is nice - low lighting - a good place for a romantic evening and the service was really excellent.  Next time I am in town, I will be back.
author: Allegra G.

description:
I had the vegetarian lasagna, it was drowning in to much cheese.
The rest of my party's food was ok.

The deserts that I tasted (the cheesecake and chocolate-ice-cream-thing) looked store bought, like they just took them out from the freezer. 

The waiter was very unprofessional and seamed, to be honest, drunk. He forgot to ask everyone for their orders, stumbled in to not just one of us but two, forgot to give me my credit card back when brining the receipt etc. 

I would never go back.
author: Alexa K.

description:
Love the waiters here. So Italian. Great service. 
The gnocchi really is fabulous. And their house Pinot is great.
The egg soup is really good too.
author: Kristy M.

description:
Great Service, great atmosphere

If you like Gnocchi...this is the right place to eat..best in the city.

I just don't recommend the swordfish unless you like a rubbery, charcoaled flat fish.

Wine list met all expectations
author: James P.

description:
Ambiance: If I was ever going to get whacked, it would be here. 5-stars

Food: The gnocchi is really incredible and the Capone is probably my favorite entree in the entire city. I also really like the pappardelle and raviolis. I have never had it, but several friends have ordered the Tutto di Mare special (they have it a lot) and loved it.

Conclusion: There are no cheesy euro-trash faux-Italian vibes here; just great food and legit service and ambiance.
author: Christopher L.

description:
OMG! i love this place
Im usually not big on Italian food kinda person since, i "think" i can make it at home for a cheaper rate but i love the food here it tastes so fresh not out the can. the bread is delicious, the glasses of wine are good and affordable Chardonnay  is my thing. i don't know what they put in the TIRAMISU BUT IS INCREDIBLE it literally melts in your mouth. the service is AWESOME so helpful and nice.if you are looking a little bit more than wine the shots are three thumbs up. there is NO REASON why this wont be one of you best restaurant. try it out u wont regret it. truly a fan
author: Julia D.

description: Came here because we saw the review on "Check Please".  Met the owner up front. We got there right when they opened on a Sunday night.  Seated at a table for two.  Our waiter was Italian and spoke with my husband. There were a few younger good looking waiters as well.  Very professional service, down to scrapping off the breadcrumbs from the table.  We went with the tomato, buffalo mozzarella topped with pesto. It was ok, I was hoping for some nice tomatoes since they are in season, but they were beefsteak hot house version.   Ordered half a plate of the famous gnocchi, which was absolutely delicious, light, and with a wonderful red creamy sauce. For entrees we had saltimbocca and the special homemade ravioli, which we shared.  The ravioli so were outstanding, stuffed with a ground procuttio, in a brown mushroom gravy. So rich, so special.  We will be back.  Yes the decor is a little dated, but we sat under the mural of Florence, which we liked.   Good bar prices. The tiramisu was rich, full of flavor and one of the things we judge when eating Italian.  We would give it a 10!
author: Maureen S.

description: Simply the best Italian dining in North Beach.  It's a family owned business and one of those place where everyone knows your name. From the waiter, the host, the owner, the bartender, its just an amazing atmosphere, with great food and dining.
author: Nael M.

description:
My favorite gnocchi I've come across in the city.  I have a hard time ordering it elsewhere because it's always a disappointment compared to Firenze.  

I always bring out of town guests here and no one has ever been disappointed in their dish.  

Service is always spot on and they bring out a lot of fresh bread, which is always a huge plus in my book.

I love this place!
author: Beth J.

description:
I will be the first to admit that I bitched & moaned the entire time driving to this restaurant.  Eating Italian in North Beach is like eating Chinese in Chinatown - tourist trap hell.  I know there had to be a few gems in the area and I think this is one of them.  First of all, it's off the main strip - blending in with its surrounding Chinese markets.  The service was very friendly - although, the waiter was hesitant to advise me on dishes to order - they even covered up the naked statue man's yoo-hoo (my direct line of vision...I didn't mind, really) with an Italian flag.

For dinner I ordered the gnocchi - omg, it was delicious.  I don't eat Italian too often so I don't know what "bad gnocchi" is but the sauce and texture was amazing.  The carpaccio (my spelling is atrocious) was cut very thinly - plain, but good.  I had some of my friend's linguini & clams...really, really good.  Their vegetable soup was just "alright" but why in the world would you get vegetable soup *unless you're my best friend Yi, who also orderd the tomato salad...which consisted of slices of tomatoes...hrmm*.  

Now, I'm not usually a dessert person - but their tiramisu was insanely good as was their ricotta cheesecake.  I'd definitely go back....and as a friendly reminder, don't try to cross Market going up 3rd street from the freeway on a weekend.
author: Helen F.

description: The food was OKAY but the service was not there or SNARKY.  I wouldn't come back or recommend.  I go out because I like to served good food.  If the service part is wanting then I'd rather take my business elsewhere where it's appreciated.
author: Susan B.

description: I don't go to the city very often but when I do, I make sure I stop here at some point. The staff is beyond friendly, the food is excellent, what more could you want? My favorite... like most is the gnocchi (I asked for a trio and they brought it out with 3 different sauces).
author: Chad M.

description: BEST MEAL THAT WE HAD IN SF!   Great service and all 4 meals that the family had were delicious. Tortellini soup, the sole, the chicken prosciutto special, and shrimp risotto were great! Highly recommend!
author: Howdy J.

description:
So, my buddies and I went to this restaurant around 9 pm, hammered drunk and the bartender Chris, was so nice that he let us sit at the bar because he was convinced we needed food in our stomach. 

Food came out 15 minutes later, and it was fantastic. One buddy got shrimp scampi which was butterflied and delicious, I got a chicken marsala type dish with artichoke hearts on top which I loved and will probably order the next time I go. My third buddy was too drunk and left to go find another bar, but he ordered the rack of lamb which i also ate - this was unbelievably good as well.

Very impressed with the restaurant, and special thanks to Chris (bartender) for letting 3 belligerent guys eat there.
author: Steve S.

description:
We picked this restaurant on a whim based on the mostly-positive Yelp reviews, and I'm so glad we did!  Good food, good prices, good service, calm and relaxed atmosphere...what more can you ask for?

The food was delicious.  We had pork scallopini and some kind of spicy pasta dish.  They were both really well executed and were delicious.  Our server even had the kitchen split the entrees onto two separate plates so we wouldn't have to worry about dishing everything up ourselves.  It was a nice touch.

Another plus is that the wine list is very extensive, and wines by the glass are really reasonably priced.  Some places in San Francisco are way overpriced in terms of wines by the glass, but this place is not one of them.

The interior of the restaurant is a little kitschy, but that's fine.  It's a fun place that's good for either a date or a family dinner. 

This place is a winner, and if you're in the mood for some good Italian food that isn't overly fancy or foo-foo, you'll like it here.
author: Kyle M.

description:
This is not your typical North Beach Italian restaurant.  Locals actually go here.  It's well priced and worth the 1/2 hour looking for parking...

If I ever crave gnocchi, I will return here.

The server was very flattering, almost nervous. He kept insisting to fill my wine but I told him I was driving, he kissed my hand and said 'My beautiful lady should never drive. '   Cute, if you like that kind of attention ;)
My date clearly wasn't too impressed but he didn't make the cut for date # 2 anyway so I can yelp and chuckle about it. 

BTW: They do have amazing lemincello (pardon the spelling)
author: Athena S.

description:
Slightly off the main strip of Italian food heaven. 
Nice decor. 
Real Italian servers that speak to you in Italian. (love it)

Gnocchi is suppose to be a highlight but thought they were a tad too mushy. The tomatoe cream sauce was great through.Tortellini had good flavor but the toppings such as the ham/peas was a tad too sparse.
author: E. Y. G.

description: Let me make it simple.  The food is amazing.  The atmosphere is busy and fun.  I would have licked the floor if my veal with mushrooms had fallen on the ground and I don't typically like that dish.  The polenta and veggies were my sides and they were ridiculously tasty.  The polenta was cheesy and the veggies were infused with garlic.  My friend ordered the seafood pasta which was also tasty but a bit less incredible then my dish.  The staff was a pleasure.  The place was a mad house.  The bread is weak so if you are going for bread don't expect to be impressed.  This place was the highlight of our night even with Beach Blanket Babylon.  Expect to wait even with reservations.
author: Jay S.

description: Absolutely one of the most incredible finds in a restaurant, family feel and amazing gnocchi!! Hidden gem highly recommend Firenze by night
author: Kevin P.

description: Fun place with a loud, neighborhood, friendly atmosphere.  Our host was personable and pleasant, and so waiting for a table was OK.  The food was decent...above average.  Our waiter was another story.  He seemed angry, and impatient with our questions, especially about the night's specials.  His English was not easy to understand, it was like he was trying to fake an Italian accent (or he was an Italian under the influence of speech altering substance), and we quickly learned NOT to ask any more questions, or say, "What did you say?"  So we ended up with good, but common dishes, rather than trying something new.  The desert menu looked great, and Yelpers get a free one with dinner, but we were afraid to bother him further, so didn't have any.  It was really kind of funny.  Two such ballsy broads were intimidated out of a fine and FREE desert by their surly waiter!.  At first, we thought maybe we offended him for some reason, but he was a dick to everyone we heard him interact with.
author: Mary J.

description:
Okay, I do have to preface this by saying that the service here? Is AMAZING. I didn't even sit down to eat and I felt like they were the nicest, friendliest, sweetest staff ever.

I went in last night to pick up some food to go. It was my first time stopping by AND it was the last night of fleet week, so things were CRAZY HECTIC. Even with the hectic atmosphere, though, all the staff took special time out of their tasks to help me out (the bartender even got out from behind the bar to help me get my order down!) 

The staff was joking around with the customers like they were best friends as they left, giving the restaurant a really homey, friendly, inviting atmosphere--almost like you were at a big potluck with a bunch of your friends. The food arrived quickly and was very hot, and even though I was a to go order, they gave me bread (: 

The reason why they get 3 stars, though, is because the food is not SUPER STELLAR. I should preface this with the statement that I just lived in Rome for half a year, so perhaps my idea of 'good' isn't fair for America. It's good, don't get me wrong, but I paid 33 bucks (not including tip) for tortellini and the ravioli, and they were both normal tasting. My last meal in Rome was ravioli, and I remember the pasta being so light and fresh that it felt like I was eating something I'd never tasted before in my life. That's the difference well-made homemade pasta makes.

I will DEFINITELY be going back since I live so closeby, but unfortunately the food wasn't as top-notch as I'd hoped.
author: Tracey Z.

description:
This is a great little Italian restaurant.  Actually, my waiter was so Italian he could barely understand anything I said!  I read all the great reviews and was excited to try this place, it didn't disappoint for the most part.  They were very accommodating and easily took our reservation for 6 on Saturday morning for that same night.  

Before I critique the following dish, I should say that I love gnocchi and Firenze did a pretty good job, but it just didn't compare to the gnocchi at my favorite restaurant.  Don't get me wrong, it was good and you will enjoy it, but I guess I just like it the way I like it!  That is the only reason for 4 stars instead of 5... all the hype surrounding the gnocchi just didn't live up to my expectations.
