I tried snails for the first time at Firenze by Night,  Lumache alla Rustica (snails with garlic, shallots, butter and white wine), and was pleasantly surprised by how much I enjoyed it.   My bf seemed satisfied with his Osso Buco as well.  Overall, a great experience and I would definitely go back if I lived in San Francisco.
author: Morgan D.

description: It was our first time to North Beach and we planned to go to Tony's on Union and Stockton. It was a Monday night and Tony's was closed, so we walked further up Stockton and stumbled upon Firenze by Night. It was what I would call genuine Italian. The pasta was homemade and the server even had an Italian accent. The bread and oil was a delicious starter (on the house) and I thoroughly enjoyed the eggplant parm. I must warn you, it is not obvious that the eggplant entree is what you would consider "typical eggplant parm." My husband has gnocchi and ate every bite (and it was a big plate)! We'll definitely be back next time we are in North Beach.
author: Kelsey K.

description:
Wonderfully friendly service. Chris, the bartender, is charming, talkative, and right on top of things! Our waiter Migel (I believe was his name!) was delightful with his genuine Italian accent and knew the menu well.

We started with the Gnocchi Firenze in a light tomato cream sauce, which is melt-in-your-mouth delicious.  My date had the Pappardelle Toscana, large noodles in rabbit sauce ... delicious, a light sauce with a lot of flavor. I had Saltimbocca Alla Romana, veal and Prosciutto with Fontina cheese with a very light sauce. It was simply incredible! The wine list was extensive, listing Italian wines by their regions.

The atmosphere was charming and despite the white table clothes and well-dressed waiters, its far from pretentious. It's friendly, you feel like you have gone into someone's Italian home. You could come in your jeans or dressed to the nines and feel right at home. 

I highly recommend Firenze by Night!
author: Laura T.

description: I took my family from out of town here and we all had a really good time. We got the bruschetta, and everyone had a different pasta. I liked the pesto fettucini, really creamy and tasty sauce with homemade pasta. The service was great, our server was funny and about as Italian as you can get. Prices were pretty reasonable considering the competition in the neighborhood. We will be coming back.
author: John T.

description:
We were in the mood for some authentic Italian and I found great Yelp reviews for Firenze. I was completely sold on the description of the gnocchi being "little pillows of heaven on your tongue."

The service was good, we didn't have to wait for a table on a Friday night. We ordered escargot for an app and gnocchi and the other award winning dish (I believe it was rabbit). As you can see, it wasn't memorable but it wasn't horrible, it was just eh. Oh and the gnocchi didn't feel or resemble heaven in my mouth or on the plate.

So I can't say I'd return only because there are so many other great Italian places to try, however I don't have anything bad to say about this place either.

I wouldn't go out of your way to come here but if you're in the area and need a place to eat, give it a try.
author: Becca L.

description:
Bravo Firenze by Night!! 

This spot is a treasure in North Beach. The moment you walk in you feel like you re right at home; like a slipping on a favorite sweater or comfortable pair of shoes. Sergio at the door is wonderfully accommodating and welcoming. Chris at the bar is both hilarious and helpful (and pours a great cocktail). The food is authentic and delicious; priced right (especially for the city) and served in generous portions. The waiters are wonderful managing to be both playful and accommodating at the same time. 

We recently visited Firenze with a large group and Sergio and the gang could not have been more gracious. Reservations are definitely recommended (leave a message - they will get back to you), and parking can be found around the corner on Vallejo Street at the North Beach Garage (across from the S.F. Police substation). 

If you want an authentic Italian dinner in a warm, inviting environment, Firenze if the place! 

Bravo!!!!
author: Dave V.

description: I wish i could give six stars its realy that good so good that i actualy drive 100 miles from stockton to sfo just for the tuti marie in case you dont know thats linguine pasta with a mix of seafood realy great place.
author: kings s.

description: My husband and I went here and LOVED it! Make sure to make a reservation because it was packed! The gnocchi was to die for and they had a great wine selection! The service was the best too! It felt like we were actually in Italy. This place is worth trying...I'm sure you will go back again and again!
author: Brittany E.

description: I am very suprised by the 4 star-average.  The food was very average at best...my friend had the veal porcini which was quite bad. I had a pasta dish that was ok but nothing outstanding, we left without desert because we did not want to waste any more money.
author: caro S.

description: Amazing!!  All of our food was great and the service was fantastic. I recommend Mamma's Ravioli.
author: Natalie C.

description: LOVE this restaurant and everything about our experience there! It could have been our romantic Italian waiter, the delicious wine that was sent to our table, or the traditional Italian setting of this phenomenal little sanction.  We all 3 were in heaven with our food. 2 of ordered gnocchi and 1 of us ravioli. I am Italian and grew up on my Nana's homemade gnocchi, so when I say I am picky with the dish, that is an understatement. I don't order gnocchi when I go out because I know I have such a high expectation. BUT it is my  M.O. to always ask the waiter what they suggest, as they should know the best thing on the menu.  I did, and he said the gnocchi, so I went with it, and I am SO GLAD I DID.  This will now officially be my new place for gnocchi for certain.  It was a lovely evening of friendship, laughter, love, and indeed delicious food. The service is out of this world, and it truly was as good as it gets for me!
author: Gina R.

description: Great service with a professional waiter complete with authentic Italian accent. The heated spinach salad was awesome as was the pasta with chicken and shrimp. Great atmosphere, I highly recommend this restaurant.
author: Mike W.

description:
I'm not going to pretend that I'm an expert at Italian food, so here goes my review. 

This place is pretty freaking authentic. The atmosphere, attitude, and food is all top notch. 

We started the night off with an eccentric but awesome bartender, a couple of bottles of peroni, and some red wine - all fantastic. The host did a great job accommodating our 8 person party in the middle of a packed house, and our server was real fun and gave us awesome recommendations. 

Favorites: Cannelloni biagio and Ravioli della mamma. The stuffed cannelloni in light crepe shell just melts in your mouth, not too cheesy, not too oily. Perfect cleanup with soft french bread rolls (and awesome authentic variety of olive oils). The Ravioli (stuffed with spinach and cheese served in meat sauce) is probably the best Ravioli I've ever had. You can definitely tell that the chef hand made the shells and the way it melts in your mouth tells you the ingredients are slow cooked with TLC. Best part? We didn't feel like passing out or throwing up from heavy sauces afterwards - good sign.

Bad parts? I think most of this was personal preference, but I didn't expect the calamari to be served in a ceviche-style - raw and lightly sauced with a squeeze of lime served cold - I'm definitely used to the fried and battered kind.

Overall one of the best Italian food experiences I've ever had. Definitely come here and enjoy some of the best authentic cuisine and a great atmosphere.
author: Jon H.

description:
Like many of the low ratings I've read about this restaurant, this place definitely need to improve on service.  It took more than 30 minutes to get my first glass of water, in a not so busy night.  The waiter didn't come to get our order until an hour later.  The food took more than 45 minutes from the time we ordered.  

The food is outrageously priced for the portion they give.  The taste and texture is nothing to brag about.  I would definitely not recommend this place to anyone.  I can get better tasting food and price from near by restaurants.  I would pick Stinking Rose over this place any time.
author: Gary Z.

description:
Everything from the chef, Sergio - to the sexy Italian waiter to the pillows of heaven they call gnocchi - were perfect. 

Firenze is a charming, moderately priced restaurant in the heart of North Beach.

We began the night with a warm greeting by Sergio who greeted with a kiss on my hand and said his goodbyes with a kiss on the cheek. It doesn't feel any more like Italy then that! 

Somebody on my table ordered the veal, somebody else the lasagna and another the eggplant parmigiana - all was delish but the gnocchi stole the show. four forks went at it on my plate. 

We ended the meal with some homemade lemonciello. perfect shot to take us into the night. thanks Firenze for a beautiful dinner.
author: johanna a.

description:
I actually really enjoyed the food AND I had extremely high expectations.  To me, that says a lot.  Probably the most memorable part of my night was that the atmosphere truly reminded me of Florence.  I have to be honest that my very positive association with Florence may have impacted my opinion of this restaurant. :)  Regardless, the place is quaint and adorable with a romantic candle lit feel.

My only negative comment is that the wait staff was straight out rude.  Although one could say this adds to some Florence dining experiences as well....
author: Cody S.

description:
We had reservations (party of five) for 7p but weren't seated until 7:30p. That being said, it was a busy Friday at a popular restaurant in North Beach, so we made sure we weren't in a hurry.  We enjoyed cocktails at the bar until our table was ready.

Once we were "welcomed" by our clearly busy waiter, the experience was great.  He was quite the character fitting in with the environment (thick Italian accent and attentive if not overly friendly demeanor). He was so busy though, the ownership may consider adding a waiter or two on busy evenings so they can spend a bit more time with us.  The waiter's wine recommendation was perfect.  Food arrived quickly and everyone enjoyed their dishes.

It is quite loud there, so no intimate romantic rendevous unless you happen to be there on a rare quiet night.
author: Ken M.

description:
Ok, it must be tourists writing these 5 star reviews. This place almost made me sick. The caprese salad was no different from me buying the cheese and tomatoes from the safeway and making my own. They didn't bother to refill my water (and there were 6 waiters and 2-3 busboys in a not so busy atmosphere) for 25 minutes.  The first dish I ordered, the "special" pasta with shrimp, clams, fish of the day, etc was disgusting. I could taste that the fish had been frozen for a few months. I sent that back and tried the famous gnocci. Ok, it was obviously microwaved as the center was hot but the surroundings were not. Also the sauce tasted exactly like Ragu with some powdered parmasean on top.

BTW, I've had better gnocci in Edmond, Oklahoma. Yes people, OKLAHOMA. What is wrong with you that you think this gnocci is "amazing"? 

I would have been better off ordering pasta from a pizza hole in the wall. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY!  The Pelligrini place on Filbert and Columbus across from Da Flora (assuming you can't get into Da Flora) is much better. Firenze had cheesy waiters that don't do much but ask if you want more wine and take your order. I'm very picky on taste, smell, and service... And I'm extremely confused why this horrible place ever got more than 2 stars.
author: Laura D.

description: I was in town for business.  I asked one of the locals about a good Italian place and they recommended this place.  I ate at the bar and ordered the special, dover sole.  I also order soup which was pretty good.  It took almost 50 mins to get served my food.  It was OK; however, the vegetables and potato were cold--barely room temperature.  I notified the bartender.  He actually had me place the vegetables on a plate so they can warm them up.  Another 15 mins went by.  I ate my fish without any sides.  The bartender didn't even try to make this right--terrible customer service.  I would not recommend this place.
author: Ray J.

description:
Super friendly staff! Very welcoming. If you go around 8ish at night, there is literally no wait. It's sorta hidden on the street, which may be why. 

Great food. I've had the spicy Penne and the Tortellinis--both REALLY good! 

Love this place. New to North Beach and will be taking my parents every time they come to visit!
author: Sarah E.

description:
We came in on a Tuesday night and had no wait for a table - awesome!  

The menu was very reasonably priced, portions were large, and the food was incredibly delicious - what more can you ask for?  Service was also prompt - we had food on our table less than 10 minutes after we ordered. 

The fettucini with pesto was great, and obviously so was the gnocchi.  

Would definitely go again!
author: Laura C.

description:
Best gnocchi I've ever had.  Light and pillowy.
Cannelloni had good flavor, was excellent.
They refilled our bread basket, great service.
Modestly priced, much better than Olive Garden at a similar price.
author: Light Bulb J.

description: I wanted to try more Italian places in North Beach and my friend and I stumbled upon this one. We got their pork dish (it was a bit dry) and the clam linguine (amazing). The pasta was perfect and the sauce was delicate and tasty. The service was really great too.
author: Tif L.

description: It's quite funny how there is ONE bad review...I experienced nothing bad, horrible, nasty, un Godly. Everything from the bread and wine to the pasta was fab. Ok, one annoying thing...The waiter did have a bit of ADD...didn't make eye contact and wasn't listening...But that's nothing to bitch about...Try it out, you won't be dissapointed.
author: Jarrod R.

description:
I usually shy away from Italian restaurants, especially those in the North Beach - you can imagine why, "Why should I pay $25 for a plate of pasta?!" I think that really means is that I haven't had good quality Italian food (except Terzo - i love that place!) and I know that it exists out there. 

A friend of mine recommended Firenze By Night  - it was fine but I expected more. 

Basically, I could have made my dish at home just as good if not better (Linguine Di Mare)

The bottles of wine are moderately priced. We found a good bottle of red (specifics escape me now) for around $35.

The service was attentive and attractive (wink wink).

I probably won't be back because the food did not blow me away but others may enjoy. 

(Steer clear of the calamari appie. It's drenched in oil.)
author: Kiristen R.

description:
Greeted with a smile and seated shortly. We had a reservation but arrived 10 mins early. Our server was Fabio and excellent. He was confident and no bullshit, I like that. He took our drink order, I like a good sidecar which is not easy to get, Fabio delivered perfectly. We shared the Brushetta, simple and nice, same with the salads and soup. I had the tortallini with prosciutto and peas, the pasta was very fresh. My daughter had the gnocchi it was very nice. Her exact words, "the best iv'e had in America, since Rome". My son and husband had chicken cannelloni also very tasty. 
I would go back and after having travelled to Rome felt they did the food proud.
Cheers
author: Patricia L.

description:
Tweaker:  A person who does Crystal Meth. They talk very fast all the time. You're lucky to get a word in with a serious tweaker. They do obsessive projects, have the concentration of a fruitfly and are usually short tempered when recognized as a meth head.

Chris the bartender=tweaker.

Me:  (while at the bar, I look at waiter next to me, then, I look at CTB=T)  What's his deal?
Waiter:  I think he forgot his Prozac.

10 minutes later:

Me: (while still at the bar, I look at waiter next to me again, then, I look at CTB=T scurrying around like a rat in an alley full of cats)  I think the problem is more than just Prozac?
Waiter:  (shrugs)
Me:  I think the Prozac mixed with an 8 ball of crank is more like it.
CTB=T:  (while being 10 steps away from me) I heard that.
Me:  Wow, your drug combo gives you superhuman hearing!!
CTB=T:  (walks away like a wounded dog).

10 minutes later:
My friend:  Excuse me, can we get another drink? (To CTB=T)
CTB=T:  (doesn't look at my friend, sticks a "wait a second" finger in the air)
Us:  Never get another drink.

LOL, TWEAKER!!!

Why 4 stars after such a long, negative intro?  Well, the food is very good.  Each of us had something different, and, each dish was very good.  I had a Caesar and the Saltimbocca, both very good.  B&C had a mixed green and the seafood linguini with prawns and calamari, both very good. Friends had the mixed green and the swordfish and the linguini with clams.  Absolutely satiated afterwards.

Chris, get help before you get fired, ya cranker.

I'll still come back, and soon.  Gotta try the gnocchi!

Ya feel me?
author: Johnny L.

description:
I have now been to Firenze two times and both times it was excellent. I have had the gnocchi, the veal and the ravioli. The food is excellent. And this is a great place to enjoy a nice dinner with one other person or a whole group. 

We had a show to be at within an hour of getting our table and they got us our food and drinks so quickly that we didn't even feel rushed while eating. We had to wait for 45 minutes or so for the table and during that time we got a couple drinks on the house, which is always nice, and awesome service from the hostess, bartender and our waiter. I definitely felt taken care of. 

I generally hate North Beach. It's full of frat boys, tourists, and large people who walk way too slow and take up the whole sidewalk. When I want Italian food I want the real deal. I don't want a touristy "we're Italian but the Macaroni Grill Italian" meal. Firenze is authentic in every way and delivers on everything I could want. 

It's also not that expensive which is the great part. Sure, you could easily run up a large bill, but you wouldn't have to scrimp to get out of there for under $50. I really enjoy this place and look forward to coming back here in the future.
author: Hanley B.

description:
Every single major milestone party my family has ever celebrated has been at Firenze by Night. 

5th grade North Beach Sandcastle contest - oh yeah, we were here after we won first place! 

My parent's 20th wedding anniversary - my entire family, extended family, and parents good friends ... I'm pretty sure there were at least 50 people in our group - not a problem! 

My Dad's 60th birthday ... My Mom's 50th birthday ... and my favorite: My Grandma's Burn the Mortgage party (she finally paid off her mortgage and officially owns her SF home!) 

In addition to being great with large groups and private parties, Firenze is a wonderful place to take a romantic date. Paolo and Sergio know how send a couple your way/on the house to impress your date. 

I've been eating at Firenze for the last 20 years and I plan on eating there for the next 20. An all-around wonderful experience every time.


And just in case you've never been (and love the beverages like I do) the bartender is AMAZING! Delicious drinks!!
author: Jennifer L.

description:
All about it! This place has amazing food and a fun atmosphere.  The bartender Chris was the man too.

I'll be back.
author: Andrew B.

description:
We went here for dinner after a day at the museum.  One of my friends was a vegetarian and she loved that she had multiple options on the menu, which is rare for most of the restaurants we go to.  The gnocchi was really good,probably one of the best I've had for the price of $15.  The risotto was really good too.

I would say the food is 1-2 notches above average, however, the service was just ok.  Our waiter wasn't friendly but he wasn't unfriendly either.  He was really fast so we felt rushed.  We had cocktails, appetizers and dinner all under 1 hour.  He pretty much took our order,dropped off the food and never came back.  

Overall, I would say this is a great place for take out...you get to enjoy really good food and not feel rushed to leave the restaurant.

Price is about $30 per person.
author: Joyce L.

description:
THE GOD FATHER SHOULD TAKE OUT THE OWNERS OF THIS HORRIBLE PLACE. YOU ARE WORSE FOR ITALIAN PEOPLE THAN JERSEY SHORE!

Yelp failed us on this one. Even with a discount voucher from Bloomspot, dinner at this place (we've walked passed it hundreds of times and will resume RUNNING PAST IT in the future after the fiasco of a dinner they served us last night !) couldn't muster up enough of a real meal with any flavor whatsoever for the two of us last night. 

We knew we were in trouble when the $12 stuffed mushrooms caps arrived  - 5 tiny (and I mean tiny mushrooms - the kind you'd cut up for a salad) not actually stuffed but with an even smaller lump of tasteless meat (I think ground pork?) balled up on top - in a thick and tastless sauce. In most real restaurants 3-4 of these would count as a single properly prepared and stuffed mushroom cap ! Is it possible that they don't use garlic, oregano, grated parma cheese or pancetta? How else could these little turds on a plate taste sooooo bland and icky !? Yuck. 

As we tried to figure out what these were I was left to face a wall with spackle all over cracks and uneven plaster that appears to have been a half-assed repair - yet it remains unpainted and ignored - so as to "blend in" to this tacky, and truely awful clip joint. The unpainted and plastered wall, right where the waiter kept placing a serving dish of grated cheese (apparently used to mask the poor quailty and lack of flavor of the food they will serve you here) was sign number two we were in DEEP Trouble. The entrees sealed the deal - making this the  CRAPPIEST MEAL we've eatten in a Long Time. Quite the award.

Entrees included a "special" (anything but) of what we were told would be "assorted seafood on linguini ($18)" and then there was my "veal and mushrooms" ($21). The mussels on the seafood pasta dish (all 6 of them) were LONG PAST THIER SAD "PRIME" and NOT APPROPRIATE TO SERVE (read that as gummy / smelly / chalky and tastless except for the off flavor and texture they imparted to the whole dish) sitting atop the pasta and except for a few itty bitty bites of unknow seafood floating in the off-tasting, thin and TASTELESS red sauce - the rest of the shellfish (3 clams) were also off and spoiled tasting. My sad looking veal dish consisted of three of the thinnest portions of meat (they claim it was veal - it was hard to tell given the wierd texture due to pounding it so thin these lacked any firmness and flavor, absent mushrooms (there were stems only !?) and a smear of hard crusted over polenta - lacking any flavor whatsoever.
Once again - no seasoning whatsoever ?! HAVE YOU GUYS HEARD OF GARLIC, OREGANO, SALT ? 

The good news - we didn't have to head to the ER this AM and except for the idiotic tourists that seem to fill this place - it is a SAD EXCUSE for italian food. SAVE YOUR MONEY, AVOID FOOD POISONING and RUN, DO NOT WALK - AS FAR AWAY from this dreadful place as you can.
author: alan c.

description:
Love love love this restaurant!! My family and I have been coming here for 15 years and have never had a bad experience!! We feel right at home! The waiters are outstanding, the bartender is wonderful and the chef is a genius! If I could give it 8 stars, I would. I'm thrilled to read that so many people love this restaurant, but I also think that other people who post ignorant opinions, merit no consideration and hold no credibility whatsoever. 

Case-in-point, see johnny I: 
jI: Thank you for proving my point. You serve only as a bad example. Your blatant attempts at humor are both tasteless and offensive. Your pleas for attention (see your 130+ Yelp Reviews) are nothing more than fluff, and, ya feel me, kinda douchey (read: unimaginative, uninteresting, stale, a manifestation of self-promotion). A bruised ego (probable situation: the bartender charming your lady friend better than you ever could) doesn't justify insulting someone's character - that's just low class (example: your Down Syndrome comment, 11/09 and your making fun of the homeless, 03/09 & 07/09). Ya feel me? I long for the day when people stop breeding "the southern ends of northbound horses". Ya feel me? 
And one more thing, Pac-Man Jones (read: idiot) might be a better profile pic for you instead of the great Hall-of-Famer Ronnie Lott.
author: Gina T.

description: Yummy dinner, great service, friendly staff and a complimentary limoncello...what more could you ask for?
author: Cathleen R.

description:
I went to Firenze with family. Overall the experience was pretty disappointing. Not that it's a bad place, but you can easily find a better Italian restaurant for an equivalent price in the city.
My apetizer was an unattractive salad ans was overly loaded with garlic. The entree was big, so if you re hungry, It's a good place to go
author: Alex M.

description: Do not waste your good money here. Mediocre food, mediocre service and overly priced. There are so many good restaurants in SF, go elsewhere. We will never go back.
author: Theresa S.

description: Fantastic! We ordered 3 vegetarian dishes and all were stellar. The gnocchi was fantastic. One meat eater (ordered ravioli de la mamma) said it was the highlight of his trip to SF. Four sparkling clean plates at the end of the meal. :) Also - Flavio's a true Italian server who knows the meaning of hospitality!
author: Robert P.

description: Absolutely the best Italian food in San Francisco!  It's always a pleasure coming into this restaurant because of the tremendous customer service, incredible food and perfect atmosphere.  I recommend this place to anyone in the North Beach area that wants the best!
author: Ryan B.

description:
I would give this place a 0 if it was an option.  Tony's pizza nearby was too long of a wait so I wandered over to Firenze based on the good yelp reviews.  That was a really bad mistake.  Despite many good yelp reviews, I had a extremely bad experience.  The dining experience was so bad that I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.   

Let's start the review on food.  We started with mushroom with italian meatball and clams and mussel in marinara sauce.  The mushroom with italian meatball was excellent and probably one of the better ones I have had.  The clams and mussels came with great reviews but was very disappointing.  The flavor was bland and the mussels were not fresh.  Moving on to the main entrees, we ordered the pasta with rabbit sauce and gnocchi with tomato cream sauce.  Both the rabbit sauce and the tomato cream sauce were good.  However, the pasta and gnocchi were overcooked and had no texture.  Good Italian restaurant usually serves pasta al dente and it was close to mush.  Minus 2 stars

The dining experience is also made up by the service experience.  As a rule of thumb, good service is judged by the waiter's attention to need.  If the patron asks for something, please do not make them ask multiple times.  One of the gals in the party asked for balsamic vinegar to go along with olive oil for dipping.  This may not be the Italian way of life but please don't make weird faces and have her ask again and again.  When the waiter came by to fill out the water, a baby cockroach was poured out from the water jar.  F=ING DISGUSTING!!!  I pointed out to the waiter and he said oh a bug must feel off from the tree.  Last time I checked this was indoors seating and there were no tree.  I was disappointed to how the waiter handled the situation.  There was NO apology and the issue was not addressed.   Life goes on.  When the main entree was served, one of the dish was missing.  When we asked about the salad, the waiter said there is no more salad.  Really?  Sounds like the waiter forgot to put int the order.  No apologies and gave a bad cover up for his mistake.  As soon as we finished the food, I wanted to leave.  Had to ask the check on several occasions and the waiter finally came after 20 minutes.  Minus 3 stars.

My overall experience was so bad that I would not come back again.  A waiter in high school would have been better compared to the one I had.
author: Daniel C.

description: Amo questo ristorante!... I have eaten here several times over the past few months... as I become more of a regular it keeps getting better!  Traditional family owned and operated...  takes me back to Toscana!
author: Stan B.

description:
We are definitely going back.  

We went for date night on a Friday, per the recommendation of a friend, and it a was successful, delicious meal. 

From the refreshing calamari appetizer, to the great rabbit pappardelle (award winning dish!), to the chicken/artichoke and petrale sole entrees, it was all tasty and well cooked.  The wine was ok, but the food was really the star.  

The timing of the food was great.  We made requests about splitting the rabbit pappardelle pasta before getting our entrees, and the fresh italian waiter happily obliged.  He gave us good time in between courses, and the they gave us what we needed on a very busy night. 

Even the vegetables and polenta with the entrees were well done.  

We'll see you soon again, Firenze.
author: Andrew D.

description:
An unexpected delight in North Beach. In a land where you can go very wrong given the glutton of Italian restaurants and short supply of actual good food, Firenze delivers. They also benefit from the seeming seclusion off the main strip on Columbus - crowds were minimal and you can easily hold a conversation.

What to get - any of their pastas. We had the Papardelle Toscana (an award winner) and the Penne Zenzero. Both delectable! I wasn't even very hungry and ended up killing the dish.  

What not to get - the bread. Not much thought is given to the free starter and it shows.

The service was delightful (in the vein of charming and slightly seductive Italian stereotype) and the price is definitely worth it. For a casual mid week night out, give Firenze a shot.
author: Adeola O.

description: It's a good date restaurant (at least that was why I was there).  The service was attentive but not intrusive. Good wine selection. Decent food, but there are a number of better spots in the area.
author: Tootie T.

description: We ate there tonight and enjoyed the food and service.  Had only one disappointment and that was the corkage fee - a total rip off.  There were over 20 in our group and we spent alot of money eating and drinking but were charged a shocking $40 to open a large bottle of wine we brought that they didn't even pour for us and the glasses were already on the table and ready to use.  I've never heard of such a thing even in a  5 star place.  It was clearly unreasonable.  When we saw the check I went to the bartender who was rude and unwilling to negotiate.  In fact he acted like I had no clue and I've been eating out a lot longer then he has been mixing drinks.  Greed like that makes me lose my appetite.  Will not go back there or recommend.  Very sorry to have to write this.
author: Amy F.

description:
Amazing!! Customer service was excellent, Thank you Palo! All the food was amazing. I had the gnocchi, friends had pasta with prawns, pasta with sun dried tomato's, and angel hair with a wonderful tomato marinara. 
Great date atmosphere, great girls night out location.
author: Nichole F.

description:
I've been here a couple times on dates and in casual groups, and this is my go-to Italian place in north beach. Definitely recommend a reservation on weekends.

Smallish restaurant, old-timey decorations, and your waiter is an old man speaking Italian to you. The food is absolutely delicious, not overly fancy, and not super expensive, so you feel at ease here.

The service was perfect in that you barely noticed it - orders came promptly, water and bread never empty, all timed to accommodate but never rush you.
author: Kevin M.

description:
I never get excited about Italian food. Unless it's amazing, I try not to go for it. 

With that said, this place was good, but not a place I would put on my rotating list of Italian dinners.

Service was good considering that one waiter was handling about 10 LARGE tables/groups. Jees...hire another fucking waiter for goodness sake...this poor guy was running around like a madman. He was still very friendly and pleasant in spite of his hectic pace.

Gnocci does live up to the hype, but then again, how good can Gnocchi be? It is very soft and pretty light, and the sauce is nice. If that makes it the best Gnocchi in SF, then so be it. Other dishes were very good too.

Overall, this is a nice place to have dinner with a big group and share a few dishes.
author: Adam D.

description:
People that live in North Beach know that this place is one of the best Italian restaurant in the neighborhood.  This place is better than Bocce and less expensive too.  Inexpensive and the food is frigging awesome.
Service is top notch.
author: Jason E.

description: Gnocchi was amazing but the seafood pasta was OK.  I would recommend this place and visit again.
author: Karin E.

description: Really liked the place. The waiter was very helpful in suggesting the rabbit sauce pasta (which was phenomenal) and paired a great local wine with it. Te coffee and sorbet was great too, and there was a wonderful atmosphere. Highly recommended.
author: Hugo B.

description: Food is good I guess but I left the place hungry.  Portions were small in my opinion.  You have to order each item separately such as salad, soup and it gets very expensive.  Service was a bit abrupt.  It took me only five minutes to eat the entre, it felt incomplete.
author: Serena V.

description: I'm not entirely sure why this restaurant is rated so highly. Perhaps we ordered the wrong things, but it seemed like another run-of-the-mill, over-embellished North Beach "Italian" restaurant. My date had the special of the night, a seafood pasta and I had the rabbit ragu pasta. Neither dish stood out. Also, there was no vinegar on the table to add to the olive oil for the bread. Overall, just average.
author: Elena M.

description: We were greeted by Sergio, the owner, the minute we walked through the door.  The atmosphere was cozy and they were doing a brisk business even on a Thursday night!  The wait staff were attentive, knowledgeable, and friendly.  The food we ordered, including their handmade gnocchi, was delicious!  The prices for everything were very reasonable and the portion sizes were just right!
author: Lynnette M.

description: I'm a huge Italian food lover and they have the absolute best chicken Parmesan in the entire world I could not recommend this place more!!!!!
author: Tom L.

description: Good place. Terrible house Chianti.  The parpadelli with rabbit sauce was exceptional!  This is a good place to go at least once; to have the rabbit sauce.
author: Brian F.

description:
Eh, it was ok. I went here on a recommendation with a friend who was in town. Last time she was in town we went to North Beach Restaurant, and we wanted to try something new.

I am a big gnocchi fan - which you can probably tell if you read other reviews of mine. So when I saw award winning on the menu I had to have it. Certainly was not bad, but average on my list. We weren't very hungry so we didn't really explore the menu, but overall I felt like it was just average. But it wasn't too expensive so I guess that is ok. If you are in the area and can spend a little more, North Beach Restaurant is much better.
author: Katie W.

description: Great Pasta and Service.  Sergio is the best!  Stopped by for a late night glass of wine and a plate of Penne Pasta!!  Sat at the bar and was serviced by Mike.  Great service and conversation with both Mike and Sergio.  They definitely know how to treat their customers and keep you coming back for more.  I have previously dined here and their menu has everything you would want in an authentic tuscan meal.  Grazie di tutto!
author: Jack S.

description: My husband and  had the pleasure of dining at Firenze last night.   We had doubts the food at Firenze would be as good as the food in Florence or our attempts to recreate the food magic of Florence at home.   We were wrong!   Firenze at Night is EXCELLENT.    Asked the waiter to slow our service and we shared 3 courses-  clams and mussels in marinara, gnocchi and squid in tomato, garlic and capers.   The service timing was excellent and the food even better.   Wine selections with each course excellent as well.   The GNOCCHI made me cry it was so good.   The best Ive ever had.   The only problem we expereinced was that "Joey Bag of Donuts" ;) was at table next to us  and he apparently thought the word F!@# should be conjugated and used VERY LOUDLY in every sentance ---  TOO BAD HE WAS THERE AND NOT ASKED TO STOP as it would have been a perfect evening......  Disgusting.
author: JoAnn S.

description:
Went to Firenze by Night for a friend's birthday. I was the first in our party to arrive and the owner/host greeted me. He was so nice! When the majority of our party arrived we were seated.

I did not order an appetizer, but went straight for the famous Gnocchi Firenze with light tomato sauce. It definitely lived up to the pillows of yummyness that I had read about. It wasn't too overwhelming and felt as if it was instantly melting in my mouth. I also had their Pinot Noir by the glass which complemented my meal nicely. 

One of my friends had the Peppardelle Toscana which were noodles in rabbit sauce and insisted that I try it. I was unsure of the rabbit because I instantly thought of Peter the Rabbit and my preschool class pet, but it was awesome! I will be ordering that next time I visit. 

We had a great time. The service was great (our server was very helpful with pronunciation), prices were reasonable, and the authentic Italian feel made it that much better.
author: Erica H.

description:
Food was excellent, service wasn't so good.

My business associate and I were in town on a Sunday evening and a friend recommended this place. We walked in and had no problem getting a seat at about 6:15. The place filled up a bit more as we were there.

I ordered Cannelloni, and it was as good as I have ever had. My friend had Ravioli and was very pleased with it.

The problem was the service. Every thing for our waiter was "perfecto"...way overused- to the point of annoyance. My friend asked for a sip of the Cabernet before spending $9 on the full glass. The waiter announced to the whole room that he was now going to have a "wine tasting", embarassing her. Then when she liked the wine he again announced "now you can fill up the whole glass".

I would retrun, but ask for a different waiter..........
author: Richard R.

description:
The partying gene runs in my family - to the extent that when I go out with my 80-something parents, I usually have a worse hangover the following day than when I go out with friends my age. They also know some haunts I've never really noticed. Given how long they lived in San Francisco, I am surprised we've never made a ruckus in Firenze by Night. The place has been around since the '80s. The night we went, we met up with some old family friends who've been going there since it opened. This time they drove from Sebastapool for the occasion. 

We arrived at 6pm on a Saturday before the place got slammed. The waiter had time to spend with us describing the dishes and point out who on staff that night was part of the family. 

I concur with the reviews which say the gnocchi and pasta are great. I truly have never had such good gnocchi in a restaurant. They were semi large, redolent of potato and semolina, not too chewy but not soggy and textureless either. Toothsome may be the right word. I loved them in their slightly creamy tomato sauce. The papardelle with a beefy ragu was also delicious. Five of us shared two plates of pasta as a primi and then had our own entrees. The osso bucco was very nice - fork tender and flavorful. The chicken with funghi was also very good. All entrees came with sides of tasty polenta and julien squash and carrot.

I have read that a lot of tourists are sent here by local concierges. The place was packed with families and kids. Packed to the point, in fact, that our waiter actively discouraged us from getting dessert due to all the people waiting. The Italian family restaurant feel was evident in the crowd, the standard sides on the entrees, and the very good but - at the end - rushed service. On one hand it's nice to see a still-affordable good Italian restaurant that isn't "trendy." On the other hand the only thing that would discourage me from returning is that I like to sit around talking for a long time after I finish my dinner with friends or family, and this is more of a turn 'em and burn 'em place. 

Definitely stop by to try the pasta though - it really is worth it.
author: Roxmarie M.

description: As authentic as Italian food can get, the garlic snails, bruschetta, rabbit pappardelle, seafood linguini, I was really looking forward to their award winning gnocchi which I thought was overcooked, I like my gnocchi aldente so I was really dissapointed. Nevertheless, everything else was really tasty, the lemon meringue and peach sorbet are worth a try too.
author: Ennie L.

description:
Firenze by Night, sounds so cheesy, right? I'm thinking: "Great, another tourist trap with a pervy waitstaff and mediocre Italian food." I was relieved when I was proved HALF wrong. 

The food was actually quite a treat, the highlight being the gnocchi with tomato cream sauce. That was a damn good meal and some of the better gnocchi I've had well, ever. 

They did NOT prove me wrong with the service. The waiters were indeed pervy, stopping at every pass to comment and stare at the table full of pretty girls. However, OUR server was actually quite a dud. He wasn't friendly or flirty (which I almost would have preferred to deadpan) He was just blah, along with all the other bus boys waiting on our table. For example, I would ask a simple question such as, "Can I get some cheese on top of this pasta?" and they they would turn away with not even a gesture suggesting they had heard me. Had it not been for this, it would have been a 4 star rating. It just goes to show you that service can go a long way with an overall experience. Just because the food is good doesn't mean I'll be back.
author: Julia N.

description:
This place evokes a serious time and place of yore, and that, for me, is San Francisco circa 1989.  I was a little kid and North Beach has a feeling of being in your Italian friend's grandma's kitchen all the time. 
I am, admittedly, more of a fan now adays of more modern restaurants when it comes to italian cuisine, or, if not modern, more "refined" if you will (I'm sure that comes off as pretentious....what's a girl to do).
All of that notwithstanding, I do recommend that anyone go to this place once.  It is SO lively in that high spirits, la chaim way. LIFE is happening here.  Our waiter was a gem and we enjoyed his help all night.   
The one item that surprise me as the standout was the spinich and bacon salad....WHA? Yes. It stood out big time.  
The world-reknowned gnocchi WAS, indeed, good, but it didn't make me go all nutty-eyed like I was hoping.  
Come to Firenze by Night if you wish to have that SF back when it was a rulin' freak-filled city not yet trying to be tamed by lots of outsiders feeling.
author: Lila G.

description: The gnocchi is absolutely amazing along with everything else on the menu! I am well traveled and will only try gnocchi if it is made in house, I have yet to find a place that can top these dumplings! Very authentic and great service!
author: Marisa K.

description:
It's Friday night and my friends and I decide to have a late dinner in the North Beach area. There was no wait which makes absolute sense because we arrived around 10. I just have to say, the ambiance is totally appealing if you're on a date because it's kind of dark in there. It's like Hollister but without that funky smell.

The only complaint that I have is the long wait to place our order. Our waiter seemed kind of tired which is understandable, at least he wasn't rude to us. I ordered the gnocchi which seems to be their most popular dish. It was delicious and the portion was good too. Not too big, not too small.  It was a good dinner overall, the company was awesome, food wasn't too shabby, I love eating in the North Beach neighborhood.
author: Lauren L.

description:
'dunno if you get served fruit flies in Italy, but you do at Firenze! 

My two girl pals and I went there for a drink and dinner after a lousy Tuesday; it turned out to be a nightmare, cause the guy behind the bar wouldn't stop yapping. The wine he suggested was bad, the food that put on our table was oily, insipid, garnished with fruit flies and a pithiful quantity....enough for a sparrow!

Spend so much, and get so little. Never going back there!
author: Me Iz S.

description:
I go to Firenze By Night every now and then, and they have never failed me.  The food is always excellent, flavorful and extremely satisfying. It's a fairly small restaurant, slightly off the beaten path.  It's easy to walk by it if you're not paying attention.

Their veal is awesome, as is their risotto, which is usually on their "Specials" menu.  The veal is very tender, and the cream sauce was tangy, flavorful, and not overdone.

The service is exceptional, with each waiter treating each table like family.  They are courteous and always smiling.  My water glass was never empty.

This place is a treat to enjoy.  It's not touristy.  It's a great hidden gem right in plain sight.
author: Marc E.

description: Amazing Gnocchi, I also enjoyed starting off with their prosciutto and melon appetizer. Haven't tried much else on the menu, but have been back many times for their Gnocchi. Firenze by Night is not on Colombus Ave, the main street,  so it doesn't have the luxury of being able to serve mediocre food like some of the many mediocre restaurants in this tourist-trap-area. Overall I've always had a great experience here.
author: Mariano A.

description:
Love this place.  Went with friends last night and had the Gamberoni pescatore/Jumbo prawns with calamari in a white wine and lemon sauce and the Saltimbocca alla romana - both were exquisite. 

My lady friend had the Petto di cappone ripieno and the other couple had Maiale alla maremmana/Pork scaloppine sauteed with garlic, sun dried tomatoes and white wine and the Vitella alla medici/ Veal sauteed in white wine, fresh basil, pine nuts, and a touch of cream.

We all shared the grub, and, we are glad that we did.  Each dish was unique in its own right and very good.

I'd highly recommend this place.
author: jack m.

description:
Top notch restaurant! Excellent food, welcoming atmosphere and friendly staff.

As a man, do not attempt to order anything that is sweetened in any way from the barkeep, Chris. He will bust your chops to no avail! =)

Lumache alla Rustica (snails with butter, garlic, white wine) was awesome. Our table kept re-ordering this appetizer after we scarfed it down with the bread. 

There are a couple of items on a somewhat "secret" menu if you are a regular. My friend comes to this restaurant often is on a first name basis with just about everyone on staff. If you are more daring, ask if they have the tripe available. The chef prepares a limited number of this entree ahead of time. You might be lucky enough to try it!
author: Emil C.

description:
My husband and I treated another couple to dinner to thank them for being great hosts during our SF trip.  We'd never been to Firenze, but a local friend had recommended it.  

Our friends arrived early.  When we joined them, we were shocked to learn that the host refused to seat them and had asked them to wait outside in the cold, windy night until the rest of our party arrived.  That's no way to treat new customers!  It was a weeknight and the place was half-full.

Firenze's poor hospitality put a damper on the rest of our evening.  The gnocci was tasty, not sublime, and the spinach salad and bruschetta were good.  However, the decaf coffee tasted bitter and looked like mud, even when I asked for a fresh cup.  You can do better for your money.
author: Elaine S.

description: Highly recommended any food you eat! Excellent Italian restaurant. Reasonably priced with very tasty food and friendly staff.
author: Anonymous T.

description: Merita 4 stelle anche se è nel quartiere della little italy vicino a chinatown e la location è triste e tenuta male ma il cibo è veramente ottimo i gestori e i camerieri sono tutti italiani e molto disponibili. Prezzo ottimo
author: Andrea O.

description: Amazing experience! My boyfriend and I came in without reservations on a Friday night and were seated within 10 minutes. The food was absolutely delicious filled with authentic flavor, and the service was provided by a kind and attentive italian gentleman. We will make this restaurant part of our San Francisco tradition. Great energy, food and atmosphere! Food/Drink: full bar was a plus, we had carpaccio ravioli and gnocchi! Perfect serving amounts and delicious! Can't wait to head back for the Saltimboca!
author: Kathryn C.

description:
Came here for my boyfriend's holiday party. The staff was super friendly. We were in a rush to see Beach Blanket Babylon so dinner was a little hurried. We even had to skip the dessert. We had a fixed menu for the holiday party so I don't quite know the names of the dishes: 

Hearts of Romain with Roquefort Cheese: The cheese was really good and the dressing was light and citrusy. 

Penne Pasta Dish: This was the best part of the dinner. The meat sauce was savory and the pasta was cooked perfectly. 

Veal Dish: I don't know what this veal dish was but it was not my favorites. The veal was overcooked which made it tough. Nothing spectacular here. 

I might of liked this place more if were weren't so rushed. Would consider giving it another try.
author: Thang H.

description: My sugar daddy Albie took us and his beautiful daughter plus 9 others for her 30th birthday dinner. Perfect place. Sat in the back room. Service was outstanding. Food fabulously. Gnocchi is world renown, must order at least 2 to 3 dishes. Bruschetta is the best I have every eaten. Thank you Paolo!
author: Heather D.

description: Delicious food.  Very busy and good hospitality.  I highly recommend this restaurant.
author: Kim O.

description: Food was average for the table and the meatballs were terrible. Who would think that an Italian restaurant can't make meatballs. The service was good but could not save the food. Would not ever go back or recommend.
author: Sanford R.

description:
I came two nights ago and was fawned over and treated like a princess...the ever suave Sergio sat with us and drank wine and fed me enough food for a family of 4...every dish that was put down and every glass of wine poured was accompanied by a lavish compliment from our charming Italian server.

I think this is what I had.  There was so much I can't remember.

Mushrooms Stuffed with Italian Sausage 
Mussels
Peppardelle Toscana 
Ravioli della Mamma
Gamberoni Pizzaiola
Saltimbocca alla Romana
Torta Di Formaggio
Tartufo

All very yummy, particularly the pastas.   It's not a fancy pants overdecorated place which I like and it's far enough off Columbus to be missed by the tourists.
author: Poppy C.

description:
For my 100th review I'll write a love story:

Once we started dating, I think I was already in love with you. We were infatuated with each other, San Francisco, and dining out. Some of our first and most memorable meals together were spent at Firenze. Our smiles brightened by each other as well as the food. I love you as much as I love Firenze's gnocchi and tortellini combined, and we both know that that is saying a lot. 

Even during our hard times and occasional break-up's we would try to stay away from Firenze, but the staff had become our family and the restaurant a second home. It was too hard to go there without you, but it was also too hard to stay away. Paolo and Sergio helped bring us together, keeping our glasses full of Barolo. Chris endlessly helped mediate when we were love sick. Once we were together again I remember being so excited to go in again with you. 

Firenze is the most special place to me because of all the memories I have shared with you there. Mille grazie.
author: Lauren B.

description:
Florence immersion? Maybe not but close especially with the giant mural of it's Italian namesake, locals of South Beach and homemade food that Momma would be proud of.
Where else would you enjoy good, inexpensive Italian food in the city? Firenze by Night Ristorante! From the moment you walk in this, almost hole in the wall, eatery is bursting with excitement. Service was a little slow off the starting line but it was packed at 8 on a Tuesday so I let it slide. I have a feeling it's always like this. Well worth the wait kidos as our authentic Italian waiter was more than accommodating with an enthusiastic review of the specials and suggestions from the generous wine list. 
A starter of bruschetta then onto the pasta! As one who enjoys the features of the day, I jumped on the veal with bechame and mozzarella even though the award winning gnocchi and risotto looked great on other peoples table. I was not disappointed in my choice. The bechame was fantastic and a great, soft and sweet contrast to the veal.
The great food and fantastic service (after the bumpy start) did not end with the meal. I stopped by the bar to inquire about my next stop. Christopher, the bartender, not only gave me his recommendations for neighborhood libations but walked me to the corner to point out the next whiskey bar. Now that's service folks.
Firenze by Night is on my hit list! It should be on yours too.
author: Mark F.

description: Definitely more than 2 dollar signs. Way more! We had a birthday dinner here and it ran us $73 per person -- for admittedly a lot of food. The food was fresh and tasty - they have their own pastamaker and butcher. The gnocchi was great! I would go back. And, I'd order myself. And, I'd probably spend a lot less. Oh yeah, service was delightful.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Love it. Don't just like it... LOVE IT!

I am a concierge and I send so many people to this restaurant (30-50 a week). Food is amazing, people are equally amazing, atmosphere makes you feel like home.

What really makes me sure about this place is the amount of people who come back to my hotel just to thank me. I've had multiple parties sit at my desk just in awe of this place and talk with me for 5 minutes about how it is the best italian they have ever had. People from all over the world, with all different backgrounds.

Sergio and his son have done an amazing job!
author: Matthew D.

description: Good food.  The service was great.  Not five stars because I didn't think the food was exquisite, but definitely a solid Italian restaurant to visit.
author: Peter H.

description: I had dinner here and I was quite impressed. I asked the weighter if he had any gluten free pasta. He said no, but then started to tell me the things he did have that I could eat. The reason why this impressed me is that he did not look at me like I had two heads. He was knowlegable about what gluten is and how to avoid it. an added plus was that the Risotto he suggests was the absolute best I've ever had! It's a little pricey, but not rediculous, and totally worth it:)
author: Diane S.

description:
This place gets 5 stars for being an old school Italian joint a little off the beaten path from columbus ave...on stockton street. They have a wall of fame of eighties celebrity headshots on the wall near the bar.  I quickly glanced at it.  I saw Isaac from the Love Boat up there with an autographed head shot, as well as one from Tom Jones...etc. The kitchiness of this made me feel all warm inside.

Sergio and his son Paolo are the ones running this place.  And it has been pretty much been the same for 25 years.  Italiano Tuscano.  I love the family vibe of the place and age range of its guests.  You can take grandma and your parents here, or just take your friends and enjoy yourself.  I took my friend and his wife here last Saturday and we had a blast.  

I grabbed a Ruffino and jumped in my friends car.  We valeted right in front.  They said just leave your car parked there, no problem. Ok, North Beach parking problem solved.. 

The food was very good that night.  My friend's wife had the fresh sole with polenta and vegetables and she said it was delicious.  I had the lingune con vongole.  They had fresh clams in shells plus canned clams all mixed together.  This is a good way to serve this dish in a hearty fashion.

Paolo was giving me tips on my planned vacation to Italy.  As they have some digs over there in Tuscany.  And they comp'd our corkage fee. Of course they know, we will be coming back.
author: Georgio N.

description:
This place has amazing seafood linguine for the price. The ambiance is very relaxing and it feels like you're in a different country. 

The only thing that was a bit annoying was the wait for our table even though we had reservations. We waited almost 30 mins for the table but the food and service made up for the wait. 

Very good.
author: L H.

description: Ok this is my 2nd review now! This place saved what could have been a horrible birthday night for our group of 8.  We had reservations at this other restaurant for 8:15 at Vicoletto's, but they did not have it together and were unable to honor our reservation. At this time it was 9 pm without reservations in North beach for a party of 8, kinda a nightmare to find a dinner spot for a group that large on a saturday night at that time of night.  We were able to be accommodated after a bit of a wait, but it was well worth it as the food and service was great. I'm so happy that my brother was able to have such a good dinner for his birthday after the big fiasco we had earlier. Thank you Firenze and our host Paulo!
author: Patricia M.

description:
With low-lighting, a DELICIOUS menu, Italian waiters, and a quaint atmosphere, this is the absolute perfect place for a date!!!

Too bad I was on a date with four other people.

But I was SOOOO okay with that because I got to try four other dishes besides my own!

From unbelievable gnocchi, to some scrumptious pesto fettucini, every single thing I tried was to die for.  And I tried everything. =)
If someone was watching our table, one would've stared with their mouth wide open.  

We literally passed each plate around like a merry-go-round.  Like family.

Like I said, I tried everything.

With a central location within North Beach, you really can't go wrong with trying this place.  We even brought three bottles of our own wine, yes three bottles, and they gave us the third corkage fee on the house.  We definitely appreciated that!

The bill with five entrees and two appetizers, and three bottles of wine,  the bill was only less than $150.  Not too bad.

We were actually getting together for a friend's farewell dinner, so it made a really bittersweet night just a little bit sweeter than bitter.


Graci!!!
author: Vince S.

description:
I went here with a couple girlfriends and was so impressed!  I live in North Beach but rarely check out the restaurants...silly me.  This place may be near tourist central but it is worth a visit.  I love how typical Italian it was.  Our server pushed us to our seats and started talking about some recent family drama with the host's daughters.  He was quite chatty and when he noticed that I had a pretty bad cough he brought over a hot cup of water with lemon.  How sweet!  Besides that the food was absolutely delicous!  My entire group left with a very happy tummy.  The only reason this is 4 and not 5 stars is because I did not find the interior all that attractive and I am all about visuals.  

Come here and leave happy...and very full.
author: Kate J.

description:
It's been two weeks since Tony and I came back from our Italian honeymoon (Venice, Florence, and Rome) and we have been missing the great food since. So based on the advice of fellow yelpers, we came by to visit early Friday evening for dinner.  We ordered the Antipastidellacasa (salami, a bologna-type meat, tuna with tomatoes/capers/onions, kidney/garbanzo bean/mushroom, pickled eggplant, pickles, frutti di mare), the award-winning gnochhi, the pappardelle con agnello (lamb), and a glass of chianti. Dinner was delicious! While the gnocchi wasn't as good as what I ate in Florence, it was no less delicious. The lamb ragu was delicious light and not too heavy. 

For dessert, we opted for two cappacinos with a homemade tiramisu, and a dark chocolate tartufo with white chocolate in the middle. It was all very good.

While it's not quite Italy, the ambiance was delightful.  We had to resist our urges to order acqua naturale, to say "grazie" everytime they said "prego" and "buon appetito."  It brought us back - and that was all we could ask for.
author: Annie Y.

description: I love the beautiful Italian mural on the wall! Firenze is comfy and in a great North Beach location. Firenze is great for dates too and especially for one of your first dates since the food is yummy but very reasonably priced. In case it doesn't look like it's going to work out between the two of you, you won't have to feel too bad asking her (or him!) to pay her (or his!) half of the bill... ;)
author: Meghan P.

description:
Cravin steak and suprisingly, for not being known as a steak house,  Firenze delivered the goods.. The perfectly medium Porterhouse steak melted in my mouth. Perfectly charred and seasoned,

Forgot this was an Italian joint.. ahha..

This steak was so flavorful and tasty, that it put to shame some of SF's best steak houses.. For $28.  I'd order two..

Can't wait to try the Italian food here.. ahah..
author: Carlo M.

description: Would be interested in going back when the lasagne choices include more then vegetarian.
author: Marc Lee R.

description: Our group of five went early on a weeknight to try this restaurant based on a great recommendation. Started with carpaccio which everyone loved. Best saltimbocca I have ever had. Husband loved his veal with porcini mushrooms. Fresh swordfish was great and the pesto! Oh my, the pesto is worth a trip in itself. Service top notch, Marco was helpful and fun as was Paulo. Prices are crazy reasonable and I can't wait to go back!
author: Michelle Z.

description:
As an overall dining experience, good or very good but not great.

The food is delicious. The bruschetta as an appetizer was superb. Simple but perfect. Salads were good (nothing to write home about, but well-prepared) and cocktails were delightful. I had the gnocchi which was soft, pillowy, and generally delicious. My dining companions had the vegetarian lasagna, the eggplant dish, and the seafood penne. I will say that I thoroughly appreciate the number of vegetarian options.

Anyway, my main complaint is that the service needs a bit more work to be truly great. We were seated right next to the bar, which was full of loud and already pretty drunk patrons. There really shouldn't even be a table here. When we were first seated, one of the members of our party couldn't actually sit down because there was a woman standing where his seat was. Basically, we got the worst seat in the house. And we had reservations! The door was also open and a freezing cold wind was rolling in until I got up to ask the host if we could shut it. Our waiter was very sweet and energetic but was not at the top of his game. He forgot a few things we asked for and there were a few otherwise awkward moments. It's not that he wasn't trying... but it just wasn't extraordinary service. 

From the other Yelp reviews it seems like this place suffers from inconsistency in service. Some people seem to love it, while others like me were a bit disappointed. I think this place has real potential -- it just needs to make sure diners' service and ambience is as great as their food.
author: Rachel S.

description: reminds me of when I studied abroad in Italy. Simple, authentic dishes, reasonably priced. One of my favorite Italian spots in the city
author: Dico B.

description:
Firenze is hands down the best authentic Italian restaurant I have ever been to. I have been a regular customer here for several years. This place is my boyfriend and my "special spot" and we are treated with the best service. 

Also, their food is phenomenal and reasonably priced for the utmost quality that they serve. I have not tried a single thing on their menu I did not love. I eat here for dinner on weeknights many times and it will be busy by 7-7:30pm most of the time. I always call to make a reservation.

I ALWAYS order escargot and gnocchi (***best gnocchi you will ever eat! melt in your mouth) every time!! And I like to try the different entrees or specials that they have to offer. I am never disappointed. 

I will continue to come to this restaurant for many years to come.
author: Shivani S.

description:
I've been coming to Firenze's for years, partly because my sister in law has developed a good rapport with everyone who works there. This is part of the draw. It is a "family" operation. Everyone working there may not be related (I'm not sure) but they may as well be. It's always the same staff, and after coming in a few times - they'll remember you. They clearly take pride in their work and in servicing their customers.

Enough about the people, how's the food? Spectacular! I can't say much for the regular menu because I always order a special. Sergio (owner) comes up with at least 5-6 unique specials a night. Last night I had Linguine in a garlic white wine sauce with mussels and scallops. Sounds ordinary, and it is a classic, traditional Italian dish - but executed to perfection. Fresh fish, properly cleaned shellfish (no grit), savory sauce, and fresh homemade pasta. That is what you can expect...traditional Italian dishes executed well. Any pasta dish on the menu is a homerun!

Other classics are the gnocchi, quite possibly the best in the city! Not into pasta? They always have other meat or fish dishes on the menu, most memorable for me are Ossobuco and Braciole.

Atmosphere is casual. I wouldn't go in shorts and a tshirt but jeans, short sleeve collar shirt, and tennis shoes are acceptable (I love casual dining in San Francisco).

Firenze's - A++ in Northbeach!
author: Craig G.

description: want a good authentic Italian meal?  This is the place to go. I had the pappardelle which was delicious.  Portions were great and the wait staff was great.  They have a great wine list W/many different Italian wines.  Just ask your waiter if you are not sure what to pick.  They were a great help.
author: Lynnet S.

description:
This place was awesome- especially the atmosphere and the service. Each employee we interacted with was very happy, chatty, and clearly enjoyed working at Firenze.

 I went with my boyfriend and mom on a Wednesday and there was a short wait so we got 3 martinis from the bar. The bartender was great (Michael? I could be making that up)- really funny and a good guy. Of course my Russian vodka-loving mother complained that the martini glasses were too small but Michael made sure to make our drinks strong enough to satisfy her. The host (an older Fabio) was super friendly and sat us shortly after we got our martinis. He and my boyfriend got into a conversation and were laughing for a good few minutes- also seemed like a really good guy 

Our server greeted us right away and told us about the specials- they all sounded amazing so we all ended up getting specials instead of ordering off the regular menu- except for the clams and mussels in marinara sauce that we got as an appetizer. The app was probably my favorite part of the meal- the shellfish were very fresh and tender and we scarfed them down. For our entrees, my boyfriend and I split the swordfish and the beef wrapped in veal with mushrooms. Mom got linguini with mussels and scallops. All of the portions were huge and decently priced- but the food was definitely more in the 3-4 star range. The swordfish was incredibly overcooked and served with some bland broccoli, cauliflower and carrots. The beef wrapped in veal was decent, but I expected it to be on the rarer side and it too seemed to be overdone. Mom's pasta and shellfish were pretty good- she loves scallops and there were lots to go around in her dish. Our server was absolutely wonderful- just really light-hearted and attentive. My boyfriend kept telling me that he wanted to "be his best friend"

Service- 5. Like I said, everyone we encountered was absolutely awesome. The service was definitely unbeatable
Atmosphere- 4.5. The place was really cozy and we loved everything about it. Just a really good place without any gimmicks, great place to go with friends or a date.
Food- 3.5. The clams and mussels were so tender and yummy, but our entrees were overcooked

Overall 4.5-- I have to say that the service was really worth it and that alone will make me go back. Maybe next time I'll get the gnocchi, as all these yelpers are recommending
author: Alisa B.

description:
Sergio Giusti has created a Tuscan dining experience in San Francisco.  The ambiance and food combine to create one of the best restaurants in town.

As we entered the compact eatery, the young bartender was holding court, lubricating customers while locals dropped in for a quick, momentary pop at barside. The patter and joking ebbed and flowed naturally, comically, boisterously.

We joined the crowd in cocktails and waited patiently for our table - we had reservations for 8:30pm, but this was a Saturday night and the place was packed. We were seated by 8:45pm and the charming Sergio must have apologized to us 4-5 times during the course of the evening for our having had to wait and thanking us for our patience.

About the food: We started simply with bruschetta -- it was good. I would have liked the toast crispier, but the topping was elegant with hints of lemon, balsamic vinegar and chives. Garlic was present but not overwhelming.

Next, to the salad - She had Insalata estiva and I the classic Insalata alla cesare. Both were great. I wished I'd ordered the Insalata estiva after trying a bite of hers, though my caesar was spicy and tasty. Like creme brulee, I use caesar salads as a beacon -  a marker or buoy. If you make a good caesar, I'm happy. If you deliver a great creme brulee, you're going to see me again.

Entrees were Pappardelle toscana (large noodles in rabbit sauce) and for her, Gamberoni pizzaiola (Jumbo prawns with fresh tomato and garlic) with a side of linguini. The rabbit dish was like an open-faced ravioli with a brown sauce of shredded rabbit. It's listed as "award winning" on the menu and i could taste why.

Both dishes were sumptuous, satisfying - like home cooking, not manufactured. 

We finished the night with espressos and my wife tried a chocolate mousse pie/cake thingy that I thought was disappointing when I had a mouthful, but she wanted chocolate. IMHO, we should have gotten a tiramisu.

The wonderful food, combined with the atmosphere of this family restaurant packed with enthusiastic diners, perfectly attentive waiters and the very charming owner/manager/chef, compels me to give this place 5 stars. I will come back here again and again and again.  

Grazie, Sergio!!
author: Don W.

description:
My best friend loves this place so my mom and I went last night again.  I only eat pasta from places where I know it will be good and man is it good here!  I lived in Florence for a year and I'm not Italian - but all of their dishes are made the way I remember them in Tuscany.  

Bruschetta - lots of tomatoes and the perfect hint of garlic
Award winning gnocchi - its cooked to perfection - this is such a heavy and dense dish that this is a MUST and they get it right - melt in your mouth!
Papparadelle with rabbit ragu - AMAZING!  Very unique - fully of flavor, and the meat is pulled which is so nice
Fettucine with mushrooms and other stuff (can't remember) - also very flavorful - one must like mushrooms, but mushrooms were cooked well

They also have a great bar and bartender - and waiters who are actually Italian!  A joy of a place - in a random spot in North Beach, but absolutely worth checking out.
author: Erika M.

description:
For starters, it is difficult to get good Italian anywhere in San Francisco. 
Even in North Beach this is the case, super annoying. Anyhow, It was supposed to be dinner at Albona, the Istrian place way at the end of Columbus. But they were full, so the owner called the owner at Firenze by Night, who did have room for us. Welcome to Old Skool Italian.

FBN is just off Columbus, on Stockton. Owner Sergio greeted a friend passing on the street as he ushered us in past the bar, to a table near the window in the carpeted dining room. I'd forgotten how much noise control carpet provides, you just don't see that too much any more. Yay Carpet!

Once we got situated, the waiter came and took drink orders, gave us the specials, and left us to ponder. The menu has all the classics, caprese salad, saltimbuco, pork scallopine, steak florentine.

2 of us shared the calamari appetizer, a nest of baby squid marinated in vinaigrette on a bed of baby greens. It was a fresh alternative to the usual fried calamari. The specials sounded good we ordered a pasta with scallops and mussels, a beef bresaola? special, a petrale sole special, and from the menu the pork scallopine. I was hoping we'd share bites, but that didn't happen. The pasta with the shellfish was super yummy in a white wine/olive oil sauce with herbs. Everything else looked great and everyone said so.

Service was nice. We didn't have to wait to place our order, bread appeared without fuss. Our waiter was friendly and helpful with suggestions.

This could have been a 5 star review except for the wines by the glass. Because our entrees were all over the menu, ordering a bottle for the table made no sense.  There are so many quality imports that cost less than Californian wine, that where price point is an issue, still allow the wine manager to put together a thoughtful wine list. But the options were HORRIBLE. SImi??? Seriously? Wente? Decent wine could have really elevated this dinner to sublime status. Instead a respectable 4 stars.
author: Claudius R.

description: Gnocchi is super tasty! Ravioli is yummy! The waiter recommend me one appertizer I didn't order it but it's served anyway.
author: Kei S.

description: I absolutely loved the atmosphere.  It was the kind of loud that warms a place, rather than making it overwhelming.  Our server was great.  The wine was fantastic.  The food tasted like Chef Boyardee, despite having ordered their two most famous dishes.  Really, really, really bad.
author: C B.

description:
We haven't been here for quite awhile. We used to get off work and drive to the city once or twice a week for dinner here. Love the place and the waiters are great. Knowledgeable, helpful. And it's OK if you can't pronounce the words right, they still know what you mean. What I like about it the most is that it is old country style. If you have been ti Italy then you know what I mean. 
Triple thumbs up
author: Charlie O.

description: Went in June 2011.  Great food, reasonable prices.  Wish I lived closer to this restaurant!
author: Harvey S.

description: Came here for dinner with some friends who are kind of regulars, and I had a great time. We decided to order a bunch of items and eat family-style, which is always nice. We got their calamari appetizer (not fried) and a salad, and then shared their signature gnochhi in tomato cream sauce and another pasta dish I forget the name of (wide flat noodles with rabbit sauce!). The gnocchi was so fluffy and tender; I've never had gnocchi like this before. Everything was very good, and our waiter was awesome. Solicitous and on top of things without being smarmy or bothersome. For dessert I got what was basically tiramisu, but I guess there were enough differences that they couldn't call it that? it was also very yummy. A good selection for reliable Italian food in the crowded Italian field that is North Beach!
author: Steph H.

description:
----- THE BAR -----

*sings*  "I like the baaaar-tenderrrrrr..."
          Okay, I'll stop.

Oh Chris, was that you who I talked to when I tried to make reservations over the phone?

Chris the bartender (totally cute, by the way), hooked me up with this amazing drink called the "Absolut Mess."

"First thing you learn in bartending is how to get the girls drunk," he said.

He was right, after my first drink, I was ALMOST in an absolut mess!

This guy's a comic, an ultra sweetheart and always full of energy.

----- APPETIZERS -----

WTF, a bottle of chianti compliments of Chris? Hmm, I think he really is trying to get me drunk!

Beef Carpaccio: A simple carpaccio, with lemon and a special mustard sauce.

Funghi Ripieni Con Salsiccia: These mushrooms stuffed with Italian sausage is absolutely tasty! The sauce, oh, the sauce! *Hint: if you still have your bread, dip it in the sauce!

----- INTERMISSION -----

Chris approaches our table. "I'm a little busy right now, so I'll skip the jokes and go right to the laughs, HAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA!"

---- ENTREE ----

Chicken Breast with Prosciutto in Marinara Sauce: This was a special of the day. Perfectly cooked chicken; not dry.... And that's a big plus because I usually don't like chicken breast much!

Saltimbocca Alla Romana: Veal prepared with proscuitto and fontina cheese. I don't know what else to say except for it is good!

----- DESERT -----

I love dessert. I believe dinner was invented because of dessert.

Waiter: "...And what would you like for dessert?"
Nance: "Do you have flan?"
Waiter: "Yes we do."
Nance: *eyes lit up*  "YES!! CAN I HAVE THAT... please?

OH. MY. GOD, I LOVE YOUUUUUUUUUUUUU!!!!! This is the BIGGEST serving of flan I've ever had and I can't thank you more for that! How did you know, that flan is my absolutely favoritest (I know that's not a real word) dessert?! I was bouncing up and down my seat with every BIG bite of flan I had.

----- FINE -----

*sings*  "I like the baaaar-tenderrrrrr..."
          Sorry, I just can't help it!
author: Nance W.

description:
Navigating North Beach can be tricky.  You walk down Columbus and you are courted by both scruffy and finely-clad Italian men alike.  Where do you go?  Where shall you dine?  I live in North Beach and am still discovering the tricks to trade.  

I have known the Giustis since I was toddling around in Catholic school with their son, Paolo (we called him Paul in those days).  We chatted over AOL under the screenname FirenzeBN.  Paolo is now the front man at Firenze and provides the best customer service I have seen out of a man my age.
