The fam sent him back to the homeland to study the cuisine, and he is doing an unbelievable job.  

Everything out of this restaurant is the real deal.  The bartender is Mr. Shmoozy shmoozy, and will romance any walk of life to love the bar at Firenze By Night more than anywhere else in the 'hood.  I have met couples and patrons from outside SF that come ONLY here to dine.  

Go authentic.  Order your pasta or risotto as the middle course...the way it's supposed to be.  This restaurant's entrees are not hidden behind its pasta dishes (which are still pretty damn delicious!).  Also, do not be afraid to ask for Paolo when you arrive...he works hard to make this fantastic restaurant tick, but is humble enough to greet any customer who wants to meet him.   This is the definition of a true SF family establishment.   

Firenze By Night is on Stockton, off the beaten path of Columbus. 
check it.
author: Kerry D.

description:
I would give this place five stars, but I'm afraid my review is colored by the company in attendance.  

I took a wonderful women here for our first date, on the recommendation of a friend.  I managed to secure a reservation, but I screwed up in calculating how long it would take to  a. get into the city, and b. traverse from the excelsior to north beach.  I hate traffic.  Anyway, despite being ~40 minutes late (and apparently with other people waiting for a table), we were seated within five minutes.  This included the time we spent waiting to speak with the host (who, I believe, was the owner).  The only downside was that we were seated *very* close to the kitchen, and thus our dinner conversation was accompanied by the inevitable clanging of dishes, pots, and pans.  Our server was awesome.  It seemed as if he knew we were on a first date, and  he gave us enough space to converse, and yet timed his appearances perfectly so that he was always there when we needed him.  I had the swordfish special, which was seared and seasoned perfectly, although the vegetables were slightly cooler than I'd like.... this could be due to the fact that I was entranced by my date and our conversation, so it took me a bit to get to my food.  My date had the gnocchi, which, according to her, were very, very good (as they should be as their signature dish).  The wine was slightly overpriced for what you get, but you can't expect anything more than that in sf.  We didn't have a chance to try any dessert (despite a two hour allowance on my part) as we had tickets for cobbs, and had to leave, but I've heard good things.

All in all it was a wonderful experience, although, again, my date was wonderful and definitely colored my perception of the evening.  Although I did account for that in my rating.  I would say you can't go wrong for a romantic evening, even if you do get a noisy table.
author: Kevin C.

description:
For award-winning Italian food, look no further than Firenze By Night.  Located off a half block off Columbus, you will find an older looking sign bearing the Italian word for Florence written in script.  Although its appearance is not as trendy as newer restaurants, it radiates a rustic charm that is only found at restaurants that value their traditions and heritage.

From the inside, the restaurant is actually quite big.  On a lively Saturday night, we saw families, couples, and friends all dining and enjoying themselves.  The décor yielded a warm brown wallpaper/paint that reminded patrons of the countryside, along with pictures of the home country and autographed 8x10's of famous celebrities.  The wait staff was also very attentive and knowledgeable, giving wine recommendations and his favorite dishes from the menu.

Before I give a play by play of our meal, let me first and foremost recommend the Pappardelle Toscana.  It definitely ranks as one of the best pasta dishes as the rabbit sauce is out of this world.  Now for the play by play:

Appetizer #1 - Funghi Ripieni Con Salsiccia (Stuffed Mushrooms with Italian Sausage) - Good starter, but very rich and heavy.  The sauce is nice to dip bread in, but can be unappealing if you have a lot of courses coming.

Appetizer #2 - Insalata Estiva (Tomato and Mozzarella salad) - Very similar to a caprese, the heirloom tomatoes, small chunks of mozzarella, basil, onions, and olive oil made this dish simple, light, yet elegant

Entrée #1 - Pappardelle Toscana (Large Noodles in a Rabbit Sauce) - This award winning dish is a must try.  I feel compelled to not write anything more because its experience should be pure and untainted.

Entrée #2 - Calamari Giusti - (Sauteed Calamari) - Unbreaded calamari sautéed with garlic, mushrooms, and olive oil, this entree was light and decent.  Good enough to try once, but I will probably go for something else next time around.

With decent pricing, great service, and a warm atmosphere, I'd definitely come back to Firenze.
author: Herman N.

description:
So, I came here for a b-day celebration and had reservations. I spent more time at the bar, than the table but it was because the bartender was pretty entertaining even though he was an a-hole...

Food was good once I finally ate and would recommend for either an intimate date or a big group.
author: Brandon L.

description:
Firenze by Night is everything you'd expect out of a North Beach restaurant done right. It's touristy for sure, with signed celebrity photos from the 70s and 80s, a statue of David, even wallpaper that imagines Florence as the city you're dining in.

Get past all that and you're in for some super Italian cuisine. The gnocchi is "award-winning" according to the menu, so of course I tried that, and was not disappointed. In fact, all of the things our party of eight tried was pretty delicious and worthy of another return visit, from the antipasti to the bruschetta to the papardelle (another award winner!). 

The staff is friendly in that North Beach way, so it's hard not to have a good time here, especially after a few glasses of choice vino (we actually picked up our own at nearby Coit Liquor).
author: Nish N.

description:
How much do I love me some Stefan Dimancescu! Even his name is cool, but what really made me love the guy, in addition to him being a kick ass server, is that he looks exactly like a painting I saw at a gallery the week before coming here to nosh. Weird I tell ya.

Anyhoo, about Firenze by Night. For starters, the ceiling looks like it's going to gobble you up. What's not to love about that. Next there's a wall mural of Firenze including the Duomo! Hey, I hiked the stairs of the actual one once and so it's neat to see it while stuffing my face with food. Then there is the statue of David, hello, it's a statue of David and if all of the above hasn't painted a beautifully cheesy and kitchetastical vision of this place for you, well then, you'll just have to go see it for yourself! 

How anyone could hate on this place, I don't know, but you got a whole lotta love comin from me here. As for what we ordered, a bottle of wine, duh. It was a Montepulciano for $40.00 and it was a pretty decent wine. We also tried the Bresola con Rugola and the Mozzarella di Bufala. Both were solid dishes and worked well with the wine.

Will I be back? Of course!
author: Stephy S.

description: This place is bomb! I had the pasta in tomato sauce with chicken and shrimp...literally the most amazing sauce I have ever tried!
author: Irina M.

description:
Assolutamente adore questo ristorante. Cos tanto in modo che calcolassi scriverei la mia revisione in italiano (ringraziamenti Babelfish!) in modo che i proprietari gentili possano leggerli. Quello  quanto autentico questo giunto  la gente qui  realmente italiano, che amplifica la mia fiducia notevolmente nell'autenticit dell'alimento. Ma sar onesto, anche se questo posto  stato fatto funzionare da un mazzo di cracker (non sicuri questo tradurr, ma qualunque) che ancora lo frequenterei a causa di Paolo sexy eccellente! Signore, un suggerimento: ama i collegamenti mancanti Craiglist. Inserisca la risata diabolica qui. 

Translation, for all the Gringos out there:

I absolutely adore this restaurant. So much so that I figured I would write my review in Italian (thanks Babel Fish!) so that the kind proprietors could read it. That is how authentic this joint is- the people here are actually Italian, which boosts my confidence greatly in the authenticity of the food. But I will be honest, even if this place was run by a bunch of crackers (not sure this will translate, but whatever) I would still frequent it because of the super sexy Paolo! Ladies, a hint: he loves the Craiglist missed connections. Insert evil laugh here.
author: Anna K.

description:
Top notch Italian on the fringe of North Beach. This place has been around for years, and deservedly so. 

I would recommend any of the homemade pastas. Gnocchi and Papparadelli with rabbit ragu are tops. Veal dishes are tender and very well prepared. Prices are reasonable for what you get. 

Service is the old fashioned efficient type. It is like having a meal in Rome (or Firenze). Ambiance is old-fashioned, but that's what they're going for. 

Like any well-run restaurant, the customer is expected to cooperate in the experience. If you don't have a reservation, if you dress like you're at McDonald's, if you have an unruly child, if you're late for your reservation, if you ask stupid questions to prove you're important, etc., etc., you will be treated like the ill-mannered unsophisticate you are. 

If you're prepared for an adult experience of fine food and service, you won't be disappointed.
author: Frank D.

description: I came here with my mom when she was in town to have a nice, Italian dinner. This is definitely true Italian and my veal saltimbocca was amazing; however, the ambiance factor ruined my experience. It's cold and musky in there, almost even moldy. It looks like the place hasn't been refurnished in decades. It's really dark too, and not the romantic kind, as there weren't any lit candles. If you're going to pay $30 for a plate, you have some expectations. I want to believe LIttle Italy has the best Italian restaurants in the Bay, so I'll keep searching around the area. Until then, if you're toting around your Italian family, drive up to Marin and check out Fradelizio's or Sorella's in Fairfax. They are both equally the best Italian restaurants I've been to.
author: K M.

description:
I went to dinner with a friend on a Saturday evening and we left completely satisfied. 

We each had a glass of red wine that we enjoyed. We started by splitting a ceasar and we were both impressed!  We even enjoyed the bread on the table!!

I had ravioli in a cream & mushroom sauce (which I loved) and my friend had a seafood pasta with muscles, prawns and clams (both were specials on the menu). She loved it- said she could taste all the flavors - very clean & delicious. 

We split the tiramisu and it was very good. For me, it was one of the best I've had. For my friend, she said she has experienced even better, but thought it was really good. 

Service was awesome, atmosphere was cozy and prices were reasonable considering you're in the heart of North Beach where prices are jacked up for tourists. I definitely recommend this spot and would return to introduce it to my friends.
author: M Y.

description: Was very disappointed that the menu prices are significantly (about $4-$6) higher than is shown online.  We sat down, saw this, and left as it felt more like a "bait and switch" than simply a recent price increase that hadn't yet been updated on the website.
author: Steve B.

description: This place is corny but romantic! Love the staff and the food is great. Our favorite waiter has a really heavy Italian accent. Warm and friendly.
author: Kelly D.

description: I loved the food and the ambiance - Authentic!  The famous gnocchi just melted in my mouth and the linguini special was "al dente" with fresh seafood (I'd never seen mussels do big).  I will definitely go back to taste everything they have on the menu!
author: Ann I.

description:
I went here with a group -- they have a great space in the back room that is perfectly suitable for groups. 

The food is very authentically italian - nice. We had many courses and all were fantastic. I loved the eggplant parm! 

The service here is very mediocre (why I am not giving this place more than 3 stars). They offer the worst of european service (namely inattentiveness) with the worst of american service. Not a good combo.
author: lindsey l.

description:
Nice italian place, with good fresh pasta. Had the meat tortellini soup in a chicken broth.

Had the calamari in a light tomato sauce with capers, with good side of polenta and steamed veggies.

Papperdelle was very tastey as well.

$12-18 per pasta, $20 for meats and fish.
author: Eddy N.

description:
If I still lived in this neighborhood, I would weigh a ton by now.  So many restaurants to choose from - and now we have one more to add to the list of places to go back to.  Recommended by a friend, we had a wonderful evening here.  We tried two of their specials.  I had their homemade fettuccini with meatballs, and hubby had veal wrapped in steak.  Always odd to see meat wrapped in meat - but it's all good.  So tender and juicy!  I really enjoyed my pasta and actually had enough leftovers for another meal.  Yay!  It had a light tomato sauce that really made the dish.

No room for dessert unfortunately, but I know there will be a next time.
author: Denise M.

description:
I'll admit that I didn't think this place would be too great.  Just looked like your typical NB fare.  Wrong again Thadd!

Everything that I have tried there is just fantastic.  I haven't been to Italy as an adult so I can't speak to authenticity, but I can tell you that this place is effen-good.  I know the folks there now and I am happy to see that being a regular still means something to an establishment.  Hats off to Firenze by Night Ristorante.
author: Thadd L.

description:
This is off the North Beach "strip" (Columbus Ave...you know) so while it's a popular restaurant, it's not an overrated tourist trap like most others in the area.  

Chris, the bartender, is incredibly sweet, funny, and intelligent, and he makes damn good drinks.  The owner and his son have worked hard to create a welcoming environment.  The wait staff is very attentive and knowledgeable, and they seem to remember me (or at least pretend to), which is nice.

Perhaps more importantly, the food is fantastic!  I am especially fond of the gnocchi, which comes in a tomato cream sauce and melts in your mouth.  Their pesto sauce is creamy and flavorful.  The vegetable lasagna is a huge serving.  I've ordered the mozarella di bufalo (sp?) and the carpaccio for appetizers, and I wholeheartedly endorse them.  But the best dish, IMHO, is the petrale sole, which always seems to be a seafood special, egg battered and fried to perfection, and flavored with lemon.

This is easily my favorite Italian restaurant in the city.
author: Dwigt S.

description: Amazing service. Really good authentic Italian good. How anyone could give less than 5 stars is a mystery to me.
author: Ty H.

description: I was very disappointed in this restaurant. The food was okay and the service was poor. The waiter didn't even refill our drinks and we had to ask for bread. This is also not a kid friendly place to eat despite being listed so on Yelp. They will make some plain pasta for your kid and charge a lot of money for it. That is the extent of it being kid friendly. Okay food, high prices.
author: Melissa T.

description:
Great food.  Great service.  Great wine.  I really can't think of a single bad thing to say about Firenze.

My husband and I had our rehearsal dinner there and I can even say that they can handle a large crowd (30 people) flawlessly.  

And, it's an Italian restaurant in North Beach that's actually owned and run by Italians.  This may sound like a no-brainer to you, but trust me, it is the exception to the norm.  

Favorite dishes: any of the Risottos, the Patrale Sole, the gnocchi and the Carpaccio.  And try a shot of the Limoncella if you're not scared.  It's superb.
author: Jessica B.

description: Great pasta.  Can taste the freshness and homemadeness.  Try the Rabbit pasta = ummm awesome.  Calamari is different and really good.  Its not friend but tasty and very light.
author: Jordan S.

description: A "tourist trap" restaurant with overpriced food and horrible service. For the price you can get much more interesting Italian food in the city. The bus boy spilled water on me and barely apologized. Ignored my requests to call the waiter. The waiter threw some cheap appetizer on the table as a means to make up. I didn't want the god damn desert. Why not ask first? I would expect more from a place that wanted to retain clientele. Go elsewhere.
author: greg s.

description:
"Do you have a reservation?" the host asked us when we entered the restaurant.

"No..." we responded sheepishly.

"Well don't worry. Now you do" they stated before promptly seating us at a table for two near the bar.

The decor was the typical tacky crap you find in an italian restaurant--fake marble statues, cornacopias, etc. But the lighting seemed appropriate for a place that could be romantic and the restaurant was sectioned off with class windows so that it wasn't too loud (of course, our table was very loud since we were sitting next to the bar and a party of 10 birthday, but sometimes that can't be helped.

The waiter was attentive and very quick. To start, he recommended a soup to me that he said was "their house specialty... very unique" but it ended up being way super salty. Like a chicken chive egg drop soup thing. Don't get it.

For my main dish, I got the seafood linguine in tomato sauce. The scallops were small but the mussels and clams were well prepared. The sauce was standard...nothing great nor spectacular. I've made much better pasta sauces myself, but all in all the pasta was good and a decent price for a place that didn't seem as touristy as most of northbeach. My friend got the veal, and though the basil pine nut sauce was good, I felt they pounded the meat too thin until it was unrecognizable. Veal is supposed to be tender to begin with... it doesn't need to be paper thin with a veil of sauce so you can't see the quality. Good taste though, as well as good polenta and veggies on the side.

Overall, it was only an okay restaurant. Perhaps that wouldn't have seemed as bad if we weren't sitting right next too the bar, but at least our waiter was attentive and it was reasonably priced compared to some of the nearby restaurants. Not my favorite northbeach establishment, but I've certainly had worse.
author: Stephanie H.

description: This place is absolutely fantastic. Reservations required; it's a smaller place so don't wait in line if you don't have to. The bar tender while we were waiting was absolutely hilarious though. I think it was all the espresso shots! I went with a large group and not one complaint from any of us. The gnocci is incredible, they just melt in your mouth. My wife's sun-dried tomato penne was pretty good too. In regards to the other reviews; I swear I saw the grandma in the kitchen; as for parking, stop complaining "you are in San Francisco," there is a parking garage right around the corner on Vallejo St. If you want more authentic Italian food than this place, then go to Italy. My wife and I cannot wait to go back and soon.
author: Kolby S.

description:
I came here for my 22nd birthday with a group of friends and called in advance for a reservation. They were very friendly and accommodating. Half of my group was on time and the other half was late but the waiters were very nice and patient in waiting for us. The waiters are also very friendly and charismatic. As soon as I sat down, I got that mom and pop run Italian-at home feel. It felt like I was back in Italy inside a family run, very cozy restaurant. 

I ordered the linguine with clams which I thought was only decent. It didn't stand out to me that much. However, their other dishes are actually really tasty. Their famous gnocchi is really good...for the first bite. It's so rich that even a big guy with a big appetite couldn't finish it. Their lasagna is also amazing. 

Don't underestimate their small portions because when it comes to good Italian food, it can be very filling because the sauce and the pasta is hearty. 

I'll definitely come back to the place if I'm in the area.
author: Stephy Y.

description:
I've noticed that I haven't yet fallen in love with any Italian restaurant in the city. Last night I attempted to find a spot in Firenze by Night. Here are my thoughts:

Waiter -- Very helpful and offered up his opinion in his authentic Italian accent.

Decor -- Exceptionally cheesy. Somehow I don't think the space looks that great in daylight.

Wine -- It is almost better/more economic to order wine by the glass, plus everyone can get what they want. 

Food -- Good, but nothing made me swoon. The bruschetta was the best thing I ate. The caesar salad was average. The gnocchi, although award-winning, was nothing special. Kind of bland if you ask me. The eggplant, covered with onions, tomatoes and mozzarella, was decent. The vegetarian lasagna was huge - the biggest portion I've seen yet.

Ambiance -- Wasn't very touristy. Drunk loud girls sitting nearby interrupted disrupted our conversation a couple times. Plus they routinely spoke Spanish to the waiter thinking it was Italian. Kind of annoying.

My search for a go-to Italian spot continues....
author: Defne A.

description:
My friends and I were crabby and hungry because finding parking around this area is a bitch and a half. I walked in skeptical -- do restaurants in North Beach cook generic tasting chef Boyardee or are the seemingly authentic accents indicative of yummy, Italian food??

To our delight, it was the latter! We ordered the Risotto, some pasta dishes, the caprese salad, and the eggplant. I can vouch for the eggplant since that was my dish -- it was the right blend of tomato sauce, eggplant and cheese. The texture of the eggplant was perfect -- not too mushy and not crunchy, raw. 

Service is an added plus! If you're in North Beach and are overwhelmed by the multitude of restaurants -- check this one out. You won't be disappointed.
author: Lisa H.

description:
Traditional Italian food, yum. They aren't cutting corners on taste to save a buck, which is refreshing to find in north beach. 

not a large party? eat at the bar! the friendly staff will have you entertained the whole night long.
author: Beth M.

description:
After having bad experiences at other Italian restaurants, I was skeptical to try the gnocchi @ Firenze. To my surprise, it really did seem to "melt in my mouth." Excellent...not too starchy and the sauce was great.

Unfortunately, service could definitely be taken up a notch at this joint. Without a reservation, my table of 3 waited too long to be acknowledged and put on the wait list. Once seated, our waiter took our order quickly and our food came fast, but not once were we checked up on...never asked how the food was! I guess if you're a regular here, you won't have a problem with this -- while we waited to be seated, lots of the waiters seemed to know the customers walking in the door. I guess they were smart to call ahead for a reservation.

Overall the food is good here with fair pricing, but the service is lacking. For that, 3 stars.
author: TJ C.

description:
Where do I even being? The food alone gets Firenze five stars. I went with eight other people, and everything we had was perfect. We ended up passing our plates round and round trying to decide which was best. Of course many said the gnocchi, and you couldn't blame them, but the rest of the dishes were each cooked perfectly with so much flavor and taste.

Beyond the food, the service and hospitality were excellent. Friendly, welcoming, and entertaining, but not overly so.

All in all it's good stuff.
author: Daniel G.

description: Three stars for the food-- it's just average, especially since you're in such a fantastic city for food.  The thing that made this a place I would come back to was the bartender (Jesse, I think).  I ordered a drink with fresh grapefruit and lime juices, rum, simple syrup, and ginger ale.  Holy snap, it was delicious.  Jesse (maybe?) was aloof at first, but I think I won him over with my witticisms.  He had a great sense of humor and made an addictive cocktail-- what more can I ask for in a man?
author: Rachel Z.

description:
Ate at Firenze for the first time last night.  Overall it was great.  The prices are fair and the portion size is good.  

Famous for their award winning gnocchi but I had the special.
author: Dave P.

description: The award winning gnocchi was delicious. My linguini with clams was also good.
author: Helen Y.

description:
In a neighborhood full of tourist trap faux-Italian restaurants, it's nice to have found Firenze. The food, service, and most of the employees are authentically Italian. Like they are actually from Italy.

Everyone there is super friendly and very professional. Sergio, Paulo, and Chris are all very entertaining, especially if you catch Sergio after a few glasses of white wine.

The food is very good across the board. Some stand outs are their petrale sole and hand made gnocchi. They also make a very tasty, very alcoholic, home made limoncello.

I've been here for huge group meals (my wedding rehearsal dinner), large groups (birthday party), small groups (dinner with a few friends),  solo eating (carb padding before a night of drinking), and just for drinks (alcohol tastes better while Chris is entertaining you). It's a great place for all of these.

If you are looking for Italian food in North Beach, do yourself a favor and avoid the over-priced tourist traps and eat at Firenze.
author: Justin F.

description: Very enjoyable. A group of us went on a late Friday evening after the show and LOVED the service, fun atmosphere, reasonable price and tasty, well-presented food.  We will be back.
author: Maureen F.

description:
My girlfriend and I have been considering moving to the Bay Area, and went out to SF for a week to assess. The first day there we went to a little dive bar for happy hour, and met a few friendly and gracious locals who actually wrote out a list of their favorite tourist-free bars and restaurants.

I am so glad we walked into that bar, because Firenze by Night was on that list--and damn, that was the best Italian food I have ever had in my life. The gnocchi was absolutely perfect--freshly made with a delicately balanced homemade tomato sauce. Diverse and reasonably priced wine list. We finished with a tiramisu that I thought was going to make me cry. The price was so reasonable for the quality of the food, and it was so nice to not be flanked by tourists in fanny packs.

We tried another Italian restaurant later in the week closer to Union Square because they offered live jazz music, but we were so disappointed and realized that we should have followed our taste buds back to Firenze by Night.
author: Nate G.

description: My company actually held our annual Holiday dinner at this restaurant because the food was so great. There is a wonderful atmosphere in this small family style restaurant and the pasta was absolutely incredible.
author: Juan S.

description:
My friend took me this place. I couldn't find any good Italian place at SF but finally I found it!
Owner from Sicily. He is really friendly and great guy!
He served Parmesan cheese. It's so good! 
Salami plate is perfect much for wine.
I had pasta which is mushroom and garlic base.
They cook pasta to al dente and very tasty. 
Price is really affordable!
I love this place!!!
author: Megumi T.

description:
Seated at a table with stunning views of Florence.... okay it was a wall mural but it felt like I was in Italy!

Firenze by Night had been recommended to me by several different people, but of course I had to check it out for myself.  Although it is butted up against China Town, the Italian flair is not all but lost to a potsticker.

The service was fun, and charming... they know how to treat a lady or a lush I am not sure which, but either way they were quick with the wine!

The food was delicious.  I had their award winning Niocci (definitely worth a trophy or whatever you give to award wining pasta). Others enjoyed the Pesto Linguini (which was a bit generic), although the Rabbit with papperadale, and Ravioli della Mamma shined.

Definitely worth a stamp in your food passport, come for the views stay for the food....
author: Sara Ann S.

description:
Firenze by Night was the official champion of our Tour De Gnocchi!!!  (Tour de Gnocchi included: Firenze by Night, Da Flora, and Franchino.)

Absolutely wonderful.  Like the others have said... melt in your mouth delicious.  The tomato cream sauce is great too. Oh. AND the foccacia and olive oil. Mmm. 

Another thing we loved about this place was the service.  Guiseppe was our server and he made feel so at home.  And Paolo (the owner's son I believe?) came over and talked to us for a while.    

The whole experience was perfect.
author: Natasha P.

description:
The food is good, not great. The wine selection and service are great.  
Make sure you call ahead and make reservations.
author: Mrs. G.

description:
Food is good and authentic and portions are also Italian-sized. It's definitely nicer inside than you would think. It's also comforting that the cooks and waiters are Italian. 

Enjoy!
author: JeF m.

description:
For some reason, call it bias from familiarity, I have been reluctant to write a review of Firenze despite the fact that I have probably eaten here more than any other restaurant in the city, and it stands to reason that my frequent visits reflect on the consistent stellar quality of both the food and the experience. Well, in this case, the reasonable conclusion is the right conclusion. The body of evidence supporting my love of this place is far too strong to ignore.

First, let me start with people. Firenze is family owned and operated by some of the most welcoming people I have ever met. The staff and owner are genuinely invested in the patron (you) have an enjoyable experience. One time, during a power outage, the staff escorted would-be-guests to nearby restaurants. I was witness to this because the bar was still able to serve drinks.

Now, about that bar. It is small but its primary purpose is to entertain you before you are seated so for that purpose it is perfect and if you are just a few and don't want to bother with a table because all you need comes from the top self then you may as well just plop yourself down, order some grub (read: very fine food), and shoot the shit with the bar tender (who is also excellent).

Finally, the food is excellent. Anyone who says that Firenze has "just ok" Gnocchi likely doesn't know dick about great Gnocchi. But, the Gnocchi is far from the only thing on the menu. All of their fish dishes and pastas stand out of the crowd and I understand the veal is excellent as well although I have never been a fan of veal myself so I cannot speak from experience on that one. Also, if you have room, the deserts are a must.

I have taken many of my friends here and I have yet to hear a complaint.
author: Peter F.

description: Best gnocchi ever. Great pasta. Everything was very fresh. Thoroughly enjoyed this spot. Would love to visit again.
author: Ami D.

description:
I came to Firenze by night for my 24th birthday celebration this past weekend. After having scoured yelp for a top notch italian place in North Beach, Firenze seemed to be the best. I wanted authentic italian that could bring me back to my months of living of Firenze....this did not disappoint. I had 7 friends come to dinner, originally set for 10, but the host had no problem taking some plates off our table and seating us immediately-DEFINITELY get a reservation, it was so packed when we got there at 7:30 on a saturday that I cannot even imagine the wait.

The waiter came out immediately, asking us if we wanted water and drinks. He was genuine italian, as most of the staff seemed to be-which I got a kick out of as I speak italian and am half italian. Service was quick, we never had to wait for thing, but they didn't rush us either. We ordered the mushrooms with meatballs as a starter to share and a warm spinach salad-they were amazing. Most of my friends and I ordered pasta entrees-I ordered the famous gnocchi and it really lived up to its award winning standard. My close friend ordered their special that night, which was swordfish-given that he was siting next to me, I ate more than my fair share-it was so good. 

there is no doubt that I will be coming here again very soon, we all left with smiles on our faces and it was a perfect location to going out afterwards in the heart of North Beach
author: britney p.

description:
My hubby took me here for my birthday.   My b-day was on a Tuesday.  He met me after I got out of work in the FD and we arrived at the restaurant for its 5:00 PM opening.  We were given a large table by the window, and were the only people in the restaurant for the first 30 minutes of our meal.  

We had a delicious, inexpensive bottle of wine - which we only knew to choose thanks so the great descriptions of the various choices given by our waiter, as neither my hubby or I know wine coniseurs...  

We split a ceasar salad - our waiter split it into two separate plates for us.  How nice, and unusual, is that?  It was delicious.  As was the yummy bread we ate while sipping wine, chatting, and waiting for our meal.  For entree, we split the gnocchi (yum!!! - our waiter put this on two separate plates, too!) and the vegi lasanga (yum!).  Then, for dessert (which I only have on my b-day), my hubby and I split chocolate cake w/rasberry sauce --- if you only have dessert 1x a year, this is a good choice.  :)

Service was GREAT for the whole meal.

We went here because of the good yelp reviews - thank you yelpers.   You made my b-day!
author: Cara C.

description: Everything here is great.  I usually go here for work events, and we make special requests for our group menu.  We make sure that the porterhouse steak is one of the options for the carnivores of the team.  In addition to the salad, appetizer gnocchi, this 20oz. porterhouse seasoned in the owner's special Italian way give this steak a good alternative to normal Italian dining as well as a good alternative to ordinary steakhouse steaks.  I've been meaning to go back for a casual dinner on my own time but haven't done so yet.
author: Chanson H.

description:
It's not the best Italian food I've ever had but it'll do for a decent meal. Definitely better than Olive Garden or Macaroni Grill.

I picked this place because it was convenient to my friend's hotel and they accommodated children. However, I would probably pick another location in the future as the service was not that great. 

They were very gracious at first but we felt very rushed in the end. They were slow to bring us bread even though one of our entrees would take a while to cook and they were quick to clear our table and hand us the check and indicate to us that they wanted us to leave even though we had been there for barely an hour if that. (It wasn't because of the kid who was not fussy at all). I understand they need to turn their tables but please try not to shove your customers out the door.
author: Y C.

description: A friend recommended this place to me and told me I'd love the gnocchi, and he was so right!  Really friendly service, authentic Italian food, decent wine selection, and romantic ambience.  Go, but don't tell too many people about it...  I want to be able to go back and get a table!
author: Andi T.

description:
Firenze by Night Haiku 

San Francisco has 
a lot more restaurants per 
square mile than most 

Firenze by Night is 
just another tourist-y 
nothing special place

White chocolate "egg" 
dessert and gnocchi were fine
but I've had better

Medicore food
Boring service, expensive
I won't come back here
author: Christine N.

description: Yeah - came back here again - always excellent service.  I called the place day of 3 different times to change the reservations to different counts - my mistake.. Sergio totally helped and was very nice with all my changes and requests.  Thank you!!!  PS - sorry for the ass that was with us that made a rude comment.  He's not invited to go out with us any longer!!!  Thanks again!!!!!!!!!!
author: Jodi B.

description: We went to Firenze after looking for a nice place to eat when spending the rest of the evening watching Beach Blanket Babylon.  We were 10 minutes late for our reservation and they still held our table for us! (a first for me!).  The entire team was very friendly and happy to have us dine in their restaurant.  The restaurant was filled with both regulars-right out of the Sopranos- and tourists. The three of us ordered the special of Sole (x2) and the Veal Marsala. All I can say is it was one of if not the best Sole I have ever had!  It was light, fluffy, juicy and flavorful without overwhelming the fish itself!  I even ate all my farm fresh vegetables and I all I could leave from the large portion was a small bit of the polenta.  They served nice wines - even turned my dining partners off their regular wine they drank at home...  We were worried about being late, but the meal was fast, perfect and service was not rushed or in anyway pushy.  The only negative was that the regulars felt like were intruding on their place a little and weren't friendly-- but I can understand not wanting to have their local turn into a tourist trap.  All in all the best meal out I have had in years!!
author: Sara K.

description: Nice place in north beach! Good food - the gnocchi really are the best - servers are a bit odd. We liked the somewhat loud, vibrant feel to the place.
author: Sue P.

description:
This is my favorite place in North Beach! I have been coming here for years and have never been disappointed. My first trip here was by recommendation of a taxi driver. I was staying in San Francisco and got in a cab and asked the cabbie to take me to the best italian place in San Francisco, without hesitation the cabbie says "I'm taking you to Firenze's". 

The place is small, I doubt they could seat more than 50 in the dining area. The staff is very friendly. The food is absolutely wonderful. I especially like the pasta dishes. They have a decent wine selection and a full bar. The atmosphere is intimate, a great place to take a date.
author: Wayne P.

description:
Great food, the staff seems to favor certain people though and pick and choose who they give a table. They told a friend and I that even though we didn't have reservations they could fit us in. A couple came in after us and asked the same thing and they told them no, but then some other people came in later and they told them yes. 

As far as atmosphere goes, the average customer appears very yuppy (ie Marina crowd). All the women look like they are trying way too hard and the dudes kinda look like tools. Obviously this didn't ruin my experience but just something to note. The service wasn't amazing either. I had the gnocchi and it was great!
author: Brittney E.

description:
Bumping up to 4 stars because of the owner, otherwise it would have been 3-3.5 stars. 

After years of passing by and pondering if this is good or not, we finally decided to give it a try.  It was a Wednesday night and upon entering, there were folks at the bar and the host was missing.  While we were looking around and thinking maybe we should leave and try next time - an older man with a ponytail in kitchen uniform came and asked if we've been helped then lead us to a nice corner table. 

Our waiter was new and was really not very good - he doesn't remember the menu, can't answer any questions and couldn't recommend a bottle of wine.  For his sake, I hope he learns fast.  Anyway, he got the seasoned waiter over and you can tell he has worked there forever and probably part of the family by now.  He recommended a bottle that was not on the menu but it was good although not as full body/bold as I wanted.

What we ordered:
Bresaola con Rugola - aged beef w/ arugula - $10.25 - small portion and it was ok, not very tasty.

Pappardelle toscana - large noodles in rabbit sauce - $14.25 - this is one of their award winning pasta.  It was very delicious.  I loved the large noodles and the sauce was very tasty.

Pasta of the day - risotto - $14.50 - it was ok, the risotto wasn't creamy but more like rice.  

We were too full for dessert.  When we were leaving, we came upon the older man who lead us to the table again.  He asked if everything was ok and if we enjoyed dinner.  We told him yes and I asked if he was the owner and he said yes.  That explains it and because of his friendliness and the delicious pappardelle, we will return...perhaps try their other award winning dish, gnocchi.
author: Gloria H.

description: This is one of those reviews I hate to write because it might mean the restaurant gets too crowded to go to! The food is amazing, the service is awesome and the variety of great food on the menu makes you want to come back for more. This place is great for a date or to bring your family. Two thumbs way up!
author: Tom S.

description:
Date No. 7:
A decent Italian restaurant with the self indulgent entertainment of a one man show. Chris, the head bartender, has excellent knowledge of Zim Space Invader (and makes a great Manhattan). Be sure to dine at the bar. He is the life of the restaurant and will make you feel more than welcome. Owners Sergio and Paulo make a good ravioli, too. If you try the exquisite house-made Limoncella, make sure you have cab fare. Tip your bartender well and enjoy the oddity and entertainment of the amazing unprompted monologues that accompany this awesome dining experience. Try anything with the porcini mushroom sauce.
author: Gwenyth K.

description:
I decided to take my husband here for his birthday. This was supposed to be a fantastic surprise dinner and it turned into a stressful evening. The food tasted good, portions were very miniscule, but the lying staff makes this place the last time I will visit. This is located in North Beach area of San Francisco and believe me there are many other Italian restaurants up and down the same street for three blocks which I should have chosen instead. Most of the other ones offer free wine and appetizer just for having dinner but not Firenze. I never received a wine menu or a happy hour list. This place is way understaffed. The only drink I got was water as I never did have my drink order taken by our waiter as he was serving the entire restaurant himself. The place was packed. It took 2 hours for us to get our meal!!  We had made reservations ahead of time. A friend of ours made reservations as well for his own table right next to ours. When we got there is clear that they hadn't done what we had asked as they were about to seat my husband and I at a table for two and then our friend somewhere else in the restaurant. When I informed the hostess/apparent manager he said oh no your friend said he was just meeting you for "drinks.' That was such a lie I was dumbfounded as our friend doesn't "drink" and specifically said he was having dinner for a party of 1 next to our party of 2. He takes blood pressure medicine and wouldn't touch a drink otherwise he would have a heart attack. I couldn't believe this lie and excuse they came up with. I chalked it up and tried my best to rectify this. Finally they asked would you like to be seated at a table together, this being their idea, we said okay as that would free up another table for some other couple to be able to eat, so we thought we were being generous! We were wrong. We each had a coupon that stated one per table and reservations required so we followed their rules to the letter. We informed the waiter that we had coupons and he said, "Oh, I will get that at the end." With this coupon our friend had $40 to spend on himself for food and was looking forward to it. When the bill came they would only accept one coupon trying to make us pay over $56, when $40 was our friend's food that was supposed to be paid with his coupon. In front of a whole restaurant we had to argue this problem out with not one but two people to try and get this resolved. On our way up from the table we got lectured by the staff again about this problem and it truly was quite embarrassing to have everyone staring at this scene taking place. How rude this service was. The fact that we did or did not use coupons shouldn't have been broadcasted to the entire restaurant. We shouldn't have been put on the spot like that for following their rules. I will never go back here again!! Beware I do not recommend this restaurant at all! This wasn't even an upscale restaurant. Firenze by Night Ristorante sucks! Remember, this was my husbands birthday dinner and it ruined our evening and was the conversation for the car ride home about how they could have done this and dealt with this in a much better way had they known how to run a restaurant or cared about customer satisfaction. We followed their rules and were treated like trash for it!

 If you want good upscale with a wonderful staff, plenty of food--- huge portions, and nice atmosphere then go to IL Postale in Sunnyvale, CA. ilpostale.com/
author: Allexus Q.

description:
Rarely do I throw five stars out there, but Firenze by Night Ristorante is well deserving.  Located on the cusp of Chinatown, if not actually in Chinatown, Firenze by Night Ristorante is one of the best Italian spots in the area.

The atmosphere is lively, the service is great, but the food is where the place really takes the cake.  I ordered the Peppardelle Toscana - large noodles with rabbit sauce.  This was one of the best pasta dishes I have ever had.  I've had rabbit before, but this was unlike any other.  Others at my table ordered the Gnocchi, Ravioli della Mamma, and Fettuccine Pesto, all of which were also excellent. 

All in all, I highly recommend Firenze by Night Ristorante.  No witty comments here, this place deserves a quality, humbling review.
author: Jason M.

description: Went on a tuesday night with my cousin. We were nicely greeted. Our waiter had the energy of a dead person. He was definitely not into his job, he looked like at that moment, he'd rather have any profession besides waiting. I could barely hear anything he said. The bruschetta was really good. i ordered the shrimp and chicken pasta. It was ok, I could tell the shrimp were not shelled properly and the shells were still on some of the shrimp which was kind of nasty. I kept biting into hard things. The chicken was overcooked as well. If I were you, I'd go on a weekend night when they are probably more on top of their game.
author: S M.

description:
Firenze by Night is a North Beach gem for Italian cuisine. The décor is nothing to be impressed by, especially the cracked upholstery on the bench seating (must fix). Overall, Firenze had a very warm and comfortable feel that you would expect from a small Italian restaurant. We received a great seat by the window and the entire staff was extremely welcoming and friendly throughout the night. 

The Gnocchi is no joke here...probably the best you'll find in North Beach. I thoroughly enjoyed the Lumache alla Rustica (snails)...they are served outside the shell with a delicious combination of garlic, shallots, butter, and white wine. We ordered the fish of the day, which happened to be Capone...it was cooked to perfection and was the perfect compliment to the heavy Gnocchi. When we told our server that we would like to split the dishes, they prepared individual plates with a beautiful combination of our entrees (Thank You). The full bar is always a big plus for any restaurant...we both had excellent martinis with our dinner.

3 appetizers, 2 entrees, 4 drinks, 1 desert...out the door for $120.
author: Jerry A.

description: Linguini with seafood....shrimp...everything my group ordered, they loved!  There are lots of restaurants in North Beach, but I think you should pick this one.  There, your decision has been made!
author: Newyorkwalk D.

description:
We had veal scolopine in a cream pesto sauce that was deliceous one night, and Osso Bucco another night.  It is one of our favorite San Francisco Restaurants.

J & R Neumen
Redlands, CA
author: Joe N.

description:
My absolute favorite Italian restaurant in SF! Like all the other reviewers keep echoing, the food is scrumptious! I usually go for the Pasta Mare e Monte (pasta with chicken and shrimp) and every time I do, I try to savor every single bit, because the al dente pasta, light tomato sauce and tender chunks of meat are DELICIOUS. My boyfriend has tried the rabbit and the quail, and been very pleased with both. I recall him loving the sauces they were served in, as well as the tenderness of the meat. The waiters are helpful with wine suggestions, and the bruschetta is very good. Mmmm delicious tomatoes. If we have room, we try to finish off the night with cappuccino and the ricotta cheesecake. LOVE IT. 

The service is superb. We're usually served by old Italian men who have probably been in the business for decades. And they always take care of us so well. 

The decor is a little kitschy, sure. But it's also unpretentious and welcoming. I feel like I could get dressed up and go here, or stop on by in my jeans if I'm in the mood. 

Excellent. I truly cannot praise Firenze enough. I love it!
author: M. L.

description: Gnocchi was amazing! Service was good and fast and everyone was very nice and the gnocchi was melt in your mouth! I will be back
author: Jenny I.

description: Pure gem in the middle of an Italian neighborhood. Paolo the owner greets you at the door and you are welcomed into the restaurant. Food is great (recommend the veal) and the service is prompt and friendly; just what you want in a place to eat. Next time I am in town I will be sure to stop by.
author: Patrick S.

description:
I swung by this place on a Friday night on the recommendation of Yelp.  I'm not in a big review writing mood right now, so all you get are the highlights:

+ wine by the bottle is very reasonably priced
+ you can sit here and chat for hours (just as a group of people before us did... for a loooong time)
+ the bartender was friendly and made some great suggestions
+ dessert was awesome.  i would recommend the White Chocolate Tartufo with Mango Sorbet, as well as the tiramisu.  mmmm... i might return just for the dessert.  woohoo!
+ the $26 porterhouse is an incredible value... that's a lot of meat!
+ very friendly and accommodating owner... read more below

- you can sit here and chat for hours (see below)
- service was somewhat slow.  we spent more than 3 hours eating dinner (if you count all the time we spent waiting for a table)
- main courses are kinda heavy, but that's just the way italian food is, i think.

So here's the story... our group of seven (without reservations -- sorry!) arrived shortly after 8pm.  The bartender informed us it'd be 5-10 minutes, as another table of six had just finished dessert and would be leaving soon.  Thirty minutes later, they were still there, nursing their lukewarm light beers and dishing about who knows what.  The owner (Sergio, I think) came out and apologized for the delay and brought us a plate of bruschetta to tide us over to dinner.  After a total of forty five minutes, the waiters gave up and opened up the banquet room just for our group.

Overall, a pretty reasonable experience.  They did a good job of handling a situation outside of their control.  I'll be back.
author: Andrew C.

description:
Went here for dinner on a Friday night with a friend.  We both were in the mood for Italian and both hungry.  Once we got there we only had to wait about 10 minutes for a table.  I had a drink at the bar while we waited.  The bartender is really awesome and entertaining.  We wanted to order appetizers right away and the server told us that the food comes out really fast so we should just order everything at once. Whatever.  We ordered mozzarella for appetizers and we both got the "award winning" gnocchi for dinner.  The mozzarella was good, but came without balsamic vinegar.  I prefer it with balsamic vinegar but my friend prefers it without so she was happy.  There was also none on the table for mixing with oil for bread.  Maybe that's authentic Italian, I dunno.  The food was hot when it came out, which was definitely nice.  The gnocchi was good enough - I inhaled mine, but it wasn't award winning good.  It was very soft, but the sauce wasn't that great.  Also the server asked if we wanted Parmesan cheese and I said yes.  But it was powdered! Not the fresh kind.  

The service was fast and our server was really nice and friendly.  In fact everyone who works there is nice.  All in all a good meal, in a jovial atmosphere, with great service.  I'd probably go back and try another dish to give them another chance if I was in the neighborhood.  Then again there are so many other Italian places to try in North Beach.
author: Isi C.

description: The gnocchi are delicious, probably the best gnocchi I've ever eaten. The rest of the food is pretty decent.  The service is friendly, but the queue is long, and the waiter are too busy.
author: Laurent T.

description:
I can't believe I've never tried this restaurant!   It's off the main North Beach streets of Columbus but very close by.  I had the parpadelle with the rabbit sauce and it was very good - perfectly cooked pasta, nice tender rabbit meat (i'm not the biggest fan of rabbit) and a tasty ragu sauce.   I can see why this is one of their 'award-winning' pastas.   I also shared the torellini in chicken broth with my honey and it was very good as well.    Only few complaints - the bread wasn't warm and when my friend told me to ask the waiter to see if we could get the bread heated the guy looked at me like i was crazy :P    you would think I was asking for sushi or something.  Is it that much of a faux pas to ask for warm bread at an Italian restaurant?  

Overall I would go back if I'm craving some good italian and if I'm in the mood for spending more than the cheap $10 that you would at pasta pomodorro.
author: T M.

description:
i took my boyfriend here for his birthday after hearing great reviews about the award winning gnocchi from two separate friends, both East Coast Italians, like me, and so of course I had to order the gnocchi.  it was fantastic- the best I've ever had.  Even better than the fresh pasta store gnocchi's and better than my homemade gnocchi.  it was soft and smooth and the serving was just right, big enough for me to be full, but not my-tummy-hurts-and-I-can't-breathe full. 

I do wonder what award they won though - the menu just says "Award Winning!!"  I bet it was the "Best Gnocchi in America" award.  I can't wait to take my family when they come to visit.
author: Diane L.

description:
This was a nice little place we tried out the other night when the bf's parents were in town.  The ambiance is nice and I loved the mural on the wall.  The service was attentive and the food was good (I'll echo everyone else's sentiments about the gnocchi being great).  

We had the sausage stuffed mushrooms, gnocchi, stuffed crepes and the calamari dish.  No complaints about anything.  It was all delicious!  Everything was reasonably priced, $13-19 for pasta dishes and something like $15-30 for the other entrees.

We had to rush our dinner to make a show, but I'd definitely like to come back here for a leisurely meal.  If you want a place in NB, this is a great place where you know the food will be authentic and tasty.
author: Jaime C.

description:
Did my birthday dinner here this year. I picked it mainly because of the name and then discovered my new favorite place. The Gnocchi is fantastic, they are famous for it. And the wait staff was great and friendly(not to mention cute) and got us going with drinks before we sat down. Its definitely less cheesy than most NB restaurants. Get reservations before you go. 

Try the Gnocchi Firenze and the cute hosts.
author: Erin F.

description: Staff is great.. Food needed a lot of salt for me.. We were looking for Italian comfort food.. Found it.. Thx again Gary..
author: Robert F.

description:
The host helped us with parking-if you are familiar with North Beach, then you know how awesome it is when someone helps you find parking-, he seated us in a timely manner, and our server was very nice.  

They had  a great selection of wines to choose from and the pasta that I had, can't remember what it was called, was very good.  

It was sweltering hot inside, but I won't blame this on the restaurant because this was the night in SF that was "a small heat wave" in August.

North Beach has a TON of Italian restaurants to choose from, but this is definitely one that is worth stopping by.
author: Carly W.

description: Love, Love this restaurant!! My boyfriend made reservations here for my 30th Birthday and I couldn't have been more pleased. We had a party of 8 and everything we had was FABULOUS!! We recently went back for my brother's 21st birthday and once again were not disappointed!!
author: Ava F.

description: My girls and I went here for dinner and we had an awesome experience. The staff was really friendly and totally in love with us. I started off with a glass of Pinot noir and ordered the Pappardelle Toscana. It was BOMB! Just the right amount of sauce and chunks of meat. The other girls also ordered the gnocchi which was just as good and super filling! At the end of the night, dinner was on the house. Pretty dope I must say! Great experience, great restaurant!
author: Juliane M.

description:
I'm not a huge fan of gnocchi to be honest.  Sometimes I find them too starchy.  Sometimes they're too light that they're hardly filling.  This restaurant has it down right!  They just melt in your mouth that you just want to savor every bite to make each piece last.

I arrived ahead of my reservations time and my party so they were very nice enough to offer me the table or if I wanted to, just sit at the bar for a drink.  Tbe bartender served me promptly.  When my party showed up, the table ended up not being quite ready yet, so we chatted.  Then the bar tender overheard our discussion for desserts and cannolis.  He jumped in and said "oh we don't serve cannolis here but there are two great places down the street!"   I thought it was amazing that he was willing to suggest that we get our dessert elsewhere!

The service was friendly and quick.   The chefs were very accommodating to our order- the three of us wanted to share 3 entree so they set up our plates in home style so we could serve ourselves.

Entree #1 was gnocchi of course.

Entree #2 was the eggplant parm.  Very nicely done- not too deep fried or overload with cheese.  If anything, the real cheese came from the topping, not so much in between layers.  

Entree #3:  Special of the day- sole filet encrusted in some bread crumbs and lemon herb.  The fish was very fresh and tasty.  Plenty of salt in that one.

I have to say that the tomato sauce was just delicious with the right touch of cream.

Atmosphere was good- not too noisy.
author: Sara H.

description:
The vibe felt as soon as I sat down here was that of a place which was way past its prime.  Probably a once harrowed local eatery, where the passion for good food and service was common.  It now feels like they're just going through the motions, with little or no concern whether you're enjoying your experience.

Service wasn't bad until we weren't the only people seated.  Our waiter's shtick was cute until I heard him perform the same routine, verbatim, for every party that arrived after us.  The appetizers looked and tasted thrown together and were of poor quality.  Their "famous" gnochhi and special ravioli were both mediocre at best.  Everything just looked like it was slung on the plate.  Things were falling apart, in pieces and splattered all over.  We will not be returning.

Yelp continues to astound when I see places like this racking up the 5s and 4s with ease.
author: Max F.

description: Great Italian food! Great service! Great prices! Had an awesome experience, awesome sole, awesomely priced bottles of pinot noir, and an awesome time with a group of 6.  Loved it and will definitely back!
author: Jaclyn L.

description:
Damn! Yelpers were spot-on with this place.

I took my lovely date to this place, and while the seating was a little tight, the food was great. In fact, I would call the gnocchi SUBLIME! Try it. Also, the pre-dinner drinks were strong!

This is my new favorite place in North Beach.
author: KEVIN M.

description: This place is awesome. The service is great. The dishes are the best italian ive ever had
author: Nicholas G.

description:
This is really a 2.5 star rating

The gnocchi was as good as I've had.  The meat sauce benefited from truly amazing fluffy gnocchi.  Outside of the gnocchi, the rest of the dinner was only average. 

If you want a no frills middle of the road Italian dinner, this is as good a place as any but a little higher priced then it deserves. 

I'm sure the owners are Italian but our waiter that tried to have an Italian accent didn't even know about some major cities or regions in Italy...just found that odd.
author: Doug C.

description: Excellent service and delicious authentic Italian food.  The osso bucco was outstanding.  And you must get the chocolate mousse cake for dessert.
author: Lynn W.

description:
Really? Interestingly bad. The server sounded Italian, right up until he pronounced fettucine as "fettucini" in that supremely Americanized fashion.

Wine - warm and obviously been opened several days ago. 

Appetizer - I can make a better mozzarella di buffala from Safeway for cheaper. cheese was like the usual plastic garbage in string cheese.

Entree - The papparadelle was well done. The rabbit tasty. but the pasta was somewhat overcooked. The gnocci was good and solid, but nothing to shout home about (this is being compared against what I've tasted in New York, Boston, Wash DC, Milan, Venice). Their tomato sauce for the gnocci was quite good though.

Dessert - yuck! the tiramisu was flat. no fluffiness at all. and the ladyfingers were hard and sugar-crusted. Correct me if i'm wrong, but they're supposed to be fluffy, espresso soaked, and slightly bitter. The only saving grace is that the cappucino was of adequate quality. 

Overall: menu is solid, but lacks depth beyond their ragu and gnocci. appetizers inadequate, dessert dismal. service was quick but there wasn't much to serve. Hopefully they can just accept their american-ness, since their Italian-ness is obviously questionable. There are many better places in the North Beach area that are worth patronage before this place...
author: Jeff C.

description:
We had no idea where to eat and just started walking- we accidentally found Firenze By Night- and I must admit we were a bit skeptical about the name... anyway- we we sat the minute we walked in. The place seemed to be full, at least the main dining room was. This did not explain why they had so many wait staff just standing around talking by the front door- it was very disruptive. 
We had the first table as you came out of the kitchen and throughout our meal several gentlemen just stood their staring at us.
The food was good; we had the Penne pasta, lamb shank, seafood linguine and the brusceta. The portions are fair- and the pricing is reasonable.
author: Janell D.

description: Went once and now I want to go back again. Wonderful old school, true Italian feel. A classic - Bravo!
author: Kay V.

description:
My wife and I arrived for our 7:00 pm reservation and were immediately seated. We ordered drinks and the stuffed mushroom appetizer. The mushrooms were great. The cocktails not so good. The spinach salad was excellent. My wife had the petrale sole special and I had the osso bucco. Once again they were both excellent, well cooked, sauced, and hot. The polenta which came with both entrees was perfect. The only complaint I could have was no time to breathe between courses. As soon as one dish was cleared the next was ready. I was hungry so I didn't mind too much.

The coffee and desserts were very good. The tiramisu was sweet & light. We will definitely go back, but ask to be seated anywhere but adjacent to the bar. It was extremely loud. You almost had to shout to hold a conversation.
author: David L.

description: We had a wonderful dinner with great service. The gnocchi was delicious.  We also tried 2 specials and both were great!  We would definitely eat here again when we come to San Francisco.
author: Latisha C.

description: Delicious.  Was recommended by a bartender in Chinatown as the real deal.  And it was.  Guy at the bar belonged in Goodfellas and a gaggle of Hell's Angels was at the next table.  Three customers, three different dishes encompassing pastas and meats, three satisfied tummies.  Good drinks and wine to accompany.
author: Kent K.

description:
Came here for my friend's birthday dinner yesterday. It seemed like any other Italian restaurant from the outside and wasn't expecting much, but I was impressed. The decor is like any small restaurant you would find in Italy and the food is authentic home style cooking! That's not too common in the states since everything is usually "Americanized." The tables are a bit close to each other, but who cares? Just try to keep the X-rated topics for after dinner. Service was excellent and our server was quite funny and charming. 

My friend ordered their award winning gnocchi and it was delicious! It was a perfect doughy texture and the sauce was great. I had the other award winning dish, papardelle toscana, which was good too, but the noodles tasted a bit too eggy. Their rabbit sauce was amazing though. My other friend's risotto was huge and it was just a big plop of risotto with nothing else. They should really serve it with some vegetables or some kind of side to go with it. Other than that, our whole party was pretty satisfied with everything. Oh and the wine menu wasn't too overwhelming with a decent selection of wines by the glass. I would highly recommend this place for some good old authentic Italian food. Can't wait to come back to try other items on their menu.
author: Linda C.

description:
This is an old-school Italian food joint. The service was just great, the bartender was witty and fast, the host was helpful and accommodating and the waiter was informative. 

The food is very Americanized but adequate. The tomatoes in my Caprese Salad were meally and not that sweet. Right in the middle of tomato season. But the Osso Boco saved the day. They did this dish very well and this is something I like to get when eating out, since I can never seeing myself making this at home. 

I am knocking a star off for the tomatoes but otherwise pretty good place.
author: Seamus M.

description:
another amazing meal here. the lady had penne mare e monte, another pasta of the day with artichoke hearts in a white wine sauce, tiramisu for dessert. 

delicious! still my favorite italian restaurant.
author: Andrew C.

description: Came here for a great Friday night dinner.  I've been here a few times and it never fails to be amazing.  You absolutely have to get the gnocchi's even if you get for the table to share.  Atmosphere is great and so is the service.
author: Luigi C.

description:
Okay, Yelpers!  I went here with my boyfriend's relatives based on your reviews and they loved it!  Minus one star for the long wait to get our entrees and the one bathroom for the ladies- come one, add another toilet, people!  Plus four stars for the food and service.  The gnocchi was amazing--nearly perfect with perfect tomato/cream sauce.  His aunt enjoyed the eggplant dish thoroughly.  The wine was tasty, the waiter competent and knowledgeable (the cute Italian accent didn't hurt).

I was slightly worried when we got there for our 7:30pm reservations on a Friday night and the place was probably only half full.  But it quickly filled up, and it is quite a large place, so the atmosphere was lively.

I recommend the snails--the sauce they're in is super yummy on the bread and the snails themselves were cooked perfectly.
author: Sarah L.

description:
I'm shocked I haven't already written a review for this place. My favorite Italian in the city, though admittedly I haven't tried many. This was the first restaurant I ate in San Francisco - maybe 5 years ago?? I moved here 3 years ago, and this place has really become a spot for me. There is plenty of buzz and noise. You'll be immediately greeted by either Chris (the bartender), Sergio (the owner) or Paolo (the owner's son). 

My favorite dish is the pasta carbonara. It isn't on the menu, but it is the best I have ever had. Not soupy, like I find so often, but dry and delicious. On Saturdays and I think Sundays as well, they have a Ossobucco (lamb shank with a brown gravy) that falls right off the bone - which happens to be the first meal I had at my first restaurant in SF. I was with a friend and his girlfriend. We both ordered the ossobucco, his girlfriend didn't. I remember giggling after my first bite, like I had been told a clever secret and was trying to keep it to myself. I looked up and my buddy was doing the same. Needless to say, I recommend it.

They make their own lemonchello, which you must have with the homemade tiramisu for desert. Oh, and the gnocchi is also outstanding. When you go, tell everyone I said hello!
author: Scott S.

description:
We had a large party of 30 people for my grandmother's 80th birthday.  We had originally booked at another restaurant (Fior d'Italia) but after reading the reviews we decided to bail and go to Firenze by Night and boy are we glad we did!.  My wife and two kids and I had actually eaten at Firenze when we were scoping out picnic sites for the big birthday weekend.  

We had our hotel concierge call at 4:00pm for a 6:00 reservation and they were able to accommodate our group in their back room.  Major kudos for their fitting us in on such short notice on a holiday weekend!  The staff at Firenze is so friendly and accommodating and they really delivered on the service.  

We only had one waiter for all 30 of us, AND he was handling two other tables.  Even with just one waiter he handled everything extremely well and got everyone in our party served quickly.  We had several appetizers for both tables to start off.  We asked that they get food out for the seven children in our party first.  They served the kids and all of the fish dishes first and had everyone else served within short order.

The bus boys kept our water and drink orders coming quickly and we didn't have to ask or remind them for water or bread.  We had eaten at the Lauren Court (Allegedly a 5 star restaurant) at the Fairmont hotel the night before, and I have to say that the service at Firenze blew the Laurel Court away! 

Desert was delicious and everyone in our party absolutely raved about how good the food was.  My aunt who has lived in the Pacific Northwest for the past decade stated that her salmon was "the best she has ever had".  I highly recommend the Gnocci as it simply melts in your mouth, but the fish and pasta dishes are excellent as well.  They do not have a kids menu but they will cook any type of pasta with veggies and grilled chicken which all of our kids gobbled up.

The bill was very reasonable and a good value for a party of 30 people.  (Our bill was half as much as the Laurel Court at the Fairmont hotel and the food and service were much better at Firenze!)

Major kudos to Firenze by night for an absolutely fabulous meal!
author: Mark H.

description:
We went there last month for the first time for our wedding anniversary, it was so perfect, that we are coming back with a huge party to celebrate my birthday. The gnocci is super velvety, its everything and more... The swordfish was perfectly cooked... Escargot was even amazing! So craving the Firenze! It just doesnt get any better than this!
Update: we went back for my birthday! A large group of 20! And now there are more Firenze Fans. Lord how I crave their food! Soooooo AMAZING! Love it! Cant wait until I get back to the city... Thank you for such a fabulous meal, consistantly! Kudos!
author: La S.

description:
We tried Firenze by Night when asked to pick somewhere in North beach by some visiting friends who had a couple of kids. All I can say is that the Yelps don't lie!

The food was great but the star of the night was the service. They handled our group arriving in parts and were happy to create dishes specifically for the kids.

I'm sure they get their fair share of the tourist trade but this place didn't pander to it and felt like a great family Italian restaurant.

Highly recommended.
author: Jez H.

description: Awesome food. Very genuine place with great specials. I learned things about birds I didn't really want to know.
author: Artem M.

description: Bar none the best, most authentic Italian experience in North Beach. The food is incredible, the staff friendly and knowledgeable, and the bartender Chris quick to pour and even quicker to make you forget the worst of days with a funny story or joke. The ambiance is incredible - I've celebrated birthdays, milestones and any number of events here! Highly recommended!
author: Rhawnie P.

description:
Loved this restaurant! I was looking for a place to take my pakistani family and this was not an easy task. Their idea of good italian is Olive Garden so I needed to find a place that had food they might be familiar with, like lasagna and fettucini. I was nervous already given my fiance was meeting my extended family for the first time so I wanted to make sure everything went perfectly.  Firenze made it happen! The food was absolutely amazing. The atmosphere was so beautiful and the wait staff were charming and attentive. My opinionated pakistani family scraped their plates clean and couldn't say a bad thing about the place. We ordered 
Veggie Lasagna- in a yummy creamy tomato sauce (we asked them to make it spicy and they did with no questions asked)
Gnocchi- Also in a creamy tomato sauce, super light a fluffy practically melts in your mouth. 
Fettucini with Creamy Pesto Sauce- My dish, absolutely heavenly! 
The others ordered a wide variety of things on the menu all of which they asked to make spicy. The food was great, the service was prompt, it was awesome!
author: shazia b.

description: Great food, friendly family owned and run restaurant.  My husband and I like to sit at the warm and cozy bar but the dining area is equally welcoming.  Would definitely recommend and plan on returning when in the city again.
author: Gwen K.

description: Truly the best Italian food I have ever had. My Freind who used to live in San Francisco recommended this. It's were all the locals choose to eat Italian. It's s must ..... Its very loud, but the ravioli and the pesto fettuccini are to die for. Also had some kind of egg soup that was like nothing I ever had. $200 for 4 of us and a bottle of wine. That included appetizers as well. Will definetly be back.
author: Carlos E.

description: I went here on fellow yelpers recommendations the other night. My fiance and I were greeted by a warm host who happened to be the owner. The waiter was very patient with us and didn't rush us the atmosphere was warm and friendly and the owner came over to recommend a bottle of wine which was FABulous! Love the gnocci.
author: Nikki M.

description: I came here with a large party of foodies and we were all happy and full. The service was great and food totally delivered.
author: Stacey C.

description:
I come here w/my family & family friends regularly so we're loyal to them. Their menu isn't very big, but I tend to stick to the same thing at restaurants anyways.  I always order the tortellini alla romana and it is pretty amazing. The cream sauce is really good, but I learned the hard way the first time they put wayy too much on so make sure to ask for them to put it on lightly unless you like your tortellini swimming in cream. The tortellini itself was great I loved the peas with prosciutto!
& the bruschetta is a must but one order is good-you'll want more though! it's soooo good! overall, the atmosphere is great, service is good, & food is is good, but not FABULOUS.
author: Holly G.

description:
Ate here tonight, party of eight. Took reservations (hooray). There is a little hidden parking lot "behind" in alley for $15 flat rate or down the street for $6 or metered parking (very hard to find). 

Really a nice atmosphere with waiters all speaking Italian or English with Italian accents. Friendly, warm waiter. Friendly warm host. A bit on the loud side with other parties talking; but, part of the warmth of the place. 

We ordered typical fare for the kids (penne with meatballs, butter with penne, spaghetti with meatballs) and the adults ordered linguine with clam and the seafood special.

We ordered the house wine. It was average - ok. The kids enjoyed their meals. The adults did not care for their dishes thinking that it was just ok or too salty. My dish, the daily seafood special, actually tasted like clam guts and was too salty. 

We spent about $230 including tip.

Would we go again? Probably not. Although we liked the atmosphere, the food was just average.
author: Cara H.

description: Another authentic Italian find in North Beach. I am an eggplant parmigiana freak, and the dish at Firenze is not heavy--really well cooked eggplant with tasty sauce and light mozzarela. The waiter was so friendly and attentive, and of course, 100% native Italian. The place is right around the corner from the convenient Vallejo parking garage (next to the Police station). Prices were reasonable for North Beach. Definitely will go back.
author: Ron P.

description: BEST Italian in all of SF.  Hands down.  No competition.  The gnocchi is little pillows of heaven on your tongue.  Phenomenal.  I could go on like this for hours, but I'll stop so you, who are reading this, can get off your computer and go try it yourself! :)
author: Hanna D.

description: This restaurant was recommended by an actor from the Beach Blanket Babylon show (another must) around the corner.  We were not disappointed. The server was comical and made us feel right at home.  Yes, the gnocchi melts in your mouth.  Two of us had that and one of us had the noodles and rabbit sauce which was a winner as well.  The chef  also made accommodations for dietary restrictions.  Just one item that was not up to a 5 star rating: the tomato and onion salad was amazingly tasty,  however, the tomatoes were not heirloom quality. But go and enjoy a wonderful dinner.
author: Pi B.

description: This place was recommended by the concierge at our hotel.  Prior to going we read mixed reviews on yelp.  We had a very good meal at what we considered a reasonable price.  The wait staff were very good. The food was very good. If you decide to go save room for the Peach Sorbet was out of this world.  Special orders are ok with them as everything is made to order. The dining area is accessible to wheelchairs. I would go here again!
author: Douglas B.

description:
