The very friendly staff makes for a nice experience. We took my wife's parent's here as her mom used to live in SF and wanted some north beach Italian.

While the ambiance and wine were good I have to say the food was a little above average. They are also not very lactose or vegetarian friendly though they were more than willing to make a modification to my dish to remove the cream.
author: Thomas P.

description:
This is truly as authentic to Italian as you can get.  Yes, it's in North Beach, so there's plenty of competition.  Let's begin with what I had.

The gnocchi is top notch as everyone has stated.  Not sure what award it received, but if there was  "JM" award, I would definitely give it to them.

Lumache Alla Rustica (Snails) is the best I've had hands down.   I've only had 2 other experiences, and this may have been my favorite dish of the night.

Pollo Con Funghi was exquisite.  It's only chicken but it's definitely a taste that I have not experienced before and am going to be having again when I come back.

The wine selection was pretty up to par with the rest of the places I've been to which is pretty good.  Our party of 5 went through 2 bottles of $80 Chianti which was recommended by our server.  Great recommendation!

I wish I remembered our servers name, an older Italian gentlemen.  Since I am not too familiar with the Italian words and their pronunciation, I wanted to do the "I'll just point to what I want" on the menu.  When I  pointed to the dish, our server pretended not to be able to see.  I made an attempt at saying the name, and he corrected me and had me say it the correct way.  He did it in a matter that was humorous and not in a belittling fashion.  He made my party felt like we were, how do I say, Family.

Overall, great food, great people, place is kinda small, but that made it seem more special.  Stop reading these reviews and go there, you'll find yourself back on Yelp raving about them like me.
author: JM C.

description:
This was pretty much fantastic, and as a lonely east coaster desperate for good Italian.  

I went with a friend and at the gnocchi.  We had good wine.  We had good service.  We had good appetizers.  What is there to complain about?

Nice ambiance, great service, delicious.  Enjoy.
author: Max A.

description:
Maybe i was expecting too much based on the reviews.  I went a little while back with a group of friends, i think there may have been 12 of us.  Good thing is that we were seated promptly, bad thing about our seating was that it was right by the kitchen door.  
 
I don't recall the food nor the service being exceptional only that they were fast and polite, but wouldn't you expect that from any sit down restaurant??

the other yelper was right about the antipasto being disappointing - cold cuts and marinated veggies, this is it?  really?  ok then...  

I ordered a chicken dish which was eh.  Good wine selection and a little set back from the rest of North Beach,so you get less of the kids bar hopping, but it was still difficult to find parking around these parts.  

I would say this is more suitable for a smaller group of 6 max.
author: Ella B.

description: Definitely overrated in my opinion. Buffalo Mozzarella (caprese) is nothing to brag about and the tomatoes bland. The gnocchi is not THAT great either. Nice staff, ok atmosphere.
author: Boris v.

description: Went there last Saturday night. Had the Osso Bucco and my tablemates had gnocchi, and a few pasta dishes. Everything was fabulous. Service was great. I will be back!
author: Que T.

description:
Wandering through North Beach, I was immediately drawn to this restaurant because of the name. After having studied in Florence, I have a deep affinity for Tuscan food and have not yet found anything in the States to be close. One of the waiters standing outside told me it was authentic Tuscan...and the menu had some good options, so I thought I'd give it a try. 

The atmosphere is quite lovely. It is simple and fresh, with a large mural of the Florence skyline on one wall. 

Initially, I was a bit put off by the waiter and host. As they seated my boyfriend and I, I could overhear them talking, in Italian (which I can understand), about how we were just "bambini." Thus, we were given no wine list until I asked. 

The wine, however, was very good, and there was a great selection (though overpriced as most restaurants are). 

The menu has some really tasty items on it- the ravioli della mamma was delicious, as was the gnocchi firenze. The tiramisu we had for dessert was quite good as well. 

Despite the condescension we felt from the wait staff- presumably because we look quite young- it was a pretty good experience. The food was delicious and well apportioned. It was very close to "authentic Tuscan," probably as close as a restaurant here can come. I do look forward to returning to try the ribollita and the papardelle toscana! (A return visit or 2 could redeem that other star perhaps, given an improved performance by the staff.)
author: Barbs J.

description:
After reading reviews from here, we've decided to come here with another couple friends. We sat down and noticed the cheesy decor and surroundings and yes, a very distinct Status of David wrapped with an Italian flag was in the corner. The host was very entertaining and hilarious when sitting us at our table.

Without hesitation, I ordered the gnocchi Firenze (award winner) of festivals in the past, bf and another friend ordered the daily special of chicken wrapped with proscuitto with spinach and brocolli. our friend's wife ordered the Fettuccine pesto which came in a huge portion and she had 3/4 of it to go. The gnocchi was delicious, great texture and the light tomato sauce was delicious. Bf's chicken was tender and very juicy....very flavorful.
We ordered the tiramisu which was kinda disappointing coz I was used to moist and nicely textured tiramisu however, our friends pointed out that Firenze uses cake(?) instead of lady's finger and the liquor was not quite Amaretto, I can't really tell what it was. Another setback was the lil insect/flying bug which keeps hovering over our friend's pesto dish....what's a lil insect doing in  the dining area?
author: Yan M.

description:
This place deserves the best rating for their food, service, and drinks. Yes, I am a fan!  

As soon as I walked in the bartender was super friendly. Normally the bartenders don't socialize with people that are not sitting at the bar. He directed us to the host and then we were seated no more than 2 mins. WOW! The bartender was cool, I told him I needed a drink cause I was dealing with my family, so he opt to give me a free shot of tequila. I took the shot like a champ and got myself a Tokyo tea. Loved it! The bartender made my drink super strong and which is always a good thing. 

The host was polite and seemed like he had a lot of things running through his head. We talked about how it was such a hectic night and were doing his best to accommodate anyone. This is always a good response to a customer. The guy was friendly even when we told him some of the people flaked on the last minute. The service was still great! 

The food, oh the food! Everything that my family got was extremely good. We all got different dishes and tried each and everyone. I couldn't decide what my favorite dish was cause they were all damn good. I will def come back with a different crowd. This place is perfect for a first date!
author: Lucky M.

description: We started the meal with beef carpaccio that was pretty good.  The award-winning gnocci in tomato cream sauce lived up to its status.  The gnocci was so light and soft, it practically melted in my mouth.  I think they actually have someone's 80 year old grandma that they kidnapped from the old country chained to the stove in the back.  Dinner Date had the special linguini tossed with clams, muscles, and scallops in a white wine sauce (within 10 minutes, there was nothing left on the plate).  The tiramisu was a bit too boozy for my taste; cappuccino was really good, and made correctly (which is rare).  Wine mostly by the bottle.
author: Denise K.

description: Excellent Italian restaurant. Reasonably priced with very tasty food and friendly staff. Highly recommend it !!
author: Scoot S.

description:
Tucked away on the border between Chinatown and North Beach, Firenze by Night is a charming place (complete with full wall length mural of florence and statue of David with strategically placed Italian flag).  I dined here with a neighbor friend before attending a birthday party in North Beach.  

Partook in a sausage stuffed mushroom as an appetizer - solid.  She had the gnocchi and loved it.  I'm not a huge gnocchi guy so opted for the mushroom risotto - good quality but I wasn't floored by it.

I agree with most of the comments about the service:  friendly in that warm Italian way.  Atmosphere is quaint and charming but can get noisy in the main dining room.
author: Simon N.

description:
Last night I ordered "to go" for my office and was able to try a lot of stuff.

Bruschetta - not bad for price I've had more developed tomato topping.  Almost tasted like they didnt finish it, was a tad watery and not salty enough.
Caprese - Not too shabby, tomato maybe no ripe enough, fresh basil and healthy cheese, and a dab of pesto and olive oil, no balsamic vinegar.
Ceasar Salad - unremarkable
Gnocchi - Very tasty, they call it their best, but i actually preferred-
Creamy Tortellini w/prosciutto - Sooooo good, very rich, tres delicious.
Spicy Penne - Sundried tomato base, not all that spicy, but good flavor.  
Pesto Fettucini - Pesto is unremarkable as well.
Bread - Came with a wheat bread (boring) but some foccacia-esque bread that was actually very good.  

I ordered 1.5 hrs in advance and when I arrived on time I waited another 20, which was kind of lame.  Didnt offer me water or anything while I waited, and portions werent sized as "family", as I was told over phone.  Might even give this a 2.5, but I'll give them the benefit of the doubt.  Also, had I eaten there, the atmosphere was very nice and more authentic than olive garden....
author: Grant B.

description:
I tried the Parpadelle(sp?) with rabbit sauce about 2/12 years ago and though it was great. I would have given this place a 4 star back then. 
Just went there recently(however, I also went to Florence recently) and I wasn't impressed by the food.

Decided to try something besides the Parpadelle.  There were two of us so we have the mushrooms caps with sausage, chicken soup with egg, special of the night: seafood linguine and also had the tortellini with prociutto.  The food was ok.  Nothing special about any of the dishes that impressed up. An Italian restaurant in NB, I expected a little more.  Maybe something closer to the food I had when I was in Florence.

Not sure if I am willing to go back again to try something else from the menu.
author: Will I A m.

description:
For all the time I have spent in North Beach, this was never a place I really noticed.  Walked by countless times on my way back to the parking garage, but it is easy to miss.  But that would be a big mistake!

Had a great dinner with friends here and everything was thoroughly enjoyable - and well priced!  The service is fantastic beginning with the bartender who seems like an old friend from the start to the Italian waiters (love the accent!). The food was fantastic.  The homemade gnocchi are deceptively light little pillows of yumminess.  Other pasta dishes and the specials are also quite tasty.  The veal ravioli special  was awesome!  Good wine selection - but why bother with anything other than Chianti when dining Italiano?
author: Danielle R.

description:
Well I hate to give this restaurant only 3 stars because for awhile it was my favorite Italian place (but then I discovered Milano!).  

I've been here 3 times.  It is a GREAT place for groups.  Two of the times I went here were for birthday dinners.  The service was pretty great for a group dinner on both occasions.  The bread was fresh, the entrees were out of this world and the whole dinner in general was reasonably priced.  The gnocchi is awesome.  My friend who had studied in Italy couldn't believe how authentic this place was.  But then I took my boyfriend there....

So the third time I went we sat up front.  The service was still pretty good.  I just felt like the waiter pushed us on appetizers/dessert and was kinda slimy.  The bread was not very good at all.  It tasted a day old.  Our appetizer was this stuffed mushroom thing and it was pretty good.  Both our entrees however were amazing once again.  I still do think this place is one of the best Italian restaurants in North Beach (that doesn't take too much though).  However, after I discovered Ristorante Milano, it'll be hard for me to come back (Unless it's a group event).
author: Rachel S.

description:
So here are my thoughts of this place, sorry if its a bit spastic...

I have to say this place has room for improvement. Service was a bit slow, and I believe all the waiters are Italian, so that was suppose to give it an authentic feel. The host and bartender were funny and supper nice. They has a cheesy backdrop of Italy, only wish the front was as cheesy.

Besides the decor and feel of the wait staff I have to give them 4 Stars for food. Watch out for the bread, ours was a bit hard! Make sure that someone orders the gnocchi, it is award winning, or whatever they mention on the menu, it was really the best gnocchi  I've ever tried. I went with the Ravioli, which was really good, but the next time I go, I will be all over the gnocchi!!!

Definitely worth a try and worth going back for. I docked off a star for the slow service and the bread!!
author: Olivia W.

description: Wonderful meal, amazing service. We will definitely be returning. Came in Saturday night with no reservation and were seated within a half hour. While waiting, we enjoyed a glass of wine at the bar, tended by the very entertaining Chris. Delicious tiramisu!
author: Jennifer G.

description: Food was terrific -- the gnocchi lived up to its reputation! And the owner/staff friendly and very attentive..when we called they found us a table at the time we needed and made us feel welcome immediately.
author: Rob E.

description: Came here with some friends before a night out. Pretty intimate restaurant, nice wait staff. Our server recommended the calamari appetizer which was surprisingly really good. The pasta I had was pretty good too -- overall pretty happy with the restaurant.
author: Shafaq C.

description:
This place was excellent!

Double points for being able to accommodate a reservation for 8 with only a day's notice..

Cute atmosphere with murals of Italy (?) on the wall, Michaelangelo's David, mood lighting, and an oldfashion-y make-up mirror/chair combo in the bathroom. 

Our order was promptly taken, bread (and replacement bread) were quick to be on the table, as were our water refills.

Started off with a half bottom of fizzy-wine, followed by a clam and mussels appetizer, finished off with the gnocci. All were delightful and delicious!!! Also: our friend had the lamb shank which i *highly* recommend!

The waiter was friendly and humorous. In the traditional manner, he took the ladies' orders first and allowed me to sample the wine instead of my bf. :) Points for him! When we mentioned that it was a friend's birthday, he brought us out a cake with a candle.

The prices were reasonable, especially if you share an entree (the helpings are fairly large). 

I loved that the crowd wasn't annoying and touristy considering we were more or less in North Beach. 

I would go back!!!
author: Kristi D.

description: Great service, good food. Don't remember too many of the particulars of either of my visits here, but both times I came with a group of people and I do remember that everyone was satisfied with both the service and the food. Will come here again and attempt not to order as many bottles of wine...
author: Daffodil K.

description:
This place is fantastic.  The best Italian I have had in San Francisco (or all of Northern California).  I am from the Northeast, where good Italian food is everywhere.  Not so in California.  I have searched.  I have spent hordes of money and nothing else has compared to Firenze by Night.
Weeknight - no wait, lovely atmosphere (Bar filled with customers also eating).
Host and servers speak Italian (and of course English).
Their wines are pricey, but the food is amazing, especially for the price.
Bruschetta - fresh, great tomatoes
Gnocchi Firenze - how in the world one can make gnocchi so light and soo creamy at the same time is AMAZING.
Papardelle in rabbit sauce - earthy flavors, a great combination without anything overpowering the subtle fusion.
Tartufo dessert - delicious and the caramelized hazelnuts added great flavor and texture.
We also had a glass of wine and coffee All for around $65.00 - 2 people!!

You cannot go wrong here!
author: Erin B.

description:
The touristy Firenze by Night certainly is filled to the ceiling with Italian restaurant cliches, yet that is one of the main reasons why I like it so much. The cheesy decor is delightful, and gives the place a fun atmosphere. The food is actually pretty tasty and filling, the wine list not too expensive. Our enthusiastic Italian waiter was charming, and the overall service was just fine.

North Beach is generally notorious for having just OK food at exorbitant prices, accompanied by hostile and pretentious service, yet Firenze by Night successfully avoids falling into either of these stereotypes. My meal there was very enjoyable, Even though this restaurant may not tout the most amazing cuisine in North beach, it definitely enables you to ENJOY your meal more any other restaurant in the area.

This is a great place for a satisfying meal that will leave you with a smile on your face.
author: Aaron J.

description: Based on my experience, everything about this restaurant is very good: nice ambiance, very good food, very good service, very reasonable prices (I think) for the North Beach neighborhood. For me to give a restaurant 5 starts, the food either has to knock my sox off or offer amazing value for the price (i.e., deliver on the "wow" factor), and Firenze By Night didn't quite rise to that level, but I was very happy with my meal, and definitely I would go back again. We had one order of the Gnocchi, one order of the Fettuccine Pesto, and one Insalata Di Spinaci (warm spinach salad) as an appetizer that we split, and all were very good. Service was prompt and courteous. The strong Italian accent put on by our waiter seemed a bit over the top, but hey, it did add a little fun and amusement to our dining experience. Whether you're in the neighborhood for a show (Club Fugazi and Beach Blanket Babylon are right around the corner) or just for the fun of it, this restaurant is a fine place to dine.
author: Dan L.

description:
This place was easily one of the best Italian restaurant experiences I have had since moving away from near the American Mecca of old Italian restaurants (the NY/NJ area).  Finding good Italian food is far too hard to find in CA in general, and SF in particular.  There's certainly a lot of bad ones around Columbus that are just fake tourist traps.  This one is not.

Note this place is also not a modern Italian-American fusion style place that many people expect now when they think of an "Italian" restaurant (especially here), which I suspect is the reason why some reviewers don't like it.

5 Stars for those who appreciate old school good high Italian food.  For those who know only modern fusion, fuhgedaboudit.
author: David B.

description:
I went here for my birthday last night. I had made a reservation and even changed it and they were very accommodating. We were seated promptly and were asked our drink order fast as well. The place was very busy and seamed to be a great experience. We ordered wine and bruchetta. We were given bread while we wait. It took 20 min to get our wine. Then we had to ask for more bread, which they said they weren't sure they had, but then it miraculously appeared. Next thing we know our meals arrive. They totally forgot the bruchetta. And when my dish arrived they left out the chicken. Then I had to wait another 20 min to get my dinner. By the time I got it everyone else was almost done. The server apologized but never apologized about the bruchetta. Then, at the end of the night, messed up how we paid and almost over charged us $40.  Glad we noticed it or we would have walked out without catching it.

I have to say that the food itself was absolutely amazing. Very delicious. I would definitely go back, despite the problems. I truly chalk it up to BAD SERVICE. If you go, make sure you don't get Robert Vickers. I think he was just not paying attention or something because it was really bad service.... 

Thanks!
author: Josh G.

description: Went with grandma and our 23 yo daughter.  Everybody loved the meal, the wine and the service.  They missed on nothing!  Carpaccio was to die for.  Gnocchi were perfect.  Veal was prepared to perfection.  The tiramisu was a great ending.  The service was perfect.  What more can I say.  We are already talking about our next visit.
author: Michael F.

description:
Likely the best place for authentic Italian in the city for 2009. To be fair I have a dull pallet so I love most of what I shove down there. But the service here is homely and personal. Sergio and his son, Paulo, will make you feel like you're one of the boys; they run a taut ship, balancing class and taste with affordability and service. The bartender's got a good swing going too. 

Great place for a date or to soak down a quick whiskey. Hell, it's a great place to take anyone in essentially any circumstance. 

Tourism takes over the city but the heart beat remains in places like this. I've eaten Italian all around the town but here is where my heart is. Excellente, per sempre..
author: Nate L.

description:
Excellent. If I had a better word, I'd use it.  food / service / ambiance / cleanliness. A must see/stop. Make a reservation. 

Firenze -the city - is my favorite place and now I have an equiv. restaurant in North America. 

My wife is Roman, we've eaten in many fine restaurants in Italy (Firenze, Milano, Catania and of course Rome). There is no better gnocchi, anywhere. 

Feb 3/11

Ciao
author: David T.

description: This is my favorite Italian Restaurant in the city. If I crave Italian, I go to Firenze. I am in love with the gnocchi. I also had a very fresh and delicious seafood pasta. The price is right and the food wins my stomach. I definitely plan to frequent this spot more often.
author: Helen L.

description:
The gnocci is excellent but if you get the chance, try the veal stuffed ravioli.  I know it's baby cow but that baby is delicious.

Great for groups.  My friends and I celebrated a birthday here recently and had a party of 10.  Our service was better than most places I've been in the city....the waiter wasn't bad to look at either ;P

My only complaint - bathrooms.  They need more.
author: Erin H.

description:
I love living near North Beach! Everyone says it is a tourist trap but there are still plenty of pretty good Italian restaurants- and this was definitely one of them. I was with a big party for a birthday and we were seated right away for our reservation time.  There were some other big parties here too (including some sort of bridal party!) and there were still plenty of seats. 

Everyone in my party had good food. We had a lot of gnocchis in the group since the menu claims it is an "Award Winner!!!".  I had the Penne allo Zenzero w/ Sun Dried Tomatoes, Garlic and Shallots.  I'd don't think I've ever had shallots be a main ingredient in a dish like this and boy was it delicious! It was a little spicy too, just the way I like it! 

The pastas were in the 12 dollar range, which is always fine for my cheap little self!  Fellow yelper, Beah B. was there that night as well and I'm hoping she enjoyed her meal too!
author: Jess K.

description:
Read the reviews and should have listened to my instinct. The mood and atmosphere didn't disappoint in the boisterous environment. That being said, that was the most enjoyable part of the evening. We both had different pasta. The food was bland and over priced. The standard wines were something that you might get from the grocery store on sale. The parmesan isn't fresh, it was canned and processed, odd for an authentic Italian restaurant. It seems that they might still be living off their laurels of success from years ago. 

My advice, try the place across the street. There's several... Certainly not a destination Italian dinner.
author: ILiveForFlavor A.

description: I can't speak for the food, but I can assure you that the drinks are fantastic, especially if Chris is bar tending. I love it because it feels like San Francisco inside (the kind I grew up with). Not this relatively new  yuppie-afied, hipster distorted reality charging  too much for food and drinks that won't make a dent in your appetite. Thank you Firenze for keeping it real.
author: Michelle K.

description:
We went to Firenze because of friend's recommendation and I wasn't disappointed.  It was a little hard to find if you were driving so we drove right pass it and didn't even realize it.  After finding a spot, which was not an easy task in North Beach, we walked to the restaurant.  
We were greeted by a host and was seated right away (I've made a reservation.)  They have a full bar, as well as a pretty good wine list.  We started out with a couple of cocktails and the stuffed mushrooms.  They were really good and the gravy that came with them was quite yummy.  Then we split a Caesar salad.  For the main course, I opted for the homemade wide noodles with rabbit sauce.  I've never had rabbit and it wasn't bad.  My boyfriend had the linguine and clams and from the look of it, he really enjoyed it.  Our waiter also helped us pick our wines to go with the entrees and they turned out beautifully.  The dessert was good, nothing very special.  
Overall experience was great.  Waiter was attentive.  Glasses were never empty of water.  Drinks were strong from the bartender.  Will go back with friends for sure.
author: Wikki Y.

description: Charming authentic Italian in North Beach. Nothing like those fuddy duddy Italian wanna-be's ... this is the real deal. The decor leaves something to be desired, and at times it can get a little warm in the restaurant. But you can't beat the authentic delicious Italian food. Hands down the best homemade Italian in the City.
author: Karolyn M.

description:
This place is awesome!  I've been to North Beach numerous times for great Italian food and Firenze by Night is always one of the places you walk by and it's always packed, but you've never taken the chance to go in.  We finally ended up here one night and LOVED it.  The bar tender, Chris, was great-- within 2 minutes of waiting for our table he recommended a great bottle of wine (cheaper than the one we had picked out), 10 F-Bombs were dropped and needless to say we were bummed once our table was ready and we had to go to our table. 

The food was nothing short of delicious.  The appetizers (recommended by Chris) were great!  The stuffed mushrooms are a must and you can't go wrong with any pasta.  The cheesecake was also amazing--good, not too rich, perfection!  

This place looks super cheesy (little Italy New York style), but it's definitely worth a stop the next time you're in the area.  Where else can you get a double cheeked kiss from the chef upon leaving...and that was for my fiancee, not me!  We'll be back in no time!
author: Katie T.

description:
There was good, there was not so good, there was ugly. 

This place was really an old-school joint with decent prices and a nice waitstaff that was fairly attentive. It's the kind of place I could imagine my mobster grandpa patronizing (maybe he did?), and was very american-italian old school authentic. We really enjoyed the atmosphere: it's tucked away on a side street in an unassuming building, but the interior is really fun, with frescos on the ceiling. 

The Good: My sweetheart said that the gnocci were like little potato clouds in his mouth  - the best he had ever had. He says, they deserve their 5-star, award wining reputation. I had the veal with what appeared to be a creamy basil sauce, and what I hoped was not made with roux. 

The Not so Good: We had the melon with prosciutto which was good, but sort of bland. It had never had this before but was keen to try it. It was even featured in photos on the webpage! I was disappointed because I felt like I could have cut up melon and laid prosciutto on it at home and saved myself the time and money. 

The Ugly: Even though the dining room was beautiful and well decorated, it was packed on a Wednesday night at 9pm, and it. is. small. The couple in the table next to us finished their meal, and then three other people (The owners? Friends?) came and stood at their table and talked to them. Oh, I mean YELLED AT THE TOP OF THEIR LUNGS IN ITALIAN FOR AN HOUR. Because apparently Italian can only be spoken at the top of one's voice. Oh yeah, EVERYONE ELSE IN THE RESTAURANT HAD TO YELL TO BE HEARD TOO. Not exactly the romantic atmosphere we were planning on. 

Gluten Free Review: Seeing as it was an italian restaurant and our waiters seemed to be of the old-school, italian speaking type, I didn't even try. I knew that they probably wouldn't know what I was talking about. I took a chance on the veal with the cream sauce, and it turned out to be gluten-free (whew!), but not everyone is as brave as I am. I wouldn't recommend taking your celiac sweetheart here unless you want to accidentally poison her. Oh, and unless YOU ENJOY PEOPLE YELLING IN ITALIAN DURING YOUR MEAL TOO :)
author: Rebecca H.

description:
First off... I have to say I only gave a 3 because the service was beyond believable! I mean... the waiter is just ridiculously RUDE!!!!!!

I went there on Sept 27th, 08! it was my birthday.. and I searched on Yelp to find a nice good restaurant to eat for my birthday! since my experience last year was all that nice too! and I came across this restaurant with very good review! so I called and made a reservation! 

I arrived at the restaurant right on time for my reservation at 815 but... no one was at the stand! and plenty of people were waiting to check in! but there was this guy walking around and not checking us in! (later on I found out he was the owner) but he was really friendly.. he finally checked us in and gave us a table right away!  although I didn't find the table that nice.. since.. I didn't get to sit next to my bf cuz.. they had a seat from another table occupying part of our table! but I was fine with that.. since... they were busy! in my mind at that time... was... as long as the food is good!

We ordered our food.. but the waiter did not recommended anything for us... nor did he give us any bread!!!! until we asked! He never serve us anything... except our entree... but I see that he served other tables!... for example.... we asked for some bread... he would asked the busboy to serve the bread... when we asked for some drink... the busboy hand us the drinks.... when we asked for some cheese... he would ask the busboy to serve us the cheese on our entree... We would tell how different he was treating the other customers at the other table better than at our table!!!! I have to make this assumption... that he was being absolutely RACIST! because we were asian! there was this other table with asians too.. and it's still the same... 

Let's talk about the food... we ordered Snails for appentizer..... I love garlic and they put so much garlic in there that made me LOVE this dish..!!! and the sauce can be used to dip the bread too!! 1 dish... 2ways to eat it! hahaha..  I ordered Linguine with Fresh Calms... It was GOOD!!! My bf ordered the Pappardelle toscana... he didnt' like it that much because the pasta... since the pasta is the thick kind... but I had a taste of it.. and I thought it was pretty good... the sauce was good.. the other 2 orders was Vitella con porcini and Penne mare e monti.. they were good too.... We were happy with the food... but just not the service... 

At the end... one of us talked to the owner.. and he gave us a 60% discount for our next visit.. but... I think i still need to recover from this experience first then.. I will decide if I want to eat there again...
author: Carol H.

description:
my all time favorite Italian restaurant in san francisco. if your looking for amazingly authentic food, great wine and spectacular service don't venture anyways else but frienze!

the gnocchi melts in your mouth and you leave not feeling gross and heavy (like some gnocchi meals) but like you are napping on a cloud of savory goodness. 

it does tend to be a little nosy, but that makes it even more Italian!
author: nikki b.

description: I really love this place. I'll tell you what I REALLY love about this place, though. Have you ever craved a fountain diet coke before? Not a can, not a bottle, but fountain. It's amazing here!!! No joke, I am well aware this is an Italian restaurant, but I had to comment, it's incredible! The food is good too, I am a relatively picky eater and they actually create the dish I request when I go in there (not that it's a difficult dish to throw together, but still!) I'd say, if you are looking for a decent priced, non-touristy Italian place in North Beach, give this place a shot.
author: Sara L.

description: I've been hearing good things about this restaurant for awhile and finally went. The gnocchi is suppose to be their signature dish but I thought it was ok. I have to say the seafood pasta was excellent. The sorbet is a must after dinner.
author: Mary L.

description: If you like Tuscan cooking this is the place because it showcases Medici dishes and other Fiorenti recipes.
author: Roger H.

description:
I am a local, therefore a bit harder to please when it comes to authentic Italian dishes. If I could give 6 stars I would, never have I had a more flavorful Petrale Sole. This is the 2nd best fish dinner I have ever eaten in life, 2nd only to the brioche crusted salmon I had @ Spago Las Vegas in 1998. 
The service here is STELLAR, I barely finished speaking my order and viola! It appeared, be it a cocktail, appetizer, piping hot entree, or dessert, our water was constantly refilled as was the bread (this is muy importante as I'm a carb-a-holic) Considering we ate here 8ish on a busy Thursday night I was extremely impressed with the attention to detail by the ENTIRE STAFF! 
The owner came over numerous times (as did his son) to make sure every thing was to our satisfaction, I don't speak with my mouth full, so, I nodded my head vigorously as not to miss a moment of this amazing meal! I can say this has been the best month for my taste buds in I don't even know how long. Thank you Sergio & Paolo for the amazing finale to a month of some of the finest Italian food around the Bay area! Your establishment takes first place in San Francisco. 
I'll bring you a gold medal next time I'm there ;-)
author: Courtney D.

description:
I love this place so much! Every time I go up to the city I eat here. The staff us amazing and the food is awesome! 

One time I was sick when I went here and the bartender made me a special drink to make me feel better! So sweet!
author: Liz K.

description: This is one of the best Italian places in North Beach.  The service is great and the servers are true Italians.  I found the place randomly and have been going ever since.  The gnoochi is amazing and so are many other dishes.  The service I feel is the best part of going to Firenze by Night they are amazing!!
author: Hillary B.

description: Solid, solid, delicious, and affordable. What more can I say? Came here for multiple occasions including my birthday. The atmosphere in the dining area makes you feel like  you are always a tourist in SF and I mean that in a good way. The service staff is reliable and not too bad on the eyes as well.  If you want to ever have a group dinner and are uncertain about your guests' preferences in terms of food, atmosphere, or trendiness - Firenze somehow is able to accomodate and satisfy all types of people. Love it - 5 stars.
author: Trishna P.

description:
I've come here a couple times with a large party and they've always been excellent accommodating us.  Plus there's a parking garage around the corner.

The foods is consistently good. My favorites are the mushroom risotto and the calamari giusti. 

The chef is super friendly and the waiters are helpful.
author: Richie L.

description: My favorite Italian restaurant by far in the city (and I'm a local).
author: Jennifer M.

description: Dinner on a Wednesday night, so no wait (!)  Server was very professional and the food was really good.  I had the wild mushroom fettuccine...soooo good.  I highly recommend it, very simple, yet delicious.  I also tired the tortellini and the eggplant Parmesan, both tasty.  I would go back.
author: Autumn C.

description: I went here about 6 months ago and i swear to god i dream about the gnocchi every night. I am about to beg my boyfriend to take me back ths friday.
author: A. H.

description: Delicious, delicious, delicious.  Great service, great atmosphere. The total package.  We were pleasantly surprised at the Northern Italian style cuisine.  Just like my husband grew up with.  We'll definitely go again.
author: Pamela P.

description: I've been here at least a dozen times and never had a bad experience.  The food is amazing and the staff friendly and professional.  My friend and I were even offered free drinks because we were willing to wait at the door on a particularly busy night even though we had reservations (which I would recommend calling ahead for if you plan to go on the weekend).  Wonderful place!  One of my favorites in the City.
author: Jessica S.

description:
* * * * * 
Firenze is golden..

It is the type of place you can go to on any given night and have a great time because it is made golden by its management, which has an unbeatable sense of humor and hospitality that is truly classic.    

In addition, Firenze has everything else I could desire:  delicious food, beautiful ambiance, and outstanding service.  

Sergio uses ingredients so awesome that every time I order something it's like I've never tasted it before, and everyone there has a great attitude.
 
When I went through a rough patch and the recession had me down, Firenze was one of my favorite places to go to for all these reasons.  These guys are the best. 

Try the Gnocchi!

Sincerely, 

David Paoli
author: David P.

description: The ambiance here was wonderful and so was the food! Our server was extremely friendly and joked with us. The pasta is made at the restaurant so come here hungry! I got the angel hair pasta with tomato basil sauce and it was heavenly. The merlot is very good and so was the cheesecake. Doesnt get much better!
author: Shannon G.

description: Great food! Loved the pesto feteccuine and Gnocci was amazing.
author: Jaime K.

description:
I've eaten at Firenze probably a hundred times,  maybe more, and I've never had a bad meal. Their gnocchi is superb, the pappardelle ala Toscana (rabbit sauce) is, too. Ensalata estiva never fails to please and they have the best tiramisu that I've ever tasted in or out of Italy. From time to time another menu item will be exceptional but mostly they're just consistently good. 

Owner/maitre d' Sergio Giusti is charming and the rest of the staff, from the bartender to the busboys, is professional, friendly and caring. I would never bother to eat at another Italian restaurant in San Francisco; certainly not one in the North Beach area.

Don't go, though, if you want a truly quiet dinner. Diners at Firenze emjoy themselves out loud!
author: Dick M.

description:
I'm thankful for the parking garage around the corner.  However, after the bartender insisted on a bottle of wine recommended by the manager in the very well-tailored "pimp-stripe" suit...I knew my friend and I weren't driving anywhere.  After that bottle and a few offers for free drinks from a table of men across the restaurant, we were hardly equipped to walk unassisted, let alone drive.

My dinner friend had spent a year in Naples and once she revealed that her pretty face could also communicate in beautiful, melodious Italian, we were constantly flocked and fawned upon by adoring servers.  I've discovered the fixins to a perfect evening out - find a native speaker of the restaurant's mother country, make sure he/she is attractive, sit and smile and nod along.  Eat/drink perks as they appear.  Life is tough for the sidekick.  Ohhh yesss.

Our judgment wine-impaired or not, the food whore side of us had to be pleased before we could endorse the restaurant.  The verdict - startling authenticity - in presentation and flavor as well as atmosphere.  Bravo.
author: Denise P.

description:
Came upon this resturant by accident. It is absolutly mine as well as my boyfriends favorite spot.
Great food, great serive, very romantic, reasonably priced.
author: Stephanie M.

description: One of the fancier places in North Beach. I went with someone from Florence, and I was really glad he spoke Italian because our servers didn't speak much English. I had some amazing rabbit pasta. The dishes were heavier than what I would usually expect, but very good.
author: Monika M.

description:
This was a great place to have a nice dinner. Definitely not an upscale restaurant - just a cute, nice place with good food and good service.

The gnocchi was by far in the top 3 of the best I've ever had, while the prosciutto with melon was pretty good, but not great. The drinks were strong, however, which is always a good thing in my books.

Don't come here expecting a mind-blowing food experience, or expecting a really fresh, modern environment. If you're looking for a really good dinner though, I highly recommend it.
author: Chris S.

description:
Best eggplant. Great restaurant. You can make a reservation. We were lucky and walked in a got a table right away. 

Looking forward to going back.
author: Leslie S.

description: This place reminded me a lot of being in little Italy in NYC. It is a small little crowded restaurant that seems to be family run and has a sky painted on the ceiling. Delightful atmosphere for enjoying a good glass of red wine and some pasta. I got the ravioli della mamma and it was great. Everything other people were eating looked great too. And the service was fantastic, loved our waiter. All in all, it was great. I wish I knew where places like this were in Chicago...
author: Lesley G.

description:
I luuurrvve gnocchi.  It's my litmus test for pasta.  Good gnocchi is like an out of body religious experience involving fluffy pillow-y pasta in a simple sauce that plays off the delectable starchiness of the potato complex without weighing it down in excessive salt or grease.  Bad gnocchi is like rocks dropping down your gullet.  Since gnocchi is so rich in its starch level, a light marinara usually does it for me, any cream sauces are so overwhelming that I usually go into a food coma mid bite.  Needless to say, the gnocchi were light & fluffy & the marinara with a touch of cream highlighted the starchy goodness of the gnocchi.  I'm so addicted I can't seem to try anything else when we come here.  Capt Hook loves a cooked down sauce & is enamored of the Pappardelle toscana.  Slightly chewy wide ribbons of pasta with a savory, tangy, rabbit ragù.  Sometimes the sauce seems to be thinner than others but when it's dense & cooked down, yum!

The staff are efficient & professional if not very personable.  Much preferable to Johnny squatting down next to you to invade your personal space & see how many fillings your molars are sporting.  The decor is campy but I'm all about the food.  Always seem to find some other friendly guests to chat with or share foodie spots which is priceless.
author: Cam T.

description:
Good food, nice and professional waiters, decent prices.

I, like many before me, tried their gnocchi and I thought it was pretty good.

Only complaint I can think of is that the dessert was to sweet...but hey, you can never have it all, now can you? ;P
author: Pastor Z.

description: I had a fantastic meal with my wife after seeing the King Tut exhibit.  Every course was melt in your mouth.  It was the best dining experience I have had in several years and I highly recommend this restaurant.  I also recommend reservations and an earlier time, as it is near "Beach Blanket Babylon" performances and they get a lot of this crowd.
author: Jeff S.

description: I've been to Firenze by Night a total of 4xs.  The previous 3 visits would have been 3 to 3.5 starts.   Pretty disappointed this visit.  We were seated in a back corner.  Very tight accommodations.   I felt like a switch had been flipped when my friend didn't order wine or a drink.   I felt rushed from then on.   The fettaccini pesto was good - not great.
author: Adriann D.

description: Restaurant was very crowded with several large parties. It was LOUD. We could barely talk to one another at our table. Our server did a great job taking care of us. He was clearly very busy with the large groups, but he made extra efforts.  Sadly, food was just ok. Had the tortellini and prosciutto. Very blah and almost no flavor. Even the prosciutto was bland.
author: D L.

description: Like Jennifer L, every major visitor to SF or event warrants a trip to Firenze by Night. The food is amazing, wine flowing, and the service is fantastic. It really feels authentically Italian, and the ambiance with their lighting certainly helps! Highly recommend the gnocchi and prawns with tomato sauce...mmm.
author: Kelly B.

description: One of my North Beach favorites.  Just a few steps off of Columbus. I had walked by many times and saw that it was always busy and filled with locals...always a good sign.  It's old school Italian restaurant - decor, waiters, patrons etc. Best of all...the food is solid!
author: Charlie B.

description: love this place. the gnocchi is by far the best in the city... and i've sampled many a gnocchi in sf! friendly service, run by a charming italian family, and great at accommodating large groups. everyone absolutely loved their food.. from the mushroom chicken, ravioli in cream sauce, and artichoke chicken, everything was delicious. we'll def be back.
author: Kelly N.

description:
I wish i could of experienced this restaurant because i hear very good things about it but unfortunately a man was very rude/short when i asked how long the wait would be. He gave me a shoo go away gesture with his hands and said i dont know. Acting like i was bothering him. I think he was a waiter and not the actual host but in any case he didnt have to be rude. Granted, yes, it was busy, but like other italian restaurants in the area, despite being busy, they are very nice when taking your name or answering a question. If he can't the heat of a busy restaurant, he shouldnt be a waiter because he was a mess.  I know how the italian restaurant scene is in the neighborhood, as i live close by, and i've had great experiences. The great italian restaurants have amazing staff and this guy just set a bad impression. 

I'll update this review eventually as I will be back sometime soon. I was just mind boggled by his treatment when i have other experiences to compare it by.
author: Jesse O.

description: Nice place with friendly staff. Food was good we had the shrimp and calamari pasta. Lemon saus was very good. Place can use a small make over though
author: Marco G.

description: Firenze by Night was one of the first North Beach Italian restaurants we ate in back in the 90's and we have eaten there several times over the years.  We thought it was great then; but, with so many restaurants to chose from, we hadn't been there for a while.  We decided to eat there again this trip and we still think it's great.  They serve one of my favorite pasta dishes called Penne Allo Zenzero which is made with sun dried tomatoes, garlic and shallots.  I was all fired up for that when we got there; but, the seafood special was Petrale Sole.  Another favorite; so, I went with that instead.  I was not disappointed.  It was cooked perfectly and the sauce was so good that I cleaned the plate with onion foccacia bread they provided when we sat down.  My wife had the seafood linguine, the pasta special.  It was good; but a little rich for her taste.  It had a lot of salmon and not enough clams, mussels, shrimp and calamari.  Anyway, the food and service is good and the ambiance is nice.  The dining room is small; so, the tables are close together.  I guess you can call it intimate.  I say go, you'll like it.
author: Bill M.

description: I had an outstanding dinner here this evening.  Started with Ribollita (vegetable soup) and had Saltimboca for the main entre, ended with coffee and lemon sorbet.  Nice ambiance, very good food, and waiters that obviously enjoy what they do.  The soup was hot and very flavorful.  The Saltimboca - portion was very reasonable and served with broccoli and potatoes.  Execellent taste; I would order it again!  Definietely one of the better italian restaurants in San Francisco and very reasonable prices!  I'll be back!
author: Clint L.

description:
we had the gnocchi and a chicken/artichoke special, wilted spinach salad, calamari appetizer, tiramisu, and vino.

it was all pretty good. from the yelpers rants and raves we sorta expected a little better...but it was good and we enjoyed ourselves.

in my mind, i'm hoping their other award winning dish...noodles in rabbit sauce....was cooked by rabbits. my friends assured me it's possible, that the movie ratatouille proved it. :)
author: Donna K.

description: I have been here over a dozen times for a number of different occasions and each time is Fantastic.  The gnocci is excellent and the sauce never ahs too much tomatoe.  SImple things like minestone soup are done very well.  Veal dishes are excellent as well.  Stop in but be sure to call before.
author: Jimmy M.

description: true italian style restaurant and has a sense of humor lol
author: Linda A.

description: My friends and I had an terrific meal when we visited SF back in June, so I had to return while in town again for business.  The atmosphere is lively, the decor is warm and totally unpretentious.  I started with the warm spinach salad with bacon and pine nuts, and I've got to say that this is pretty close to being the best spinach salad to hit my belly.  The spinach leaves were still firm (not wilty) and the dressing was the perfect blend of vinegar and hint of sweet.  I couldn't decide between the gnocchi and the linguine with mussels and shrimp, so our server suggested we get a plate of gnocchi to share between the four of us.  Brilliant idea!  Prego!  My entire crew was in pasta euphoria.  The soft gnocchi melted in our mouths bursting with delicious goodness.  If I wasn't in a public place, I would have licked that plate clean.    The linguine with mussels and shrimp in white wine sauce had the right amount of garlic in the sauce.  This was exactly what I needed after the heavy gnocchi as it was a beautiful light sauce with perfectly al dente linguine.  By the end of our meal, the four of us thought we could have a bite of something sweet.  That was not the case....we were in a food coma.  Grazie!  God, I love this place!
author: Beth H.

description: True Italian Food by Italians in a small, very clean, and attractive setting, a North Beach Classic.
author: Joseph B.

description: My wife & I had dinner at Firenze by night, owner/chef Sergio Giusti created a Master Piece plate of pasta, my wife ordered Gnocchi Firenze ( smoothest, mouth watering potato dumplings with tomato & cream sauce and a touch of basil, i ordered Rigatoni Toscana, large tubular pasta in rabbit sauce. There was a award on the wall it read: "So Italian, you need a passport" - HerbCaen.....we will be back
author: Joe B.

description: I had no idea how popular this place is. Maybe it was because it was a Friday. However, I can say that the food is very good. I love the panorama of Florence against one of the walls. The wine list is relatively good and so are the pastas. My only qualm is that for some relatively simple dishes, they charge far too much. Pasta + tomato sauce and basil is not the most challenging pasta dish; charging $15 is a bit much. Service-wise, our server was nice enough, but the host was missing when we entered and the standing area is awkward and uncomfortable.  The overall experience was nice, but not excellent.
author: Veronica W.

description: I was brought up in an Italian household, so when I say my family and I love this restaurant it means a lot. Paulo and all the other staff always make us feel right at home. I have tried many different dishes on the menu and I have been pleasantly surprised every time. My favorite dishes would have to be the Gnocchi Firenze, and the Petto di Cappone..... Delizioso!!!!! In my opinion if you do not like this restaurant you do not know what real Italian food is and you should stick to Olive Garden. For everyone else BUON APPETITO!
author: S E.

description: Just had dinner at the restaurant and loved it! Great food and a warm and attentive staff!  Thank you fellow yelpers for pointing me in the right direction! I definitely recommend it!
author: Dorothy T.

description:
Firenze by Night Ristorante is now one of my favourite restaurants in San Francisco!  Let me tell you why!

This past September I spent many months searching for an affordable, quality restaurant in San Francisco that would be able to accommodate a group of 20 to 28.  This was not an easy task!  Most restaurants I inquired at either could not or would not accommodate such a large group.  Many were rude when I called to inquire!  And the few that could take our group were either too expensive, or too "funky" for the kind of event I was planning.  So finally I posted on one of the Yelp forums and Firenze by Night was one of the suggestions.  I did a bit of research and then I called the restaurant.  Everyone at Firenze was very nice!  They were easily able to accommodate our group and even called to confirm a few days before.  They reserved the special back room for us, which was lovely.  They also gave us the option of placing orders in advance, or ordering at the restaurant.  We chose the later, and they happily accommodated our wishes.  As an extra benefit, I pleased to find that there were a couple of inexpensive late-night parking garages within a block of the restaurant, so no one would have to worry about trying to find street-parking on a busy Friday night.  One of my friends went to Firenze before the night of our event, and reported that the food and service were excellent, which of course was encouraging.  

When my guests arrived at the restaurant on our chosen day, they were immediately greeted and offered drinks at the bar.  When I arrived they took us all to the back room and offered us appetizers while we waited for all our guests to arrive.  They cheerfully served drinks, and when two guests couldn't make it, they re-arranged the tables for us to accommodate our new group size.  They did an excellent job of serving all our food - for 24 guests - nice and hot at the same time!  They let us stay late and were very respectful of our entire group, and even went out their way to accommodate our tired six-year-old.  They were especially respectful of me, the young host, and continually checked in with be about our tab and how I would like to time dinner and desert, etc.

So, the customer service was exceptional, but just as importantly... so was the food!  Between the 24 of us we sampled the menu thoroughly, and not one of our guests had a single complaint!  In fact, everyone was so pleased that several of my guests later told me that they subsequently took out-of-town guests to Firenze, because they knew it was sure to be a good experience for everyone!

I can't recommend Firenze highly enough.  I was just about to give up on finding a great, affordable restaurant with delicious good that could accommodate such a large group, and Firenze came through better than I could have expected.  So visit Firenze with confidence, and let them earn another great review!  :)
author: Jai K.

description: We went there on a rainy Saturday night and found it to be already packed with local diners. Didn't have reservation but since there were only 2 of us, it was quick for us to get seated. Food is good, service is affectionate and atmosphere is lively! I think some of their servers are Italians. Must-try!
author: Joie T.

description: A friend found this restaurant on yelp.  It was an excellent experience to share the wonderful food and wine at this restaurant.  They have a great list of specials to choose from for the evening.  They also have great wines.  Surprisingly, this did not feel touristy, but more like a neighborhood restaurant.  You won't be disappointed!!
author: Jaimie O.

description: Blatantly homophobic patrons and staff--I would never patronize that restaurant again. There is no excuse for the staff to engage customers in their own homophobic gestures at the expense of others' dining experience. Keep your homophobic thoughts to yourself--though I feel sorry for you for having them.
author: Alyssa T.

description: Food is really good but I'm not digging the atmosphere. It's dark, it's crowded, it's stuffy, and service was a bit slow.
author: Jonas T.

description: Nice restaurant start to finish.  I'm not a huge fan of gnocchi, but the gnocchi at Firenze seemed very well-made.  All around, the cooking tasted more like real Italian than most Italian restaurants in America.  Would definitely go back.
author: Anonymous P.

description: You want fancy Italian food?  Go somewhere else.  But if you want true Italian home cooking, this is the place to be.  We came here for our holiday party and my boss, being Sicillian knows her Italian food and wine.  The veal marsala was off the wall good.  The meat was moist and the sauce excellent.  Then there is the halibut.  It was just great!  It retained the fresh taste and yet it was not overcooked.  The fish was soft and buttery.  My sister had the pork chops and she loved it.  I think the secret is all in the sauce.  It made everything taste better!  We ended our night w/ the peach sorbet and it was just so pretty.  They froze the peaches from the summer and stuffed the sorbet into the hollowed peaches.  what a nice touch!!   A must try in the North Beach area.
author: AhLin C.

description: Firenze by Night is a quaint Italian neighborhood restaurant...and a great one at that. We started at the bar with a delicious shot of homemade Limoncello. The bartender was extremely friendly, and totally hilarious. Once our table was ready, we ordered escargot, which was the best I've had in the city...it was cooked with plenty of olive oil and garlic. SO delicious. My boyfriend and I ordered pasta dishes for entrees; he had a wide noodle pasta with rabbit sauce, and I had stuffed crepes. His was far better than mine, but I should have known that since it was labeled "award winning". I'm so happy we found this warm and inviting restaurant in our neighborhood...we'll definitely be back!
author: Brianne K.

description: Definitely as traditional as you get in north beach. The fact that they aren't begging you to come in (like many of the tourist traps down the street) is a good start. The place was packed, so I guess that was the reason for the slow and inattentive service (and also why he offered us free dessert, no thanks). Beyond that, the food was decent. I had the Pappardelle Toscana (large noodles in rabbit sauce) which was good, but not mind blowing. I tasted the Veal special, which was actually really good and a huge portion. I like the fact that a place like this exists and am glad its still thriving, but its not something I'd find myself craving on a regular basis...
author: Nicolas H.

description: I was sort of unimpressed.  It could have been the fact that the table seated in the single most acoustically reverberating section of the restaurant were a bunch of remarkably drunken professional town criers (I am assuming that was their profession because they didn't look anything like opera singers and, quite simply, the decibel level they were capable of producing was, frankly, cry-worthy.  There are probably small deaf babies in the neighboring seven block radius and the parents will never understand what happened to their poor little precious infants.  Well, I know.  It was them.  Those damn town criers).  The food was so-so, but I had a FISH!  I never eat fish!  Go me!  I did it, and it wasn't at all terrible.  I love my girlfriend who makes me eat yummy fish.  Ok, just cause she was there, this place gets and extra star.
author: Mason G.

description: Amazing, rustic, perfect Italian food. The gnocchi is the best in the city.  House-made limoncello is the perfect way to end a meal. The bartender, Chris, is always entertaining. Worth it just for him!
author: Jody B.

description: A great time was had by all.  Welcoming staff, very good food. Made us feel good in being there. Highly reccomend.
author: John K.

description:
I took my friend here for her birthday to pay homage to our fun times we had in the real Firenze, Italy.  We were so excited to read the menu and compare to everything we ate on our tour de Italia.  I knew a lot of people liked this place and we wanted to go for the good stuff.  The place filled up quickly with regulars, preparing themselves for a Friday night on the town.  It was crowded and the layout is really crowded/claustrophobic, especially on an odd warm night in May.  I swear my legs were stuck to the booth because I was sweating in there.  

We got some pretty tasty foccacia bread and ordered a Riesling.  It took us a really long time to decide on a main dish because there are so many excellent choices.  We were debating on the linguine and clams, the florentine steak (which we really loved in Florence), pesto, and the rabbit pasta.  Maddie tried the famous gnocchi and I tried their special tutto mare.  My husband, who also loves the real Italy, came with us and tried the giant shrimp with mushrooms.  We thought the gnocchi was definitely the best and totally deserved that "award winning" title on the menu.  It was definitely the best gnocchi I've ever had, and I'm not a huge fan of the stuff.  My tutto mare was also excellent with shrimp, mussels, fish, and some other stuff, in a white wine sauce.  I'd probably pass on the shrimp dish that my husband got.  It was filled with heavy cream and pastas are probably a little bit better than just the shrimp.

We left the restaurant without getting dessert since we were so full, although the wine still got me a tiny bit buzzed.  The waiters were very attentive.  Such a classic italian kiss-on-the-cheek place that we will definitely go back to.  And yes, it's definitely comparable to Italy!
author: Stacey C.

description:
It's been a long time since the five year stint when I lived in North Beach back in the 80's.  It was a great place to dine at hole in the wall restaurants and find bars where only the locals hung out.  We go back regularly and are to glad to have the help of so many adventurous yelpers to help discover hidden gems in a neighborhood that we don't know as well as we used to.  

So last night when we wanted to eat in a "local" restaurant, we made our way, with open minds and stomachs, to Firenze.  As we had reservations, we got a table right away - although at 6:15 there were only about 10 other people in the place. But, in no time at all, it filled up quickly and crowds were waiting by the time we made our way out around 8:00pm.  So, you have to ask yourself, if it fills up that quickly and people are waiting to get in, what is it about this place that makes it so great...especially given the great disappointment we felt as we departed.

Previous diners have mentioned the less than adequate service and they are right.  A request for bread had to be made three times, a glass of water more times than necessary.  When the busboy refilled my daughter's iced tea, he managed to pour whatever slime was living at the bottom of the pitcher into her glass.  Of course, this wasn't discovered until just before she drank the mysterious substance.  I mean, when was the last time that container was washed??

We waited quite awhile for our entrees even as others who had arrived after us were served their meals.  And, when they did arrive, they were wrong.  My daugher's girlfriend ordered the shrimp and calamari but no calamari was seen on the plate.  Perhaps they had run out.  I ordered the pork special and was served, instead, some beef concoction.  When I pointed out the error, it was taken away and I thought I would get my order.  Instead, I was told they were out of the pork and was handed the menu so I could pick something else.  Given that the other three people at the table had their meals, I didn't want to watch them eat and then dine alone. So, I opted for the previous beef dish which by now had been sitting on some counter in the kitchen for at least five minutes and looked like it when it made the return trip to my table.  Resigned, I decided to make the best of it and enjoy the meal.  Imagine my surprise and irritation to overhear the chef, only minutes later, present the pork special to a nearby table.  This would be the same pork that was not available when I ordered it.  Maybe he knew them, who knows.

So, can I recommend the place?  No, but a lot of people seem to like it and I would be hard pressed to tell you why they do.  But go...you might get lucky...or not.  It certainly didn't take me to my happy place.
author: John P.

description: I ordered the "famous" gnocchi.  It was OK.  It was essentially mashed potatoes balls.  It was really soft and not as firm as most gnocchi that I've enjoyed.  Otherwise the meal was very good.  Carpachio and bruscheta to start.  Gnocchi and bites of my friends meals to tide me over after I realized I didn't really enjoy the gnocchi.
author: Josh V.

description: Amazing restaurant, great food. Authentic Italian ambiance, attitude, feel. Great waiters (if you speak Italian, go for it - they can hang). Gnocchi is a must have. I've gone here with my friend's Italian family and on dates, and each time, the experience has been nothing short of memorable. Highly recommend Firenze by Night.
author: PM M.

description: Like my friend Lisa H. wrote, "You won't be disappointed". =) I had the Penne allo Zenzero, and it was quite delicious. The pasta was cooked perfectly al dente, and the sauce was just enough so that each penne had a consistent coat of pasta sauce around it. I freakin' ate the entire dish. Scared myself there a bit....But yes, this place was really good.
author: Carol L.

description: Outstanding! I came here with a friend last night. The gnocchi was amazing! Light and fluffy, served with a tomato cream sauce that was not heavy. She had the vegetable lasagna and she said it was really good. When the food came, we stopped yapping and gobbled it all done. Ended dinner with a cheesecake for her, and chocolate mousse cake for me. The chocolate mousse cake was a little rich and strong for me, so I did not finish it. The bread basket came with slices of focaccia that were so good, I almost asked for more. Needless to say I fell off the diet wagon last night... :)
author: Charlotte T.

description:
Alright, so the food was good BUT the rest of this whole experience wasn't the best I've ever received. 

I was so excited to eat at this place after I walked in, was greeted by a nice bartender and saw all the pictures with all the famous signed photographs on the wall.

Now let's go onto the list of things that went wrong at this restaurant...
1) Walked in at 630PM with my group of 9 people. Was told that it would be a 10-15 minute wait. Didn't get seated until 7PM (I had checked back with the host/owner's son (I think) for status at the 15 minute mark and he replied with "I told you 15 minutes." Nice guy.
2) Our order and bread was not taken until 730PM.
3) I ordered the Fried Calamari appetizer and received a calamari salad (unfried)
4) I ordered a Fettuccine dish that included garlic, sun dried tomatoes and fresh wild mushrooms. I asked if it were possible to put the mushrooms on the side. If it's already in the sauce, then I would order something else. The waiter stares blankly at his page and said, no it's ok. As you have already probably guessed, I received two bowls, one with my mushroom sauce and one with a bowl of plain cooked fettuccine. The waiter said "uh yea, the mushrooms are in the sauce, that's all we could do." I had to pick up every single mushroom.
5) The busboy packaged our leftovers, brought back the bagged boxes and dumped one sideways on the table in front of my friend. Then left it there in that position. I went to move it and after flattening it properly so that the sauce wouldn't drip out, I removed my wet hand from the bag. Who knows what was on that bag?

Well those are my reasons why I probably never go and spend 2.5 hours at a restaurant that didn't even include dessert or drinks. It was just an entree with some bread.
author: Katherine F.

description:
I attended a large birthday party at firenze by night and they did a fabulous job. We reserved the back room where they pushed the tables together for us so there was plenty of room for our group of 20. We had a fixed menu with the choice of mixed green salad or Caesar, I had the latter which was great, had a nice bite and was a great way to start the meal along with their yummy bread. Next was a pasta dish which everyone loved, I wish I could remember what it was called all I know is that it was fabulous and I could have eaten more. Then we had the choice of a petrole sole with white wine sauce, chicken with marsala sauce and artichokes or linguine with clams. I had the chicken which was good but I probably could have made it at home, the bf had the linguine which was also very good. The service was excellent and very attentive, the party went smoothly and everyone enjoyed it. They even cut up and served a cake we bought from Victoria's bakery next store instead of having their spumoni ice cream.
I would definitely recommend this place for large groups or parties as well as intimate dining affairs and I look forward to returning.
author: Meg L.

description: The food was great and the service reminds me of Firenze!   Love it when I can go to places in the City meeting people from their country.  The pasta was fresh and the flavors were wonderful.
author: Christina T.

description: This is a cute little Italian restaurant in the heart of Little Italy.  We dined here last night, after a matinee showing of BBB.  It's a short 1-1/2 block walk from Club Fugazi.  The warmed spinach salad was excellent, as was the gnocchi and petrale sole.  The gnocchi is "pillow soft" and melts in your mouth with a delicious creamy tomato sauce.  The sole was buttery, garlickly and oh so yummy.  Would definitely go back again.  It's a small venue, so reservations are recommended.  Oh, and be sure to try the raspberry chocolate cake - moist and dee-licious!
author: Jess T.

description:
gnocchi sauce tasted like it came from a jar and my linguini vongole was a bit too salty didn't have enough clams in the shell. 

great service.

expected better food for the price.
author: Adam K.

description: I chose this place to celebrate my brithday a couple of years ago. It has a really warm atmosphere. There is a nice space in the back for big groups.
author: Kelly S.

description:
From the outside this place is deceiving because it looks small and unattended.  But once inside, there are actually plenty of seating and the place itself was very lively.  Thanks to their sleek, eye-catching wall decor you can't help but divert your attention once in awhile, but only for a couple of seconds, to appreciate the photos. We were seated promptly as we were one of the few in the restaurant just a little past 6.  But after some time, the tables filled up quickly.

We started off with the Funghi ripieni con salsiccia-  petite mushrooms stuffed with Italian sausage, flavored in a rich, thick sauce that was good enough to dip your bread in.  The insalata estiva- sliced tomatoes and onions tossed with mozzarella cheese and fresh basil- was very simple, yet seasoned carefully with olive oil, which made it a perfect light dish that prepared us for the main entrees.  In fact, I liked it so much that it inspired me to make my own.  The delectable appetizer and salad were followed by the "award winning" Pappardelle toscana- large noodles in rabbit sauce.  I loved the large and randomly shaped noodles, drenched in a red sauce with pieces of rabbit meat. It sounds hard to swallow, but the meat really tasted like beef.  The calamari giusti was sauteed with garlic, mushrooms, olive oil and white wine, served with side of couscous and veggies. The cous cous wasn't the best, so focus your attention to the calamari pieces.
author: Lisa C.

description: Gnocchi is delish! So is the seafood pasta. I agree with the previous reviewer... there is so much crap in North Beach. If you are looking for a solid home cooked Italian meal (in a romantic restaurant!!), Firenze by Night is a good pick.
author: Annie T.

description:
seems like just your run of the mill italian place.  loud boisterous waiters and the traditional italian restaurant decor, but as is the story with anywhere else in north beach, parking is a nightmare even if you're trying to park in the garages which randomly tell you they're full.  i can't yelp about north beach without telling you to take a cab.

get the bruschetta... such a simple appetizer but their's blows most places out of the water... and the gnocchi is award-winning for a reason.  outstanding.  and generous portions at reasonable prices.
author: Steven C.

description: I had a wonderful dinner here last night.  My boyfriend and I woke up with a craving for pasta and decided to revisit Firenze.  I had a fabulous spinach salad, simple and good.....pine nuts, bacon, spinach, and brandy vinegrette!  The rabbit pasta was steaming hot and perfectly seasoned.  My boyfriend's idea of pasta was fettichini alfredo, which they gladly made for him and was quite good!  The pasta was  cooked to perfection!  And then tiramisu for dessert.....so good I had the last bite!  Yum!!!! Live in the neighborhood and will be back for more!
author: Peanut L.

description: I got a coupon to go here and tried it out.  Service was pretty shite.  Food took forever to get to us.  I noticed other patrons got wrong orders and had to tackle the waitstaff just to get water.  Food was alright but nothing to write home about.  If you want to eat in North Beach, try Panta Rei, across the street, instead.
author: Buddy R.

description:
My husband and I were staying in the city to participate in the Bay to Breakers event.  He wanted to find a restaurant that served pasta so he could load up on carbs the night before the race.  I read about this place doing a general search on North Beach restaurants and the description sounded very interesting - surround yourself with images of Florence (I've always wanted to visit Florence).  There are so many dining choices in North Beach that choosing can be a bit daunting. We were wanting to find a small, unpretentious place with good food, and this sounded like it was just what we were looking for.  Also, the many positive reviews on yelp reinforced our decision to check out the restaurant.  Well, I am happy to say that we had a wonderful dining experience!  

The entrance is through the bar area (full bar, by the way), which also has some smaller tables for dining.  The main dining room I found to be cozy and inviting.  Some other reviewers mentioned how the proximity of the tables felt a bit crowded, but I actually didn't mind the closeness to other diners.  It reminded me of dining with a big group of family.   There were many regulars dining, talking to each other and the wait staff, and they all seemed to be thoroughly enjoying their wine and food - a good sign.

My husband ordered the award winning gnocchi - going for the starch overload - and it was marvelous.  I sampled his dish and it was some of the best gnocchi I've ever tasted.  The sauce was just the right  amount of flavor - I'd call it a "pink" sauce because it was between a red and white sauce - to complement the fluffy, light potato dumplings without overpowering  them.  It was very well done!  I had the special meat dish #2 which our waiter recommended I try: chicken which was flattened and stuffed with a mixture of proscuitto, sausage and savory herbs, then rolled and topped with a light tomato sauce.  A sort of chicken-eloni.  It was accompanied by a side of sauteed, julienned zucchini and carrots, along with some very buttery tasting polenta.  The entire dish was extremely tasty - I ate every bit of it - and very filling.   We will definitely be coming back to sample their other menu offerings as they did have a wide variety of pasta and meat dishes.
author: Lily Y.

description: Gnocchi = Great! This place has great Italian. I would say one of the better in North Beach. I would choose this place probably over any of the others. Quality of the food is not a concern the few times I've been there in the last few months. Hadn't been in years, revisted on a night out in the city. Very glad we did!
author: Brian D.

description:
This isn't your East Side Mario's type of place; it's authentic, home style cooking you're looking for then you'e come to the right place. The portions are perfect, the price is reasonable and the staff are friendly.

The gnocchi is amazing; it melts in your mouth like butter. The chicken with mushrooms is seasoned perfectly and the osso bucco is delicious (though it was a bit salty for me).
author: Jo R.

description: Awesome small Italian (Tuscan) place in North Beach.  The Tortellini is super creamy and really good. I also highly recommend the bruschetta, very good. You'll need to have reservations, otherwise be ready to wait a while. Prices are also pretty good $10-20 per meal.
author: Tony A.

description:
Decent gnocchi (it gets hard to eat after a couple bites). The best dish was the spicy penne and pasta with rabbit sauce. 

We had a group of 12 and were treated horribly. Maybe it was because we were a happy younger group in our 20's and annoyed our waiter by smiling too much. He was scowling the entire night, snapped when asked to repeat the specials, and snatched a napkin while cleaning the table. I am embarrassed for this restaurant for hiring such rude waitstaff. We will never be coming here again. If you are served by a guy in black framed glasses, just walk out.
author: regina n.

description:
Had a very disappointing meal here last night. 
Started with bad wine, ok I picked it, but why have bad wine on the menu?  
Next, we got some pretty bland bread.  I expect better in NB, but no big deal.
Third, was a pretty good cesar salad.  No problem there.
Forth we got the Buffalo Mozzarella, which was fine, but not good for NB.
