For the main course we got their "famous" gnocchi and a special veal stuffer ravioli.  The gnocchi itself was ok, very tender.  The sauce was just a bland tomato sauce.  Not impressive.  
My wife's ravioli was truly bad.  It was watery and flavorless.
We didn't finish either of our main dishes, or the wine.  Although the wine was only a $35 bottle, and we only had pasta (no meat or fish) the total still came out to $90.  
All in all, a waste of money.  It's easy to find good italian in NB, and this wasn't even close.
author: Jim R.

description: the gnocchi was so perfect and delicate! plus our waiter, guiseppi, made the whole night entertaining with his accent
author: Emily A.

description:
service 5; food 5; value 4; $20 corkage fee

Service warm and friendly with great recommendations.  We  had a half order of the gnocchi to start which was the best I've ever had.  not sure I would want it for a full dinner given how heavy it is though.  entrees were quite good (veal pillows and classic ragu).  definitely worth a return visit.  

only slight negative the bruschetta toast was really burnt on the edges and soggy in the middle - time to upgrade their toaster!
author: Stacy N.

description: Whenever I miss my beautiful city  I stop by Firenze by night and it feels like I am home! Good food and very good ribollita (typical Florentine bread soup), good meat and seafood and nice atmosphere... 5 stars of course I was born and raised in Firenze!
author: claudia c.

description: The bathrooms and location are gross (I've seen cockroaches twice - one near the bathroom and one GIANT one outside on the sidewalk) but the food and the service are great.  Classic dishes with modern flavor.  Just close your eyes until you're inside and don't use the restroom.
author: Danielle B.

description: Reminded me and my husband of the many charming restaurants we ate at in Italy on our honeymoon.  Very delich!  We had bruscetta, soup, salad, a veal dish and pesto pasta.  Everything was tasty and it was a fun atmosphere.  I think you could have a great meal in many North Beach establishments but this one will be something we remember for awhile and probably head back to the next trip.
author: Lisa L.

description: I stumbled across this place a few weeks ago, basically because there was a parking spot on the same street.  Everyone there was so warm and inviting.  The pinot noir we had was good, though not the year specified in the menu.  No worries though as it went perfectly with the delicious dinner.  I had the gnocchi firenze and loved it.  Maybe because it was so tasty, or maybe because the server called me bella.
author: Beth G.

description: Amazing, great, fabulous, fully enjoyable, happily fulfilling...doesn't that explain it enough? Love the food, love the owner, love the waiters...I haven't found one wrong thing with this place. Best gnocci in town, hands down.  Order the chianti. Make out with the bartender. Stay late and talk to the owner.  You won't regret it.
author: Stephanie J.

description: At the risk of sounding far too midwestern, I'm going to admit that my favorite italian is The Olive Garden before I say another thing about this place. However, that considered, I was unimpressed by this place. The service was quite slow, and seemed to pass me and my friends over for the older, more wine consuming customers. The bread was dry and boring, and the entrees were kind of dull. At least Olive Garden gives you a free salad!
author: Jesse H.

description: The only restaurant I feel I absolutely have to eat at when I'm in San Francisco. Enough said.
author: Justin P.

description: Fun atmosphere and delicious food. Beer and alcohol selection is good. Bartender is great!
author: Austin R.

description: Had another fantastic dinner here tonight. Needless to say the gnocchi, sole dore and other dishes were amazing.
author: Mike G.

description:
I'm sorry but this was the best gnocchi I've ever tasted.  EVER.  It was heaven.  

And, we got a nice greeting at the door, a strong drink from the friendliest bartender I've ever met, prompt but not pushy service, and when we were accidentally charged for an extra glass of wine our server quickly and graciously took it off the bill.

My only gripe that would knock off a half star would be the salads - 7 bucks for some mixed greens and shredded carrots did not light my fire.

Overall a 5 star experience - but skip the salad!
author: Vicki M.

description: Best Italian this side of Florence and great service too.  Sergio and his crew make dining here a real treat.  Kudos!
author: Susan H.

description: I eat here once a month after attending services at St.Peter and Paul, and the fact I always go here given the plethora of choices is saying a lot.  Top to bottom I have tried the whole menu and I have never been disappointed.  The food is outstanding, especially the gnocchi and scampi pizziola, the service is uniformly good with very entertaining waiters, most from Italy, and the prices reasonable.  The wines are a bit more up and down, but you can always find something you will like at a fair price.  Overall it is solid in everything it does, and for that reason is my go-to north beach spot.
author: Benjamin C.

description: Six for dinner to celebrate a birthday and everyone loved the entire dining experience!
author: Diane G.

description: This italian place in North Beach is my place to go when guests are in town and want to head to NB. Always good and friendly and nice selection of food. Always happy with the gnocchi. With so many bad experiences in North Beach I stick to this place for reliable good food.
author: Alyssa C.

description: A "must visit" destination every time I'm in SF.  I absolutely love the food and atmosphere of this place.
author: Mike P.

description: Classic solid old school Italian eatery with a good amount of character.  Good service with fun, busy noisy ambiance.  Nothing adventurous for the taste buds here, and pasta is not exceptional.
author: Anthony Z.

description: While the decor made me feel that I should have been wearing shoulder pads and dining with Joan Collins, the food was wonderful. The Gnocchi was the best I have ever had, the service prompt and attentive. I would strongly recommend dining here, make reservations and don't plan on really lingering around the dinner table (they like you in and out). Every member of our dinning party loved their meal from chicken, to fish, pasta and steak.
author: Dawn S.

description: 3.5 stars actually.  Good, solid Italian in an influenced (and competitive) North Beach neighborhood.  Stefan (our server) was very knowledgeable, seasoned and passionate.  Gnocchi was good, not great,  prices were decent and the flavors pretty good.  Nice, cozy atmosphere.
author: Anne M.

description: The pasta was all top notch and reasonably priced hence the four stars. The rest, not so great. The tomatoes in the apps were not good and should be in season (WTF?) but the mozzerella and balsamic were very good. Our waiter was cold and never dropped a single please or thank you. The wine list is good but overpriced (seriously, nothing under $30?). Great food, but I'm not sure how soon I'll be back.
author: M L.

description: The best gnocchi ever! This place is loud, fun, energetic and smells sooooo good. The bartenders at the front are cool, smart asses and seem to have a good time working here. Not a romantic spot but definitely a fun night in North Beach that doesn't hump your leg to get try to get you in the doors, although listening to all the Italian speak makes me want to stop and jive with them every few steps. One of my best dinner experiences. Definitely worth a visit to North Beach! Minus a star for super close proximity to other diners but hey thats a great way to get a good look at the plates!
author: Deanna V.

description: i've been here a handful of times and the meals have always been satisfying.  it's off broadway so there's   less tourists and more regulars.  gnocchi is my fave dish on the menu.  a solid place to check out if you're in north beach and not sure what to pick out of plentiful italian restaurants.
author: Helen T.

description: I would says the best Gnocchi in San Francisco--for sure!!  Firenze by Night is a wonderful family establishment with the owner, Sergio running the kitchen.  I've been going to Firenze for about 12 years now and love the fun, sometimes crazy atmosphere!  I tried my first Limoncello there...sigh.  It's been awhile, time for me to make a reservation for another visit.
author: Michelle B.

description: Firenze is a cool spot and not too noisy. I went there a couple of weeks ago with on date. We shared the bruschetta which was ok. I had the grilled salmon & he had a steak. The salmon was fresh and not to flaky... The overall service was extremely attentive. The real deal was that the waiter had a major crush on my date. Which worked out cool for him in the end we got free desert...
author: Teresa H.

description: Very pleasant, but I couldn't exactly describe it as amazing.  Waiters are very entertaining.
author: Anastasia Beaver Housand J.

description: I was raised in the Bay Area but now live in OC but every single time I come home I crave Firenze. Crave it like chocolate and coffee. Everything is good there, everything. The setting is wonderful, crowded but good. If you like a lot of space to sit and spread out this might not be the best place for you (but good for me, one less person ahead of me in line). The staff is fantastic and never misses a beat!!
author: Rachel M.

description:
Ended up here last minute for a birthday dinner when another popular restaurant in North Beach (initials M.L.) couldn't take a large party.. 
They seated us in the private room in the back where another large party was sitting and, while the noise level was out-of-this-world, we were clam-happy to have a table.  The service was soo nice and the owner came back to greet us, take photos of us and with us and...we felt just like family there.
The food: WOW!!!  I am seriously still dreaming about the rabbit ragout pappardelle.  Home-made pasta, SO fresh and so freakin' delicious!!  The rabbit ragout serving seemed skimpy until you take a bite and the flavors just sing!
The gnocchi appetizer dishes were large and all had outrageously delicious sauces.
The tiramisu?! OMG. Save room for this...the best I've ever had.

I'd totally give this place 5 stars...I mean the food and service alone deserves 6 stars out of 5, but the actual restaurant loses a star for the lack of cozy ambience.  I like to find great special occasion places or  romantic mood setting date places or places that have that certain je ne sais quois, but Firenze By Night is simply a awesome meal destination.  It's like the best gift you received under the Christmas tree....wrapped in a paper brown bag.

The bottom line, as  a previous reviewer said, "this is my new favorite place in North Beach," and I will be back!!
author: Lindsay A.

description:
the website listed didn't work for me, but this one did:

http://firenzebynight.ypguides.net/
author: jen b.

description: Yelp, you disappoint me so infrequently, but alas this is one of those times. 4 stars, really? I dunno... Firenze by Night smells wonderfully inviting and is very cozy inside, and service *is* good. But that antipasto plate, a few slices of meat and way too many vinegar soaked veggies, not a good start! The ossobucco was very good but the cappellini pomodoro e basilico was soggy and a bit lacking in flavor. I'll give you three stars, but 1 is only because the great wine and lovely company made for one of my best nights in SF =)
author: Will A.

description: Never a bad meal at Firenze! Always order the gnocchi and any nightly special, as they are always amazing! The decor could certainly use an update, but the food is so good you don't even care. Great service at the bar and at the table.
author: I F.

description: This is one of my favorite Italian restaurants in the city, and I take practically every guest of mine who likes Italian food here.  The upside is, as many people have pointed out here, the fluffy gnocchi.  The downside is that you'll need a reservation, and they only take them by phone.  (Sorry, OpenTable users, but trust me, it's worth the phone call!)  Every time I've been here, I've seen people turned away without reservations.  Make a phone call or ask your hotel concierge, and enjoy.
author: Matthew G.

description:
This restaurant is an embarassment to my home town, San Francisco. 
My group was seated almost 45 minutes late. We were kept waiting in the bar area that was crammed so full you couldn't turn around. A picture fell off the wall on to the head of one member of our party. We were pushed around and bumped in to the entire time. 
We were seated in the back room. The noise was unbelievable. You had to yell just so the person next to you could hear. Trying to talk to anyone any further away was pointless. 
The waiter was awful. He rolled his eyes, was short tempered and was obviously exasperated by even the slightest hesitation in answering his questions. When he brought our main dishes he yelled out the dish "Chicken! Chicken! Who had the chicken?" at the top of his lungs. If we didn't answer fast enough he blew out his breath and slammed the plate down on the empty table next to us. 
For my appetizer I ordered tomatoes w/ red onion. It came on a big white plate - 4 slices of colorless plastic tasting tomato with 4 slices of red onion. Awful. It looked like something from Denny's. 
I ordered the chicken stuffed canalloni. It was two small tubes stuffed with chicken that had been put in a food processor with some other ingredients I could not pick out. The whole thing had a strange fishy taste. 
The dessert was something from Costco. My decaf coffee was NOT decaf which seriously screwed me up as well as my baby (I'm nursing). 
The price was a crime.
author: Bernadette G.

description: Gnocci.  Perfect.  'in.  Gnocci.  Award winning beautiful gnocci.  Fantastic service.  Perfect service.  Friendly People.  Great Wine.  Great Combinations.  Great salads.  Great Apps.  Friends For Life.  Keep It Real Italian...and Perfect. F'in. Gnocci.
author: Francis K.

description: I had the vegetable lasagna and I'm dreaming of when I can return to have it again!  My friend is coming from out of town to visit SF for the first time and wants to eat at a non-touristy restaurant.  After 78 reviews, I can't imagine that mine will make much difference, but I highly recommend this restaurant.
author: Carol B.

description: This place was awesome. From the owner greeting you at the door to the amazing Food. Gnocchi was out of this world the best I have ever had.
author: Virginia R.

description: waoooooo!! the best italian restaurant in san francisco so far! ll' be back soon for more! gratzie..........
author: Edward A.

description: This review is only for the lemoncello only. AMAZING! It's got so much more lemony flavor and kick. Thank you Chris for making it an interesting night, and recommending other great hangouts! BTW their lemoncello is homemade! They wouldn't let us buy a bottle.
author: jj c.

description: I love this place! The papardelle toscana is delish! They give you huge portions & the staff are charming.
author: Caroline B.

description: I went to this restaurant based on reviews I had read on Yelp. The reviews that I read did not do this restaurant justice. For starters, the waiters are very accommodating. I had to change mt reservation three times and each time the answer was "no problem" and "we will wait for you', "take your time." I thought wow thats great! When we arrived, all the waiters and staff had Italian accents which I loved. I had the ravioli...one word; succulent.
author: jam v.

description: One Saturday family from Fremont were in town (they never* come to the city) and requested Italian in North Beach. My mister and I are highly allergic to North Beach, so we didn't know jack. This place drew us in because my cousin wanted MEAT...and saw the porterhouse steak on the menu. The wait was 15 minutes. It was decent food at half the cost of many restaurants we saw in the area. The most expensive thing was the steak for $26.50. My cousin--a real meat eater--said the steak was fabulous. All the pastas were in the $15 range. My raviolis were $13 and fairly good. Their gnocchi is supposed to have won awards. Firenze is a casual, no frills, mid-range place. The interior could be spruced up and the service was average (the waiter never brought us an appetizer we ordered), but the food was fair for the price. I won't be returning b/c there are  better Italian restaurants in the city.
author: Sumi Y.

description:
bruschetta was to die for.
the house cab was yummy.
i got the penne with meat sauce special.  i'm thinking it was the "and then it gets baked in the oven with mozzerella cheese" bit that sold me.  either way, it was fantastic.
the bread was good, nothing extraordinary.
the waiter was running around, very busy...but he seemed very genuine and apologized for the long gaps between his stops.
author: Adela K.

description: A great place to take locals or out of town guests for supper. Excellent food, personalized service and affordable pricing. I highly recommend this place. you will not be disappointed.
author: Steve B.

description: Great food, friendly attentive service in an unassuming but nice environment.  Waiters are very knowledgeable and the bartender pours a great cocktail while being very welcoming.  I've been going to Firenze for 12 years and plan to continue the trend.
author: R F.

description: We only had 4 nights in San Francisco, and ate here 2 of the 3! The bar area is small, and a lot of locals come in. The restaurant is separate from the bar area. Nicely decorated with table cloths. We were sold after talking the the bartender, Chris, who relayed the specials to us. When we came back the second night, he remembered what we drank, and treated us as old friends.The service was impeccable, friendly and knowledgeable. We had mushrooms stuffed with crab meat, vegetable lasagne, and bresoala. All were to die for. Second night farfalle with wild boar ragout, linguini with clam sauce and spinach salad. Can't wait to go back. Don't miss it!
author: Sue W.

description: At the edge of chinatown you would think this place would be sketchy.   I was wrong.  The decor is warm and romantic, with italian music softly playing in the background.  Our waiter was friendly with italian humor.  We had the escargot with garlic which was wonderful.  The lingiune w/ clams and the quail dish were awesome and authentic.  Would definitely come again.  Perfect for dates.
author: Nagoo N.

description: Go for the pasta and wine.  See my full review in the "Hungry? San Francisco" guidebook!
author: Katie K.

description: Amazing papadelle di toscana! I would highly recommend trying this. The rabbit sauce is uniquely delicious. I also sampled my friends gncocchi and it is easily one of the two best in San Francisco! The consistency or the homemade pasta matches 100% with the potato and literally melts in your month. Trust me, you'll be sad when you've finished your dish.
author: Heather M.

description:
amazing gnocchi.

really awful waiter. he seemed new. but that doesn't make up for the fact that he was kind of an asshole. 

i'm giving it three stars because that gnocchi was ridiculous. and the other waiters seemed to know what they were doing.
author: Jana G.

description: So there was a lot of hype around this restaurant before i even went here and that always worries me that it wont live up to the hype.  But i have to say Firenze did a great job hitting my expectations.  I had one of the specials which was baby lobster tails and that was an amazing dish.  The sauce they had over it was absolutely delicious.  The fiancee had the Gnocchi and they were cooked perfectly so they melted in your mouth.  I would recommend this restaurant in general but there are some others in North Beach that are better.
author: Vincent R.

description: The environment was very nice, food was pretty good. I had the chicken and artichokes. Pretty good. My friend and the gnocchi and it was quite yummy. Our only complaint was that when the waiter took the order he asked if we wanted soup or sald with our meal. He made it sound like ti came with it. We all opted for salad without knowing it was an extra charge. It was another $10 for lettuce and dressing, a. deceptive and b. overpriced for a plate of lettuce since the meal itself was like $17. So be careful ordering. The food was good nothing outstanding but not a bad place to go.
author: Jen G.

description: If there is a special on the menu that I think I might like, my rule of thumb is to always order it.  Should have gone with the gnocchi...the chicken ravioli special was good, but not fantastic.  My husband and I brought his parents here to give them a little taste of North Beach, and overall it didn't disappoint.  Prompt and friendly service and GREAT tiramisu made the visit worthwhile.
author: Alison P.

description:
It was just....ehhhh. Really, 2.5 stars.

After reading all the reviews on yelp, I was hoping this would be our new neighborhood Italian Place....where we could also host our rehearsal dinner. We LOVE Italian food and wine and live a handful of blocks away...what could be better?

We arrived for our res a few minutes early and waited at the bar for about 10-15 minutes. The bartender was really nice but grumbled incessantly about some guy at the bar who must be a skeezy regular. Ew. Both the bartender and the Maitre'D were funny and kind. But frazzled.

We got seated and took a while ordering wine. We wanted to talk with the waiter but he was buzzing all over the place...not very attentive. The wine we chose was good (albeit somewhat overpriced as we've bought similar at Coit Liqours on recommendation from their staff for a lot less...) 

Anyway, Prosciutto E Melone was yummy. Their Prosciutto is great (very salty and non greasy) which I was into.

The Bufala, Basil and Tomato app. was just so so. Tomatoes weren't all that flavorful and mozzarella was dry. The basil however, was excellent and very fresh.

We ordered the Veal with pine nuts, basil, "and a touch of cream" and the Ravioli Della Mamma.

The veal was a definite disappointment. The meat itself was tender and well pounded...but the sauce. BOO. Literally tasted like it was made with Mayo. I might actually bet some money on it. What we were expecting was a light, course chopped flavorful basil dish with elements of pine nut and light on the cream. Instead it was a very heavy creamy green sauce with pine nuts thrown in for good measure. We're talking major cream...little to no basil flavor. We were bummed.

The Ravioli was better. Red sauce was meaty and salty but not a lot of good fresh tomato flavor. Raviolis were well cooked and filling was okay (I think spinach and cheese. Not really memorable)

What topped it off for us was hearing all the rave about the Gnocchi. I wanted to taste it, not order it...and asked for a small sample. Waiter says he will do a half order for me. Low and behold, never comes. We were already full from our mediocre other things....and thought, eh...why even ask. Of course it was on our bill though. Waiter seemed non-plussed about the fact he never delivered it, but took it off the bill no problem.

We had the spumoni and ricotta cheesecake for dessert. Spumone was really, really tasty and cheesecake was alright. Not dry, but not like "Damn this is worth the workout I'll have to do later".

All in all, we were bummed. Waiters were sort of sour pussed when they thought you weren't looking ( we were by the kitchen and saw the crabbiness go down) and the food really wasn't very good.

With wine, 2 apps, 2 entrees, 2 desserts....a full meal : around $130 not including tip.

For $200, you could go to Da Flora down the street and eat things that AMAZE YOU. Better ambiance too. 

If you're looking for better Italian than on the Columbus Strip, but nothing special - go here. As a neighborhood local, I'd say...try somewhere else.
author: Lady L.

description:
Pretty solid place to get Italian food in North Beach.  I was a bigger fan of the appetizers than my entree, especially the antipasti.  The calamari salad was a particular favorite off that appetizer, though the entire plate was well-received by our group.  We also got the carpaccio, my first foray into uncooked beef.  

It was very tender and the lemon did not overpower it, though I can't honestly compare it to anything, as it was my first taste of the dish.

My papardelle was okay.  The rabbit sauce was very good, but I kept wishing there was a bit more sauce and a bit less papardelle.  Additionally, the pasta was just the slightest bit overcooked, although I'm pretty picky with that as I like my pasta al dente.
author: James S.

description:
The best gnocchi in the Bay Area!  Great food. Great service.   The extensive menu is full of wonderful choices and the specials are just that.  I tried the pan roasted quail. Perfectly prepared, moist and flavorful. 

This is a regular destination for the family. We have never had a bad dish.
Although I consider North Beach restaurants a bit "touristy", Firenze by Night is the exception.
author: Geary L.

description:
the food itself was good (not wonderful, but good), but i encountered beyond bad service here. i understand it is busy on a saturday night (come on though, 4 waiters and this is a small place where the food takes forever to cook anyway), but i felt like crying when i left thats how aggravated i was here!
our main waiter was a huge twat. i feel like saying cocksucker, but being in san francisco, i probably shouldnt say that. we had to ask the busboy for bread, and it was hard and cold. everyone else also got butter, we didnt. when our waiter finally came, i asked him about the butter and he gave me a look like they dont give out butter unless you request it.... didnt matter anyway. the bread sucked! waiter again was smug.
towards the end of the night, he spilled a glass of water on my shirt, jeans, and jacket. i only brought 1 pair of jeans and 1 pair of sweats for my trip here. he apologized but did it in such a smug way again saying "sorry. but its just water". NO COMPLIMENTARY ANYTHING OR DISCOUNT OFFERED FOR THIS! 

i did something i never did before and i usually tip very well (i have been a server before). i left .02 cents. 

i ended up calling the manager because i was too angry to say anything in person. he was nice enough to invite me back the next night for free drinks, but i just now would rather forget the place.
author: Yelper Y.

description: Got fooled by Yelp.  This place is definitely not for kids.  If you have a child less than 20 months old, do not go here.  The high chair was broken (only had one).  The dinning room was so loud, it scared the crap out of our child (we couldn't even talk to him it was that loud).  Little room to walk around with the kid. The food was descent , but the inconvenience ruined the night.   Please ignore the "Good for Kids" rating this restaurant has.
author: Larry S.

description: This was the best gnocchi I have ever tasted! It just melts in your mouth! The service is also amazing! I visited San Fran last August with my boyfriend and we were referred to a place around the corner from FBN. The place was closed for a private party, so they directed us to FBN. Our waiter was more than gracious that we came in. They gave us free corking service and free dessert for all of our troubles. If you go to San Fran, you have to eat here!
author: Brittany B.

description: I've been here twice and both times it was very good, unstuffy Italian.  The gnocchi are as good as people say.  The house-stuffed ravioli were really good too.  Last time I had something with rabbit sauce.  It was really good but I think rabbit's a little stringy in general for my taste.  The server did this weird hovering thing, kept trying to slyly see if we were done with our dishes, but it was more amusing than annoying.
author: Alex T.

description: Our favorite in NB! We have been here so many times and have had a wonderful experience and an even better meal each time. The Giusti family KNOWS how to do Italian. We absolutely love this restaurant and it's our 'must' each time in NB. We have tried many others, but Firenze is our favorite. For the wonderful meal, a bottle of wine and the great wait staff, it's worth every penny! Fantastico!
author: KJ B.

description: I had dinner with my Dad, step-mom, & girlfriend for my birthday & everything we had was delicious, especially the gnocchi! Hands down the best gnocchi we have ever had. Great food at a decent price, I definitely recommend it.
author: Anthony A.

description: Best Italian in North Beach by far. My family goes here for pretty much every occasion. I have thrown huge parties here and the family that owns it is so nice, accomodating etc. I love that it is family oriented: If you go here a few times they will remember you and give you special treatment. Best Gnocci I have ever had. Can't say enough about this place. Ask for Fabio as your waiter for the true Italian experience.
author: Lauren B.

description: Wonderful, delicious, Italian food!  Within walking distance of Beach Blanket so we were set for a great meal after the show. Good service and wine.  A little noisy, but that's part of the energy and charm. Will go again for sure.
author: Pam C.

description:
Excellent - caught it on a quiet Monday, quiet in this restaurant....the normal mob scene on Columbus Street....

excellent veggie lasagna
uber tits bruschetta 

and did I mention this is quality Italian just off the beaten path from all the noise on Columbus?

Giovese wine at $7 a glass = beaut

Service = beaut

Repeat trip = most def
author: Hubba T.

description:
A friend in from the East Coast wanted "authentic" Italian food, and we were headed to a trivia night in North Beach anyway, so we headed to Sodini's, based on good reviews from friends.  That place must be great, because at 7pm on a Tuesday, there was an hour wait.  Wouldn't have made it to trivia.
 
We walked around looking and smelling in doors of other Italian looking spots, and came across Firenze by Night.  The menu was extensive and affordable, and they could seat 4 with almost no wait.  We were in.  

As we stood waiting for our table to be set up, a server (obviously Italian) came out making jokes about how slowly Italians do things and how maybe we'd get our table the next day.  He proceeded to entertain us with ancedotes about working in this small restaurant with his father.   Finally, our table was ready, and we were told that Uncle Eddie would be right with us.

Yes, Uncle Eddie was so authentic that over the noise the specials were a bit hard to understand.  But who cares?! - the man's accent and the lyrical way he spoke made it so worthwhile.  Besides, the specials were all written on a board above the kitchen.

I would have given it 3 stars based purely on charm, but we were looking for really good food, and this place had it.  Generally, gnocchi ends up heavy and paste-y, and I can't say I'm a fan.  The dumplings here were really like pillows, so light and fluffy.  We also had a fresh clam pasta and a papardelle with rabbit ragu, which were both amazing.  

And we made it to trivia on time.  and since we only spent $100 for 3 glasses of wine, 2 appetizers, and 4 pastas, we could still buy drinks at the bar.
author: redheaded s.

description:
Like going back to the ol'country... Took my gorgeous girl here Saturday night and it was everything we expected. The interior of the restaurant reminded her of some of the little italy restaurants back home in NY. I actually noticed that there was pizano's in the place. My pop always did tell me, "if we spot each other in restaurants - it must be good, because there is nothing like home cooking."
We both shared a good size plate of thier gnocchi - which was incredible, the sauce and freshness...next I had the special of the day which was a snapper in a killa sauce that when I sprinkled the lemon ova it, no one in that restaurant heard me say a thing during and even after the meal. The vino seleccione, was awesome I must admit, we shared a bottle of their Barbera and I must say, bellisimo! So with that, the service of the owner and our server were very inviting and warm...just like home.  ;-)
author: Fernando T.

description: Really wanted to like this place. It is after all kind of quirky in a good way. Food however is pretty fair. Ordered the world famous gnocchi which was ok. Last time I was here was on New Years Eve. Clear they had raised the prices by 20% just for the night. One appetizer, two pasta dishes, two glasses of wine. total bill was $120. Not worth it
author: AJ R.

description: Went for a group birthday last week and had a very nice time. Loved our waiter. He spoke Italian to us and spoke with his hands as true Italians do ;) We had a variety of dishes including 2 of the specials of the evening and were all very pleased. The pricing was just right as well. We will be back for sure!
author: Melissa T.

description: The service was very poor. Though we had reservations we were stuck in the back room which soon filled up with a hoard of screaming women having a class reunion. Went we didn't purchase a bottle of wine the waiter was very put out. When I complained  about the service as we were leaving the waiter lunged at me . I am sorry I left a tip.  Food so so. The entire experience was terrible. I live in North Beach but would go to Modesto for diner rather then return to frirenze by night.
author: blaine p.

description:
firenze by night proves what a difference 50 yards can make.  they are only 50 yards from columbus street but they are so far from the columbus street italian restaurant business model.  let me explain columbus street economics and why you never want to go to any restaurant on columbus street: the leases on columbus street go up and up till they drive out all but the most profitable restaurants.  each restaurant on the street is guaranteed a certain amount of tourists by virtue of their location on the street.  and since the restaurants can't CHARGE any more per person and since they can't squeeze in any more people due to space limitations, therefore their top line revenue is fixed.  since rents go up, the only way to make enough profit to pay the outrageous rents they need to lower costs - labor and cheaper ingredients.  so that's what you get on columbus street.  the same basic prices but lower and lower costs... cheap stuff. the only way to get _good_ italian food is move OFF columbus like Fior d'Italia (not even really in north beach anymore), Firenze by Night, Tratoria Contadina and (way down but still on columbus) Cafe Macaroni.  

Of those, Firenze is my fave.  it's the one that's the most "upscale."  the waiters wear black ties, the tableclothes are white, the wine list is decent, the staff is very well trained and not only trying to mack on the customers and you have a pretty good shot of going there with a hot girl and not hearing any of the staff go: "Bella Bella..."  

Order almost anything, it's all good.  the ground rabbit pasta is awesome. the Mare-Monti is a chicken and shrimp dish is tomato sauce.  the canneloni is a crepe stuffed with proscuitto and chicken.  the veal dishes are awesome. the swordfish special is a great piece of fish.  the chicken dishes are straightforward, not trying too hard to be fancy but still fancy.  as you can tell, i've been here a lot and i've never been disappointed with any of the food. 

not only that, but this place will reaffirm your belief in italian people.  sometimes i go to these places in north beach and i wonder what these guys are thinking. i must have been to this one place, that shall remain nameless (initials S of R) 100 times but i don't think those guys ever looked me in the face.  my date's a**, they look at plenty, but not my face.  

anyway, the owner of Firenze, Sergio, is one of those guys that sees you twice and will recognize you for the rest of his life.  he came up to me when i was having lunch with a client in South San Francisco (at another italian restaurant) and chatted with us for a minute.  i remembered him but couldn't remember where i'd met him till after he left.  then i was like "oh, the owner of Firenze by Night! that's where i met him."  one of the main waiters, fabio, is also really cool.  he comes by and is friendly and he doesn't give you the impression he's only doing it to look at your girl's cleavage and legs.  :)  when i lived in north beach, this was the place all the neighborhood folks came for a nice italian dinner!
author: dan h.

description: On a tip from the cable car operator we tried this place and were not disappointed.  The bruschetta warm and delicious... my husband got the linguini pesto and I couldn't stay out of it. Our kids shared their linguini with meatballs.... SO Yummy! And I of course had their famous gnocchi! It is delicious and light. The portions are generous and the service is impeccable. It was nice to have the owner seat us rather than hawking their wares on the street like other places we encountered on our way to this little gem.
author: Jessica N.

description: Have visited Italy before...the food at this ristorante...is authentic italian, to die for food, the tongue quivers at the fantastic tastes...quaint, small but that's the way a lot of ristorantes are in Italy.  However, you have to eat here...you will be back...I know that I will.
author: Fern N.

description:
yum yum yum. after reading all the great reviews about the gnocchi, how could i not try it???? it was amazing and a lot lighter than ive had at other places. the sauce is simple but in a good way. i started off with the ensalada estiva which was really tasty, everyone at my table kept stealing bites. it has mozarella, heirloom tomatoes, basil, red onions AND capers, which was a nice surprise. 

yum yum, cant wait to go here again! :)
author: Melanie F.

description: this definitely hit the spot for standard, hearty italian dinner, but i do think that the 4-star average from hundreds of reviewers is pretty steep. this is probably symptomatic of the fact that italian food in san francisco leaves something to be desired [especially for us east coasters], but it shouldnt be overlooked that firenze by night probably ranks among the north beach elite.
author: Jon W.

description: My fiancée and I LOVE this restaurant! I am Italian and my mom makes the best Italian food, so it's hard for me to find an Italian restaurant that tastes okay..but this place is delicious! My favorite pasta is gnocchi and my mom makes it and so do I, and Firenze's award winning gnocchi is perfect! And if you like calamari they make a really great calamari salad as an appetizer. And if you want a dessert at the end I recommend the cheesecake, it's made with ricotta cheese and is the best cheesecake I've ever had. This place has become mine and my fiancee's anniversary spot. There is this one waiter that is so sweet, he has a thick accent and he is so nice, he even remembers me every time we go back. The service is great. I can't wait to go back!
author: Anna B.

description: came in here post bay to breakers for a relaxed yet quick dinner for 2 and left very pleased. prompt yet friendly service. we had the 2 pasta specials of the day, one mussels and scallops with pasta, the other a veal ravioli. both very tasty. the rest of the menu looks great too.
author: Rich B.

description: Firenze reminds me a bit of the North End in Boston. The Italian influence on the neighborhood is definitely present  - the only thing that's missing is Modern Pastry with delicious on-the-spot filled cannolis. In any case, Firenze is a good restaurant for dates, casual gatherings and good food. We started with the prosciutto and melon and sausage and mushroom appetizers and they were both fantastic. The prosciutto wasn't too salty and the melon was perfectly sweet. The sausage and mushroom appetizer was tasty as well. I don't like foods when their natural flavor is over-camouflaged and Firenze does a good job of bringing out flavors. Yes, I tried the gnocchi and it was quite good. I agree with other reviewers when they say that it melts in your mouth. I'm not a huge carb-heavy fan so it wasn't really my thing, but it was tasty. The Boyfriend had the special chicken with prosciutto special and it was great. The chicken was tender and juicy, not overcooked, and the flavors complimented each other well. I had the spinach ravioli with meat sauce and was pleased. I know, a boring dish, but still yummy when you're looking for something light. The portions here are typical Italian-sized (i.e. pretty large) so don't each too much bread! While there's olive oil on the table, there's no balsamic vinegar but just ask the waiters and they're happy to oblige. Prices here are good, especially considering the amount of food you get and the taste.
author: Christine P.

description: Boisterous and fun, they still gave us a wonderful, romantic night out anyway. The gnocchi is simply the best I've ever had.
author: Jack H.

description:
I went here a few times before moving to the neigborhood and I'm very much a fan.  

The food:
The boyfriend likes their Rabbit Papperdelle (and I'm veg, so I like to sing "here comes Peter Cottontail, hopping down the bunny trail" to him while he's eating).  I wasn't in love with their veg lasagne when I ordered it, and it took forever (usually food comes up quick), so minus 1/2 star.  The gnocchi is superb.  I love me some sauteed spinach with my pasta, and while it's not on the menu, just ask for it, and they'll charge you for a spinach salad.  I get it every time, and it's not greasy, and it has the right balance of lemon and garlic.  The olive oil they put on the table to dip your bread into is the real deal and is of good quality.

The service/ambiance:
This place is small and the tables are really jammed together, but for a place that seems to be busy when other places are empty, it's a neccessity.  Like I mentioned before, the food usually comes up pretty quick.  Service is prompt and efficient (I really like that), and the Italian waiters are flirty without being creepy (and that's exactly what you get in Italy, so I like that too).  The decor is kinda cheezy, with a mural of the Florence skyline at night dominating the main wall of the dining room, but hey, that's what the restaurant is named after, right?  There are lots of choices for Italian in North Beach, many of them with sidewalk dining, which I love, but sadly not here so minus another 1/2 star.  I can't remember if they have valet, but there is a reasonably priced self-parking garage around the corner on Valejo (away from Columbus).  And it seems like each time I go there there is a table close by that is speaking to each other in Italian, which is always a good sign.
author: Amanda B.

description: the staff and the tomato cream sauce was great!  i'd say it's more $$$, than just too. the wine list is pretty overpriced.
author: L M.

description:
this was my first visit:

the host was upset about us not calling ahead because we were late--oops
the waiter kept on looking down on our birthday girl's dress---um...
the waiter visited our neighbor's table a whole lot more-- (neighbors came AFTER us)
the waiter forgot to bring in someone's order--a simple soup and everyone else's order was more complex

food--all the food was salty
bread--did not service us with balsamic vinegar ( i assumed that they didn't have it until i saw that our neighbors had it all set at their table BEFORE they received their bread)
I asked for pesto--waiter said that the kitchen did NOT have pesto (what kind of italian restaurant does not have pesto?) he implied it would be an inconvenience to make it from scratch and take a while so i didn't order it
customer service with our waiter--not so good
bar service--usual adequate service
rating of our first visit--- poor

I will give them another chance when i find a big enough party again & we'll see how they do, but the first visit was enough for me to think that if all their meals are this salty... i dunno...
author: Pang M.

description: my bf and i went here this past weekend and it was sooo good.  the bf had the prawns and calamari (i tried it, it was excellent), i wasn't very hungry so i just got an appetizer, proscuitto w/melon. the proscuitto was the best i've ever tasted, sliced super thin and nice and salty. we got watermelon martinis which were good and super strong, which was even better. i definitely plan on going back sometime when i'm actually hungry. the only downside was that the portions seemed kinda small....
author: Meghan H.

description: The most authentic Italian food I have ever had the joy of eating. Food is amazing, and the staff is warm and inviting. I can not go anywhere else for my pasta! I drive from Burligame at least twice a month to eat here! I would highly recommend going here for any occasion!
author: anonymous a.

description: It would be a mistake to go to San Francisco and not eat at Firenze. The gnocchi lived up to - and surpassed - its reputation. AMAZING. Creamy, melty, delicious. And the decor was charming, with white lights and a scene of Italy over the whole wall.
author: S P.

description:
for food, this restaurant deserves 5 stars.  

for service, this restaurant deserves 1 or 4 stars (av 3), depending on who is serving you.  i'll tell you why.

i've been to this restaurant before and it was a great experience.  service is really  R E A L L Y  S L O W, but i suppose worth the wait.  

so, my 2nd visit to firenze happened with myself, my girlfriend and 6 friends.  We are all lesbians.  We do not LOOK like stereotypical lesbians (we're all on the feminine side), however I suppose it could be apparent to other people that we were all gay.  ANYWAY, our dinner was good, however near the middle of our visit 3 tables behind us got sat with men in suits.  ALL 3 tables, all men in suits.  We were just eating and having a good time, when we noticed that these men (from all 3 tables behind us), were pointing and gawking at us.  Not to themselves or quietly, but as if we were a complete spectacle or freak show.  Have they  never seen lesbians before?  Have they forgotten they are in San Francisco?  We didn't know.... so we continued on with our friendship reunion.  Moments later, we noticed our waiter in the kitchen window, pointing at us with one of the cooks looking at our table as well and nodding.  What the heck?  what did we do?  All we were doing was eating, laughing and having a good time.  Not loud, not obnoxious, just eating like normal people.  A while later, we then notice our waiter talking to one of the men at the table behind us, they both look over, look at each other and laugh.  OK -- WEIRD.   This continued on for the duration of our dinner (about 2 hours), and it was extremely disappointing to be around clientele AND staff with such disrespect.  

As I said before, I've never had a problem at this place before.  The bartender was EXTREMELY nice and apologetic (he gets 4 stars), however our waiter was not and acted very defensive when we mentioned how we didn't appreciate what was going on all night.  

Never in my life have I ever experienced such blatent rudeness... you  might expect this kind of behavior from a young child who doesn't know better, but not from adults.  ugh!! 

I'm a believer in 2nd chances, and I wouldn't want to cut this place from my list of favorite places to go either, but this was just one of the most completely ridiculous evenings I've ever had.
author: KL S.

description: This is an amazing place if you are into gnocchi or pasta or both.  Although we did not end up having the gnocchi, the pasta was one of the best i have had in a while.  They also seem to have a pretty decent collection of wine (though both my pals got beer - at an italian place, go figure).  The service was good, though there was a debate whether the waiter was just putting on an accent or was italian, not that it mattered anyway.  One thing though, the place gets pretty loud, especially if you are sitting next to a large group, so if a quiet evening with the wife/gf/[partner is your thing, then probably not the best place to be.  Overall, i was very impressed with the food, wine selection and the service.  Moderately priced (entrees were $15-$20) with large portions, and totally worth it.  We did not get the dessert (we were SOOO close to so many better dessert places) but I am sure it would have been great.  Highly recommend.
author: Pat T.

description:
Being a visiter to SF, I asked our host where to have a pleasant meal in North Beach, and he volenteered that he enjoys Firenze By Night.
Our first night we dined at Ristorante Ideale, on Grant,  and enjoyed it.
 Our second night, we decided to try our host's recomendation- Firenze by Night.
Upon entering, I should have taken a decisive cue from the stall carpet smell. My 82 year old Mother In Law mentioned she liked the 'cozy atmosphere,' so we continued to the table.
Long evening short, the pappardelli with rabbit was good- the pasta slighty over done, and I purchased the same $39 bottle of "Castello Di Monastero ' ' Geografica Tipica' sangiovese wine at Molinari's Deli down the street the next day for $7.99, and enjoyed it more, in the privacy of my apartment..
And someone ought to cue the water pourer/busboy that he should enjoy his job... or at least pretend to.
It's back to Ristorante Ideale for me!
author: philip g.

description: I love this place. I just hosted a surprise party for my dad's 60th birthday here, and it was such a hit! We had the back room (it was a little tight, with 40 people, but it worked.) The food was fantastic, the service was with a smile, even though we made it near impossible for them to serve us all by putting AV equipment in the middle of the aisle between the tables.. The bartender is awesome, even gave me and my BF a free nice glass of wine cause he saw how crazy my family can be! Overall a huge hit, wish I could take home the gnocci and tiramisu!
author: erica r.

description: Went here for a birthday party and loved it.   We were in their back room--20+ people and it was excellent.  One waiter ran that room like a true pro.   As for the food, we started with a nice salad of Romaine Lettuce, blue cheese, good tomatoes and a light dressing--not a caesar.  Very good salad.   We then had a pasta course and everyone ordered their Gnocchi which was everything it was hyped up to be.  Outstanding--best I've ever had.  Our main course was Veal Saltimbocca for me and Halibut for my wife.  We both thoroughly enjoyed this.  Both came with roasted potatoes and vegetables.  Very good portion and delicious.  For dessert I had a Cappucino Cake and my wife had the Tiramisu which was outstanding.  The cake was very good but the Tiramisu was better.  Great meal and we will go back.  Every worker is very personable and seems to love their job.
author: Wayne E.

description: I am going to have to dissent here...I can't see how this place gets any 4 and 5 star reviews.  I'm not an Italian food or North Beach specialist, so when my friends from out of town said they wanted to go there, I came to Yelp to research.  We went based on the strength of these reviews but I at least was severely disappointed.  They first sat us at a window table, which featured a somewhat dismal view of Stockton but seemed OK...until we noticed the 3 HUGE flies buzzing around the window.  I mean, literally like half an inch long.  We got reseated near the bar, which had no flies but also no ambience.  The place looked at least 30 years past its prime.  The carpet was ancient, threadbare and looked like it had never been cleaned.  There was no decor to speak of.  There were lots of movie star photos, but it was hard to believe any of them had ever been here.  We had our menus closed for fully 10 to 15 minutes before the waiter came by to take our order and we were starting to get annoyed.  This was on a Monday night and the place was not crowded at all.  The food was OK but nothing special and not particularly affordable either.  There was no pizza on the menu for my friends' little girl, which isn't the restaurant's fault but just be aware.  With all the delightful Italian restaurants in North Beach (some of which we walked by on the way back to my friends' car, which brought a comment or two), I felt like I let them down.  They were very nice and didn't say anything negative, but I will not return and would never recommend it.
author: Paul D.

description: This place is always so delicious! I love their excellent service and the quality of their food is so authentic. I would recommend getting whatever their special is.
author: Stella G.

description: Best Italian food( next to my nana's) i've ever had. my boyfriend & i go there for every anniversary, birthday, holiday & whatever else excuse we can use to go! Sergio & the rest of the Firenze Family are all extremely nice and when theyre serving the best food how can you dislike them?! i'm actually so in love with the place, that i won't even go anywhere else in the city for Italian. im stubborn when it comes to my Italian food, & Firenze is def a family fav now! i always get the capellini pomodoro or the linguini & clams. the  straticella soup & the bruschetta are AMAZING.my boyfriend wont get anything other than the gnocchi. He swears by it. i'm pretty sure he's never even gotten anything else but those! They're award winning (: can't go wrong. I'm not sure what the dessert is called, but my boyfriend & i call it the white chocolate egg! its AMAZING. its like a white chocolate dipped ice cream (egg shaped) ball with passion fruit sorbet in the center, and chocolate drizzeled over the top...we've have the regular chocolate one, but the white is still our favorite! AMAZING. also very reasonable.
author: Tryxi D.

description: this place is the bomb~like tic tic.. i mean it. i have been going here for years. The Tutamari is to die for!!! The Ganchi is mouth watering with the sauce. So Tasty and full of herbs and spices. The Owner is amazing, he runs it himself and his son. I love this place. But Yes they do have one rude waiter there which i have told the owner about but i think it might be his nephew so his hands are kind of tied there. But overall this is by far the best italian place in all of north beach if not san francisco.
author: Wale N.

description: I have eaten here way more times than I can count and have enjoyed every bite!  Firenze is a real dining experience.  Some people have bagged on the fact that it is crowded...Did you all see how many excellent reviews there are?  Great places mean lots of people want to be there!  Lets face it-great food is like a drug and people want it all the time.  I wish I could eat at Firenze all the time myself and if I could , I would!  If you are in north beach you would be missing out by not dining at this wonderful place!
author: william w.

description: The only way this restaurant could be better is if they delivered to my house every day. This is one of my most favorite Italian restaurants ever. I had their pesto pasta and to this day, two months later, I am STILL craving it. The food had very little oil, was extremely tasty and very reasonably priced. The food really reminded me of the food I had while travelling through Italy. Service was very friendly, even the bartender was chatting it up with us while we waited for a table. Food came very quickly and literally surprised us with it's amazingness. We had the Neopolitan gelato afterwards which was heavenly. The perfect end to a perfect meal. I will be returning here as many times as I can. It was AMAZING!!
author: P D.

description: I ate with three friends at Firenze by night for the first time and it was incredibly delicious!!!!  Best Italian meal I've had anywhere!!! The dressing on the Caesar salad was so delicious that I was trying to figure out what they put in it all night (since I make all of my own dressings at home) - but then move on to the main course. I had sole with polenta and vegetables - the sole was cooked to perfection, veggies delicious and polenta was so light and delicious - there are no words for how amazing it was. Valpolacella ripassa was one of the best bottles of wine - a tad pricey at $47 but it tasted like a $100 bottle.  My husband had shrimp and it was melt in your mouth!  Don't leave without the tiramisu - NEVER NEVER had anything this delicious!  Even our friends who said they didn't like tiramisu couldn't stop taking bites!  One of the rooms is pretty noisy, but we were in a the quiet back room and very happy.  I can't wait to go back!
author: Cathy W.
